Text

ï»¿SAINTS PROGRESS

By [John Galsworthy]121-john galsworthy

PART [I]0-i

[I]0-i

Such a day made glad the heart . All the flags of July were waving ; the sun and the poppies flaming ; white butterflies spiring up and twining , and the bees busy on the snapdragons . The lime - trees were coming into flower . Tall white lilies in the garden beds already rivaled the delphiniums ; the [York]1-york and [Lancaster]2-lancaster roses were full - blown round [their]323-their golden hearts . There was a gentle breeze , and a swish and stir and hum rose and fell above the head of [Edward Pierson]122-pierson , coming back from [his]122-pierson lonely ramble over [Tintern Abbey]3-tintern abbey . [He]122-pierson had arrived at [Kestrel]199-kestrel , [his]122-pierson brother [[Robert]123-robert 's home on [the bank of [the Wye]5-the wye]325-the bank of the wye]324-robert 's home on the bank of the wye only that morning , having stayed at [Bath]6-bath on the way down ; and now [he]122-pierson had got [his]122-pierson face burnt in that parti - coloured way peculiar to the faces of those who have been too long in [London]7-london . As [he]122-pierson came along [the narrow , rather overgrown avenue]326-the narrow , rather overgrown avenue , the sound of a waltz thrummed out on a piano fell on [his]122-pierson ears , and [he]122-pierson smiled , for music was the greatest passion [he]122-pierson had . [His]122-pierson dark grizzled hair was pushed back off [his]122-pierson hot brow , which [he]122-pierson fanned with [his]122-pierson straw hat . Though not broad , that brow was the broadest part of a narrow oval face whose length was increased by a short , dark , pointed beard - a visage such as [Vandyk]124-vandyk might have painted , grave and gentle , but for its bright grey eyes , cinder - lashed and crow's - footed , and its strange look of not seeing what was before it . [He]122-pierson walked quickly , though [he]122-pierson was tired and hot ; tall , upright , and thin , in a grey parsonical suit , on whose black kerseymere vest a little gold cross dangled .

Above [[[his]122-pierson brother]327-his brother 's house]328-his brother 's house , whose sloping garden ran down to [the railway line]329-the railway line and [river]330-river , [a large room]331-a large room had been built out apart . [Pierson]125-pierson stood where [the avenue]332-the avenue forked , enjoying the sound of the waltz , and the cool whipping of the breeze in the sycamores and birches . [A man of fifty , with a sense of beauty]333-a man of fifty , with a sense of beauty , born and bred in [the country]334-the country , suffers fearfully from nostalgia during a long unbroken spell of [London]7-london ; so that [his]122-pierson afternoon in [the old Abbey]335-the old abbey had been almost holy . [He]122-pierson had let [his]122-pierson senses sink into the sunlit greenery of [the towering woods]336-the towering woods opposite ; [he]122-pierson had watched the spiders and the little shining beetles , the flycatchers , and sparrows in the ivy ; touched the mosses and the lichens ; looked the speedwells in the eye ; dreamed of [he]122-pierson knew not what . A hawk had been wheeling up there above [the woods]337-the woods , and [he]122-pierson had been up there with it in the blue . [He]122-pierson had taken a real spiritual bath , and washed the dusty fret of [London]7-london off [his]122-pierson soul .

For a year [he]122-pierson had been working [[his]122-pierson parish]338-his parish single - handed - no joke - for [[his]122-pierson curate]339-his curate had gone for [a chaplain]340-a chaplain ; and this was [his]122-pierson first real holiday since the war began , two years ago ; [his]122-pierson first visit , too , to [[[his]122-pierson brother]327-his brother 's home]342-his brother 's home . [He]122-pierson looked down at [the garden]343-the garden , and up at the trees of [the avenue]332-the avenue . [Bob]125-pierson had found a perfect retreat after [his]125-pierson quarter of a century in [Ceylon]8-ceylon . [Dear old Bob]125-pierson ! And [he]122-pierson smiled at the thought of [[his]122-pierson elder brother]345-his elder brother , whose burnt face and fierce grey whiskers somewhat recalled a Bengal tiger ; [the kindest fellow that ever breathed]346-the kindest fellow that ever breathed ! Yes , [he]122-pierson had found [a perfect home for [Thirza]137-thirza and [himself]122-pierson]347-a perfect home for thirza and himself . And [Edward Pierson]122-pierson sighed . [He]122-pierson too had once had [a perfect home]348-a perfect home , [a perfect wife]349-a perfect wife ; the wound of whose death , fifteen years ago , still bled a little in [his]122-pierson heart . [[Their]350-their two daughters]351-their two daughters , [Gratian]127-gratian and [Noel]197-noel , had not " taken after "[127-gratian] [her]349-a perfect wife ; [Gratian]127-gratian was like [[his]122-pierson own mother]352-his own mother , and [Noel]197-noel 's fair hair and big grey eyes always reminded [him]122-pierson of [[his]122-pierson cousin]353-his cousin [Leila]129-leila lynch , who - poor thing ! - had made that sad mess of [her]129-leila lynch life , and now , [he]122-pierson had heard , was singing for a living , in [South Africa]9-south africa . Ah ! What [a pretty girl]354-a pretty girl [she]349-a perfect wife had been !

Drawn by that eternal waltz tune [he]122-pierson reached the doorway of [the music - room]355-the music - room . A chintz curtain hung there , and to the sound of feet slipping on polished boards , [he]122-pierson saw [[his]122-pierson daughter]356-his daughter [Noel]197-noel waltzing slowly in the arms of [a young officer in khaki]357-a young officer in khaki : Round and round [they]358-they went , circling , backing , moving sideways with curious steps which seemed to have come in recently , for [he]122-pierson did not recognise [them]358-they . At the piano sat [[his]122-pierson niece]359-his niece [Eve]130-eve , with a teasing smile on [her]130-eve rosy face . But it was at [[his]122-pierson young daughter]360-his young daughter that [Edward Pierson]122-pierson looked . [Her]349-a perfect wife eyes were half - closed , [her]349-a perfect wife cheeks rather pale , and [her]349-a perfect wife fair hair , cut quite short , curled into [her]349-a perfect wife slim round neck . Quite cool [she]349-a perfect wife seemed , though [the young man in whose arms [she]349-a perfect wife was gliding along]361-the young man in whose arms she was gliding along looked fiery hot ; [a handsome boy , with blue eyes]362-a handsome boy , with blue eyes and a little golden down on the upper lip of [his]361-the young man in whose arms she was gliding along sunny red - cheeked face . [Edward Pierson]122-pierson thought : ' [Nice couple]363-nice couple ! ' And had a moment 's vision of [himself]122-pierson and [Leila]129-leila lynch , dancing at that long - ago Cambridge May Week - on [her]349-a perfect wife seventeenth birthday , [he]122-pierson remembered , so that [she]349-a perfect wife must have been a year younger than [Nollie]131-nollie was now ! This would be [the young man [she]349-a perfect wife had talked of in [her]349-a perfect wife letters during the last three weeks]364-the young man she had talked of in her letters during the last three weeks . Were [they]365-they never going to stop ?

[He]122-pierson passed into view of those within , and said :

" Are n't [you]349-a perfect wife very hot , [Nollie]131-nollie ? "[122-pierson]

[She]349-a perfect wife blew [him]122-pierson a kiss ; [the young man]366-the young man looked startled and self - conscious , and [Eve]130-eve called out :

" It 's a bet , [Uncle]3026-uncle . [They]365-they 've got to dance [me]130-eve down . "[130-eve]

[Pierson]122-pierson said mildly :

" A bet ? [[My]122-pierson dears]3027-my dears ! "[122-pierson]

[Noel]197-noel murmured over [her]349-a perfect wife shoulder :

" It 's all right , [Daddy]132-daddy ! "[197-noel] And [the young man]366-the young man gasped :

" [She]349-a perfect wife 's bet [us]365-they one of [her]349-a perfect wife puppies against one of [mine]130-eve , [sir]3028-sir ! "[366-the young man]

[Pierson]122-pierson sat down , a little hypnotized by the sleepy strumming , the slow giddy movement of [the dancers]368-the dancers , and those half - closed swimming eyes of [[his]122-pierson young daughter]360-his young daughter , looking at [him]122-pierson over [her]349-a perfect wife shoulder as [she]349-a perfect wife went by . [He]122-pierson sat with a smile on [his]122-pierson lips . [Nollie]131-nollie was growing up ! Now that [Gratian]127-gratian was married , [she]131-nollie had become a great responsibility . If only [[his]122-pierson dear wife]370-his dear wife had lived ! The smile faded from [his]122-pierson lips ; [he]122-pierson looked suddenly very tired . The struggle , physical and spiritual , [he]122-pierson had been through , these fifteen years , sometimes weighed [him]122-pierson almost to the ground : [Most men]371-most men would have married again , but [he]122-pierson had always felt it would be sacrilege . Real unions were for ever , even though [the Church]372-the church permitted remarriage .

[He]122-pierson watched [[his]122-pierson young daughter]360-his young daughter with a mixture of aesthetic pleasure and perplexity . Could this be good for [her]360-his young daughter ? To go on dancing indefinitely with [one young man]374-one young man could that possibly be good for [her]360-his young daughter ? But [they]375-they looked very happy ; and there was so much in [young creatures]376-young creatures that [he]122-pierson did not understand . [Noel]197-noel , so affectionate , and dreamy , seemed sometimes possessed of a little devil . [Edward Pierson]122-pierson was naif ; attributed those outbursts of demonic possession to the loss of [[her]360-his young daughter mother]377-her mother when [she]360-his young daughter was [such a mite]378-such a mite ; [Gratian]127-gratian , but two years older , had never taken [[a mother]379-a mother 's place]380-a mother 's place . That had been left to [himself]122-pierson , and [he]122-pierson was more or less conscious of failure .

[He]122-pierson sat there looking up at [her]360-his young daughter with a sort of whimsical distress . And , suddenly , in that dainty voice of [hers]360-his young daughter , which seemed to spurn each word a little , [she]360-his young daughter said :

" [I]360-his young daughter 'm going to stop ! "[360-his young daughter] and , sitting down beside [him]122-pierson , took up [his]122-pierson hat to fan [herself]360-his young daughter .

[Eve]130-eve struck a triumphant chord . " Hurrah [I]130-eve 've won ! "[130-eve]

[The young man]366-the young man muttered :

" [I]366-the young man say , [Noel]197-noel , [we]3029-we were n't half done ! "[366-the young man]

" [I]366-the young man know ; but [Daddy]132-daddy was getting bored , were n't [you]366-the young man , [dear]3030-dear ? This is [Cyril Morland]133-cyril . "[366-the young man]

[Pierson]122-pierson shook [the young man]366-the young man 's hand .

" [Daddy]132-daddy , [your]366-the young man nose is burnt ! "[366-the young man]

" [[My]366-the young man dear]3031-my dear ; [I]366-the young man know . "[366-the young man]

" [I]366-the young man can give [you]366-the young man some white stuff for it . [You]366-the young man have to sleep with it on all night . [Uncle]3032-uncle and [Auntie]3033-auntie both use it . "[366-the young man]

" [Nollie]131-nollie ! "[366-the young man]

" Well , [Eve]130-eve says so . If [you]366-the young man 're going to bathe , [Cyril]133-cyril , look out for that current ! "[366-the young man]

[The young man]366-the young man , gazing at [her]366-the young man with undisguised adoration , muttered :

" Rather ! "[366-the young man] and went out .

[Noel]197-noel 's eyes lingered after [him]366-the young man ; [Eve]130-eve broke a silence .

" If [you]366-the young man 're going to have a bath before tea , [Nollie]131-nollie , [you]366-the young man 'd better hurry up . "[130-eve]

" All right . Was it jolly in [the Abbey]3034-the abbey , [Daddy]132-daddy ? "[366-the young man]

" Lovely ; like a great piece of music . "[130-eve]

" [Daddy]132-daddy always puts everything into music . [You]366-the young man ought to see it by moonlight ; it 's gorgeous then . All right , [Eve]130-eve ; [I]366-the young man 'm coming . "[366-the young man] But [she]366-the young man did not get up , and when [Eve]130-eve was gone , cuddled [her]366-the young man arm through [[her]366-the young man father]384-her father 's and murmured :

" What d'you think of [Cyril]133-cyril ? "[130-eve]

" [[My]366-the young man dear]3031-my dear , how can [I]366-the young man tell ? [He]133-cyril seems [a nice - looking young man]3036-a nice - looking young man . "[366-the young man]

" All right , [Daddy]132-daddy ; do n't strain [yourself]132-daddy . It 's jolly down here , is n't it ? "[366-the young man] [She]366-the young man got up , stretched [herself]366-the young man a little , and moved away , looking like [a very tall child]385-a very tall child , with [her]366-the young man short hair curling in round [her]366-the young man head .

[Pierson]122-pierson , watching [her]366-the young man vanish past the curtain , thought : ' What a lovely thing [she]366-the young man is ! ' And [he]122-pierson got up too , but instead of following , went to the piano , and began to play [Mendelssohn]134-mendelssohn 's Prelude and Fugue in E minor . [He]122-pierson had a fine touch , and played with a sort of dreamy passion . It was [his]122-pierson way out of perplexities , regrets , and longings ; a way which never quite failed [him]122-pierson .

At [Cambridge]10-cambridge , [he]122-pierson had intended to take up music as a profession , but family tradition had destined [him]122-pierson for [Holy Orders]11-holy orders , and an emotional Church revival of that day had caught [him]122-pierson in its stream . [He]122-pierson had always had private means , and those early years before [he]122-pierson married had passed happily in [an East - End parish]386-an east - end parish . To have not only opportunity but power to help in the lives of [the poor]387-the poor had been fascinating ; simple [himself]122-pierson , [the simple folk of [[his]122-pierson parish]338-his parish]388-the simple folk of his parish had taken hold of [his]122-pierson heart . When , however , [he]122-pierson married [Agnes Heriot]135-agnes , [he]122-pierson was given [a parish of [his]122-pierson own]390-a parish of his own on [the borders of [East]12-east and West , where [he]122-pierson had been ever since , even after [her]135-agnes death had nearly killed [him]122-pierson]391-the borders of east and west , where he had been ever since , even after her death had nearly killed him . It was better to go on where work and all reminded [him]122-pierson of [one whom [he]122-pierson had resolved never to forget in other ties]392-one whom he had resolved never to forget in other ties . But [he]122-pierson knew that [his]122-pierson work had not the zest it used to have in [her]135-agnes day , or even before [her]135-agnes day . It may well be doubted whether [he]122-pierson , who had been in [Holy Orders]11-holy orders twenty - six years , quite knew now what [he]122-pierson believed . Everything had become circumscribed , and fixed , by thousands of [his]122-pierson own utterances ; to have taken fresh stock of [his]122-pierson faith , to have gone deep into its roots , would have been like taking up the foundations of [a still - standing house]393-a still - standing house . [Some men]394-some men naturally root [themselves]394-some men in the inexpressible - for which one formula is much the same as another ; though [Edward Pierson]122-pierson , gently dogmatic , undoubtedly preferred [his]122-pierson High - Church statement of the inexpressible to that of , say , [the Zoroastrians]136-the zoroastrians . The subtleties of change , the modifications by science , left little sense of inconsistency or treason on [his]122-pierson soul . Sensitive , charitable , and only combative deep down , [he]122-pierson instinctively avoided discussion on matters where [he]122-pierson might hurt [others]395-others or [they]395-others hurt [him]122-pierson . And , since explanation was the last thing which o could be expected of [one who did not base [himself]396-one who did not base himself on reason on Reason]396-one who did not base himself on reason , [he]122-pierson had found but scant occasion ever to examine anything . Just as in [the old Abbey]335-the old abbey [he]122-pierson had soared off into the infinite with the hawk , the beetles , and the grasses , so now , at the piano , by these sounds of [his]122-pierson own making , [he]122-pierson was caught away again into emotionalism , without realising that [he]122-pierson was in one of [his]122-pierson , most religious moods .

" Are n't [you]122-pierson coming to tea , [Edward]122-pierson ? "[398-the woman standing behind him , in a lilac - coloured gown , had one of those faces which remain innocent to the end of the chapter , in spite of the complete knowledge of life which appertains to mothers]

[The woman standing behind [him]122-pierson , in a lilac - coloured gown , had one of those faces which remain innocent to the end of the chapter , in spite of the complete knowledge of life which appertains to [mothers]399-mothers]398-the woman standing behind him , in a lilac - coloured gown , had one of those faces which remain innocent to the end of the chapter , in spite of the complete knowledge of life which appertains to mothers . In days of suffering and anxiety , like these of the great war , [Thirza Pierson]137-thirza was [a valuable person]400-a valuable person . Without ever expressing an opinion on cosmic matters , [she]137-thirza reconfirmed certain cosmic truths , such as that though [the whole world]401-the whole world was at war , there was such a thing as peace ; that though [all the sons of mothers]402-all the sons of mothers were being killed , there remained such a thing as motherhood ; that while [everybody]403-everybody was living for the future , the present still existed . [Her]137-thirza tranquil , tender , matter - of - fact busyness , and the dew in [her]137-thirza eyes , had been proof against twenty - three years of life on [a tea - plantation in [the hot part of [Ceylon]8-ceylon]405-the hot part of ceylon]404-a tea - plantation in the hot part of ceylon ; against [Bob Pierson]125-pierson ; against the anxiety of having [two sons at the front]406-two sons at the front , and the confidences of nearly every one [she]137-thirza came across . Nothing disturbed [her]137-thirza . [She]137-thirza was like a painting of " Goodness "[137-thirza] by [an Old Master]407-an old master , restored by [Kate Greenaway]138-kate greenaway . [She]137-thirza never went to meet life , but when it came , made the best of it . This was [her]137-thirza secret , and [Pierson]125-pierson always felt rested in [her]137-thirza presence .

[He]125-pierson rose , and moved by [her]137-thirza side , over [the lawn]408-the lawn , towards the big tree at the bottom of [the garden]343-the garden .

" How d'you think [Noel]197-noel is looking , [Edward]122-pierson ? "[125-pierson]

" Very pretty . [That young man]3037-that young man , [Thirza]137-thirza ? "[125-pierson]

" Yes ; [I]125-pierson 'm afraid [he]3037-that young man 's over head and ears in love with [her]137-thirza . "[125-pierson]

At the dismayed sound [he]125-pierson uttered , [she]137-thirza slipped [her]137-thirza soft round arm within [his]125-pierson . " [He]3037-that young man 's going to the front soon , [poor boy]3038-poor boy ! "[137-thirza]

" Have [they]3039-they talked to [you]122-pierson ? "[125-pierson]

" [He]3037-that young man has . [Nollie]131-nollie has n't yet . "[137-thirza]

" [Nollie]131-nollie is [a queer child]3040-a queer child , [Thirza]137-thirza . "[125-pierson]

" [Nollie]131-nollie is [a darling]3041-a darling , but rather a desperate character , [Edward]122-pierson . "[137-thirza]

[Pierson]122-pierson sighed .

In a swing under the tree , where the tea - things were set out , [the " rather desperate character "]3042-the " rather desperate character "[125-pierson] was swaying . " What a picture [she]131-nollie is ! "[122-pierson] [he]122-pierson said , and sighed again .

The voice of [[his]122-pierson brother]327-his brother came to [them]411-them , - high and steamy , as though corrupted by the climate of [Ceylon]8-ceylon :

" [You]327-his brother incorrigible dreamy chap , [Ted]122-pierson ! [We]411-them 've eaten all the raspberries . [Eve]130-eve , give [him]3037-that young man some jam ; [he]3037-that young man must be dead ! [Phew]139-phew ! the heat ! Come on , [[my]327-his brother dear]3031-my dear , and pour out [his]3037-that young man tea . Hallo , [Cyril]133-cyril ! Had a good bathe ? By [George]140-george , wish [my]327-his brother head was wet ! Squattez - vous down over there , by [Nollie]131-nollie ; [she]131-nollie 'll swing , and keep the flies off [you]133-cyril . "[327-his brother]

" Give [me]197-noel a cigarette , [Uncle Bob]141-uncle bob - "[197-noel]

" What ! [[Your]133-cyril father]3044-your father does n't - "[327-his brother]

" Just for the flies . [You]3044-your father do n't mind , [Daddy]132-daddy ? "[197-noel]

" Not if it 's necessary , [[my]327-his brother dear]3031-my dear . "[327-his brother]

[Noel]197-noel smiled , showing [her]412-her upper teeth , and [her]412-her eyes seemed to swim under their long lashes .

" It is n't necessary , but it 's nice . "[412-her]

" Ah , ha ! "[125-pierson] said [Bob Pierson]125-pierson . " Here [you]412-her are , [Nollie]131-nollie ! "[125-pierson]

But [Noel]197-noel shook [her]412-her head . At that moment [she]412-her struck [[her]412-her father]384-her father as startlingly grown - up - so composed , swaying above [that young man at [her]412-her feet]414-that young man at her feet , whose sunny face was all adoration . ' No longer [a child]415-a child ! ' [he]384-her father thought . ' [Dear Nollie]131-nollie ! '

II

1

Awakened by that daily cruelty , the advent of hot water , [Edward Pierson]122-pierson lay in [[his]122-pierson chintz - curtained room]416-his chintz - curtained room , fancying [himself]122-pierson back in [London]7-london . A wild bee hunting honey from the bowl of flowers on the window - sill , and the scent of sweetbrier , shattered that illusion . [He]122-pierson drew the curtain , and , kneeling on the window - seat thrust [his]122-pierson head out into the morning . The air was intoxicatingly sweet . Haze clung over [the river]417-the river and [the woods beyond]418-the woods beyond ; [the lawn]408-the lawn sparkled with dew , and two wagtails strutted in the dewy sunshine . ' Thank [God]143-god for loveliness ! ' [he]122-pierson thought . ' [Those poor boys]420-those poor boys at the front ! ' And kneeling with [his]122-pierson elbows on the sill , [he]122-pierson began to say [his]122-pierson prayers . The same feeling which made [him]122-pierson beautify [[his]122-pierson church]421-his church , use vestments , good music , and incense , filled [him]122-pierson now . [God]143-god was in the loveliness of [[His]122-pierson world]422-his world , as well as in [[His]122-pierson churches]423-his churches . [One]424-one could worship [Him]122-pierson in a grove of beech trees , in [a beautiful garden]425-a beautiful garden , on [a high hill]426-a high hill , by [the banks of a bright river]427-the banks of a bright river . [God]143-god was in the rustle of the leaves , and the hum of a bee , in the dew on the grass , and the scent of flowers ; [God]143-god was in everything ! And [he]122-pierson added to [his]122-pierson usual prayer this whisper : " [I]122-pierson give [Thee]143-god thanks for [my]122-pierson senses , [O Lord]3046-o lord . In all of [us]3047-us , keep them bright , and grateful for beauty . "[122-pierson] Then [he]122-pierson remained motionless , prey to a sort of happy yearning very near , to melancholy . Great beauty ever had that effect on [him]122-pierson . [One]424-one could capture so little of it - could never enjoy it enough ! Who was it had said not long ago : " Love of beauty is really only the sex instinct , which nothing but complete union satisfies . "[140-george] Ah ! yes , [George]140-george - [[Gratian]127-gratian 's husband]429-gratian 's husband . [George Laird]140-george ! And a little frown came between [his]140-george brows , as though at some thorn in the flesh . [Poor George]144-poor george ! But then , [all doctors]430-all doctors were [materialists at heart]431-materialists at heart - [splendid fellows]432-splendid fellows , though ; [a fine fellow]433-a fine fellow , [George]140-george , working [himself]140-george to death out there in [France]13-france . [One]424-one must not take [them]435-them too seriously . [He]122-pierson plucked a bit of sweetbrier and put it to [his]122-pierson nose , which still retained the shine of that bleaching ointment [Noel]197-noel had insisted on [his]122-pierson using . The sweet smell of those little rough leaves stirred up an acute aching . [He]122-pierson dropped them , and drew back . No longings , no melancholy ; [one]424-one ought to be out , this beautiful morning !

It was Sunday ; but [he]122-pierson had not to take three Services and preach at least one sermon ; this day of rest was really to be [his]122-pierson own , for once . It was almost disconcerting ; [he]122-pierson had so long felt like the cab horse who could not be taken out of the shafts lest [he]122-pierson should fall down . [He]122-pierson dressed with extraordinary deliberation , and had not quite finished when there came a knock on [his]122-pierson door , and [Noel]197-noel 's voice said : " Can [I]197-noel come in , [Daddy]132-daddy ? "[197-noel]

In [her]437-her flax - blue frock , with a Gloire de Dijon rose pinned where it met on [her]437-her faintly browned neck , [she]437-her seemed to [[her]437-her father]384-her father a perfect vision of freshness .

" Here 's a letter from [Gratian]127-gratian ; [George]140-george has been sent [home]3048-home ill , and [he]140-george 's gone to [[our]3049-our house]3050-our house . [She]127-gratian 's got leave from [[her]127-gratian hospital]3051-her hospital to come [home]3048-home and nurse [him]140-george . "[437-her]

[Pierson]122-pierson read the letter . " Poor [George]140-george ! "[122-pierson]

" When are [you]122-pierson going to let [me]437-her be [a nurse]3053-a nurse , [Daddy]132-daddy ? "[437-her]

" [We]3049-our must wait till [you]122-pierson 're eighteen , [Nollie]131-nollie . "[122-pierson]

" [I]437-her could easily say [I]437-her was . It 's only a month ; and [I]437-her look much more . "[437-her]

[Pierson]122-pierson smiled .

" Do n't [I]122-pierson ? "[122-pierson]

" [You]122-pierson might be anything from fifteen to twenty - five , [[my]122-pierson dear]3031-my dear , according as [you]122-pierson behave . "[122-pierson]

" [I]122-pierson want to go out as near the front as possible . "[122-pierson]

[Her]439-her head was poised so that the sunlight framed [her]439-her face , which was rather broad - the brow rather too broad - under the waving light - brown hair , the nose short and indeterminate ; cheeks still round from youth , almost waxen - pale , and faintly hollowed under the eyes . It was [her]439-her lips , dainty yet loving , and above all [her]439-her grey eyes , big and dreamily alive , which made [her]439-her a swan . [He]122-pierson could not imagine [her]439-her in [nurse]440-nurse 's garb .

" This is new , is n't it , [Nollie]131-nollie ? "[439-her]

" [[Cyril Morland]133-cyril 's sisters]3055-cyril morland 's sisters are both out ; and [he]133-cyril 'll be going soon . [Everybody]403-everybody goes . "[439-her]

" [Gratian]127-gratian has n't got out yet : It takes a long time to get trained . "[439-her]

" [I]439-her know ; all the more reason to begin . "[439-her]

[She]439-her got up , looked at [him]122-pierson , looked at [her]439-her hands , seemed about to speak , but did not . A little colour had come into [her]439-her cheeks . Then , obviously making conversation , [she]439-her asked :

" Are [you]122-pierson going to [church]3057-church ? It 's worth anything to hear [Uncle Bob]141-uncle bob read the Lessons , especially when [he]141-uncle bob loses [his]141-uncle bob place . No ; [you]122-pierson 're not to put on [your]122-pierson long coat till just before church time . [I]439-her wo n't have it ! "[439-her]

Obediently [Pierson]122-pierson resigned [his]122-pierson long coat .

" Now , [you]122-pierson see , [you]122-pierson can have [my]439-her rose . [Your]122-pierson nose is better ! "[439-her] [She]439-her kissed [his]122-pierson nose , and transferred [her]439-her rose to the buttonhole of [his]122-pierson short coat . " That 's all . Come along ! "[439-her] And with [her]439-her arm through [his]122-pierson , [they]441-they went down . But [he]122-pierson knew [she]439-her had come to say something which [she]439-her had not said .

2

[Bob Pierson]125-pierson , in virtue of greater wealth than [the rest of [the congregation]443-the congregation]442-the rest of the congregation , always read the Lessons , in [his]125-pierson high steamy voice , [his]125-pierson breathing never adjusted to the length of any period . [The congregation]443-the congregation , accustomed , heard nothing peculiar ; [he]125-pierson was the necessary gentry with the necessary finger in the pie . It was [[his]125-pierson own family]445-his own family whom [he]125-pierson perturbed . In [the second row]446-the second row , [Noel]197-noel , staring solemnly at the profile of [[her]447-her father]384-her father in [the front row]449-the front row , was thinking : ' [Poor Daddy]132-daddy ! [His]132-daddy eyes look as if they were coming out . Oh , [Daddy]132-daddy ! Smile ! or it 'll hurt [you]132-daddy ! ' Young Morland beside [her]447-her , rigid in [his]132-daddy tunic , was thinking : ' [She]450-she is n't thinking of [me]0-i ! ' And just then [her]447-her little finger crooked into [his]384-her father . [Edward Pierson]122-pierson was thinking : ' Oh ! [[My]0-i dear]3031-my dear old [Bob]125-pierson ! Oh ! ' And , beside [him]384-her father , [Thirza]137-thirza thought : ' [Poor dear Ted]122-pierson [I]0-i how nice for [him]122-pierson to be having a complete rest ! [I]0-i must make [him]122-pierson eat [he]122-pierson 's so thin ! ' And [Eve]130-eve was thinking : ' Oh , [Father]145-father ! [Mercy]146-mercy ! ' But [Bob Pierson]125-pierson was thinking : ' Cheer oh ! Only another three verses ! ' [Noel]197-noel 's little finger unhooked itself , but [her]447-her eyes stole round to [young Morland]133-cyril 's eyes , and there was a light in them which lingered through the singing and the prayers . At last , in the reverential rustle of [the settling congregation]452-the settling congregation , [a surpliced figure]453-a surpliced figure mounted the pulpit .

" [I]453-a surpliced figure come not to bring Peace , but a sword . "[453-a surpliced figure]

[Pierson]125-pierson looked up . [He]125-pierson felt deep restfulness . There was a pleasant light in [this church]454-this church ; the hum of [a country bluebottle]455-a country bluebottle made all the difference to the quality of silence . No critical thought stirred within [him]125-pierson , nor any excitement . [He]125-pierson was thinking : ' Now [I]0-i shall hear something for [my]0-i good ; a fine text ; when did [I]0-i preach from it last ? ' Turned a little away from [the others]456-the others , [he]125-pierson saw nothing but [the preacher]457-the preacher 's homely face up there above the carved oak ; it was so long since [he]457-the preacher had been preached to , so long since [he]457-the preacher had had a rest ! The words came forth , dropped on [his]125-pierson forehead , penetrated , met something which absorbed them , and disappeared . ' A good plain sermon ! ' [he]125-pierson thought . ' [I]0-i suppose [I]0-i 'm stale ; [I]0-i do n't seem - ' " Let [us]3058-us not , [dear brethren]3059-dear brethren , "[457-the preacher] droned [the preacher]457-the preacher 's earnest voice , " think that [[our]3058-us dear Lord]3060-our dear lord , in saying that [He]3060-our dear lord brought a sword , referred to a physical sword . It was the sword of the spirit to which [He]3060-our dear lord was undoubtedly referring , that bright sword of the spirit which in all ages has cleaved its way through the fetters imposed on [men]3061-men [themselves]3061-men by [their]3061-men own desires , imposed by [men]3061-men on [other men]3063-other men in gratification of [their]3061-men ambitions , as [we]3058-us have had so striking an example in the invasion by [[our]3058-us cruel enemies]3064-our cruel enemies of [a little neighbouring country]3065-a little neighbouring country which had done [them]3064-our cruel enemies no harm . [Dear brethren]3059-dear brethren , [we]3058-us may [all bring swords]3067-all bring swords . "[457-the preacher] [Pierson]125-pierson 's chin jerked ; [he]125-pierson raised [his]125-pierson hand quickly and passed it over [his]125-pierson face . ' All bring swords , ' [he]125-pierson thought , ' swords - [I]0-i was n't asleep - surely ! ' " But let [us]3058-us be sure that [our]3058-us swords are bright ; bright with hope , and bright with faith , that [we]3058-us may see them flashing among the carnal desires of this mortal life , carving a path for [us]3058-us towards [that heavenly kingdom where alone is peace , perfect peace]3068-that heavenly kingdom where alone is peace , perfect peace . Let [us]3058-us pray . "[125-pierson]

[Pierson]125-pierson did not shut [his]125-pierson eyes ; [he]125-pierson opened them as [he]125-pierson fell on [his]125-pierson knees . In the seat behind , [Noel]197-noel and [young Morland]133-cyril had also fallen on [their]459-their knees [their]459-their faces covered each with a single hand ; but [her]460-her left hand and [his]125-pierson right hung at [their]459-their sides . [They]459-their prayed a little longer than [any others]461-any others and , on rising , sang the hymn a little louder .

3

No paper came on Sundays - not even [the local paper , which had so long and so nobly done its bit with headlines to win the war]462-the local paper , which had so long and so nobly done its bit with headlines to win the war . No news whatever came , of [men blown up , to enliven the hush of the hot July afternoon , or the sense of drugging]463-men blown up , to enliven the hush of the hot july afternoon , or the sense of drugging - which followed [Aunt Thirza]137-thirza 's Sunday lunch . [Some]464-some slept , [some]464-some thought [they]464-some were awake ; but [Noel]197-noel and [young Morland]133-cyril walked upward through [the woods]337-the woods towards [a high common of heath and furze]467-a high common of heath and furze , crowned by what was known as Kestrel rocks . Between [these two young people]468-these two young people no actual word of love had yet been spoken . [Their]468-these two young people lovering had advanced by glance and touch alone .

[Young Morland]147-young morland was [a school and college friend of [the two Pierson boys now at the front]470-the two pierson boys now at the front]469-a school and college friend of the two pierson boys now at the front . [He]147-young morland had [no home of [his]147-young morland own]471-no home of his own , for [[his]147-young morland parents]472-his parents were dead ; and this was not [his]147-young morland first visit to [Kestrel]199-kestrel . Arriving three weeks ago , for [his]147-young morland final leave before [he]147-young morland should go out , [he]147-young morland had found [a girl sitting in a little wagonette outside [the station]474-the station]473-a girl sitting in a little wagonette outside the station , and had known [his]147-young morland fate at once . But who knows when [Noel]197-noel fell in love ? [She]473-a girl sitting in a little wagonette outside the station was - one supposes - just ready for that sensation . For the last two years [she]473-a girl sitting in a little wagonette outside the station had been at one of [those high - class finishing establishments]475-those high - class finishing establishments where , in spite of the healthy curriculum , perhaps because of it , there is ever an undercurrent of interest in the opposing sex ; and not even the gravest efforts to eliminate instinct are quite successful . The disappearance of [every young male thing into the maw of the military machine]476-every young male thing into the maw of the military machine put a premium on instinct . The thoughts of [Noel]197-noel and [[her]473-a girl sitting in a little wagonette outside the station school companions]477-her school companions were turned , perforce , to that which , in pre - war freedom of opportunity [they]478-they could afford to regard as of secondary interest . Love and Marriage and Motherhood , fixed as the lot of [women by the countless ages]479-women by the countless ages , were threatened for [these young creatures]480-these young creatures . [They]478-they not unnaturally pursued what [they]478-they felt to be receding .

When [young Morland]133-cyril showed , by following [her]473-a girl sitting in a little wagonette outside the station about with [his]133-cyril eyes , what was happening to [him]133-cyril , [Noel]197-noel was pleased . From being pleased , [she]473-a girl sitting in a little wagonette outside the station became a little excited ; from being excited [she]473-a girl sitting in a little wagonette outside the station became dreamy . Then , about a week before [[her]473-a girl sitting in a little wagonette outside the station father]384-her father 's arrival , [she]473-a girl sitting in a little wagonette outside the station secretly began to follow [the young man]366-the young man about with [her]473-a girl sitting in a little wagonette outside the station eyes ; became capricious too , and a little cruel . If there had been [another young man to favour]483-another young man to favour - but there was not ; and [she]473-a girl sitting in a little wagonette outside the station favoured [Uncle Bob]141-uncle bob 's red setter . [Cyril Morland]133-cyril grew desperate . During those three days the demon [[her]473-a girl sitting in a little wagonette outside the station father]384-her father dreaded certainly possessed [her]473-a girl sitting in a little wagonette outside the station . And then , one evening , while [they]485-they walked back together from [the hay - fields]486-the hay - fields , [she]473-a girl sitting in a little wagonette outside the station gave [him]366-the young man a sidelong glance ; and [he]366-the young man gasped out : " Oh ! [Noel]197-noel , what have [I]473-a girl sitting in a little wagonette outside the station done ? "[473-a girl sitting in a little wagonette outside the station] [She]473-a girl sitting in a little wagonette outside the station caught [his]366-the young man hand , and gave it a quick squeeze . What a change ! What blissful alteration ever since !

Through the wood [young Morland]133-cyril mounted silently , screwing [himself]133-cyril up to put things to the touch . [Noel]197-noel too mounted silently , thinking : ' [I]0-i will kiss [him]366-the young man if [he]366-the young man kisses [me]0-i ! ' Eagerness , and a sort of languor , were running in [her]473-a girl sitting in a little wagonette outside the station veins ; [she]473-a girl sitting in a little wagonette outside the station did not look at [him]366-the young man from under [her]473-a girl sitting in a little wagonette outside the station shady hat . Sun light poured down through every chink in the foliage ; made the greenness of [the steep wood]487-the steep wood marvellously vivid and alive ; flashed on beech leaves , ash leaves , birch leaves ; fell on the ground in little runlets ; painted bright patches on trunks and grass , the beech mast , the ferns ; butterflies chased each other in that sunlight , and myriads of ants and gnats and flies seemed possessed by a frenzy of life . [The whole wood]488-the whole wood seemed possessed , as if the sunshine were a happy Being which had come to dwell therein . At a half - way spot , where the trees opened and [they]489-they could see , far below [them]489-they , the gleam of [the river]417-the river , [she]473-a girl sitting in a little wagonette outside the station sat down on the bole of a beech - tree , and [young Morland]133-cyril stood looking at [her]473-a girl sitting in a little wagonette outside the station . Why should one face and not [an other , this voice and not that]491-an other , this voice and not that , make a heart beat ; why should a touch from one hand awaken rapture , and a touch from another awaken nothing ? [He]366-the young man knelt down and pressed [his]366-the young man lips to [her]473-a girl sitting in a little wagonette outside the station foot . [Her]473-a girl sitting in a little wagonette outside the station eyes grew very bright ; but [she]473-a girl sitting in a little wagonette outside the station got up and ran on - [she]473-a girl sitting in a little wagonette outside the station had not expected [him]366-the young man to kiss [her]473-a girl sitting in a little wagonette outside the station foot . [She]473-a girl sitting in a little wagonette outside the station heard [him]366-the young man hurrying after [her]473-a girl sitting in a little wagonette outside the station , and stopped , leaning against a birch trunk . [He]366-the young man rushed to [her]473-a girl sitting in a little wagonette outside the station , and , without a word spoken , [his]366-the young man lips were on [her]473-a girl sitting in a little wagonette outside the station lips . The moment in life , which no words can render , had come for [them]492-they . [They]492-they had found [their]492-they enchanted spot , and [they]492-they moved no further , but sat with [their]492-they arms round [each other]493-each other , while [the happy Being of the wood]494-the happy being of the wood watched . A marvellous speeder - up of Love is War . What might have taken six months , was thus accomplished in three weeks .

A short hour passed , then [Noel]197-noel said :

" [I]197-noel must tell [Daddy]132-daddy , [Cyril]133-cyril . [I]197-noel meant to tell [him]132-daddy something this morning , only [I]197-noel thought [I]197-noel 'd better wait , in case [you]133-cyril did n't . "[197-noel]

[Morland]133-cyril answered : " Oh , [Noel]197-noel ! "[133-cyril] It was the staple of [his]133-cyril conversation while [they]492-they sat there .

Again a short hour passed , and [Morland]133-cyril said :

" [I]133-cyril shall go off [[my]133-cyril chump]3069-my chump if [we]492-they 're not married before [I]133-cyril go out . "[133-cyril]

" How long does it take ? "[496-i]

" No time , if [we]492-they hurry up . [I]133-cyril 've got six days before [I]133-cyril rejoin , and perhaps [the Chief]3070-the chief will give [me]133-cyril another week , if [I]133-cyril tell [him]3070-the chief . "[133-cyril]

" [Poor Daddy]132-daddy ! Kiss [me]496-i again ; a long one . "[496-i]

When [the long one]495-the long one was over , [she]496-i said :

" Then [I]496-i can come and be near [you]132-daddy till [you]132-daddy go out ? Oh , [Cyril]133-cyril ! "[496-i]

" Oh , [Noel]197-noel ! "[496-i]

" Perhaps [you]197-noel wo n't go so soon . Do n't go if [you]197-noel can help it ! "[496-i]

" Not if [I]496-i can help it , [darling]3071-darling ; but [I]496-i sha n't be able . "[496-i]

" No , of course not ; [I]496-i know . "[496-i]

[Young Morland]147-young morland clutched [his]147-young morland hair . " [Everyone]3072-everyone 's in [the same boat]3073-the same boat , but it ca n't last for ever ; and now [we]3074-we 're engaged [we]3074-we can be together all the time till [I]147-young morland 've got the licence or whatever it is . And then - ! "[147-young morland]

" [Daddy]132-daddy wo n't like [our]3074-we not being married in [a church]3075-a church ; but [I]133-cyril do n't care ! "[133-cyril]

Looking down at [her]497-her closed eyes , and [their]498-their lashes resting on [her]497-her cheeks , [young Morland]133-cyril thought :

' [[My]0-i God]499-my god ! [I]0-i 'm in [heaven]500-heaven ! '

Another short hour passed before [she]497-her freed [herself]497-her .

" [We]498-their must go , [Cyril]133-cyril . Kiss [me]497-her once more ! "[497-her]

It was nearly dinner - time , and [they]498-their ran down . 4

[Edward Pierson]122-pierson , returning from the Evening Service , where [he]122-pierson had read the Lessons , saw [them]498-their in the distance , and compressed [his]122-pierson lips . [Their]498-their long absence had vexed [him]122-pierson . What ought [he]122-pierson to do ? In the presence of [Love]148-love 's young dream , [he]122-pierson felt strange and helpless . That night , when [he]122-pierson opened the door of [[his]122-pierson room]501-his room , [he]122-pierson saw [Noel]197-noel on the window - seat , in [her]497-her dressing - gown , with the moonlight streaming in on [her]497-her .

" Do n't light up , [Daddy]132-daddy ; [I]497-her 've got something to say . "[497-her]

[She]497-her took hold of the little gold cross on [his]122-pierson vest , and turned it over .

" [I]497-her 'm engaged to [Cyril]133-cyril ; [we]3076-we want to be married this week . "[497-her]

It was exactly as if [someone]502-someone had punched [him]122-pierson in the ribs ; and at the sound [he]122-pierson made [she]497-her hurried on :

" [You]132-daddy see , [we]3076-we must be ; [he]133-cyril may be going out any day . "[497-her]

In the midst of [his]122-pierson aching consternation , [he]122-pierson admitted a kind of reason in [her]497-her words . But [he]122-pierson said :

" [[My]122-pierson dear]3031-my dear , [you]3031-my dear 're only [a child]415-a child . Marriage is the most serious thing in life ; [you]3031-my dear 've only known [him]133-cyril three weeks . "[122-pierson]

" [I]497-her know all that , [Daddy]132-daddy "[497-her] [her]497-her voice sounded so ridiculously calm ; " but [we]3076-we ca n't afford to wait . [He]133-cyril might never come back , [you]132-daddy see , and then [I]497-her should have missed [him]133-cyril . "[497-her]

" But , [Noel]197-noel , suppose [he]133-cyril never did come back ; it would only be much worse for [you]197-noel . "[497-her]

[She]497-her dropped the little cross , and took hold of [his]122-pierson hand , pressing it against [her]497-her heart . But still [her]497-her voice was calm :

" No ; much better , [Daddy]132-daddy ; [you]132-daddy think [I]497-her do n't know [my]497-her own feelings , but [I]497-her do . "[497-her] '

[The man in [Pierson]122-pierson]503-the man in pierson softened ; [the priest]504-the priest hardened .

" [Nollie]131-nollie , true marriage is the union of souls ; and for that , time is wanted . Time to know that [you]131-nollie feel and think the same , and love the same things . "[497-her]

" Yes , [I]497-her know ; but [we]3079-we do . "[497-her]

" [You]131-nollie ca n't tell that , [[my]497-her dear]3031-my dear ; [no one]3081-no one could in three weeks . "[497-her]

" But these are n't ordinary times , are [they]3082-they ? [People]3083-people have to do things in a hurry . Oh , [Daddy]132-daddy ! Be [an angel]3084-an angel ! [Mother]149-mother would have understood , and let [me]497-her , [I]497-her know ! "[497-her]

[Pierson]122-pierson drew away [his]122-pierson hand ; the words hurt , from reminder of [his]122-pierson loss , from reminder of [the poor substitute [he]122-pierson was]505-the poor substitute he was .

" Look , [Nollie]131-nollie ! "[122-pierson] [he]122-pierson said . " After all these years since [she]149-mother left [us]3079-we , [I]122-pierson 'm as lonely as ever , because [we]3079-we were really one . If [you]131-nollie marry [this young man]3085-this young man without knowing more of [your]131-nollie own hearts than [you]131-nollie can in such a little time , [you]131-nollie may regret it dreadfully ; [you]131-nollie may find it turn out , after all , nothing but a little empty passion ; or again , if anything happens to [him]3085-this young man before [you]131-nollie 've had any real married life together , [you]131-nollie 'll have a much greater grief and sense of loss to put up with than if [you]131-nollie simply stay engaged till after the war . Besides , [[my]122-pierson child]3086-my child , [you]3086-my child 're much too young . "[122-pierson]

[She]506-her sat so still that [he]122-pierson looked at [her]506-her in alarm . " But [I]122-pierson must ! "[122-pierson]

[He]122-pierson bit [his]122-pierson lips , and said sharply : " [You]506-her ca n't , [Nollie]131-nollie ! "[122-pierson]

[She]506-her got up , and before [he]122-pierson could stop [her]506-her , was gone . With the closing of the door , [his]122-pierson anger evaporated , and distress took its place . [Poor child]507-poor child ! What to do with [this wayward chicken]508-this wayward chicken just out of the egg , and wanting to be full - fledged at once ? The thought that [she]506-her would be lying miserable , crying , perhaps , beset [him]122-pierson so that [he]122-pierson went out into [the passage]509-the passage and tapped on [her]506-her door . Getting no answer , [he]122-pierson went in . It was dark but for a streak of moonlight , and in that [he]122-pierson saw [her]506-her , lying on [her]506-her bed , face down ; and [stealing]122-pierson up laid [his]122-pierson hand on [her]506-her head . [She]506-her did not move ; and , stroking [her]506-her hair , [he]122-pierson said gently :

" [Nollie]131-nollie dear , [I]122-pierson did n't mean to be harsh . If [I]122-pierson were [[your]131-nollie mother]3087-your mother , [I]122-pierson should know how to make [you]131-nollie see , but [I]122-pierson 'm only [an old bumble - daddy]3088-an old bumble - daddy . "[122-pierson]

[She]506-her rolled over , scrambling into a cross - legged posture on the bed . [He]122-pierson could see [her]506-her eyes shining . But [she]506-her did not speak ; [she]506-her seemed to know that in silence was [her]506-her strength .

[He]122-pierson said with a sort of despair :

" [You]131-nollie must let [me]122-pierson talk it over with [[your]131-nollie aunt]3089-your aunt . [She]3089-your aunt has a lot of good sense . "[122-pierson]

" Yes . "[122-pierson]

[He]122-pierson bent over and kissed [her]506-her hot forehead .

" Good night , [[my]122-pierson dear]3031-my dear ; do n't cry . Promise [me]122-pierson ! "[122-pierson]

[She]506-her nodded , and lifted [her]506-her face ; [he]122-pierson felt [her]506-her hot soft lips on [his]122-pierson forehead , and went away a little comforted .

But [Noel]197-noel sat on [her]506-her bed , hugging [her]506-her knees , listening to the night , to the emptiness and silence ; each minute so much lost of the little , little time left , that [she]506-her might have been with [him]197-noel .

[III

Pierson]150-pierson woke after a troubled and dreamful night , in which [he]122-pierson had thought [himself]122-pierson wandering in [heaven]500-heaven like a lost soul .

After regaining [[his]122-pierson room]501-his room last night nothing had struck [him]122-pierson more forcibly than the needlessness of [his]122-pierson words : " Do n't cry , [Nollie]131-nollie ! "[122-pierson] for [he]122-pierson had realised with uneasiness that [she]506-her had not been near crying . No ; there was in [her]506-her some emotion very different from the tearful . [He]122-pierson kept seeing [her]506-her cross - legged figure on the bed in that dim light ; tense , enigmatic , almost [Chinese]151-chinese ; kept feeling the feverish touch of [her]506-her lips . A good girlish burst of tears would have done [her]506-her good , and been a guarantee . [He]122-pierson had the uncomfortable conviction that [his]122-pierson refusal had passed [her]506-her by , as if unspoken . And , since [he]122-pierson could not go and make music at that time of night , [he]122-pierson had ended on [his]122-pierson knees , in a long search for guidance , which was not vouchsafed [him]122-pierson .

[The culprits]512-the culprits were demure at breakfast ; [no one]3081-no one could have told that for the last hour [they]512-the culprits had been sitting with [their]512-the culprits arms round [each other]493-each other , watching [the river]417-the river flow by , talking but little , through lips too busy . [Pierson]150-pierson pursued [[his]150-pierson sister - in - law]516-his sister - in - law to [the room]517-the room where [she]516-his sister - in - law did [her]516-his sister - in - law flowers every morning . [He]150-pierson watched [her]516-his sister - in - law for a minute dividing ramblers from pansies , cornflowers from sweet peas , before [he]150-pierson said :

" [I]150-pierson 'm very troubled , [Thirza]137-thirza . [Nollie]131-nollie came to [me]150-pierson last night . Imagine ! [They]512-the culprits want to get married - [those two]3091-those two ! "[150-pierson]

Accepting life as it came , [Thirza]137-thirza showed no dismay , but [her]137-thirza cheeks grew a little pinker , and [her]137-thirza eyes a little rounder . [She]137-thirza took up a sprig of mignonette , and said placidly :

" Oh , [my]137-thirza dear ! "[137-thirza]

" Think of it , [Thirza]137-thirza - [that child]3092-that child ! Why , it 's only a year or two since [she]3092-that child used to sit on [my]137-thirza knee and tickle [my]137-thirza face with [her]3092-that child hair . "[137-thirza]

[Thirza]137-thirza went on arranging [her]137-thirza flowers .

" [Noel]197-noel is older than [you]122-pierson think , [Edward]122-pierson ; [she]3092-that child is more than [her]3092-that child age . And real married life would n't begin for [them]3093-they till after - if it ever began . "[137-thirza]

[Pierson]122-pierson experienced a sort of shock . [[His]122-pierson sister - in - law]516-his sister - in - law 's words seemed criminally light - hearted .

" But - but - "[122-pierson] [he]122-pierson stammered ; " the union , [Thirza]137-thirza ! Who can tell what will happen before [they]3093-they come together again ! "[122-pierson]

[She]516-his sister - in - law looked at [his]122-pierson quivering face , and said gently :

" [I]516-his sister - in - law know , [Edward]122-pierson ; but if [you]122-pierson refuse , [I]516-his sister - in - law should be afraid , in these days , of what [Noel]197-noel might do . [I]516-his sister - in - law told [you]122-pierson there 's a streak of desperation in [her]3092-that child . "[516-his sister - in - law]

" [Noel]197-noel will obey [me]516-his sister - in - law . "[516-his sister - in - law]

" [I]516-his sister - in - law wonder ! There are so many of these war marriages now . "[516-his sister - in - law]

[Pierson]122-pierson turned away .

" [I]516-his sister - in - law think they 're dreadful . What do [they]3093-they mean - Just a momentary gratification of passion . [They]3093-they might just as well not be . "[516-his sister - in - law]

" [They]3093-they mean pensions , as a rule , "[137-thirza] said [Thirza]137-thirza calmly .

" [Thirza]137-thirza , that is cynical ; besides , it does n't affect this case . [I]516-his sister - in - law ca n't bear to think of [[my]516-his sister - in - law little Nollie]3094-my little nollie giving [herself]3094-my little nollie for a moment which may come to nothing , or may turn out the beginning of an unhappy marriage . Who is [this boy]3095-this boy - what is [he]3095-this boy ? [I]516-his sister - in - law know nothing of [him]3095-this boy . How can [I]516-his sister - in - law give [her]3094-my little nollie to [him]3095-this boy - it 's impossible ! If [they]3096-they had been engaged some time and [I]516-his sister - in - law knew something of [him]3095-this boy - yes , perhaps ; even at [her]3094-my little nollie age . But this hasty passionateness - it is n't right , it is n't decent . [I]516-his sister - in - law do n't understand , [I]516-his sister - in - law really do n't - how [a child like that]3097-a child like that can want it . The fact is , [she]3094-my little nollie does n't know what [she]3094-my little nollie 's asking , poor little [Nollie]131-nollie . [She]3094-my little nollie ca n't know the nature of marriage , and [she]3094-my little nollie ca n't realise its sacredness . If only [[her]3094-my little nollie mother]377-her mother were here ! Talk to [her]3094-my little nollie , [Thirza]137-thirza ; [you]137-thirza can say things that [I]516-his sister - in - law ca n't ! "[516-his sister - in - law]

[Thirza]137-thirza looked after [the retreating figure]519-the retreating figure . In spite of [his]519-the retreating figure cloth , perhaps a little because of it , [he]519-the retreating figure seemed to [her]137-thirza like [a child who had come to show [her]137-thirza [his]519-the retreating figure sore finger]520-a child who had come to show her his sore finger . And , having finished the arrangement of [her]137-thirza flowers , [she]137-thirza went out to find [[her]137-thirza niece]521-her niece . [She]137-thirza had not far to go ; for [Noel]197-noel was standing in [the hall]522-the hall , quite evidently lying in wait . [They]523-they went out together to [the avenue]332-the avenue .

[The girl]525-the girl began at once :

" It is n't any use talking to [me]525-the girl , [Auntie]152-auntie ; [Cyril]133-cyril is going to get a license . "[525-the girl]

" Quite . "[525-the girl]

[Noel]197-noel only smiled .

" Have [you]525-the girl the least idea what marriage means ? "[525-the girl]

[Noel]197-noel nodded .

" Really ? "[525-the girl]

" Of course . [Gratian]127-gratian is married . Besides , at [school]3099-school - "[525-the girl]

" [[Your]525-the girl father]3044-your father is dead against it . This is a sad thing for [him]3044-your father . "[525-the girl]

" [He]133-cyril might never have one , [you]525-the girl see . "[525-the girl]

[She]526-her looked at [[her]526-her niece]521-her niece , and a dim appreciation of this revolt of life menaced by death , of [youth threatened with extinction]529-youth threatened with extinction , stirred in [her]526-her . [Noel]197-noel 's teeth were clenched , [her]526-her lips drawn back , and [she]526-her was staring in front of [her]526-her .

" [Daddy]132-daddy ought n't to mind . [Old people]3102-old people have n't to fight , and get killed ; [they]3102-old people ought n't to mind [us]3103-us taking what [we]3103-us can . [They]3102-old people 've had [their]3102-old people good time . "[526-her]

It was such a just little speech that [Thirza]137-thirza answered :

" Yes ; perhaps [he]132-daddy has n't quite realised that . "[137-thirza]

" [I]137-thirza want to make sure of [Cyril]133-cyril , [Auntie]152-auntie ; [I]137-thirza want everything [I]137-thirza can have with [him]133-cyril while there 's the chance . " [I]137-thirza understand , "[137-thirza] [she]137-thirza said . " Only , [Nollie]131-nollie , suppose , when all this is over , and [we]3104-we breathe and live naturally once more , [you]131-nollie found [you]131-nollie 'd made a mistake ? "[137-thirza]

[Noel]197-noel shook [her]531-her head . " [I]197-noel have n't . "[197-noel]

" [We]3104-we all think that , [[my]137-thirza dear]3031-my dear ; but thousands of mistakes are made by people who no more dream [they]3106-they 're making [them]3106-they than [you]131-nollie do now ; and then it 's a very horrible business . " [Daddy]132-daddy 's [a darling]3041-a darling ; but [I]197-noel do n't always believe what [he]132-daddy believes , [you]131-nollie know . Besides , [I]197-noel 'm not making a mistake , [Auntie]152-auntie ! [I]197-noel love [Cyril]133-cyril ever so . "[197-noel]

[Thirza]137-thirza gave [her]532-her waist a squeeze .

" [You]131-nollie must n't make a mistake . [We]3109-we love [you]131-nollie too much , [Nollie]131-nollie . [I]137-thirza wish [we]3109-we had [Gratian]127-gratian here . "[137-thirza]

" [Gratian]127-gratian would back [me]197-noel up , "[197-noel] said [Noel]197-noel ; ' [she]533-she knows what the war is . And [you]532-her ought to , [Auntie]152-auntie . [Daddy]132-daddy does n't realise . [I]0-i know [he]133-cyril 's awfully good , but - [he]133-cyril 's forgotten . "[133-cyril]

" [[My]197-noel dear]3031-my dear , [I]197-noel think [he]133-cyril remembers only too well . [He]133-cyril was desperately attached to [[your]3031-my dear mother]3087-your mother . "[197-noel]

[Noel]197-noel clenched [her]532-her hands .

" Was [he]133-cyril ? Well , so am [I]197-noel to [Cyril]133-cyril , and [he]133-cyril to [me]197-noel . [We]3112-we would n't be unreasonable if it was n't - was n't necessary . [She]532-her turned ; and slipped back into [the house]538-the house ; and [Thirza]137-thirza , conscious of having been decoyed to [this young man]3085-this young man , who stood there with [his]3085-this young man arms folded , like [Napoleon before a battle]540-napoleon before a battle , smiled and said :

" Well , [Cyril]133-cyril , so [you]133-cyril 've betrayed [me]3085-this young man ! "[3085-this young man]

Even in speaking [she]532-her was conscious of the really momentous change in [this sunburnt , blue - eyed , lazily impudent youth]541-this sunburnt , blue - eyed , lazily impudent youth since the day [he]3085-this young man arrived , three weeks ago , in [[their]542-their little wagonette]543-their little wagonette . [He]3085-this young man took [her]532-her arm , just as [Noel]197-noel had , and made [her]532-her sit down beside [him]3085-this young man on the rustic bench , where [he]3085-this young man had evidently been told to wait .

" [You]532-her see , [Mrs. Pierson]155-mrs. pierson , "[3085-this young man] [he]3085-this young man said , " it 's not as if [Noel]197-noel were [an ordinary girl]3113-an ordinary girl in an ordinary time , is it ? [Noel]197-noel is [the sort of girl one would knock [one]424-one 's brains out for]3114-the sort of girl one would knock one 's brains out for ; and to send [me]3085-this young man out there knowing that [I]3085-this young man could have been married to [her]532-her and was n't , will take all the heart out of [me]3085-this young man . Of course [I]3085-this young man mean to come back , but [chaps]3116-chaps do get knocked over , and [I]3085-this young man think it 's cruel that [we]3117-we ca n't take what [we]3117-we can while [we]3117-we can . Besides , [I]3085-this young man 've got money ; and that would be [hers]532-her anyway . So , do be [a darling]3041-a darling , wo n't [you]544-her ? "[3085-this young man] [He]3085-this young man put [his]3085-this young man arm round [her]544-her waist , just as if [he]3085-this young man had been [[her]544-her son]545-her son , and [her]544-her heart , which wanted [[her]544-her own boys]546-her own boys so badly , felt warmed within [her]544-her .

" [You]544-her see , [I]3085-this young man do n't know [Mr. Pierson]156-pierson , but [he]156-pierson seems awfully gentle and jolly , and if [he]156-pierson could see into [me]3085-this young man [he]156-pierson would n't mind , [I]3085-this young man know . [We]3119-we do n't mind risking [our]3119-we lives and all that , but [we]3119-we do think [we]3119-we ought to have the run of [them]546-her own boys while [we]3119-we 're alive . [I]3085-this young man 'll give [him]156-pierson [my]3085-this young man dying oath or anything , that [I]3085-this young man could never change towards [Noel]197-noel , and [she]3120-she 'll do the same . Oh ! [Mrs. Pierson]155-mrs. pierson , do be [a jolly brick]3121-a jolly brick , and put in a word for [me]3085-this young man , quick ! [We]3119-we 've got so few days ! "[3085-this young man]

" But , [[my]137-thirza dear boy]3122-my dear boy , "[137-thirza] said [Thirza]137-thirza feebly , " do [you]3122-my dear boy think it 's fair to [such a child]3123-such a child as [Noel]197-noel ? "[137-thirza]

" Yes , [I]3085-this young man do . [You]3122-my dear boy do n't understand ; [she]3120-she 's simply had to grow up . [She]3120-she is grown - up - all in this week ; [she]3120-she 's quite as old as [I]3085-this young man am , really - and [I]3085-this young man 'm twenty - two . And [you]3122-my dear boy know it 's going to be - it 's got to be - a young world , from now on ; [people]3083-people will begin doing things much earlier . What 's the use of pretending it 's like what it was , and being cautious , and all that ? If [I]3085-this young man 'm going to be killed , [I]3085-this young man think [we]3119-we 've got a right to be married first ; and if [I]3085-this young man 'm not , then what does it matter ? "[3085-this young man]

" [You]3122-my dear boy 've known [each other]493-each other twenty - one days , [Cyril]133-cyril . "[133-cyril]

" No ; twenty - one years ! Every day 's a year when - Oh ! [Mrs. Pierson]155-mrs. pierson , this is n't like [you]3122-my dear boy , is it ? [You]3122-my dear boy never go to meet [trouble]3126-trouble , do [you]3122-my dear boy ? "[3085-this young man]

At that shrewd remark , [Thirza]137-thirza put [her]137-thirza hand on the hand which still clasped [her]137-thirza waist , and pressed it closer .

" Well , [[my]137-thirza dear]3031-my dear , "[137-thirza] [she]137-thirza said softly , " [we]3119-we must see what can be done . "[137-thirza]

[Cyril Morland]133-cyril kissed [her]137-thirza cheek . " [I]133-cyril will bless [you]137-thirza for ever , "[133-cyril] [he]133-cyril said . " [I]133-cyril have n't got [any people]3128-any people , [you]137-thirza know , except [[my]133-cyril two sisters]3129-my two sisters . "[133-cyril]

And something like tears started up on [Thirza]137-thirza 's eyelashes . [They]547-they seemed to [her]137-thirza like [the babes in the wood]548-the babes in the wood - those two !

IV

1

In the dining - room of [[[her]137-thirza father]384-her father 's house in [that old [London]7-london Square between [East]12-east and [West]15-west]551-that old london square between east and west]550-her father 's house in that old london square between east and west , [Gratian Laird]127-gratian , in the outdoor garb of [a nurse]3053-a nurse , was writing a telegram : " [Reverend Edward Pierson]122-pierson , [Kestrel , Tintern]3130-kestrel , tintern , [Monmouthshire]16-monmouthshire . [George]140-george terribly ill . Please come if [you]127-gratian can . [Gratian]127-gratian . "[127-gratian] Giving it to [a maid]553-a maid , [she]137-thirza took off [her]137-thirza long coat and sat down for a moment . [She]137-thirza had been travelling all night , after a full day 's work , and had only just arrived , to find [[her]137-thirza husband]554-her husband between life and death . [She]137-thirza was very different from [Noel]197-noel ; not quite so tall , but of a stronger build ; with dark chestnut - coloured hair , clear hazel eyes , and a broad brow . The expression of [her]137-thirza face was earnest , with a sort of constant spiritual enquiry ; and a singularly truthful look : [She]137-thirza was just twenty ; and of the year that [she]137-thirza had been married , had only spent six weeks with [[her]137-thirza husband]554-her husband ; [they]556-they had not even [a house of [their]556-they own]557-a house of their own as yet . After resting five minutes , [she]137-thirza passed [her]137-thirza hand vigorously over [her]137-thirza face , threw back [her]137-thirza head , and walked up [stairs]558-stairs to [the room where [he]554-her husband lay]559-the room where he lay . [He]554-her husband was not conscious , and there was nothing to be done but sit and watch [him]554-her husband .

' If [he]554-her husband dies , ' [she]137-thirza thought , ' [I]0-i shall hate [God]143-god for [His]554-her husband cruelty . [I]0-i have had six weeks with [George]140-george ; [some people]560-some people have sixty years . ' [She]137-thirza fixed [her]137-thirza eyes on [his]554-her husband face , short and broad , with bumps of " observation "[137-thirza] on the brows . [He]554-her husband had been sunburnt . The dark lashes of [his]554-her husband closed eyes lay on deathly yellow cheeks ; [his]554-her husband thick hair grew rather low on [his]554-her husband broad forehead . The lips were just open and showed strong white teeth . [He]554-her husband had a little clipped moustache , and hair had grown on [his]554-her husband clean - cut jaw . [His]554-her husband pyjama jacket had fallen open . [Gratian]127-gratian drew it close . It was curiously still , for a London day , though the window was wide open . Anything to break this heavy stupor , which was not only [George]140-george 's , but [her]137-thirza own , and [the very world]561-the very world 's ! The cruelty of it - when [she]137-thirza might be going to lose [him]554-her husband for ever , in a few hours or days ! [She]137-thirza thought of [their]562-they last parting . It had not been very loving , had come too soon after one of those arguments [they]562-they were inclined to have , in which [they]562-they could not as yet disagree with suavity . [George]140-george had said there was no future life for [the individual]563-the individual ; [she]137-thirza had maintained there was . [They]562-they had grown hot and impatient . Even in [the cab]564-the cab on the way to [[his]554-her husband train]565-his train [they]562-they had pursued the wretched discussion , and the last kiss had been from lips on lips yet warm from disagreement .

Ever since , as if in compunction , [she]137-thirza had been wavering towards [his]554-her husband point of view ; and now , when [he]554-her husband was perhaps to solve the problem - find out for certain - [she]137-thirza had come to feel that if [he]554-her husband died , [she]137-thirza would never see [him]554-her husband after . It was cruel that such a blight should have come on [her]137-thirza belief at this , of all moments .

[She]137-thirza laid [her]137-thirza hand on [his]554-her husband . It was warm , felt strong , although so motionless and helpless . [George]140-george was so vigorous , so alive , and strong - willed ; it seemed impossible that life might be going to play [him]140-george false . [She]137-thirza recalled the unflinching look of [his]554-her husband steel - bright eyes , [his]554-her husband deep , queerly vibrating voice , which had no trace of self - consciousness or pretence . [She]137-thirza slipped [her]137-thirza hand on to [his]554-her husband heart , and began very slowly , gently rubbing it . [He]554-her husband , as [doctor]566-doctor , and [she]137-thirza , as [nurse]440-nurse , had both seen so much of death these last two years ! Yet it seemed suddenly as if [she]137-thirza had never seen death , and that the young faces [she]137-thirza had seen , empty and white , in [the hospital wards]568-the hospital wards , had just been a show . [Death]157-death would appear to [her]137-thirza for the first time , if this face which [she]137-thirza loved were to be drained for ever of light and colour and movement and meaning .

A humblebee from [the Square Garden]569-the square garden boomed in and buzzed idly round [the room]517-the room . [She]137-thirza caught [her]137-thirza breath in a little sob ....

2

[Pierson]122-pierson received that telegram at midday , returning from a lonely walk after [his]122-pierson talk with [Thirza]137-thirza . Coming from [Gratian]127-gratian so self - reliant - it meant the worst . [He]122-pierson prepared at once to catch [the next train]571-the next train . [Noel]197-noel was out , [no one]3081-no one knew where : so with a sick feeling [he]122-pierson wrote :

" [DEAREST CHILD]3131-dearest child ,[122-pierson]

" [I]122-pierson am going up to [Gratian]127-gratian ; poor [George]140-george is desperately ill . If it goes badly [you]3131-dearest child should be with [[your]3131-dearest child sister]3132-your sister . [I]122-pierson will wire to - morrow morning early . [I]122-pierson leave [you]3131-dearest child in [[your]3131-dearest child aunt]3089-your aunt 's hands , [[my]122-pierson dear]3031-my dear . Be reasonable and patient . [God]143-god bless [you]3131-dearest child .[122-pierson]

" [Your]3131-dearest child devoted[122-pierson]

" [DADDY]132-daddy . "[122-pierson]

[He]122-pierson was alone in [[his]122-pierson third - class compartment]573-his third - class compartment , and , leaning forward , watched [the ruined Abbey]574-the ruined abbey across [the river]417-the river till [it]574-the ruined abbey was out of sight . [Those old monks]576-those old monks had lived in an age surely not so sad as this . [They]576-those old monks must have had peaceful lives , remote down here , in days when [the Church]372-the church was great and lovely , and [men]3061-men laid down [their]3061-men lives for [their]3061-men belief in [her]579-her , and built everlasting fanes to the glory of [God]143-god ! What a change to this age of rush and hurry , of science , trade , material profit , and this terrible war ! [He]122-pierson tried to read [his]122-pierson paper , but it was full of horrors and hate . ' When will it end ? ' [he]122-pierson thought . And [the train]580-the train with its rhythmic jolting seemed grinding out the answer : " Never - never ! "[583-the soldier]

At [Chepstow]18-chepstow [a soldier]581-a soldier got in , followed by [a woman with a very flushed face and curious , swimmy eyes]582-a woman with a very flushed face and curious , swimmy eyes ; [her]582-a woman with a very flushed face and curious , swimmy eyes hair was in disorder , and [her]582-a woman with a very flushed face and curious , swimmy eyes lip bleeding , as if [she]582-a woman with a very flushed face and curious , swimmy eyes had bitten it through . [The soldier]583-the soldier , too , looked strained and desperate . [They]584-they sat down , far apart , on the seat opposite . [The soldier]583-the soldier flung [himself]583-the soldier back on the seat and looked at [Pierson]122-pierson .

" [The wife]3135-the wife an ' [me]583-the soldier 's ' ad a bit of a row , "[583-the soldier] [he]583-the soldier said companionably . [[Her]612-her father]384-her father had suddenly thrown up [his]384-her father hands to [his]384-her father ears . [She]612-her moved closer , and put [her]612-her arm round [him]384-her father .

" [[Dad]158-dad dear]3168-dad dear , [I]612-her 'm sorry . [I]612-her did n't mean to hurt [you]3168-dad dear . "[612-her]

[Pierson]122-pierson pressed [her]612-her face down to [his]384-her father shoulder ; and said in a dull voice :

" What do [you]612-her think would have happened to [me]122-pierson , [Gracie]159-gracie , if [I]122-pierson had lost belief when [[your]612-her mother]3087-your mother died ? [I]122-pierson have never lost belief . Pray God [I]122-pierson never shall ! "[122-pierson]

" [George]140-george would not wish [me]127-gratian to pretend [I]127-gratian believe - [he]140-george would want [me]127-gratian to be honest .
