" [We]3171-we can only help [ourselves]3171-we ; and [I]614-her can only bear it if [I]614-her rebel . "[614-her]

[Pierson]122-pierson sat with trembling lips , feeling that nothing [he]122-pierson could say would touch [her]614-her just then . [The sick man]611-the sick man 's face was hardly visible now in the twilight , and [Gratian]127-gratian went over to [his]615-him bed . [She]127-gratian stood looking down at [him]615-him a long time .

" Go and rest , [Dad]158-dad ; [the doctor]3143-the doctor 's coming again at eleven . [I]127-gratian 'll call [you]158-dad if [I]127-gratian want anything . [I]127-gratian shall lie down a little , beside [him]615-him . "[127-gratian]

[Pierson]122-pierson kissed [her]127-gratian , and went out . To lie there beside [him]615-him would be the greatest comfort [she]127-gratian could get . [He]122-pierson went to [the bare narrow little room [he]122-pierson had occupied]617-the bare narrow little room he had occupied ever since [[his]122-pierson wife]618-his wife died ; and , taking off [his]122-pierson boots , walked up and down , with a feeling of almost crushing loneliness . Both [[his]122-pierson daughters]619-his daughters in such trouble , and [he]122-pierson of no use to [them]619-his daughters ! It was as if [Life]160-life were pushing [him]122-pierson utterly aside ! [He]122-pierson felt confused , helpless , bewildered . Surely if [Gratian]127-gratian loved [George]140-george , [she]127-gratian had not left [God]143-god 's side , whatever [she]127-gratian might say . Then , conscious of the profound heresy of this thought , [he]122-pierson stood still at the open window .

Earthly love - heavenly love ; was there any analogy between [them]620-them ?

From [the Square Gardens]621-the square gardens the indifferent whisper of the leaves answered ; and [a newsvendor at the far end]622-a newsvendor at the far end , bawling [his]140-george nightly tale of murder . 3

[George Laird]140-george passed the crisis of [his]140-george illness that night , and in the morning was pronounced out of danger . [He]140-george had a splendid constitution , and - Scotsman on [[his]140-george father]623-his father 's side - a fighting character . [He]140-george came back to life very weak , but avid of recovery ; and [his]140-george first words were : " [I]140-george 've been hanging over the edge , [Gracie]159-gracie ! "[140-george]

[A very high cliff]624-a very high cliff , and [his]140-george body half over , balancing ; one inch , the merest fraction of an inch more , and over [he]140-george would have gone . Deuced rum sensation ! But not so horrible as it would have been in real life . With the slip of that last inch [he]140-george felt [he]140-george would have passed at once into oblivion , without the long horror of a fall . So this was what it was for [all the poor fellows [he]122-pierson had seen slip in the past two years]625-all the poor fellows he had seen slip in the past two years ! Mercifully , at the end , [one]424-one was not alive enough to be conscious of what [one]424-one was leaving , not alive enough even to care . If [he]140-george had been able to take in the presence of [[his]140-george young wife]628-his young wife , able to realise that [he]140-george was looking at [her]628-his young wife face , touching [her]628-his young wife for the last time - it would have been hell ; if [he]140-george had been up to realising sunlight , moonlight , the sound of [the world]606-the world 's life outside , the softness of the bed [he]140-george lay on - it would have meant the most poignant anguish of defraudment . Life was a rare good thing , and to be squashed out of it with [your]630-your powers at full , a wretched mistake in [Nature]161-nature 's arrangements , a wretched villainy on the part of [Man]631-man - for [his]140-george own death , like all those other millions of premature deaths , would have been due to the idiocy and brutality of [men]3061-men ! [He]140-george could smile now , with [Gratian]127-gratian looking down at [him]140-george , but the experience had heaped fuel on a fire which had always smouldered in [[his]140-george doctor]633-his doctor 's soul against that half emancipated breed of apes , [the human race]634-the human race . Well , now [he]140-george would get a few days off from [his]140-george death - carnival ! And [he]140-george lay , feasting [his]140-george returning senses on [[his]140-george wife]618-his wife . [She]618-his wife made [a pretty nurse]636-a pretty nurse , and [his]140-george practised eye judged [her]618-his wife a good one - firm and quiet .

[George Laird]140-george was thirty . At the opening of the war [he]140-george was in [an East - End practice]637-an east - end practice , and had volunteered at once for service with [the Army]20-the army . For the first nine months [he]140-george had been right up in the thick of it . A poisoned arm ; rather than [the authorities]638-the authorities , had sent [him]140-george [home]3048-home . During that leave [he]140-george married [Gratian]127-gratian . [He]140-george had known [the Piersons]162-the piersons some time ; and , made conscious of the instability of life , had resolved to marry [her]127-gratian at the first chance [he]140-george got . For [[his]140-george father - in - law]640-his father - in - law [he]140-george had respect and liking , ever mixed with what was not quite contempt and not quite pity . The blend of authority with humility , [cleric with dreamer]641-cleric with dreamer , [monk]642-monk with [artist]643-artist , [mystic with man of action]644-mystic with man of action , in [Pierson]122-pierson , excited in [him]140-george an interested , but often irritated , wonder . [He]140-george saw things so differently [himself]140-george , and had little of the humorous curiosity which enjoys what is strange simply because it is strange . [They]645-our could never talk together without soon reaching a point when [he]140-george wanted to say : " If [we]645-our 're not to trust [our]645-our reason and [our]645-our senses for what [they]645-our 're worth , [sir]3028-sir - will [you]3028-sir kindly tell [me]140-george what [we]645-our are to trust ? How can [we]645-our exert [them]645-our to the utmost in some matters , and in others suddenly turn [our]645-our backs on [them]645-our ? "[140-george] Once , in one of [their]645-our discussions , which often bordered on acrimony , [he]140-george had expounded [himself]140-george at length .

" [I]140-george grant , "[140-george] [he]140-george had said , " that there 's a great ultimate Mystery , that [we]645-our shall never know anything for certain about the origin of life and the principle of [the Universe]21-the universe ; but why should [we]645-our suddenly shut up [our]645-our enquiring apparatus and deny all the evidence of [our]645-our reason - say , about the story of [Christ]163-christ , or the question of a future life , or [our]645-our moral code ? If [you]3028-sir want [me]140-george to enter a temple of little mysteries , leaving [my]140-george reason and senses behind - as [a Mohammedan]3174-a mohammedan leaves [his]3174-a mohammedan shoes - it wo n't do to say to [me]140-george simply : ' There it is ! Enter ! ' [You]3028-sir must show [me]140-george the door ; and [you]3028-sir ca n't ! And [I]140-george 'll tell [you]3028-sir why , [sir]3028-sir . Because in [your]3028-sir brain there 's a little twist which is not in [mine]140-george , or the lack of a little twist which is in [mine]140-george . Nothing more than that divides [us]645-our into [the two main species of mankind]3176-the two main species of mankind , [one of whom worships]3177-one of whom worships , and one of whom does n't . Oh , yes ! [I]140-george know ; [you]3028-sir wo n't admit that , because it makes [your]3028-sir religions natural instead of what [you]3028-sir call supernatural . But [I]140-george assure [you]3028-sir there 's nothing more to it . [Your]3028-sir eyes look up or they look down - they never look straight before them . Well , [mine]140-george do just the opposite . "[140-george]

That day [Pierson]122-pierson had been feeling very tired , and though to meet this attack was vital , [he]122-pierson had been unable to meet it . [His]122-pierson brain had stammered . [He]122-pierson had turned a little away , leaning [his]122-pierson cheek on [his]122-pierson hand , as if to cover that momentary break in [his]122-pierson defences . Some days later [he]122-pierson had said :

" [I]122-pierson am able now to answer [your]3028-sir questions , [George]140-george . [I]122-pierson think [I]122-pierson can make [you]3028-sir understand . "[122-pierson]

[Laird]140-george had answered : " All right , [sir]3028-sir ; go ahead . "[140-george]

" [You]3028-sir begin by assuming that the human reason is the final test of all things . What right have [you]3028-sir to assume that ? Suppose [you]3028-sir were [an ant]3179-an ant . [You]3028-sir would take [your]3028-sir ant 's reason as the final test , would n't [you]3028-sir ? Would that be the truth ? "[122-pierson] And a smile had fixed itself on [his]122-pierson lips above [his]122-pierson little grave beard .

[George Laird]140-george also had smiled .

" That seems a good point , [sir]3028-sir , "[140-george] [he]140-george said , " until [you]3028-sir recognise that [I]140-george do n't take , the human reason as final test in any absolute sense . [I]140-george only say it 's the highest test [we]3181-we can apply ; and that , behind that test all is quite dark and unknowable . "[140-george]

" [Revelation]164-revelation , then , means nothing to [you]3028-sir ? "[140-george]

" Nothing , [sir]3028-sir . "[140-george]

" [I]140-george do n't think [we]3181-we can usefully go on , [George]140-george . "[140-george]

" [I]140-george do n't think [we]3181-we can , [sir]3028-sir . In talking with [you]3028-sir , [I]140-george always feel like fighting [a man with one hand tied behind [his]3184-a man with one hand tied behind his back back]3184-a man with one hand tied behind his back . "[140-george]

" And [I]140-george , perhaps , feel that [I]140-george am arguing with [one who was blind from birth]3185-one who was blind from birth . "[140-george]

For all that , [they]646-we had often argued since ; but never without those peculiar smiles coming on [their]646-we faces . Still , [they]646-we respected [each other]493-each other , and [Pierson]122-pierson had not opposed [[his]122-pierson daughter]356-his daughter 's marriage to [this heretic]649-this heretic , whom [he]122-pierson knew to be [an honest and trustworthy man]650-an honest and trustworthy man . It had taken place before [Laird]140-george 's arm was well , and [the two]651-the two had snatched a month 's honeymoon before [he]140-george went back to [France]13-france , and [she]356-his daughter to [[her]356-his daughter hospital in [Manchester]22-manchester]652-her hospital in manchester . Since then , just one February fortnight by [the sea]653-the sea had been all [their]646-we time together ....

In the afternoon [he]140-george had asked for beef tea , and , having drunk a cup , said :

" [I]140-george 've got something to tell [[your]356-his daughter father]3044-your father . "[140-george]

But warned by the pallor of [his]140-george smiling lips , [Gratian]127-gratian answered :

" Tell [me]140-george first , [George]140-george . "[140-george]

" [Our]646-we last talk , [Gracie]159-gracie ; well - there 's nothing - on the other side . [I]140-george looked over ; it 's as black as [your]140-george hat . "[140-george]

[Gratian]127-gratian shivered .

" [I]140-george know . While [you]140-george were lying here last night , [I]140-george told [father]3187-father . "[140-george]

[He]140-george squeezed [her]654-her hand , and said : " [I]140-george also want to tell [him]3187-father . "[140-george]

" [Dad]158-dad will say the motive for life is gone . "[140-george]

" [I]140-george say it leaps out all the more , [Gracie]159-gracie . What a mess [we]646-we make of it - [we]646-we angel - apes ! When shall [we]646-we be [men]3061-men , [I]140-george wonder ? [You]159-gracie and [I]140-george , [Gracie]159-gracie , will fight for a decent life for [everybody]403-everybody . No hands - upping about that ! Bend down ! It 's good to touch [you]159-gracie again ; everything 's good . [I]140-george 'm going to have a sleep .... "[140-george]

After the relief of [the doctor]3143-the doctor 's report in the early morning [Pierson]122-pierson had gone through a hard struggle . What should [he]122-pierson wire to [Noel]197-noel ? [He]122-pierson longed to get [her]656-her back [home]3048-home , away from temptation to the burning indiscretion of this marriage . But ought [he]122-pierson to suppress reference to [George]140-george 's progress ? Would that be honest ? At last [he]122-pierson sent this telegram : " [George]140-george out of danger but very weak . Come up . "[122-pierson] By the afternoon post , however , [he]122-pierson received a letter from [Thirza]137-thirza :

" [I]137-thirza have had two long talks with [Noel]197-noel and [Cyril]133-cyril . It is impossible to budge [them]3190-they . And [I]137-thirza really think , [dear Edward]122-pierson , that it will be a mistake to oppose it rigidly . [He]122-pierson may not go out as soon as [we]3191-we think . How would it be to consent to [their]3190-they having banns published ? - that would mean another three weeks anyway , and in absence from [each other]493-each other [they]3190-they might be influenced to put it off . [I]137-thirza 'm afraid this is the only chance , for if [you]122-pierson simply forbid it , [I]137-thirza feel [they]3190-they will run off and get married somewhere at [a registrar]3193-a registrar 's . "[137-thirza]

[Pierson]122-pierson took this letter out with [him]122-pierson into [the Square Garden]569-the square garden , for painful cogitation . [No man]659-no man can hold a position of spiritual authority for long years without developing the habit of judgment . [He]122-pierson judged [Noel]197-noel 's conduct to be headlong and undisciplined , and the vein of stubbornness in [his]197-noel character fortified [the father]660-the father and [the priest]504-the priest within [him]197-noel . [Thirza]137-thirza disappointed [him]122-pierson ; [she]137-thirza did not seem to see the irretrievable gravity of this hasty marriage . [She]137-thirza seemed to look on it as something much lighter than it was , to consider that it might be left to [Chance]165-chance , and that if [Chance]165-chance turned out unfavourable , there would still be a way out . To [him]122-pierson there would be no way out . [He]122-pierson looked up at the sky , as if for inspiration . It was such a beautiful day , and so bitter to hurt [[his]122-pierson child]662-his child , even for [her]662-his child good ! What would [[her]662-his child mother]377-her mother have advised ? Surely [Agnes]135-agnes had felt at least as deeply as [himself]122-pierson the utter solemnity of marriage ! And , sitting there in the sunlight , [he]122-pierson painfully hardened [his]122-pierson heart . [He]122-pierson must do what [he]122-pierson thought right , no matter what the consequences . So [he]122-pierson went in and wrote that [he]122-pierson could not agree , and wished [Noel]197-noel to come back [home]3048-home at once .

V

1

But on the same afternoon , just about that hour , [Noel]197-noel was sitting on [the river - bank]665-the river - bank with [her]662-his child arms folded tight across [her]662-his child chest , and by [her]662-his child side [Cyril Morland]133-cyril , with despair in [his]133-cyril face , was twisting a telegram " Rejoin tonight . [Regiment]166-regiment leaves to - morrow . "[133-cyril]

What consolation that a million such telegrams had been read and sorrowed over these last two years ! What comfort that the sun was daily blotted dim for hundreds of bright eyes ; the joy of life poured out and sopped up by the sands of desolation !

" How long have [we]3194-we got , [Cyril]133-cyril ? "[133-cyril]

" [I]133-cyril 've engaged [a car]3195-a car from [the Inn]3196-the inn , so [I]133-cyril need n't leave till midnight . [I]133-cyril 've packed already , to have more time . "[133-cyril]

" Let 's have it to [ourselves]3194-we , then . Let 's go off somewhere . [I]133-cyril 've got some chocolate . "[133-cyril]

[Morland]133-cyril answered miserably :

" [I]133-cyril can send [the car]3197-the car up here for [my]133-cyril things , and have it pick [me]133-cyril up at [the Inn]3196-the inn , if [you]133-cyril 'll say goodbye to [them]3199-them for [me]133-cyril , afterwards . [We]666-they 'll walk down the line , then [we]666-they sha n't meet [anyone]3200-anyone . "[133-cyril]

And in the bright sunlight [they]666-they walked hand in hand on each side of a shining rail . About six [they]666-they reached [the Abbey]3034-the abbey .

" Let 's get [a boat]3201-a boat , "[197-noel] said [Noel]197-noel . " [We]666-they can come back here when it 's moonlight . [I]197-noel know a way of getting in , after the gate 's shut . "[197-noel]

[They]666-they hired [a boat]3201-a boat , rowed over to [the far bank]669-the far bank , and sat on the stern seat , side by side under the trees where [the water]670-the water was stained deep green by [the high woods]671-the high woods . If [they]666-they talked , it was but a word of love now and then , or to draw [each other]493-each other 's attention to a fish , a bird , a dragon - fly . What use making plans - for [lovers the chief theme]673-lovers the chief theme ? Longing paralysed [their]666-they brains . [They]666-they could do nothing but press close to [each other]493-each other , [their]666-they hands enlaced , [their]666-they lips meeting now and then . On [Noel]197-noel 's face was a strange fixed stillness , as if [she]675-she were waiting - expecting ! [They]666-they ate [their]666-they chocolates . The sun set , dew began to fall ; [the river]417-the river changed , and grew whiter ; the sky paled to the colour of an amethyst ; shadows lengthened , dissolved slowly . It was past nine already ; a water - rat came out , a white owl flew over [the river]417-the river , towards [the Abbey]3034-the abbey . The moon had come up , but shed no light as yet . [They]666-they saw no beauty in all this - too young , too passionate , too unhappy .

[Noel]197-noel said : " When [she]675-she 's over those trees , [Cyril]133-cyril , let 's go . It 'll be half dark . "[197-noel]

[They]666-they waited , watching the moon , which crept with infinite slowness up and up , brightening ever so little every minute .

" Now ! "[197-noel] said [Noel]197-noel . And [Morland]133-cyril rowed across .

[They]666-they left [the boat]679-the boat , and [she]675-she led the way past [an empty cottage]680-an empty cottage , to [a shed with a roof sloping up to [the Abbey]3034-the abbey 's low outer wall]681-a shed with a roof sloping up to the abbey 's low outer wall .

" [We]666-they can get over here , "[675-she] [she]675-she whispered .

[They]666-they clambered up , and over , to a piece of [grassy courtyard]683-grassy courtyard , and passed on to [an inner court]684-an inner court , under the black shadow of the high walls .

" What 's the time ? "[197-noel] said [Noel]197-noel .

" Half - past ten . "[197-noel]

" Already ! Let 's sit here in the dark , and watch for the moon . "[197-noel]

[They]666-they sat down close together . [Noel]197-noel 's face still had on it that strange look of waiting ; and [Morland]133-cyril sat obedient , with [his]133-cyril hand on [her]675-she heart , and [his]133-cyril own heart beating almost to suffocation . [They]666-they sat , still as mice , and the moon crept up . It laid a first vague greyness on the high wall , which spread slowly down , and brightened till the lichen and the grasses up there were visible ; then crept on , silvering the dark above [their]666-they heads . [Noel]197-noel pulled [his]197-noel sleeve , and whispered : " See ! "[197-noel] There came the white owl , soft as a snowflake , drifting across in that unearthly light , as if flying to the moon . And just then the top of the moon itself looked over the wall , a shaving of silvery gold . It grew , became a bright spread fan , then balanced there , full and round , the colour of pale honey .

" Ours ! "[197-noel] [Noel]197-noel whispered .

2

From the side of [the road]685-the road [Noel]197-noel listened till the sound of [the car]3197-the car was lost in [the folds of [the valley]688-the valley]687-the folds of the valley . [She]675-she did not cry , but passed [her]675-she hands over [her]675-she face , and began to walk [home]3048-home , keeping to the shadow of the trees . How many years had been added to [her]675-she age in those six hours since the telegram came ! Several times in that mile and a half [she]675-she stepped into a patch of brighter moonlight , to take out and kiss a little photograph , then slip it back next [her]675-she heart , heedless that so warm a place must destroy any effigy . [She]675-she felt not the faintest compunction for the recklessness of [her]675-she love - it was [her]675-she only comfort against the crushing loneliness of the night . It kept [her]675-she up , made [her]675-she walk on with a sort of pride , as if [she]675-she had got the best of [Fate]167-fate . [He]690-he was [hers]675-she for ever now , in spite of anything that could be done . [She]675-she did not even think what [she]675-she would say when [she]675-she got in . [She]675-she came to [the avenue]332-the avenue , and passed up [it]332-the avenue still in a sort of dream . [[Her]675-she uncle]692-her uncle was standing before [the porch]693-the porch ; [she]675-she could hear [his]692-her uncle mutterings . [She]675-she moved out of the shadow of the trees , went straight up to [him]692-her uncle , and , looking in [his]692-her uncle perturbed face , said calmly :

" [Cyril]133-cyril asked [me]675-she to say good - bye to [you]692-her uncle all , [Uncle]3202-uncle . Good night ! "[675-she]

" But , [I]675-she say , [Nollie]131-nollie look here [you]692-her uncle ! "[675-she]

[She]675-she had passed on . [She]675-she went up to [[her]675-she room]694-her room . There , by the door , [[her]675-she aunt]695-her aunt was standing , and would have kissed [her]675-she . [She]675-she drew back :

" No , [Auntie]152-auntie . Not to - night ! "[675-she] And , slipping by , [she]675-she locked [her]675-she door .

[Bob]141-uncle bob and [Thirza Pierson]137-thirza , meeting in [[their]696-their own room]697-their own room , looked at [each other]493-each other askance . " [I]125-pierson love [Nollie]131-nollie ! "[125-pierson] said [Bob Pierson]125-pierson suddenly . " [She]131-nollie 's [an affectionate creature]3206-an affectionate creature . "[125-pierson]

" And no dinner ! "[700-he] [he]700-he said suddenly . " What [d'you]3212-d'you think [they]3209-our boys 've been doing with [themselves]3209-our boys ? "[700-he]

" Well , all [I]700-he can say is , [I]700-he 've had a wretched evening . Get to bed , [old girl]3136-old girl . [You]3136-old girl 'll be fit for nothing . "[700-he]

[He]700-he was soon asleep , but [Thirza]137-thirza lay awake , not exactly worrying , for that was not [her]137-thirza nature , but seeing [Noel]197-noel 's face , pale , languid , passionate , possessed by memory .

VI

1

[Noel]197-noel reached [[[her]137-thirza father]384-her father 's house]702-her father 's house next day late in the afternoon . There was a letter in [the hall]522-the hall for [her]137-thirza . [She]137-thirza tore it open , and read :

" [MY]137-thirza DARLING LOVE ,[137-thirza]

" [I]137-thirza got back all right , and am posting this at once to tell [you]3136-old girl [we]3216-we shall pass through [London]7-london , and go from [Charing Cross]23-charing cross , [I]137-thirza expect about nine o'clock to - night . [Noel]197-noel ![137-thirza]

" [[Your]197-noel devoted lover]3217-your devoted lover ,[137-thirza]

" C. "[137-thirza]

[She]137-thirza looked at the wrist - watch which , like [every other little patriot]704-every other little patriot , [she]137-thirza possessed . Past seven ! If [she]137-thirza waited , [Gratian]127-gratian or [[her]137-thirza father]384-her father would seize on [her]137-thirza .

" Oh , [Miss Noel]197-noel , [you]197-noel ca n't , - "[127-gratian]

But [Noel]197-noel was gone . [She]137-thirza walked towards [Charing Cross]23-charing cross ; and , to kill time , went into [a restaurant]706-a restaurant and had that simple repast , coffee and a bun , which [those in love]707-those in love would always take if [Society]708-society did not forcibly feed [them]707-those in love on other things . Food was ridiculous to [her]137-thirza . [She]137-thirza sat there in the midst of a perfect hive of creatures eating hideously . [The place]709-the place was shaped like [a modern prison]710-a modern prison , having tiers of gallery round [an open space]711-an open space , and in the air was the smell of viands and the clatter of plates and the music of a band . [Men]3061-men in khaki everywhere , and [Noel]197-noel glanced from form to form to see if by chance one might be that which represented , for [her]137-thirza , [Life]160-life and [the British Army]20-the army . At half - past eight [she]137-thirza went out and made [her]137-thirza way : through [the crowd]713-the crowd , still mechanically searching " khaki "[713-the crowd] for what [she]137-thirza wanted ; and it was perhaps fortunate that there was about [her]137-thirza face and walk something which touched [people]3083-people . At [the station]474-the station [she]137-thirza went up to [an old porter]716-an old porter , and , putting a shilling into [his]716-an old porter astonished hand , asked [him]716-an old porter to find out for [her]137-thirza whence [[Morland]133-cyril 's regiment]717-morland 's regiment would start . [He]716-an old porter came back presently , and said :

" Come with [me]716-an old porter , [miss]3218-miss . "[716-an old porter]

[Noel]197-noel went . [He]716-an old porter was rather lame , had grey whiskers , and a ghostly thin resemblance to [[her]137-thirza uncle]692-her uncle [Bob]125-pierson , which perhaps had been the reason why [she]137-thirza had chosen [him]716-an old porter . 64

" [Brother]3219-brother goin' out , [miss]3218-miss ? "[716-an old porter]

[Noel]197-noel nodded .

" Ah ! It 's a crool war . [I]719-i sha n't be sorry when it 's over . Goin' out and comin ' in , [we]3221-we see some sad sights ' ere . Wonderful spirit [they]3222-they 've got , too . [I]719-i never look at the clock now but what [I]719-i think : ' There [you]3218-miss go , [slow - coach]3223-slow - coach ! [I]719-i 'd like to set [you]3218-miss on to the day [the boys]3224-the boys come back ! ' When [I]719-i puts a bag in : ' Another for ' ell ' [I]719-i thinks . And so it is , [miss]3218-miss , from all [I]719-i can ' ear . [I]719-i 've got [a son]3226-a son out there meself . It 's ' ere [they]3222-they 'll come along . ' And , looking at [her]3218-miss face , [he]719-i thought : ' Astonishin ' what [a lot o ' brothers]3228-a lot o ' brothers go . [Wot]3229-wot oh ! [Poor little missy]3230-poor little missy ! [A little lady]3231-a little lady , too . Wonderful collected [she]3231-a little lady is . It 's ' ard ! ' "[719-i] And trying to find something consoling to say , [he]719-i mumbled out : " [You]3218-miss could n't be in a better place for seen'im off . Good night , [miss]3218-miss ; anything else [I]719-i can do for [you]3218-miss ? "[719-i]

" No , thank [you]3218-miss ; [you]3218-miss 're very kind . "[719-i]

[He]719-i looked back once or twice at [her]720-her blue - clad figure standing very still . [He]719-i had left [her]720-her against a little oasis of piled - up empty milk - cans , far down [the platform]721-the platform where [a few civilians in similar case were scattered]722-a few civilians in similar case were scattered . [The trainway]723-the trainway was empty as yet . In the grey immensity of [the station]474-the station and the turmoil of [its]723-the trainway noise , [she]720-her felt neither lonely nor conscious of [others]395-others waiting ; too absorbed in the one thought of seeing [him]719-i and touching [him]719-i again . [The empty train]726-the empty train began backing in , stopped , and telescoped with a series of little clattering bangs , backed on again , and subsided to rest . [Noel]197-noel turned [her]720-her eyes towards [the station arch ways]727-the station arch ways . Already [she]720-her felt tremulous , as though [the regiment]728-the regiment were sending before it the vibration of its march .

[She]720-her had not as yet seen [a troop - train]729-a troop - train start , and vague images of brave array , of a flag fluttering , and the stir of drums , beset [her]720-her . Suddenly [she]720-her saw a brown swirling mass down there at the very edge , out of which a thin brown trickle emerged towards [her]720-her ; no sound of music , no waved flag . [She]720-her had a longing to rush down to the barrier , but remembering the words of [the porter]730-the porter , stayed where [she]720-her was , with [her]720-her hands tightly squeezed together . The trickle became a stream , a flood , the head of which began to reach [her]720-her . With a turbulence of voices , [sunburnt men]731-sunburnt men , burdened up to the nose , passed , with rifles jutting at all angles ; [she]720-her strained [her]720-her eyes , staring into that stream as one might into a walking wood , to isolate a single tree . [Her]720-her head reeled with the strain of it , and the effort to catch [his]730-the porter voice among the hubbub of all those cheery , common , happy - go - lucky sounds . Some who saw [her]720-her clucked [their]731-sunburnt men tongues , [some]464-some went by silent , [others]395-others seemed to scan [her]720-her as though [she]720-her might be what [they]395-others were looking for . And ever the stream and the hubbub melted into [the train]580-the train , and yet came pouring on . And still [she]720-her waited motionless , with an awful fear . How could [he]730-the porter ever find [her]720-her , or [she]720-her [him]730-the porter ? Then [she]720-her saw that [others of those waiting]735-others of those waiting had found [[their]735-others of those waiting men]736-their men . And the longing to rush up and down [the platform]721-the platform almost overcame [her]720-her ; but still [she]720-her waited . And suddenly [she]720-her saw [him]730-the porter with [two other officer boys]738-two other officer boys , close to [the carriages]739-the carriages , coming slowly down towards [her]720-her . [She]720-her stood with [her]720-her eyes fixed on [his]730-the porter face ; [they]740-they passed , and [she]720-her nearly cried out . Then [he]730-the porter turned , broke away from [the other two]741-the other two , and came straight to [her]720-her . [He]730-the porter had seen [her]720-her before [she]720-her had seen [him]730-the porter . [He]730-the porter was very flushed , had a little fixed frown between [his]730-the porter blue eyes and a set jaw . [They]742-they stood looking at [each other]493-each other , [their]742-they hands hard gripped ; all the emotion of last night welling up within [them]742-they , so that to speak would have been to break down . The milk - cans formed a kind of shelter , and [they]742-they stood so close together that [none]744-none could see [their]742-they faces . [Noel]197-noel was the first to master [her]720-her power of speech ; [her]720-her words came out , dainty as ever , through trembling lips :

" Write to [me]720-her as much as ever [you]730-the porter can , [Cyril]133-cyril . [I]720-her 'm going to be [a nurse]3053-a nurse at once . And the first leave [you]730-the porter get , [I]720-her shall come to [you]730-the porter - do n't forget . "[720-her]

" Forget ! Move a little back , [darling]3071-darling ; [they]3235-they ca n't see [us]3236-us here . Kiss [me]720-her ! "[720-her] [She]720-her moved back , thrust [her]720-her face forward so that [he]197-noel need not stoop , and put [her]720-her lips up to [his]197-noel . Then , feeling that [she]720-her might swoon and fall over among the cans , [she]720-her withdrew [her]720-her mouth , leaving [her]720-her forehead against [his]197-noel lips . [He]197-noel murmured :

" Was it all right when [you]720-her got in last night ? "[197-noel]

" Yes ; [I]197-noel said good - bye for [you]197-noel . "[197-noel]

" Oh ! [Noel]197-noel - [I]197-noel 've been afraid - [I]197-noel ought n't - [I]197-noel ought n't - "[197-noel]

" Yes , yes ; nothing can take [you]720-her from [me]197-noel now . "[197-noel]

" [You]720-her have got pluck . More than ! "[197-noel]

Along whistle sounded . [Morland]133-cyril grasped [her]720-her hands convulsively :

" Good - bye , [[my]133-cyril little wife]3237-my little wife ! Do n't fret . Goodbye ! [I]133-cyril must go . God bless [you]197-noel , [Noel]197-noel ! "[133-cyril]

" [I]133-cyril love [you]197-noel . "[133-cyril]

[They]745-they looked at [each other]493-each other , just another moment , then [she]720-her took [her]720-her hands from [his]133-cyril and stood back in the shadow of the milk - cans , rigid , following [him]133-cyril with [her]720-her eyes till [he]133-cyril was lost in [the train]580-the train .

[Every carriage]748-every carriage window was full of those brown figures and red - brown faces , hands were waving vaguely , voices calling vaguely , here and there [one]424-one cheered ; [someone leaning far out]750-someone leaning far out started to sing : " If auld acquaintance - "[750-someone leaning far out] But [Noel]197-noel stood quite still in the shadow of the milk - cans , [her]720-her lips drawn in , [her]720-her hands hard clenched in front of [her]720-her ; and [young [Morland]133-cyril at [his]133-cyril window]751-young morland at his window gazed back at [her]720-her .

2

How [she]720-her came to be sitting in [Trafalgar Square]25-trafalgar square [she]720-her did not know . Tears had formed a mist between [her]720-her and [all that seething , summer - evening crowd]752-all that seething , summer - evening crowd . [Her]720-her eyes mechanically followed the wandering search - lights , those new milky ways , quartering the heavens and leading nowhere . All was wonderfully beautiful , the sky a deep dark blue , the moonlight whitening [the spire of [St. Martin]26-st. martin 's]753-the spire of st. martin 's , and everywhere endowing [the great blacked - out buildings]754-the great blacked - out buildings with dream - life . Even the lions had come to life , and stared out over this moonlit desert of little human figures too small to be worth the stretching out of a paw . [She]720-her sat there , aching dreadfully , as if the longing of every bereaved heart in all [the town]755-the town had settled in [her]720-her . [She]720-her felt it tonight a thousand times worse ; for last night [she]720-her had been drugged on the new sensation of love triumphantly fulfilled . Now [she]720-her felt as if life had placed [her]720-her in the corner of [a huge silent room]756-a huge silent room , blown out the flame of joy , and locked the door . A little dry sob came from [her]720-her . [The hay - fields]486-the hay - fields and [Cyril]133-cyril , with shirt unbuttoned at the neck , pitching hay and gazing at [her]720-her while [she]720-her dabbled [her]720-her fork in the thin leavings . [The bright river]758-the bright river , and [[their]759-their boat]760-their boat grounded on [the shallows]761-the shallows , and the swallows flitting over [them]759-their . And that long dance , with the feel of [his]133-cyril hand between [her]720-her shoulder - blades ! Memories so sweet and sharp that [she]720-her almost cried out . [She]720-her saw again [[their]759-their dark grassy courtyard in [the Abbey]3034-the abbey]762-their dark grassy courtyard in the abbey , and the white owl flying over [them]759-their . The white owl ! Flying there again to - night , with [no lovers]764-no lovers on the grass below ! [She]720-her could only picture [Cyril]133-cyril now as [a brown atom in that swirling brown flood of men]765-a brown atom in that swirling brown flood of men , flowing to [a huge brown sea]766-a huge brown sea . Those cruel minutes on the platform , when [she]720-her had searched and searched the walking wood for [her]720-her , one tree , seemed to have burned themselves into [her]720-her eyes . [Cyril]133-cyril was lost , [she]720-her could not single [him]133-cyril out , all blurred among those thousand other shapes . And suddenly [she]720-her thought : ' And [I]0-i - [I]0-i 'm lost to [him]133-cyril ; [he]133-cyril 's never seen [me]0-i at [home]3048-home , never seen [me]0-i in [London]7-london ; [he]133-cyril wo n't be able to imagine [me]0-i . It 's all in the past , only the past - for [both of [us]768-both of us]768-both of us . Is there [anybody so unhappy]769-anybody so unhappy ? ' And [the town]755-the town 's voices - wheels , and passing feet , whistles , talk , laughter - seemed to answer callously : ' Not one . ' [She]720-her looked at [her]720-her wrist - watch ; like [his]133-cyril , it had luminous hands : ' Half - past ten ' was greenishly imprinted there . [She]720-her got up in dismay . [They]771-they would think [she]720-her was lost , or run over , or something silly ! [She]720-her could not find [an empty taxi]772-an empty taxi , and began to walk , uncertain of [her]720-her way at night . At last [she]720-her stopped [a policeman]773-a policeman , and said :

3

By the rail of [[his]775-the policeman transport]794-his transport , as far - about two feet - as [he]775-the policeman could get from [anyone]3200-anyone , [Cyril Morland]133-cyril stood watching [Calais]30-calais , [a dream city]796-a dream city , brighten out of the heat and grow solid . [He]775-the policeman could hear the guns already , the voice of [his]775-the policeman new life - talking in the distance . It came with its strange excitement into a being held by soft and marvellous memories , by one long vision of [Noel]197-noel and the moonlit grass , under the dark Abbey wall . This moment of passage from wonder to wonder was quite too much for [a boy]797-a boy unused to introspection , and [he]797-a boy stood staring stupidly at [Calais]30-calais , while the thunder of [his]797-a boy new life came rolling in on that passionate moonlit dream .

VII

After the emotions of those last three days [Pierson]125-pierson woke with the feeling [a ship]798-a ship must have when [it]798-a ship makes landfall . Such reliefs are natural , and as a rule delusive ; for events are as much [the parents of the future]799-the parents of the future as [they]799-the parents of the future were [the children of the past]800-the children of the past . To be at [home]3048-home with both [[his]775-the policeman girls]802-his girls , and resting - for [his]775-the policeman holiday would not be over for ten days - was like old times . Now [George]140-george was going on so well [Gratian]127-gratian would be [herself]127-gratian again ; now [Cyril Morland]133-cyril was gone [Noel]197-noel would lose that sudden youthful love fever . Perhaps in two or three days if [George]140-george continued to progress , [one]424-one might go off with [Noel]197-noel somewhere for one 's last week . In the meantime [the old house , wherein was gathered so much remembrance of happiness and pain]804-the old house , wherein was gathered so much remembrance of happiness and pain , was just as restful as [anywhere else]805-anywhere else , and the companionship of [[his]775-the policeman girls]802-his girls would be as sweet as on any of [their]802-his girls past rambling holidays in [Wales]31-wales or [Ireland]32-ireland . And that first morning of perfect idleness - for [no one]3081-no one knew [he]775-the policeman was back in [London]7-london - pottering , and playing the piano in [the homely drawing - room]808-the homely drawing - room where nothing to speak of was changed since [[his]775-the policeman wife]618-his wife 's day , was very pleasant . [He]775-the policeman had not yet seen [the girls]3241-the girls , for [Noel]197-noel did not come down to breakfast , and [Gratian]127-gratian was with [George]140-george .

Discovery that there was still a barrier between [him]775-the policeman and [them]3241-the girls came but slowly in the next two days . [He]775-the policeman would not acknowledge it , yet it was there , in [their]3241-the girls voices , in [their]3241-the girls movements - rather an absence of something old than the presence of something new . It was as if [each]811-each had said to [him]775-the policeman : " [We]3241-the girls love [you]775-the policeman , but [you]775-the policeman are not in [our]3241-the girls secrets - and [you]775-the policeman must not be , for [you]775-the policeman would try to destroy [them]3241-the girls . "[811-each] [They]3241-the girls showed no fear of [him]775-the policeman , but seemed to be pushing [him]775-the policeman unconsciously away , lest [he]775-the policeman should restrain or alter what was very dear to [them]3241-the girls . [They]3241-the girls were both fond of [him]775-the policeman , but [their]3241-the girls natures had set foot on definitely diverging paths . The closer the affection , the more watchful [they]3241-the girls were against interference by that affection . [Noel]197-noel had a look on [her]812-her face , half dazed , half proud , which touched , yet vexed [him]197-noel . What had [he]197-noel done to forfeit [her]812-her confidence - surely [she]812-her must see how natural and right [his]197-noel opposition had been ! [He]197-noel made one great effort to show the real sympathy [he]197-noel felt for [her]812-her . But [she]812-her only said : " [I]812-her ca n't talk of [Cyril]133-cyril , [Daddy]132-daddy ; [I]812-her simply ca n't ! "[812-her] And [he]197-noel , who easily shrank into [his]197-noel shell , could not but acquiesce in [her]812-her reserve .

With [Gratian]127-gratian it was different . [He]197-noel knew that an encounter was before [him]197-noel ; a struggle between [him]197-noel and [[her]812-her husband]554-her husband - for characteristically [he]197-noel set the change in [her]812-her , the defection of [her]812-her faith , down to [George]140-george , not to spontaneous thought and feeling in [herself]812-her . [He]197-noel dreaded and yet looked forward to this encounter . It came on the third day , when [Laird]140-george was up , lying on that very sofa where [Pierson]125-pierson had sat listening to [Gratian]127-gratian 's confession of disbelief . " Well , [George]140-george , "[197-noel] [he]197-noel said , " [you]140-george gave [us]3334-us a dreadful fright ! [I]197-noel thank [God]143-god 's mercy . "[197-noel] With that half - mechanical phrase [he]197-noel had flung an unconscious challenge . [Laird]140-george looked up whimsically .

The curious smile had come already , on both [their]817-their faces .

" [[My]140-george dear]3031-my dear [George]140-george , is not [man]631-man the highest work of [God]143-god , and mercy the highest quality in [man]631-man ? "[140-george]

" Not a bit . "[127-gratian]

[Pierson]125-pierson did not answer . [He]125-pierson could not remember . [VIII

1

Some wag]174-leila , with a bit of chalk , had written the word " Peace "[143-god] on three successive doors of [a little street]830-a little street opposite [Buckingham Palace]33-buckingham palace .

It caught the eye of [Jimmy Fort]175-jimmy , limping [home]3048-home to [[his]175-jimmy rooms]832-his rooms from a very late discussion at [[his]175-jimmy Club]833-his club , and twisted [his]175-jimmy lean shaven lips into a sort of smile . [He]175-jimmy was [one of those rolling - stone Englishmen , whose early lives are spent in [all parts of [the world]606-the world]835-all parts of the world , and in all kinds of physical conflict]834-one of those rolling - stone englishmen , whose early lives are spent in all parts of the world , and in all kinds of physical conflict - [a man like a hickory stick , tall , thin , bolt - upright , knotty , hard as nails , with a curved fighting back to [his]175-jimmy head and a straight fighting front to [his]175-jimmy brown face]837-a man like a hickory stick , tall , thin , bolt - upright , knotty , hard as nails , with a curved fighting back to his head and a straight fighting front to his brown face . [His]175-jimmy was the type which becomes , in a generation or so , typically Colonial or American ; but [no one]3081-no one could possibly have taken [Jimmy Fort]175-jimmy for anything but [an Englishman]839-an englishman . Though [he]175-jimmy was nearly forty , there was still something of [the boy]840-the boy in [his]175-jimmy face , something frank and curly - headed , gallant and full of steam , and [his]175-jimmy small steady grey eyes looked out on life with a sort of combative humour . [He]175-jimmy was still in uniform , though [they]841-they had given [him]175-jimmy up as a bad job after keeping [him]175-jimmy nine months trying to mend a wounded leg which would never be sound again ; and [he]175-jimmy was now in the War Office in connection with horses , about which [he]175-jimmy knew . [He]175-jimmy did not like it , having lived too long with all sorts and conditions of [men who were neither English nor official]842-men who were neither english nor official , a combination which [he]175-jimmy found trying . [His]175-jimmy life indeed , just now , bored [him]175-jimmy to distraction , and [he]175-jimmy would ten times rather have been back in [France]13-france . This was why [he]175-jimmy found the word " Peace "[175-jimmy] so exceptionally tantalising .

Reaching [[his]175-jimmy rooms]832-his rooms , [he]175-jimmy threw off [his]175-jimmy tunic , to whose stiff regularity [he]175-jimmy still had a rooted aversion ; and , pulling out a pipe , filled it and sat down at [his]175-jimmy window .

Moonshine could not cool [the hot town]844-the hot town , and it seemed sleeping badly - [the seven million sleepers in [[their]845-the seven million sleepers in their million homes million homes]846-their million homes]845-the seven million sleepers in their million homes . Sound lingered on , never quite ceased ; the stale odours clung in [the narrow street below]847-the narrow street below , though a little wind was creeping about to sweeten the air . ' Curse the war ! ' [he]175-jimmy thought . ' What would n't [I]0-i give to be sleeping out , instead of in [this damned city]848-this damned city ! ' [They]849-they [who slept in the open , neglecting morality]850-who slept in the open , neglecting morality , would certainly have the best of it tonight , for no more dew was falling than fell into [Jimmy Fort]175-jimmy 's heart to cool the fret of that ceaseless thought : ' The war ! The cursed war ! ' In the unending rows of [little grey houses]851-little grey houses , in [huge caravanserais]852-huge caravanserais , and [the mansions of the great]853-the mansions of the great , in [villas]854-villas , and [high slum tenements]855-high slum tenements ; in [the government offices]856-the government offices , and [factories]857-factories , and [railway stations]858-railway stations where [they]849-they worked all night ; in [the long hospitals where [they]849-they lay in [rows]860-rows]859-the long hospitals where they lay in rows ; in [the camp prisons of [the interned]862-the interned]861-the camp prisons of the interned ; in [bar racks]863-bar racks , [work - houses]864-work - houses , [palaces]865-palaces - [no head]866-no head , sleeping or waking , would be free of that thought : ' The cursed war ! ' A spire caught [his]175-jimmy eye , rising ghostly over the roofs . Ah ! [churches alone , void of the human soul]867-churches alone , void of the human soul , would be unconscious ! But for the rest , even sleep would not free [them]849-they ! Here [a mother]379-a mother would be whispering the name of [[her]379-a mother boy]869-her boy ; there [a merchant]870-a merchant would snore and dream [he]870-a merchant was drowning , weighted with gold ; and [a wife]871-a wife would be turning to stretch out [her]871-a wife arms to - [no one]3081-no one ; and [a wounded soldier]873-a wounded soldier wake out of a dream trench with sweat on [his]873-a wounded soldier brow ; and a newsvendor in [his]873-a wounded soldier garret mutter hoarsely . By thousands [the bereaved]874-the bereaved would be tossing , stifling [their]874-the bereaved moans ; by thousands [the ruined]875-the ruined would be gazing into the dark future ; and [housewives struggling with sums]876-housewives struggling with sums ; and [soldiers sleeping like logs]877-soldiers sleeping like logs - for to morrow [they]877-soldiers sleeping like logs died ; and [children]878-children dreaming of [them]877-soldiers sleeping like logs ; and [prostitutes]879-prostitutes lying in stale wonder at the busyness of [their]879-prostitutes lives ; and [journalists sleeping the sleep of the just]880-journalists sleeping the sleep of the just . And over [them]881-them all , in the moonlight that thought ' The cursed war ! ' flapped its black wings , like an old crow ! " If [Christ]163-christ were real , "[882-he] [he]882-he mused , " [He]163-christ 'd reach that moon down , and go chalking ' Peace ' with it on every door of [every house]3381-every house , all over [Europe]35-europe . But [Christ]163-christ 's not real , and [Hindenburg]36-hindenburg and [Harmsworth]37-harmsworth are ! "[882-he] As real [they]883-they were as two great bulls [he]882-he had once seen in [South Africa]9-south africa , fighting . [He]882-he seemed to hear again the stamp and snort and crash of those thick skulls , to see the beasts recoiling and driving at [each other]493-each other , and the little red eyes of [them]883-they . And pulling a letter out of [his]882-he pocket , [he]882-he read it again by the light of the moon :

" 15 , [Camelot Mansions]38-camelot mansions ,[882-he]

" [St. John 's Wood]39-st. john 's wood .[882-he]

" [DEAR MR . FORT]176-dear mr . fort , "[0-i] [I]0-i came across [your]885-he Club address to - night , looking at some old letters . Did [you]885-he know that [I]0-i was in [London]7-london ? [I]0-i left [Steenbok]40-steenbok when [[my]0-i husband]886-my husband died , five years ago . [I]0-i 've had a simply terrific time since . While [the German South West campaign]887-the german south west campaign was on [I]0-i was nursing out [there]3137-there , but came back about a year ago to lend a hand here . It would be awfully nice to meet [you]885-he again , if by any chance [you]885-he are in [England]29-england . [I]0-i 'm working in [a V. A. The nights here are n't scented quite like that . [Listerine]177-listerine ! Oh ! This war ! " With all good remembrances ,[177-listerine]

" [LEILA LYNCH]129-leila lynch . "[885-he]

A terrific time ! If [he]885-he did not mistake , [Leila Lynch]129-leila lynch had always had a terrific time . And [he]885-he smiled , seeing again the stoep of [an old Dutch house at [High Constantia]41-high constantia]890-an old dutch house at high constantia , and [a woman sitting there under the white flowers of a sweet - scented creeper]891-a woman sitting there under the white flowers of a sweet - scented creeper - [a pretty woman , with eyes which could put a spell on [you]885-he]892-a pretty woman , with eyes which could put a spell on you , [a woman [he]885-he would have got entangled with if [he]885-he had not cut and run for it]893-a woman he would have got entangled with if he had not cut and run for it ! Ten years ago , and here [she]891-a woman sitting there under the white flowers of a sweet - scented creeper was again , refreshing [him]885-he out of the past . [He]885-he sniffed the fragrance of the little letter . How [everybody]403-everybody always managed to work into a letter what [they]403-everybody were doing in the war ! If [he]885-he answered [her]891-a woman sitting there under the white flowers of a sweet - scented creeper [he]885-he would be sure to say : " Since [I]885-he got lamed , [I]885-he 've been at [the War Office]3382-the war office , working on remounts , and a dull job it is ! "[885-he] [Leila Lynch]129-leila lynch ! [Women]3282-women did n't get younger , and [he]885-he suspected [her]891-a woman sitting there under the white flowers of a sweet - scented creeper of being older than [himself]885-he . But [he]885-he remembered agreeably [her]891-a woman sitting there under the white flowers of a sweet - scented creeper white shoulders and that turn of [her]891-a woman sitting there under the white flowers of a sweet - scented creeper neck when [she]891-a woman sitting there under the white flowers of a sweet - scented creeper looked at [you]896-you with those big grey eyes of [hers]891-a woman sitting there under the white flowers of a sweet - scented creeper . Only a five - day acquaintanceship , but [they]897-they had crowded much into it as [one]424-one did in [a strange land]899-a strange land . The episode had been [a green and dangerous spot]900-a green and dangerous spot , like one of those bright mossy bits of bog when [you]896-you were snipe - shooting , to set foot on which was to let [you]896-you down up to the neck , at least . Well , there was none of that danger now , for [[her]891-a woman sitting there under the white flowers of a sweet - scented creeper husband]554-her husband was dead - poor chap ! It would be nice , in these dismal days , when [nobody]902-nobody spent any time whatever except in the service of [the country]334-the country , to improve [his]554-her husband powers of service by a few hours ' recreation in [[her]891-a woman sitting there under the white flowers of a sweet - scented creeper society]904-her society . ' What humbugs [we]905-we are ! ' [he]885-he thought : ' To read the newspapers and the speeches [you]896-you 'd believe [everybody]403-everybody thought of nothing but how to get killed for the sake of the future . Drunk on verbiage ! What heads and mouths [we]905-we shall all have when [we]905-we wake up some fine morning with Peace shining in at the window ! Ah ! If only [we]905-we could ; and enjoy [ourselves]905-we again ! ' And [he]885-he gazed at the moon . [She]891-a woman sitting there under the white flowers of a sweet - scented creeper was dipping already , reeling away into the dawn . [Water carts]907-water carts and [street sweepers]908-street sweepers had come out into the glimmer ; sparrows twittered in the eaves . [The city]3301-the city was raising a strange unknown face to the grey light , shuttered and deserted as [Babylon]178-babylon . [Jimmy Fort]175-jimmy tapped out [his]175-jimmy pipe , sighed , and got into bed .

2

Coming off duty at that very moment , [Leila Lynch]129-leila lynch decided to have [her]129-leila lynch hour 's walk before [she]129-leila lynch went [home]3048-home . [She]129-leila lynch was in charge of [two wards]911-two wards , and as a rule took the day watches ; but some slight upset had given [her]129-leila lynch this extra spell . [She]129-leila lynch was , therefore , at [her]129-leila lynch worst , or perhaps at [her]129-leila lynch best , after eighteen hours in [hospital]912-hospital . [Her]129-leila lynch cheeks were pale , and about [her]129-leila lynch eyes were little lines , normally in hiding . There was in this face a puzzling blend of the soft and hard , for the eyes , the rather full lips , and pale cheeks , were naturally soft ; but they were hardened by the self - containment which grows on women who have to face life for [themselves]913-themselves , and , conscious of beauty , intend to keep it , in spite of age . [Her]129-leila lynch figure was contradictory , also ; its soft modelling a little too rigidified by stays . In this desert of the dawn [she]129-leila lynch let [her]129-leila lynch long blue overcoat flap loose , and swung [her]129-leila lynch hat on a finger , so that [her]129-leila lynch light - brown , touched - up hair took the morning breeze with fluffy freedom . Though [she]129-leila lynch could not see [herself]129-leila lynch , [she]129-leila lynch appreciated [her]129-leila lynch appearance , swaying along like that , past lonely trees and [houses]914-houses . A pity there was [no one]3081-no one to see [her]129-leila lynch in [that round of [Regent 's Park]42-regent 's park]916-that round of regent 's park , which took [her]129-leila lynch the best part of an hour , walking in meditation , enjoying the colour coming back into [the world]606-the world , as if especially for [her]129-leila lynch .

There was character in [Leila Lynch]129-leila lynch , and [she]129-leila lynch had lived an interesting life from a certain point of view . In [her]129-leila lynch girlhood [she]129-leila lynch had fluttered the hearts of many besides Cousin [Edward Pierson]122-pierson , and at eighteen had made a passionate love match with [a good - looking young Indian civilian]918-a good - looking young indian civilian , named [Fane]179-young fane . [They]919-they had loved [each other]493-each other to a standstill in twelve months . Then had begun five years of petulance , boredom , and growing cynicism , with increasing spells of [Simla]180-simla , and voyages [home]3048-home for [her]129-leila lynch health which was really harmed by the heat . All had culminated , of course , in another passion for [a rifleman called [Lynch]129-leila lynch]922-a rifleman called lynch . Divorce had followed , remarriage , and then the Boer War , in which [he]922-a rifleman called lynch had been badly wounded . [She]129-leila lynch had gone out and nursed [him]922-a rifleman called lynch back to half [his]922-a rifleman called lynch robust health , and , at twenty - eight , taken up life with [him]922-a rifleman called lynch on [an up - country farm in [Cape Colony]43-cape colony]923-an up - country farm in cape colony . This middle period had lasted ten years , between [the lonely farm]924-the lonely farm and [an old Dutch house at [High Constantia]41-high constantia]890-an old dutch house at high constantia . [Lynch]129-leila lynch was not [a bad fellow]926-a bad fellow , but , like [most soldiers of [the old Army]928-the old army]927-most soldiers of the old army , had been quite carefully divested of an aesthetic sense . And it was [Leila]129-leila lynch 's misfortune to have moments when aesthetic sense seemed necessary . [She]129-leila lynch had struggled to overcome this weakness , and that other weakness of [hers]129-leila lynch - a liking for [men]3061-men 's admiration ; but there had certainly been intervals when [she]129-leila lynch had not properly succeeded . [Her]129-leila lynch acquaintance with [Jimmy Fort]175-jimmy had occurred during one of these intervals , and when [he]175-jimmy went back to [England]29-england so abruptly , [she]129-leila lynch had been feeling very tenderly towards [him]175-jimmy . [She]129-leila lynch still remembered [him]175-jimmy with a certain pleasure . Before [Lynch]129-leila lynch died , these " intervals "[129-leila lynch] had been interrupted by a spell of returning warmth for [the invalided man to whom [she]129-leila lynch had joined [her]129-leila lynch life under the romantic conditions of divorce]930-the invalided man to whom she had joined her life under the romantic conditions of divorce . [He]175-jimmy had failed , of course , as [a farmer]931-a farmer , and [his]175-jimmy death left [her]129-leila lynch with nothing but [her]129-leila lynch own settled income of a hundred and fifty pounds a year . Faced by the prospect of having almost to make [her]129-leila lynch living , at thirty - eight , [she]129-leila lynch felt but momentary dismay - for [she]129-leila lynch had real pluck . Like [many who have played with amateur theatricals]932-many who have played with amateur theatricals , [she]129-leila lynch fancied [herself]129-leila lynch as [an actress]933-an actress ; but , after much effort , found that only [her]129-leila lynch voice and the perfect preservation of [her]129-leila lynch legs were appreciated by [the discerning managers and public of [South Africa]9-south africa]934-the discerning managers and public of south africa ; and for three chequered years [she]129-leila lynch made face against fortune with the help of [them]934-the discerning managers and public of south africa , under an assumed name . What [she]129-leila lynch did - keeping a certain bloom of refinement , was far better than the achievements of [many more respectable ladies in [her]129-leila lynch shoes]935-many more respectable ladies in her shoes . At least [she]129-leila lynch never bemoaned [her]129-leila lynch " reduced circumstances , "[129-leila lynch] and if [her]129-leila lynch life was irregular and had at least three episodes , it was very human . [She]129-leila lynch bravely took the rough with [the smooth]936-the smooth , never lost the power of enjoying [herself]129-leila lynch , and grew in sympathy with the hardships of [others]395-others . But [she]129-leila lynch became deadly tired . When the war broke out , remembering that [she]129-leila lynch was [a good nurse]938-a good nurse , [she]129-leila lynch took [her]129-leila lynch real name again and a change of occupation . For one who liked to please [men]3061-men , and to be pleased by [them]3061-men , there was a certain attraction about that life in war - time ; and after two years of it [she]129-leila lynch could still appreciate the way [[her]129-leila lynch Tommies]940-her tommies turned [their]940-her tommies heads to look at [her]129-leila lynch when [she]129-leila lynch passed [their]940-her tommies beds . But in [a hard school]941-a hard school [she]129-leila lynch had learned perfect self - control ; and though [the sour and puritanical]942-the sour and puritanical perceived [her]129-leila lynch attraction , [they]942-the sour and puritanical knew [her]129-leila lynch to be forty - three . Besides , [the soldiers]3242-the soldiers liked [her]129-leila lynch ; and there was little trouble in [[her]129-leila lynch wards]944-her wards . The war moved [her]129-leila lynch in simple ways ; for [she]129-leila lynch was patriotic in the direct fashion of [[her]129-leila lynch class]945-her class . [[Her]129-leila lynch father]384-her father had been [a sailor]947-a sailor , [[her]129-leila lynch husbands]948-her husbands [an official]949-an official and [a soldier]581-a soldier ; the issue for [her]129-leila lynch was uncomplicated by any abstract meditation . [The Country]334-the country before everything ! And though [she]129-leila lynch had tended during those two years so many [young wrecked bodies]952-young wrecked bodies , [she]129-leila lynch had taken it as all in the a day 's work , lavishing [her]129-leila lynch sympathy on [the individual]563-the individual , without much general sense of pity and waste . Yes , [she]129-leila lynch had worked really hard , had " done [her]129-leila lynch bit "[129-leila lynch] ; but of late [she]129-leila lynch had felt rising within [her]129-leila lynch the old vague craving for " life , "[129-leila lynch] for pleasure , for something more than the mere negative admiration bestowed on [her]129-leila lynch by [her]129-leila lynch " Tommies . "[129-leila lynch] Those old letters - to look them through them had been a sure sign of this vague craving - had sharpened to poignancy the feeling that life was slipping away from [her]129-leila lynch while [she]129-leila lynch was still comely . [She]129-leila lynch had been long out of [England]29-england , and so hard - worked since [she]129-leila lynch came back that there were not many threads [she]129-leila lynch could pick up suddenly . Two letters out of that little budget of the past , with a far cry between them , had awakened within [her]129-leila lynch certain sentimental longings .

" [DEAR LADY OF THE STARRY FLOWERS]181-dear lady of the starry flowers ,[129-leila lynch]

" Exiturus sic to saluto ! [The tender]3383-the tender carries [you]181-dear lady of the starry flowers this message of good - bye . " [[Your]181-dear lady of the starry flowers very faithful servant]3385-your very faithful servant ,[129-leila lynch]

" [TIMMY FORT]175-jimmy . "[129-leila lynch]

[She]129-leila lynch remembered a very brown face , a tall slim figure , and something gallant about the whole of [him]954-him . What was [he]954-him like after ten years ? Good heavens ! Twenty - six years ago - before [he]954-him was [a parson]956-a parson , or married or anything ! [Such a good partner]957-such a good partner , really musical ; [a queer , dear fellow]958-a queer , dear fellow , devoted , absentminded , easily shocked , yet with flame burning in [him]954-him somewhere .

' [DEAR LEILA]183-leila ,

" [EDWARD PIERSON]122-pierson . "[183-leila]

And then [he]959-he had gone and become [a parson]956-a parson , and married , and been [a widower]961-a widower fifteen years . [She]962-she remembered the death of [[his]959-he wife]618-his wife , just before [she]618-his wife left for [South Africa]9-south africa , at that period of disgrace when [she]618-his wife had so shocked [[her]618-his wife family]964-her family by [her]618-his wife divorce . [Poor Edward]122-pierson - quite [the nicest of [[her]962-she cousins]966-her cousins]965-the nicest of her cousins ! [The only one [she]962-she would care to see]967-the only one she would care to see again . [He]122-pierson would be very old and terribly good and proper , by now .

[[Her]962-she wheel of [Regent 's Park]42-regent 's park]968-her wheel of regent 's park was coming full circle , and the sun was up behind [the houses]969-the houses , but still no sound of traffic stirred . [She]962-she stopped before a flower - bed where was some heliotrope , and took a long , luxurious sniff : [She]962-she could not resist plucking a sprig , too , and holding it to [her]962-she nose . A sudden want of love had run through every nerve and fibre of [her]962-she ; [she]962-she shivered , standing there with [her]962-she eyes half closed , above the pale violet blossom . Then , noting by [her]962-she wrist - watch that it was four o'clock , [she]962-she hurried on , to get to [her]962-she bed , for [she]962-she would have to be on duty again at noon . Oh ! the war ! [She]962-she was tired ! If only it were over , and one could live ! ...

Somewhere by [Twickenham]45-twickenham the moon had floated down ; somewhere up from [Kentish Town]46-kentish town the sun came soaring ; wheels rolled again , and [the seven million sleepers in [[their]970-the seven million sleepers in their million houses million houses]971-their million houses]970-the seven million sleepers in their million houses woke from morning sleep to that same thought ....

[IX

Edward Pierson]122-pierson , dreaming over an egg at breakfast , opened a letter in a handwriting which [he]122-pierson did not recognise .

" [P.]187-p. S. [I]972-he came across a little letter [you]972-he once wrote [me]972-he ; it brought back old days . "[972-he]

No ! [He]972-he had not forgotten . There was a reminder in [the house]538-the house . And [he]972-he looked up at [Noel]197-noel sitting opposite . How like the eyes were ! The words : " God forbid , "[129-leila lynch] sprang to [Pierson]186-pierson 's lips ; [he]972-he did not speak them , but put [his]972-he egg - spoon down , hurt and bewildered . What did [the child]977-the child mean ? Not feel the war ! [He]972-he smiled .

" [I]972-he hope [I]972-he 'm able to help [people]3083-people sometimes , [Nollie]131-nollie , "[972-he] and was conscious that [he]972-he had answered [his]972-he own thoughts , not [her]129-leila lynch words . [He]972-he finished [his]972-he breakfast quickly , and very soon went out . [He]972-he crossed [the Square]789-the square , and passed East , down [two crowded streets]979-two crowded streets to [[his]972-he church]421-his church . In [the traffic of [those streets]982-those streets]981-the traffic of those streets , all slipshod and confused , [his]972-he black - clothed figure and grave face , with its Vandyk beard , had a curious remote appearance , like a moving remnant of a past civilisation . [He]972-he went in by the side door . Only five days [he]972-he had been away , but they had been so full of emotion that [the empty familiar building]983-the empty familiar building seemed almost strange to [him]972-he . [He]972-he had come [there]3137-there unconsciously , groping for anchorage and guidance in this sudden change of relationship between [him]972-he and [[his]972-he daughters]619-his daughters . [He]972-he stood by the pale brazen eagle , staring into [the chancel]986-the chancel . [The choir]987-the choir were wanting new hymn - books - [he]972-he must not forget to order them ! [His]972-he eyes sought the stained - glass window [he]972-he had put in to the memory of [[his]972-he wife]618-his wife . The sun , too high to slant , was burnishing its base , till it glowed of a deep sherry colour . " In [the next world]3400-the next world ! "[972-he] What strange words of [Noel]197-noel 's ! [His]972-he eyes caught the glimmer of the organ - pipes ; and , mounting to [the loft]989-the loft , [he]972-he began to play soft chords wandering into each other . [He]972-he finished , and stood gazing down . [This space within high walls]990-this space within high walls , under high vaulted roof , where light was toned to a perpetual twilight , broken here and there by a little glow of colour from glass and flowers , metal , and dark wood , was [[his]972-he home]991-his home , [his]972-he charge , [[his]972-he refuge]992-his refuge . Nothing moved down [there]3137-there , and yet - was not emptiness mysteriously living , the closed - in air imprinted in strange sort , as though the drone of music and voices in prayer and praise clung there still ? Had not sanctity a presence ? Outside , a barrel - organ drove its tune along ; [a wagon]994-a wagon staggered on [the paved street]995-the paved street , and [the driver]996-the driver shouted to [his]996-the driver horses ; some distant guns boomed out in practice , and the rolling of wheels on wheels formed a net of sound . But those invading noises were transmuted to a mere murmuring in here ; only the silence and the twilight were real to [Pierson]186-pierson , standing there , a little black figure in [a great empty space]997-a great empty space .

When [he]972-he left [the church]372-the church , it was still rather early to go to [[Leila]186-pierson 's hospital]999-leila 's hospital ; and , having ordered the new hymn - books , [he]972-he called in at [the house of [a parishioner whose son had been killed in [France]13-france]1001-a parishioner whose son had been killed in france]1000-the house of a parishioner whose son had been killed in france . [He]972-he found [her]1001-a parishioner whose son had been killed in france in [[her]1001-a parishioner whose son had been killed in france kitchen]1002-her kitchen ; [an oldish woman who lived by charing]1003-an oldish woman who lived by charing . [Mrs. Soles]188-mrs. soles shook [her]188-mrs. soles head , and the small twisted bob of [her]188-mrs. soles discoloured hair wobbled vaguely .

" [I]188-mrs. soles ca n't take any recreation , "[188-mrs. soles] [she]188-mrs. soles said . " [I]188-mrs. soles 'd rather sit ' ere , or be at work . [I]188-mrs. soles can make [you]3028-sir a fresh cup in a minute . "[188-mrs. soles]

" Thank [you]188-mrs. soles , [Mrs. Soles]188-mrs. soles , but [I]188-mrs. soles must be getting on . [Pierson]186-pierson walked away with a very faint smile . [Poor queer old soul]1005-poor queer old soul ! - [she]188-mrs. soles was no older than [himself]186-pierson , but [he]1006-he thought of [her]188-mrs. soles as ancient - cut off from [[her]188-mrs. soles son]545-her son , like so many - so many ; and how good and patient ! The melody of an anthem began running in [his]1006-he head . [His]1006-he fingers moved on the air beside [him]1006-he , and [he]1006-he stood still , waiting for an omnibus to take [him]1006-he to [St. John 's Wood]39-st. john 's wood . [A thousand people]1008-a thousand people went by while [he]1006-he was waiting , but [he]1006-he did not notice [them]1008-a thousand people , thinking of that anthem , of [[his]1006-he daughters]619-his daughters , and the mercy of [God]143-god ; and on the top of [[his]1006-he ' bus]1010-his ' bus , when it came along , [he]1006-he looked lonely and apart , though [the man beside [him]1006-he]1011-the man beside him was so fat that there was hardly any seat left to sit on . Under a skylight six beds jutted out from a green distempered wall , opposite to six beds jutting out from another green distempered wall , and from each bed a face was turned towards [them]1025-they young faces , with but little expression in [them]1025-they . [A nurse]3053-a nurse , at the far end , looked round , and went on with [her]3053-a nurse work . The sight of [the ward]1028-the ward was no more new to [Pierson]186-pierson than to [anyone else]1029-anyone else in these days . It was so familiar , indeed , that it had practically no significance . [He]122-pierson stood by the first bed , and [Leila]186-pierson stood alongside . [The man]587-the man smiled up when [she]186-pierson spoke , and did not smile when [he]587-the man spoke , and that again was familiar to [him]122-pierson . [They]1025-they passed from bed to bed , with exactly the same result , till [she]186-pierson was called away , and [he]122-pierson sat down by [a young soldier with a long , very narrow head and face , and a heavily bandaged shoulder]1031-a young soldier with a long , very narrow head and face , and a heavily bandaged shoulder .
