And the sun , blazing suddenly out of a cloud , shone on [his]1046-he black figure and the little gold cross , in the middle of [Portland Place]50-portland place .

[X

Men]196-x men , even if [they]196-x men are not artistic , who have been in strange places and known [many nooks of [the world]606-the world]1049-many nooks of the world , get the scenic habit , become open to pictorial sensation . It was as a picture or series of pictures that [Jimmy Fort]175-jimmy ever afterwards remembered [his]175-jimmy first supper at [[Leila]129-leila lynch 's]1051-leila 's . [He]175-jimmy happened to have been all day in the open , motoring about to [horse farms]1052-horse farms under a hot sun ; and [Leila]183-leila 's hock cup possessed a bland and subtle strength . The scenic sense derived therefrom had a certain poignancy , the more so because [the tall child whom [he]1046-he met there]1053-the tall child whom he met there did not drink it , and [[her]1053-the tall child whom he met there father]384-her father seemed but to wet [his]1046-he lips , so that [Leila]183-leila and [he]1046-he had all the rest . Rather a wonderful little scene it made in [his]1046-he mind , very warm , glowing , yet with a strange dark sharpness to it , which came perhaps from the black walls .

[The flat]1055-the flat had belonged to [an artist who was at the war]1056-an artist who was at the war . [It]1055-the flat was but [a pocket dwelling on [the third floor]1058-the third floor]1057-a pocket dwelling on the third floor . The two windows of [the little square sitting - room]1059-the little square sitting - room looked out on some trees and [a church]3075-a church . But [Leila]183-leila , who hated dining by daylight , had soon drawn curtains of a deep blue over them . The picture which [Fort]175-jimmy remembered was this : A little four - square table of dark wood , with a Chinese mat of vivid blue in the centre , whereon stood a silver lustre bowl of clove carnations ; some greenish glasses with hock cup in them ; on [his]1046-he left , [Leila]183-leila in a low lilac frock , [her]183-leila neck and shoulders very white , [her]183-leila face a little powdered , [her]183-leila eyes large , [her]183-leila lips smiling ; opposite [him]1046-he [a black - clothed padre with a little gold cross , over whose thin darkish face , with its grave pointed beard , passed little gentle smiles , but whose deep sunk grey eyes were burnt and bright]1061-a black - clothed padre with a little gold cross , over whose thin darkish face , with its grave pointed beard , passed little gentle smiles , but whose deep sunk grey eyes were burnt and bright ; on [his]1046-he right , [a girl in a high grey frock , almost white , just hollowed at the neck , with full sleeves to the elbow]1062-a girl in a high grey frock , almost white , just hollowed at the neck , with full sleeves to the elbow , so that [her]183-leila slim arms escaped ; [her]183-leila short fair hair a little tumbled ; [her]183-leila big grey eyes grave ; [her]183-leila full lips shaping with a strange daintiness round every word - and they not many ; brilliant red shades over golden lights dotting the black walls ; a blue divan ; a little black piano flush with the wall ; a dark polished floor ; four Japanese prints ; a white ceiling . [He]1046-he was conscious that [his]1046-he own khaki spoiled something as curious and rare as some old Chinese tea - chest . [He]1046-he even remembered what [they]1063-they ate ; lobster ; cold pigeon pie ; asparagus ; St. Ivel cheese ; raspberries and cream . [He]1046-he did not remember half so well what [they]1063-they talked of , except that [he]1046-he [himself]1046-he told [them]1063-they stories of the Boer War , in which [he]1046-he had served in [the Yeomanry]1064-the yeomanry , and while [he]1046-he was telling [them]1063-they , [the girl]525-the girl , like a child listening to a fairy - tale , never moved [her]525-the girl eyes from [his]1046-he face . [He]1046-he remembered that after supper [they]1063-they all smoked cigarettes , even [the tall child]1066-the tall child , after [the padre]1067-the padre had said to [her]1066-the tall child mildly , " [[My]525-the girl dear]3031-my dear ! "[525-the girl] and [she]525-the girl had answered : " [I]525-the girl simply must , [Daddy]132-daddy , just one . "[525-the girl] [He]1046-he remembered [Leila]183-leila brewing Turkish coffee - very good , and how beautiful [her]525-the girl white arms looked , hovering about the cups . [He]1046-he remembered [her]183-leila making [the padre]1067-the padre sit down at the piano , and play to [them]1063-they . And [she]183-leila and [the girl on the divan]1069-the girl on the divan together , side by side , a strange contrast ; with just as strange a likeness to [each other]493-each other . [He]1046-he always remembered how fine and rare that music sounded in [the little room]1071-the little room , flooding [him]1046-he with a dreamy beatitude . Then - [he]1046-he remembered - [Leila]183-leila sang , [the padre standing - by]1072-the padre standing - by ; and [the tall child on the divan]1073-the tall child on the divan bending forward over [her]1073-the tall child on the divan knees , with [her]1073-the tall child on the divan chin on [her]1073-the tall child on the divan hands . [He]1046-he remembered rather vividly how [Leila]183-leila turned [her]183-leila neck and looked up , now at [the padre]1067-the padre , now at [himself]1046-he ; and , all through , the delightful sense of colour and warmth , a sort of glamour over all the evening ; and the lingering pressure of [Leila]183-leila 's hand when [he]1046-he said good - bye and [they]1075-they went away , for [they]1075-they all went together . [He]1046-he remembered talking a great deal to [the padre]1067-the padre in [the cab]564-the cab , about [the public school [they]1075-they had both been at]1078-the public school they had both been at , and thinking : ' It 's [a good padre]1079-a good padre - this ! ' [He]1046-he remembered how [[their]1075-they taxi]1080-their taxi took [them]1075-they to [an old Square]1081-an old square which [he]1046-he did not know , where [the garden trees]1082-the garden trees looked densely black in the starshine . [He]1046-he remembered that [a man outside [the house]538-the house]1083-a man outside the house had engaged [the padre]1067-the padre in earnest talk , while [the tall child]1066-the tall child and [himself]1046-he stood in the open doorway , where [the hall beyond]1087-the hall beyond was dark . Very exactly [he]1046-he remembered the little conversation which then took place between [them]1075-they , while [they]1075-they waited for [[her]1066-the tall child father]384-her father .

" Is it very horrid in [the trenches]3318-the trenches , [Captain Fort]197-noel ? "[1046-he]

" Yes , [Miss Pierson]198-pierson ; it is very horrid , as a rule . "[1046-he]

" Is it dangerous all the time ? "[1046-he]

" Pretty well . "[1046-he]

" Do [officers]3457-officers run more risks than [the men]3458-the men ? "[1046-he]

" Not unless there 's an attack . "[1046-he]

" Are there attacks very often ? "[1046-he]

It had seemed to [him]1046-he so strangely primitive a little catechism , that [he]1046-he had smiled . And , though it was so dark , [she]1066-the tall child had seen that smile , for [her]1066-the tall child face went proud and close all of a sudden . [He]1046-he had cursed [himself]1046-he , and said gently :

" Have [you]1066-the tall child [a brother]3251-a brother out there ? "[1046-he]

[She]1066-the tall child shook [her]1066-the tall child head .

" But [someone]502-someone ? "[1066-the tall child]

" Yes . "[1066-the tall child]

[Someone]502-someone ! [He]1046-he had heard that answer with a little shock . [This child]1090-this child - [this fairy princess of a child]1091-this fairy princess of a child already to have [someone]502-someone ! [He]1046-he wondered if [she]1066-the tall child went about asking [everyone]3072-everyone these questions , with that someone in [her]1066-the tall child thoughts . [Poor child]507-poor child ! And quickly [he]1046-he said :

" After all , look at [me]1046-he ! [I]1046-he was out there a year , and here [I]1046-he am with only half a game leg ; times were a lot worse , then , too . [I]1046-he often wish [I]1046-he were back [there]3137-there . Anything 's better than [London]7-london and [the War Office]3382-the war office . "[1046-he] But just then [he]1046-he saw [the padre]1067-the padre coming , and took [her]1066-the tall child hand . " Good night , [Miss Pierson]198-pierson . Do n't worry . That does no good , and there is n't half the risk [you]1046-he think . "[1046-he]

[Her]1066-the tall child hand stirred , squeezed [his]1046-he gratefully , as [a child]415-a child 's would squeeze .

And , in the dark cab again , [he]1046-he remembered thinking : ' Fancy [that child]3092-that child ! [A jolly lucky boy]1098-a jolly lucky boy , out there ! Too bad ! [Poor little fairy princess]1099-poor little fairy princess ! '

PART II

[I]0-i

1

To wash up is not an exciting operation . To wash up in [August]52-august became for [Noel]197-noel a process which taxed [her]1066-the tall child strength and enthusiasm . [She]1066-the tall child combined it with other forms of instruction in the art of nursing , had very little leisure , and in the evenings at [home]3048-home would often fall asleep curled up in a large chintz - covered chair .

[George]140-george and [Gratian]127-gratian had long gone back to [[their]1101-their respective hospitals]1102-their respective hospitals , and [she]1066-the tall child and [[her]1066-the tall child father]384-her father had [the house]538-the house to [themselves]1101-their . [She]1066-the tall child received many letters from [Cyril]133-cyril which [she]1066-the tall child carried about with [her]1066-the tall child and read on [her]1066-the tall child way to and from [the hospital]1022-the hospital ; and every other day [she]1066-the tall child wrote to [him]133-cyril . [He]133-cyril was not yet in the firing line ; [his]133-cyril letters were descriptive of [[his]133-cyril men]1106-his men , [his]133-cyril food , or [the natives]1107-the natives , or reminiscent of [Kestrel]199-kestrel ; hers descriptive of washing up , or reminiscent of [Kestrel]199-kestrel . But in both there was always some little word of the longing within [them]1108-them .

It was towards the end of [August]52-august when [she]1066-the tall child had the letter which said that [he]133-cyril had been moved up . From now on [he]133-cyril would be in hourly danger ! That evening after dinner [she]1066-the tall child did not go to sleep in the chair , but sat under the open window , clenching [her]1066-the tall child hands , and reading " Pride and Prejudice "[384-her father] without understanding a word . While [she]1066-the tall child was so engaged [[her]1066-the tall child father]384-her father came up and said :

" [Captain Fort]197-noel , [Nollie]131-nollie . Will [you]197-noel give [him]133-cyril some coffee ? [I]384-her father 'm afraid [I]384-her father must go out . "[384-her father]

When [he]384-her father had gone , [Noel]197-noel looked at [[her]1066-the tall child visitor]1110-her visitor drinking [his]133-cyril coffee . [He]133-cyril had been out [there]3137-there , too , and [he]133-cyril was alive ; with only a little limp . [The visitor]1112-the visitor smiled and said :

" What were [you]197-noel thinking about when [we]3463-we came in ? "[1112-the visitor]

" Only the war . "[1112-the visitor]

" Any news of [him]133-cyril ? "[1112-the visitor]

[Noel]197-noel frowned , [she]1066-the tall child hated to show [her]1066-the tall child feelings .

" Yes ! [he]133-cyril 's gone to [the Front]3464-the front . Wo n't [you]1112-the visitor have a cigarette ? "[1112-the visitor]

" Thanks . Will [you]197-noel ? "[1112-the visitor]

" [I]1112-the visitor want one awfully . [I]1112-the visitor think sitting still and waiting is more dreadful than anything in [the world]606-the world . "[1112-the visitor]

" Except , knowing that [others]395-others are waiting . When [I]1112-the visitor was out [there]3137-there [I]1112-the visitor used to worry horribly over [[my]1112-the visitor mother]3468-my mother . [She]3468-my mother was ill at the time . The cruelest thing in war is the anxiety of [people]3083-people about [each other]493-each other - nothing touches that . "[1112-the visitor]

The words exactly summed up [Noel]197-noel 's hourly thought . [He]197-noel said nice things , [this man with the long legs and the thin brown bumpy face]1113-this man with the long legs and the thin brown bumpy face !

" [I]1114-i wish [I]1114-i were [a man]3326-a man , "[1114-i] [she]1114-i said , " [I]1114-i think [women]3282-women have much the worst time in the war . Is [[your]197-noel mother]3087-your mother old ? "[1114-i] But of course [she]1114-i was old why [he]197-noel was old [himself]197-noel !

" [She]3468-my mother died last Christmas . "[197-noel]

" Oh ! [I]197-noel 'm so sorry ! "[197-noel]

" [You]197-noel lost [[your]197-noel mother]3087-your mother when [you]197-noel were [a babe]3475-a babe , did n't [you]197-noel ? "[197-noel]

" Yes . That 's [her]3468-my mother portrait . "[197-noel] At the end of [the room]517-the room , hanging on a strip of black velvet was a pastel , very faint in colouring , as though faded , of [a young woman , with an eager , sweet face , dark eyes]1116-a young woman , with an eager , sweet face , dark eyes , and bent a little forward , as if questioning [her]1116-a young woman , with an eager , sweet face , dark eyes painter . [Fort]197-noel went up to it .

" [It]3476-it 's not a bit like [you]197-noel . But [she]3468-my mother must have been [a very sweet woman]3477-a very sweet woman . "[197-noel]

" It 's a sort of presence in [the room]517-the room . [I]197-noel wish [I]197-noel were like [her]3468-my mother ! "[197-noel]

[Fort]197-noel turned . " No , "[197-noel] [he]197-noel said ; " no . Better as [you]197-noel are . It would only have spoiled a complete thing . "[197-noel]

" [She]3468-my mother was good . "[197-noel]

" And are n't [you]197-noel ? "[197-noel]

" Oh ! no . [I]197-noel get [a devil]3479-a devil . "[197-noel]

" [You]197-noel ! Why , [you]197-noel 're out of a fairy - tale ! "[197-noel]

" It comes from [Daddy]132-daddy - only [he]132-daddy does n't know , because [he]132-daddy 's [a perfect saint]3101-a perfect saint ; but [I]197-noel know [he]132-daddy 's had a devil somewhere , or [he]132-daddy could n't be [the saint]3481-the saint [he]132-daddy is . "[197-noel]

" H'm ! "[197-noel] said [Fort]197-noel . " That 's very deep : and [I]197-noel believe it 's true - [the saints]3482-the saints did have [devils]3483-devils . "[197-noel]

" [[Poor Daddy]132-daddy 's devil]3484-poor daddy 's devil has been dead ages . It 's been starved out of [him]132-daddy , [I]197-noel think . "[197-noel]

" Does [your]197-noel devil ever get away with [you]197-noel ? "[197-noel]

[Noel]197-noel felt [her]1117-her cheeks growing red under [his]197-noel stare , and [she]1117-her turned to the window :

" Yes . It 's [a real devil]3485-a real devil . "[1117-her]

Vividly there had come before [her]1117-her [the dark Abbey]1118-the dark abbey , and the moon balancing over the top of the crumbling wall , and the white owl flying across . And , speaking to the air , [she]1117-her said :

" It makes [you]197-noel do things that [you]197-noel want to do . "[1117-her]

[She]1117-her wondered if [he]197-noel would laugh - it sounded so silly . But [he]197-noel did not .

" And damn the consequences ? [I]1117-her know . It 's rather a jolly thing to have . "[1117-her]

[Noel]197-noel shook [her]1117-her head . " Here 's [Daddy]132-daddy coming back ! "[197-noel]

[He]197-noel kept [her]1117-her hand rather a long time , and gave it a hard squeeze .

Do n't worry ! What advice ! Ah ! if [she]1117-her could see [Cyril]133-cyril just for a minute !

2

In September , 1916 , Saturday still came before Sunday , in spite of the war . For [Edward Pierson]122-pierson this Saturday had been a strenuous day , and even now , at nearly midnight , [he]122-pierson was still conning [his]122-pierson just - completed sermon .

[A patriot of patriots]1119-a patriot of patriots , [he]122-pierson had often a passionate longing to resign [[his]122-pierson parish]338-his parish , and go like [[his]122-pierson curate]339-his curate for [a chaplain at [the Front]3464-the front]1122-a chaplain at the front . It seemed to [him]122-pierson that [people]3083-people must think [his]122-pierson life idle and sheltered and useless . Even in times of peace [he]122-pierson had been sensitive enough to feel the cold draughty blasts which [the Church]372-the church encounters in a material age . [He]122-pierson knew that [nine people out of ten]1126-nine people out of ten looked on [him]122-pierson as [something of a parasite]1127-something of a parasite , with no real work in [the world]606-the world . And since [he]122-pierson was nothing if not conscientious , [he]122-pierson always worked [himself]122-pierson to the bone .

To - day [he]122-pierson had risen at half - past six , and after [his]122-pierson bath and exercises , had sat down to [his]122-pierson sermon - for , even now , [he]122-pierson wrote a new sermon once a month , though [he]122-pierson had the fruits of twenty - six years to choose from . True , these new sermons were rather compiled than written , because , bereft of [[his]122-pierson curate]339-his curate , [he]122-pierson had not time enough for fresh thought on old subjects . At eight [he]122-pierson had breakfasted with [Noel]197-noel , before [she]1130-she went off to [[her]1130-she hospital]3051-her hospital , whence [she]1130-she would return at eight in the evening . Nine to ten was [his]122-pierson hour for seeing [parishioners who had troubles , or wanted help or advice]1132-parishioners who had troubles , or wanted help or advice , and [he]122-pierson had received [three to - day who all wanted help]1133-three to - day who all wanted help , which [he]122-pierson had given . From ten to eleven [he]122-pierson had gone back to [his]122-pierson sermon , and had spent from eleven to one at [[his]122-pierson church]421-his church , attending to small matters , writing notices , fixing hymns , holding the daily half - hour Service instituted during wartime , to which but few ever came . [He]122-pierson had hurried back to lunch , scamping it so that [he]122-pierson might get to [his]122-pierson piano for an hour of forgetfulness . At three [he]122-pierson had christened [a very noisy baby]1135-a very noisy baby , and been detained by [[its]1135-a very noisy baby parents]1136-its parents who wished for information on a variety of topics . At half - past four [he]122-pierson had snatched a cup of tea , reading the paper ; and had spent from five to seven visiting two [Parish Clubs]1137-parish clubs , and those whose war - pension matters [he]122-pierson had in hand , and filling up forms which would be kept in official places till such time as the system should be changed and a fresh set of forms issued . From seven to eight [he]122-pierson was at [home]3048-home again , in case [[his]122-pierson flock]1139-his flock wanted to see [him]122-pierson ; to - day four sheep had come , and gone away , [he]122-pierson was afraid , but little the wiser . From half - past eight to half - past nine [he]122-pierson had spent in choir practice , because [the organist]1140-the organist was on [his]122-pierson holiday . Slowly in the cool of the evening [he]122-pierson had walked [home]3048-home , and fallen asleep in [his]122-pierson chair on getting in . At eleven [he]122-pierson had woken with a start , and , hardening [his]122-pierson heart , had gone back to [his]122-pierson sermon . And now , at nearly midnight , it was still less than twenty minutes long . [He]122-pierson lighted one of [his]122-pierson rare cigarettes , and let thought wander . How beautiful those pale pink roses were in that old silver bowl - like a little strange poem , or a piece of Debussy music , or a Mathieu Maris picture - reminding [him]122-pierson oddly of the word Leila . Was [he]122-pierson wrong in letting [Noel]197-noel see so much of [Leila]183-leila ? But then [she]183-leila was so improved - dear [Leila]183-leila ! ... The pink roses were just going to fall ! And yet how beautiful ! ... It was quiet to - night ; [he]122-pierson felt very drowsy .... Did [Nollie]131-nollie still think of [that young man]3037-that young man , or had it passed ? [She]131-nollie had never confided in [him]122-pierson since ! After the war , it would be nice to take [her]131-nollie to [Italy]53-italy , to [all the little towns]1143-all the little towns . [They]1144-they would see [the Assisi of [St. Francis]54-st. francis]1145-the assisi of st. francis . [The Little Flowers of [St. Francis]54-st. francis]1146-the little flowers of st. francis . [The Little Flowers]201-the little flowers ! ... [His]122-pierson hand dropped , the cigarette went out . [He]122-pierson slept with [his]122-pierson face in shadow . Slowly into the silence of [his]122-pierson sleep little sinister sounds intruded . Short concussions , dragging [him]122-pierson back out of that deep slumber . [He]122-pierson started up . [Noel]197-noel was standing at the door , in a long coat . [She]131-nollie said in [her]131-nollie calm voice :

" [Zeps]3486-zeps , [Daddy]132-daddy ! "[131-nollie]

" Yes , [[my]131-nollie dear]3031-my dear . Where are [the maids]3488-the maids ? "[131-nollie]

An Irish voice answered from [the hall]522-the hall : " Here , [sir]3028-sir ; trustin ' in [God]143-god ; but ' tis better on the ground floor . "[131-nollie]

[He]197-noel saw [a huddle of three figures]1148-a huddle of three figures , queerly costumed , against the stairs .

" Yes , Yes , [Bridgie]202-bridgie ; [you]202-bridgie 're safe down here . "[1148-a huddle of three figures] Then [he]197-noel noticed that [Noel]197-noel was gone . [He]197-noel followed [her]131-nollie out into [the Square]789-the square , alive with faces faintly luminous in the darkness , and found [her]131-nollie against the garden railings .

" [You]202-bridgie must come back in , [Nollie]131-nollie . "[131-nollie]

" Oh , no ! [Cyril]133-cyril has this every day . "[131-nollie]

[He]197-noel stood beside [her]131-nollie ; not loth , for excitement had begun to stir [his]197-noel blood . [They]1150-they stayed there for some minutes , straining [their]1150-they eyes for sight of anything save the little zagged splashes of bursting shrapnel , while voices buzzed , and muttered : " Look ! There ! [There]3137-there ! There it is ! "[1151-the seers]

But [the seers]1151-the seers had eyes of greater faith than [Pierson]122-pierson 's , for [he]197-noel saw nothing : [He]197-noel took [her]131-nollie arm at last , and led [her]131-nollie in . In [the hall]522-the hall [she]131-nollie broke from [him]197-noel .

" Let 's go up on the roof , [Daddy]132-daddy ! "[131-nollie] and ran [upstairs]1153-upstairs .

Again [he]197-noel followed , mounting by a ladder , through a trapdoor on to the roof .

" It 's splendid up here ! "[131-nollie] [she]131-nollie cried .

[He]197-noel could see [her]131-nollie eyes blazing , and thought : ' How [[my]0-i child]3086-my child does love excitement - it 's almost terrible ! '

Over the wide , dark , star - strewn sky travelling searchlights , were lighting up the few little clouds ; the domes and spires rose from among the spread - out roofs , all fine and ghostly . The guns had ceased firing , as though puzzled . One distant bang rumbled out .

" A bomb ! Oh ! If [we]1155-they could only get one of [the Zeps]203-the zeps ! "[122-pierson]

A furious outburst of firing followed , lasting perhaps a minute , then ceased as if by magic . [They]1155-they saw two searchlights converge and meet right overhead .

" It 's above [us]1155-they ! "[197-noel] murmured [Noel]197-noel .

[Pierson]122-pierson put [his]122-pierson arm round [her]131-nollie waist . ' [She]131-nollie feels no fear ! ' [he]122-pierson thought . The search - lights switched apart ; and suddenly , from far away , came a confusion of weird sounds .

" What is it ? [They]1155-they 're cheering . Oh ! [Daddy]132-daddy , look ! "[122-pierson] There in the heavens , towards the east , hung a dull red thing , lengthening as [they]1155-they gazed .

" [They]1155-they 've got it . It 's on fire ! Hurrah ! "[122-pierson]

Through the dark firmament that fiery orange shape began canting downward ; and the cheering swelled in a savage frenzy of sound . And [Pierson]122-pierson 's arm tightened on [her]131-nollie waist .

" Thank [God]143-god ! "[122-pierson] [he]122-pierson muttered .

The bright oblong seemed to break and spread , tilted down below the level of the roofs ; and suddenly the heavens flared , as if some huge jug of crimson light had been flung out on [them]1155-they . Something turned over in [Pierson]122-pierson 's heart ; [he]122-pierson flung up [his]122-pierson hand to [his]122-pierson eyes .

" [The poor men in it]3491-the poor men in it ! "[122-pierson] [he]122-pierson said . " How terrible ! "[122-pierson]

[Noel]197-noel 's voice answered , hard and pitiless :

" [They]1155-they need n't have come . [They]1155-they 're [murderers]3492-murderers ! "[197-noel]

Yes , [they]1155-they were [murderers]3492-murderers - but how terrible ! And [he]122-pierson stood quivering , with [his]122-pierson hands pressed to [his]122-pierson face , till the cheering had died out into silence .

" Let 's pray , [Nollie]131-nollie ! "[122-pierson] [he]122-pierson whispered . " [O God , Who in [Thy]143-god great mercy hath delivered [us]3493-us from peril]143-god , take into [Thy]143-god keeping the souls of [these [our]3493-us enemies]3494-these our enemies , consumed by [Thy]143-god wrath before [our]3493-us eyes ; give [us]3493-us the power to pity [them]3494-these our enemies - [men like [ourselves]3493-us]3495-men like ourselves . "[122-pierson]

But even while [he]122-pierson prayed [he]122-pierson could see [Noel]197-noel 's face flame - white in the darkness ; and , as that glow in the sky faded out , [he]122-pierson felt once more the thrill of triumph .

[They]1157-they went down to tell [the maids]3488-the maids , and for some time after sat up together , talking over what [they]1157-they had seen , eating biscuits and drinking milk , which [they]1157-they warmed on an etna . It was nearly two o'clock before [they]1157-they went to bed . [Pierson]122-pierson fell asleep at once , and never turned till awakened at half - past six by [[his]122-pierson alarum]1159-his alarum . [He]122-pierson had Holy Communion to administer at eight , and [he]122-pierson hurried to get early to [[his]122-pierson church]421-his church and see that nothing untoward had happened to [it]421-his church . There it stood in the sunlight ; tall , grey , quiet , unharmed , with bell gently ringing .

3

And at that hour [Cyril Morland]133-cyril , under the parapet of [[his]122-pierson trench]1161-his trench , tightening [his]122-pierson belt , was looking at [his]122-pierson wrist - watch for the hundredth time , calculating exactly where [he]122-pierson meant to put foot and hand for the going over : ' [I]0-i absolutely must n't let [those chaps]1162-those chaps get in front of [me]0-i , ' [he]122-pierson thought . So many yards before the first line of [trenches]1163-trenches , so many yards to [the second line]1164-the second line , and there stop . So [his]122-pierson rehearsals had gone ; it was the performance now ! Another minute before the terrific racket of the drum - fire should become the curtain - fire , which would advance before [them]1162-those chaps . [He]122-pierson ran [his]122-pierson eye down [the trench]1165-the trench . [The man next [him]122-pierson]1166-the man next him was licking [his]1166-the man next him two first fingers , as if [he]1166-the man next him might be going to bowl at cricket . Further down , [a man]3326-a man was feeling [his]3326-a man puttees . A voice said : " Wot price the orchestra nah ! "[122-pierson] [He]122-pierson saw teeth gleam in faces burnt almost black . Then [he]122-pierson looked up ; the sky was blue beyond the brownish film of dust raised by the striking shells . [Noel]197-noel ! [Noel]197-noel ! [Noel]197-noel ! ... [He]122-pierson dug [his]122-pierson fingers deep into the left side of [his]122-pierson tunic till [he]122-pierson could feel the outline of [her]1168-her photograph between [his]122-pierson dispatch - case and [his]122-pierson heart . [His]122-pierson heart fluttered just as it used when [he]122-pierson was stretched out with hand touching the ground , before the start of the " hundred yards "[3326-a man] at [school]3099-school . Out of the corner of [his]122-pierson eye [he]122-pierson caught the flash of [a man]3326-a man 's " briquet "[3326-a man] lighting a cigarette . All right for [those chaps]1162-those chaps , but not for [him]122-pierson ; [he]122-pierson wanted all [his]122-pierson breath - this rifle , and kit were handicap enough ! Two days ago [he]122-pierson had been reading in some paper how [men]3061-men felt just before an attack . And now [he]122-pierson knew . [He]122-pierson just felt nervous . If only the moment would come , and get itself over ! For all the thought [he]122-pierson gave to [the enemy]1173-the enemy there might have been none - nothing but shells and bullets , with lives of [their]3061-men own . [He]122-pierson heard the whistle ; [his]122-pierson foot was on the spot [he]122-pierson had marked down ; [his]122-pierson hand where [he]122-pierson had seen it ; [he]122-pierson called out : " Now , [boys]3438-boys ! "[122-pierson] [His]122-pierson head was over the top , [his]122-pierson body over ; [he]122-pierson was conscious of [someone]502-someone falling , and [two men]1175-two men neck and neck beside [him]122-pierson . Not to try and run , not to break out of a walk ; to go steady , and yet keep ahead ! D - n these holes ! A bullet tore through [his]122-pierson sleeve , grazing [his]122-pierson arm - a red - hot sensation , like the touch of an iron . A British shell from close over [his]122-pierson head burst sixty yards ahead ; [he]122-pierson stumbled , fell flat , picked [himself]122-pierson up . Three ahead of [him]122-pierson now ! [He]122-pierson walked faster , and drew alongside . [Two of [them]1175-two men]1176-two of them fell . ' What luck ! ' [he]122-pierson thought ; and gripping [his]122-pierson rifle harder , pitched headlong into a declivity . Dead bodies lay there ! [The first German trench line]1177-the first german trench line , and nothing alive in it , nothing to clean up , nothing of it left ! [He]122-pierson stopped , getting [his]122-pierson wind ; watching [the men panting and stumbling in]1178-the men panting and stumbling in . The roar of the guns was louder than ever again , barraging the second line . So far , good ! And here was [[his]122-pierson captain]1179-his captain !

" Ready , [boys]3438-boys ? On , then ! "[1179-his captain]

This time [he]122-pierson moved more slowly still , over terrible going , all holes and hummocks . Half consciously [he]122-pierson took cover all [he]122-pierson could . The air was alive with the whistle from machine - gun fire storming across zigzag fashion - alive it was with bullets , dust , and smoke . ' How shall [I]0-i tell [her]1180-her ? ' [he]122-pierson thought . There would be nothing to tell but just a sort of jagged brown sensation . [He]122-pierson kept [his]122-pierson eyes steadily before [him]122-pierson , not wanting to [seethe men]1181-seethe men falling , not wanting anything to divert [him]122-pierson from getting [there]3137-there . [He]122-pierson felt the faint fanning of the passing bullets . The second line must be close now . Why did n't that barrage lift ? Was this new dodge of firing till the last second going to do [them]1183-them in ? Another hundred yards and [he]122-pierson would be bang into it . [He]122-pierson flung [himself]122-pierson flat and waited ; looking at [his]122-pierson wrist - watch [he]122-pierson noted that [his]122-pierson arm was soaked with blood . [He]122-pierson thought : ' A wound ! Now [I]0-i shall go [home]3048-home . Thank [God]143-god ! Oh , [Noel]197-noel ! ' The passing bullets whirled above [him]122-pierson ; [he]122-pierson could hear them even through the screech and thunder of the shell - fire . ' The beastly things ! ' [he]122-pierson thought : [A voice beside [him]122-pierson]1185-a voice beside him gasped out :

" It 's lifted , [sir]3028-sir . "[1185-a voice beside him]

[He]122-pierson called : " Come on , [boys]3438-boys ! "[122-pierson] and went forward , stooping . A bullet struck [his]122-pierson rifle . The shock made [him]122-pierson stagger and sent an electric shock spinning up [his]122-pierson arm . ' Luck again ! ' [he]122-pierson thought . ' Now for it ! [I]0-i have n't seen a German yet ! ' [He]122-pierson leaped forward , spun round , flung up [his]122-pierson arms , and fell on [his]122-pierson back , shot through and through ....

The position was consolidated , as [they]1186-they say , and in the darkness [stretcher - bearers]1187-stretcher - bearers were out over [the half - mile]1188-the half - mile . Like will - o'-the - wisps , with [their]1187-stretcher - bearers shaded lanterns , [they]1187-stretcher - bearers moved , hour after hour , slowly quartering the black honeycomb which lay behind the new British line . Now and then in the light of some star - shell [their]1187-stretcher - bearers figures were disclosed , bending and raising the forms of the wounded , or wielding pick and shovel .

" [Officer]3500-officer . "[1189-the searcher]

" Dead ? "[1189-the searcher]

" Sure . "[1189-the searcher]

" Search . "[1189-the searcher]

From the shaded lantern , lowered to just above the body , a yellowish glare fell on face and breast . The hands of [the searcher]1189-the searcher moved in that little pool of light . [The bearer who was taking notes]1190-the bearer who was taking notes bent down .

" [Another boy]3501-another boy , "[1190-the bearer who was taking notes] [he]1190-the bearer who was taking notes said . " That all [he]3501-another boy has ? "[1190-the bearer who was taking notes]

[The searcher]1189-the searcher raised [himself]1189-the searcher .

" Just those , and a photo . "[1189-the searcher]

" Dispatch - case ; pound loose ; cigarette - case ; wristwatch ; photo . Let 's see it . "[1189-the searcher]

[The searcher]1189-the searcher placed the photo in the pool of light . The tiny face of [a girl]1193-a girl stared up at [them]1187-stretcher - bearers , unmoved , from its short hair .

" [Noel]197-noel , "[1189-the searcher] said [the searcher]1189-the searcher , reading .

" H'm ! Take care of it . Stick it in [his]197-noel case . Come on ! "[1189-the searcher]

The pool of light dissolved , and darkness for ever covered Cyril [Morland]133-cyril .

II

When [those four]1195-those four took [their]1195-those four seats in [the Grand Circle at [Queen 's Hall]56-queen 's hall]1196-the grand circle at queen 's hall the programme was already at the second number , which , in spite of all the efforts of patriotism , was of German origin - a Brandenburg concerto by [Bach]204-bach . More curious still , it was encored . [Pierson]122-pierson did not applaud , [he]122-pierson was too far gone in pleasure , and sat with a rapt smile on [his]122-pierson face , oblivious of [his]122-pierson surroundings . [He]122-pierson remained thus removed from mortal joys and sorrows till the last applause had died away , and [Leila]183-leila 's voice said in [his]122-pierson ear :

" Is n't it [a wonderful audience]3502-a wonderful audience , [Edward]122-pierson ? Look at all that khaki . Who 'd have thought [those young men]3503-those young men cared for music - good music - German music , too ? "[183-leila]

[Pierson]122-pierson looked down at [the patient mass of standing figures in straw hats and military caps , with faces turned all one way]1197-the patient mass of standing figures in straw hats and military caps , with faces turned all one way , and sighed .

" [I]183-leila wish [I]183-leila could get an audience like that in [[my]183-leila church]3504-my church . "[183-leila]

A smile crept out at the corner of [Leila]183-leila 's lips . [She]183-leila was thinking : ' Ah ! [[Your]122-pierson Church]3363-your church is out of date , [[my]0-i dear]3031-my dear , and so are [you]122-pierson ! [[Your]122-pierson Church]3363-your church , with [its]3363-your church smell of mould and incense , [its]3363-your church stained - glass , and narrowed length and droning organ . [Poor [Edward]122-pierson]1201-poor edward , so out of [the world]606-the world ! ' But [she]183-leila only pressed [his]122-pierson arm , and whispered :

" Look at [Noel]197-noel ! "[183-leila]

[The girl]525-the girl was talking to [Jimmy Fort]175-jimmy . [Her]525-the girl cheeks were gushed , and [she]525-the girl looked prettier than [Pierson]122-pierson had seen [her]525-the girl look for a long time now , ever since [Kestrel]199-kestrel , indeed . [He]122-pierson heard [Leila]183-leila sigh .

" Does [she]183-leila get news of [[her]183-leila boy]869-her boy ? Do [you]122-pierson remember that May Week , [Edward]122-pierson ? [We]3506-we were very young then ; even [you]122-pierson were young . That was such a pretty little letter [you]122-pierson wrote [me]183-leila . [I]183-leila can see [you]122-pierson still - wandering in [your]122-pierson dress clothes along [the river]417-the river , among the ' holy ' cows . "[183-leila]

But [her]183-leila eyes slid round again , watching [[her]183-leila other neighbour]1204-her other neighbour and [the girl]525-the girl . [A violinist]1206-a violinist had begun to play the [Cesar Franck Sonata]205-cesar franck sonata . It was [Pierson]122-pierson 's favourite piece of music , bringing [him]122-pierson , as it were , a view of [heaven]500-heaven , of devotional blue air where devout stars were shining in a sunlit noon , above ecstatic trees and waters where ecstatic swans were swimming .

" [Queer world]3508-queer world , [Mr. Pierson]156-pierson ! Fancy [those boys]3509-those boys having to go back to barrack life after listening to that ! What 's [your]122-pierson feeling ? Are [we]3510-we moving back to [the apes]3511-the apes ? Did [we]3510-we touch top note with that Sonata ? "[197-noel]

[Pierson]156-pierson turned and contemplated [his]156-pierson questioner shrewdly .

" No , [Captain Fort]197-noel , [I]156-pierson do not think [we]3510-we are moving back to the apes ; if [we]3510-we ever came from [them]3511-the apes . [Those boys]3509-those boys have the souls of [heroes]3513-heroes ! "[156-pierson]

" [I]156-pierson know that , [sir]3028-sir , perhaps better than [you]3028-sir do . "[156-pierson]

" Ah ! yes , "[156-pierson] said [Pierson]156-pierson humbly , " [I]156-pierson forgot , of course . "[156-pierson] But [he]156-pierson still looked at [[his]156-pierson neighbour]1208-his neighbour doubtfully . [This Captain Fort]197-noel , who was [a friend of [Leila]183-leila 's , and who had twice been to see [them]1210-them]1209-a friend of leila 's , and who had twice been to see them , puzzled [him]156-pierson . [He]197-noel had a frank face , a frank voice , but queer opinions , or so it seemed to , [Pierson]156-pierson - little bits of [Moslemism]206-moslemism , little bits of [the backwoods]1211-the backwoods , and the veldt ; queer unexpected cynicisms , all sorts of side views on [England]29-england had lodged in [him]197-noel , and [he]197-noel did not hide them . They came from [him]197-noel like bullets , in that frank voice , and drilled little holes in [the listener]1212-the listener . Those critical sayings flew so much more poignantly from one who had been through the same educational mill as [himself]197-noel , than if they had merely come from [some rough diamond]1213-some rough diamond , [some artist]1214-some artist , [some foreigner]1215-some foreigner , even from [a doctor like [George]140-george]1216-a doctor like george . And they always made [him]197-noel uncomfortable , like the touch of a prickly leaf ; they did not amuse [him]197-noel . Certainly [Edward Pierson]122-pierson shrank from the rough touches of a knock - about philosophy . After all , it was but natural that [he]122-pierson should .

[He]122-pierson and [Noel]197-noel left after the first part of the concert , parting from [the other two at the door]1217-the other two at the door . [He]122-pierson slipped [his]122-pierson hand through [her]1218-her arm ; and , following out those thoughts of [his]122-pierson in [the concert - hall]1219-the concert - hall , asked :

" Do [you]1218-her like [Captain Fort]197-noel , [Nollie]131-nollie ? "[122-pierson]

" Yes ; [he]197-noel 's [a nice man]3454-a nice man . "[197-noel]

" [He]197-noel seems [a nice man]3454-a nice man , certainly ; [he]197-noel has a nice smile , but strange views , [I]122-pierson 'm afraid . "[122-pierson]

" [He]197-noel thinks [the Germans]3517-the germans are not much worse than [we]3518-we are ; [he]197-noel says that [a good many of [us]3518-we]3519-a good many of us are [bullies]3520-bullies too . "[197-noel]

" Yes , that is the sort of thing [I]122-pierson mean . "[122-pierson]

" But are [we]3518-we , [Daddy]132-daddy ? "[197-noel]

" Surely not . "[122-pierson]

" [A policeman [I]197-noel talked to]3521-a policeman i talked to once said the same . [Captain Fort]197-noel says that [very few men]3522-very few men can stand having power put into [their]3522-very few men hands without being spoiled . [He]197-noel told [me]197-noel some dreadful stories . [He]197-noel says [we]3518-we have no imagination , so that [we]3518-we often do things without seeing how brutal they are . "[197-noel]

" [We]3518-we 're not perfect , [Nollie]131-nollie ; but on the whole [I]122-pierson think [we]3518-we 're [a kind people]3523-a kind people . "[122-pierson]

[Noel]197-noel was silent a moment , then said suddenly :

" [Kind people]3524-kind people often think [others]395-others are kind too , when [they]3524-kind people really are n't . [Captain Fort]197-noel does n't make that mistake . "[197-noel]

" [I]122-pierson think [he]197-noel 's a little cynical , and a little dangerous . "[122-pierson]

" Are [all people dangerous who do n't think like [others]395-others]3526-all people dangerous who do n't think like others , [Daddy]132-daddy ? "[197-noel]

[Pierson]122-pierson , incapable of mockery , was not incapable of seeing when [he]122-pierson was being mocked . [He]122-pierson looked at [[his]122-pierson daughter]356-his daughter with a smile .

" Not quite so bad as that , [Nollie]131-nollie ; but [Mr. Fort]176-dear mr . fort is certainly subversive . [I]122-pierson think perhaps [he]197-noel has seen too many queer sides of life . "[122-pierson]

" [I]122-pierson like [him]197-noel the better for that . "[122-pierson]

" Well , well , "[122-pierson] [Pierson]122-pierson answered absently . [He]122-pierson had work to do in preparation for a Confirmation Class , and sought [his]122-pierson study on getting in .

[Noel]197-noel went to [the dining - room]1221-the dining - room to drink [her]356-his daughter hot milk . The curtains were not drawn , and bright moonlight was coming in . Without lighting up , [she]356-his daughter set the etna going , and stood looking at the moon - full for the second time since [she]356-his daughter and [Cyril]133-cyril had waited for it in [the Abbey]57-the abbey . And pressing [her]356-his daughter hands to [her]356-his daughter breast , [she]356-his daughter shivered . If only [she]356-his daughter could summon [him]122-pierson from the moonlight out there ; if only [she]356-his daughter were [a witch]1222-a witch - could see [him]122-pierson , know where [he]122-pierson was , what doing ! For a fortnight now [she]356-his daughter had received no letter . Every day since [he]122-pierson had left [she]356-his daughter had read the casualty lists , with the superstitious feeling that to do so would keep [him]122-pierson out of [them]1223-them . [She]356-his daughter took up the Times . There was just enough light , and [she]356-his daughter read the roll of honour - till the moon shone in on [her]356-his daughter , lying on the floor , with the dropped journal ....

But [she]356-his daughter was proud , and soon took grief to [[her]356-his daughter room]694-her room , as on that night after [he]122-pierson left [her]356-his daughter , [she]356-his daughter had taken love . No sign betrayed to [the house]538-the house [her]356-his daughter disaster ; the journal on the floor , and the smell of the burnt milk which had boiled over , revealed nothing . After all , [she]356-his daughter was but [one of a thousand hearts which spent that moonlit night in agony]1226-one of a thousand hearts which spent that moonlit night in agony . Each night , year in , year out , a thousand faces were buried in pillows to smother that first awful sense of desolation , and grope for the secret spirit - place where [bereaved souls]1227-bereaved souls go , to receive some feeble touch of healing from knowledge of [each other]493-each other 's trouble ....

In the morning [she]356-his daughter got up from [her]356-his daughter sleepless bed , seemed to eat [her]356-his daughter breakfast , and went off to [[her]356-his daughter hospital]3051-her hospital . There [she]356-his daughter washed up plates and dishes , with a stony face , dark under the eyes .

The news came to [Pierson]122-pierson in a letter from [Thirza]137-thirza , received at lunch - time . [He]122-pierson read it with a dreadful aching . [Poor , poor little [Nollie]131-nollie]1230-poor , poor little nollie ! What an awful trouble for [her]131-nollie ! And [he]122-pierson , too , went about [his]122-pierson work with the nightmare thought that [he]122-pierson had to break the news to [her]131-nollie that evening . Never had [he]122-pierson felt more lonely , more dreadfully in want of [the mother of [[his]122-pierson children]1232-his children]1231-the mother of his children . [She]131-nollie would have known how to soothe , how to comfort . On [her]131-nollie heart [the child]977-the child could have sobbed away grief . And all that hour , from seven to eight , when [he]122-pierson was usually in readiness to fulfil the functions of [God]143-god 's substitute to [[his]122-pierson parishioners]1234-his parishioners , [he]122-pierson spent in prayer of [his]122-pierson own , for guidance how to inflict and heal this blow . When , at last , [Noel]197-noel came , [he]197-noel opened the door to [her]131-nollie [himself]197-noel , and , putting back the hair from [her]131-nollie forehead , said : " Come in [here]3149-here a moment , [[my]197-noel darling]3170-my darling ! "[197-noel] [Noel]197-noel followed [him]197-noel into [the study]1235-the study , and sat down . " [I]197-noel know already , [Daddy]132-daddy . "[197-noel] [Pierson]137-thirza was more dismayed by this stoicism than [he]122-pierson would have been by any natural out burst . [He]122-pierson stood , timidly stroking [her]131-nollie hair , murmuring to [her]131-nollie what [he]122-pierson had said to [Gratian]127-gratian , and to [so many others]1236-so many others in these days : " There is no death ; look forward to seeing [him]122-pierson again ; [God]143-god is merciful "[122-pierson] And [he]122-pierson marvelled at the calmness of that pale face - so young .

" [You]131-nollie are very brave , [[my]122-pierson child]3086-my child ! "[122-pierson] [he]122-pierson said .

" There 's nothing else to be , is there ? "[122-pierson]

" Is n't there anything [I]122-pierson can do for [you]131-nollie , [Nollie]131-nollie ? "[122-pierson]

" No , [Daddy]132-daddy . "[122-pierson]

" When did [you]122-pierson see it ? "[122-pierson]

" Last night . "[131-nollie] [She]131-nollie had already known for twenty - four hours without telling [him]122-pierson !

" Have [you]131-nollie prayed , [[my]122-pierson darling]3170-my darling ? "[122-pierson]

" No . "[122-pierson]

" Try , [Nollie]131-nollie ! "[122-pierson]

" No . "[122-pierson]

" Ah , try ! "[122-pierson]

" It would be ridiculous , [Daddy]132-daddy ; [you]132-daddy do n't know . "[122-pierson]

Grievously upset and bewildered , [Pierson]137-thirza moved away from [her]131-nollie , and said :

" [You]131-nollie look dreadfully tired . Would [you]131-nollie like a hot bath , and [your]131-nollie dinner in bed ? "[137-thirza]

" [I]131-nollie 'd like some tea ; that 's all . "[131-nollie] And [she]131-nollie went out .

When [he]122-pierson had seen that the tea had gone up to [her]131-nollie , [he]122-pierson too went out ; and , moved by a longing for [woman]1237-woman 's help , took [a cab]1238-a cab to [[Leila]183-leila 's flat]1239-leila 's flat .

[III]150-pierson

On leaving [the concert]1240-the concert [Leila]183-leila and [Jimmy Fort]175-jimmy had secured [a taxi]3238-a taxi ; [a vehicle]1242-a vehicle which , at night , in wartime , has certain advantages for [those who desire to become better acquainted]1243-those who desire to become better acquainted . Vibration , sufficient noise , darkness , are guaranteed ; and all that is lacking for the furtherance of emotion is the scent of honeysuckle and roses , or even of the white flowering creeper which on the stoep at [High Constantia]41-high constantia had smelled so much sweeter than petrol .

When [Leila]183-leila found [herself]183-leila with [Fort]175-jimmy in that loneliness to which [she]183-leila had been looking forward , [she]183-leila was overcome by an access of nervous silence . [She]183-leila had been passing through a strange time for weeks past . Every night [she]183-leila examined [her]183-leila sensations without quite understanding them as yet . When [a woman]3280-a woman comes to [her]3280-a woman age , [the world - force]1245-the world - force is liable to take possession , saying :

" [You]183-leila were young , [you]183-leila were beautiful , [you]183-leila still have beauty , [you]183-leila are not , can not be , old . Cling to youth , cling to beauty ; take all [you]183-leila can get , before [your]183-leila face gets lines and [your]183-leila hair grey ; it is impossible that [you]183-leila have been loved for the last time . "[1245-the world - force]

To see [Jimmy Fort]175-jimmy at the concert , talking to [Noel]197-noel , had brought this emotion to a head . [She]183-leila was not of a grudging nature , and could genuinely admire [Noel]197-noel , but the idea that [Jimmy Fort]175-jimmy might also admire disturbed [her]183-leila greatly . [He]175-jimmy must not ; it was not fair ; [he]175-jimmy was too old - besides , [the girl]525-the girl had [[her]525-the girl boy]869-her boy ; and [she]183-leila had taken care that [he]175-jimmy should know it . So , leaning towards [him]175-jimmy , while [a bare - shouldered young lady]1248-a bare - shouldered young lady sang , [she]183-leila had whispered :

" [Penny]207-penny ? "[183-leila]

And [he]175-jimmy had whispered back :

" Tell [you]183-leila afterwards . "[175-jimmy]

That had comforted [her]183-leila . [She]183-leila would make [him]175-jimmy take [her]183-leila [home]3048-home . It was time [she]183-leila showed [her]183-leila heart .

And now , in [the cab]564-the cab , resolved to make [her]183-leila feelings known , in sudden shyness [she]183-leila found it very difficult . Love , to which for quite three years [she]183-leila had been [a stranger]1251-a stranger , was come to life within [her]183-leila . The knowledge was at once so sweet , and so disturbing , that [she]183-leila sat with face averted , unable to turn the precious minutes to account . [They]1252-they arrived at [the flat]1055-the flat without having done more than agree that [the streets]3240-the streets were dark , and the moon bright . [She]183-leila got out with a sense of bewilderment , and said rather desperately :

" [You]175-jimmy must come up and have a cigarette . It 's quite early , still . "[183-leila]

[He]175-jimmy went up .

" Wait just a minute , "[183-leila] said [Leila]183-leila .

Sitting there with [his]175-jimmy drink and [his]175-jimmy cigarette , [he]175-jimmy stared at some sunflowers in a bowl - [Famille Rose]59-famille rose - and waited just ten ; smiling a little , recalling the nose of [the fairy princess]1255-the fairy princess , and the dainty way [her]1255-the fairy princess lips shaped the words [she]1255-the fairy princess spoke . If [she]183-leila had not had [that lucky young devil of [a soldier boy]1257-a soldier boy]1256-that lucky young devil of a soldier boy , [one]424-one would have wanted to buckle [her]183-leila shoes , lay [one]424-one 's coat in the mud for [her]183-leila , or whatever they did in fairytales . [One]424-one would have wanted - ah ! what would one not have wanted ! Hang [that soldier boy]1261-that soldier boy ! [Leila]183-leila said [he]1261-that soldier boy was twenty - two . By [George]140-george ! how old it made [a man feel who was rising forty , and tender on the off - fore]1262-a man feel who was rising forty , and tender on the off - fore ! No fairy princesses for [him]175-jimmy ! Then a whiff of perfume came to [his]175-jimmy nostrils ; and , looking up , [he]175-jimmy saw [Leila]183-leila standing before [him]175-jimmy , in a long garment of dark silk , whence [her]183-leila white arms peeped out .

" Another penny ? Do [you]175-jimmy remember these things , [Jimmy]175-jimmy ? [The Malay women]3532-the malay women used to wear them in [Cape Town]60-cape town . [You]175-jimmy ca n't think what a relief it is to get out of [[my]183-leila slave]3533-my slave 's dress . Oh ! [I]183-leila 'm so sick of nursing ! [Jimmy]175-jimmy , [I]183-leila want to live again a little ! "[183-leila]

The garment had taken fifteen years off [her]183-leila age , and a gardenia , just where the silk crossed on [her]183-leila breast , seemed no whiter than [her]183-leila skin . [He]175-jimmy wondered whimsically whether it had dropped to [her]183-leila out of the dark !

" Live ? "[175-jimmy] [he]175-jimmy said . " Why ! Do n't [you]183-leila always ? "[175-jimmy]

[She]183-leila raised [her]183-leila hands so that the dark silk fell , back from the whole length of those white arms .

" [I]183-leila have n't lived for two years . Oh , [Jimmy]175-jimmy ! Help [me]183-leila to live a little ! Life 's so short , now . "[183-leila]

[Her]183-leila eyes disturbed [him]175-jimmy , strained and pathetic ; the sight of [her]183-leila arms ; the scent of the flower disturbed [him]175-jimmy ; [he]175-jimmy felt [his]175-jimmy cheeks growing warm , and looked down .

[She]183-leila slipped suddenly forward on to [her]183-leila knees at [his]175-jimmy feet , took [his]175-jimmy hand , pressed it with both of [hers]183-leila , and murmured :

" Love [me]183-leila a little ! What else is there ? Oh ! [Jimmy]175-jimmy , what else is there ? "[183-leila]

And with the scent of the flower , crushed by [their]1263-their hands , stirring [his]175-jimmy senses , [Fort]175-jimmy thought : ' Ah , what else is there , in these forsaken days ? '

To [Jimmy Fort]175-jimmy , who had a sense of humour , and was in some sort [a philosopher]1264-a philosopher , the haphazard way life settled things seldom failed to seem amusing . But when [he]175-jimmy walked away from [Leila]183-leila 's [he]175-jimmy was pensive . [She]183-leila was [a good sort , a pretty creature]1265-a good sort , a pretty creature , [a sportswoman]1266-a sportswoman , [an enchantress]1267-an enchantress ; but - [she]183-leila was decidedly mature . And here [he]175-jimmy was - involved in helping [her]183-leila to " live "[183-leila] ; involved almost alarmingly , for there had been no mistaking the fact that [she]183-leila had really fallen in love with [him]175-jimmy .

This was flattering and sweet . Times were sad , and pleasure scarce , but - ! The roving instinct which had kept [him]175-jimmy , from [his]175-jimmy youth up , rolling about [the world]606-the world , shied instinctively at bonds , however pleasant , the strength and thickness of which [he]175-jimmy could not gauge ; or , was it that perhaps for the first time in [his]175-jimmy life [he]175-jimmy had been peeping into fairyland of late , and this affair with [Leila]183-leila was by no means fairyland ? [He]175-jimmy had another reason , more unconscious , for uneasiness . [His]175-jimmy heart , for all [his]175-jimmy wanderings , was soft , [he]175-jimmy had always found it difficult to hurt [anyone]3200-anyone , especially [anyone who did [him]175-jimmy the honour to love [him]175-jimmy]1270-anyone who did him the honour to love him . A sort of presentiment weighed on [him]175-jimmy while [he]175-jimmy walked [the moonlit streets]1271-the moonlit streets at this most empty hour , when even the late taxis had ceased to run . Would [she]183-leila want [him]175-jimmy to marry [her]183-leila ? Would it be [his]175-jimmy duty , if [she]183-leila did ? And then [he]175-jimmy found [himself]175-jimmy thinking of the concert , and [that girl]1272-that girl 's face , listening to the tales [he]175-jimmy was telling [her]183-leila . ' Deuced [queer world]3508-queer world , ' [he]175-jimmy thought , ' the way things go ! [I]0-i wonder what [she]183-leila would think of [us]1274-us , if [she]183-leila knew - and that good padre ! Phew ! '

[He]175-jimmy made such very slow progress , for fear of giving way in [his]175-jimmy leg , and having to spend the night on a door - step , that [he]175-jimmy had plenty of time for rumination ; but since it brought [him]175-jimmy no confidence whatever , [he]175-jimmy began at last to feel : ' Well ; it might be a lot worse . Take the goods [the gods]1275-the gods send [you]175-jimmy and do n't fuss ! ' And suddenly [he]175-jimmy remembered with extreme vividness that night on the stoep at [High Constantia]41-high constantia , and thought with dismay : ' [I]0-i could have plunged in over head and ears then ; and now - [I]0-i ca n't ! That 's life all over ! [Poor Leila]208-leila ! [Me]0-i miserum , too , perhaps - who knows ! '

IV

When [Leila]208-leila opened [her]208-leila door to [Edward Pierson]122-pierson , [her]208-leila eyes were smiling , and [her]208-leila lips were soft . [She]208-leila seemed to smile and be soft all over , and [she]208-leila took both [his]122-pierson hands . Everything was a pleasure to [her]208-leila that day , even the sight of this sad face . [She]208-leila was in love and was loved again ; had a present and a future once more , not only [her]208-leila own full past ; and [she]208-leila must finish with [Edward]122-pierson in half an hour , for [Jimmy]175-jimmy was coming . [She]208-leila sat down on the divan , took [his]122-pierson hand in a sisterly way , and said :

" Tell [me]208-leila , [Edward]122-pierson ; [I]208-leila can see [you]122-pierson 're in trouble . What is it ? "[208-leila]

" [Noel]197-noel . [The boy [she]208-leila was fond of]3534-the boy she was fond of has been killed . "[208-leila]

[She]208-leila dropped [his]122-pierson hand .

" Oh , no ! [Poor child]507-poor child ! It 's too cruel ! "[208-leila] Tears started up in [her]208-leila grey eyes , and [she]208-leila touched them with a tiny handkerchief . " Poor , [poor little Noel]197-noel ! Was [she]208-leila very fond of [him]3534-the boy she was fond of ? "[208-leila]

" A very sudden , short engagement ; but [I]208-leila 'm afraid [she]208-leila takes it desperately to heart . [I]208-leila do n't know how to comfort [her]208-leila ; [only a woman]3536-only a woman could . [I]208-leila came to ask [you]1276-you : Do [you]1276-you think [she]208-leila ought to go on with [her]208-leila work ? What do [you]1276-you think , [Leila]208-leila ? [I]208-leila feel lost ! "[208-leila]

[Leila]208-leila , gazing at [him]1276-you , thought : ' Lost ? Yes , [you]1276-you look lost , [[my]0-i poor [Edward]122-pierson]1277-my poor edward ! '

" [I]208-leila should let [her]208-leila go on , "[208-leila] [she]208-leila said : " it helps ; it 's the only thing that does help . [I]208-leila 'll see if [I]208-leila can get [them]3537-they to let [her]208-leila come into [the wards]3538-the wards . [She]208-leila ought to be in touch with suffering and [the men]3458-the men ; that kitchen work will try [her]208-leila awfully just now : Was [he]1276-you very young ? "[208-leila]

" Yes . [They]3537-they wanted to get married . [I]208-leila was opposed to it . "[208-leila]

[Leila]208-leila 's lip curled ever so little . ' [You]1276-you would be ! ' [she]208-leila thought .

" [I]208-leila could n't bear to think of [Nollie]131-nollie giving [herself]131-nollie hastily , like that ; [they]3537-they had only known [each other]493-each other three weeks . It was very hard for [me]208-leila , [Leila]208-leila . And then suddenly [he]1278-her cousin was sent to the front . "[208-leila]

[Resentment]209-resentment welled up in [Leila]208-leila . The kill - Joys ! As if life did n't kill joy fast enough ! [[Her]208-leila cousin]1278-her cousin 's face at that moment was almost abhorrent to [her]208-leila , its gentle perplexed goodness darkened and warped by that monkish look . [She]208-leila turned away , glanced at the clock over the hearth , and thought : ' Yes , and [he]1278-her cousin would stop [Jimmy]175-jimmy and [me]0-i ! [He]1278-her cousin would say : " Oh , no ! dear [Leila]208-leila - [you]208-leila must n't love - it 's sin ! "[1278-her cousin] How [I]0-i hate that word ! '

" [I]208-leila think the most dreadful thing in life , "[208-leila] [she]208-leila said abruptly , " is the way [people]3083-people suppress [their]3083-people natural instincts ; what [they]3083-people suppress in [themselves]3083-people [they]3083-people make [other people]3542-other people suppress too , if [they]3083-people can ; and that 's the cause of half the misery in [this world]3543-this world . "[208-leila]

Then at the surprise on [his]1278-her cousin face at this little outburst , whose cause [he]1278-her cousin could not know , [she]208-leila added hastily : " [I]208-leila hope [Noel]197-noel will get over it quickly , and find [someone else]3544-someone else . "[208-leila]

" Yes . If [they]3545-they had been married - how much worse it would have been . Thank [God]143-god , [they]3545-they were n't ! "[208-leila]

" [I]208-leila do n't know . [They]3545-they would have had an hour of bliss . Even an hour of bliss is worth something in these days . "[208-leila]

" To [those who only believe in this ' life]3546-those who only believe in this ' life - perhaps . "[208-leila]

' Ten minutes more ! ' [she]208-leila thought : ' Oh , why does n't [he]1278-her cousin go ? ' But at that very moment [he]1278-her cousin got up , and instantly [her]208-leila heart went out to [him]1278-her cousin again .

" [I]1278-her cousin 'm so sorry , [Edward]122-pierson . If [I]1278-her cousin can help in any way - [I]1278-her cousin 'll try [my]1278-her cousin best with [Noel]197-noel to - morrow ; and do come to [me]1278-her cousin whenever [you]1278-her cousin feel inclined . "[1278-her cousin]

[She]208-leila took [his]1278-her cousin hand in [hers]208-leila ; afraid that [he]1278-her cousin would sit down again , [she]208-leila yet could not help a soft glance into [his]1278-her cousin eyes , and a little rush of pitying warmth in the pressure of [her]208-leila hand .

[Pierson]122-pierson smiled ; the smile which always made [her]208-leila sorry for [him]1278-her cousin .

" Good - bye , [Leila]208-leila ; [you]208-leila 're very good and kind to [me]122-pierson . Good - bye . "[122-pierson]

[Her]208-leila bosom swelled with relief and compassion ; and - [she]208-leila let [him]1278-her cousin out .

Running [upstairs]1153-upstairs again [she]208-leila thought : ' [I]0-i 've just time . What shall [I]0-i put on ? [Poor Edward]122-pierson , poor [Noel]197-noel ! What colour does [Jimmy]175-jimmy like ? Oh ! Why did n't [I]0-i keep [him]175-jimmy those ten years ago - what utter waste ! ' And , feverishly adorning [herself]208-leila , [she]208-leila came back to the window , and stood there in the dark to watch , while some jasmine which grew below sent up its scent to [her]208-leila . ' Would [I]0-i marry [him]1278-her cousin ? ' [she]208-leila thought , ' if [he]1278-her cousin asked [me]0-i ? But [he]1278-her cousin wo n't ask [me]0-i - why should [he]1278-her cousin now ? Besides , [I]0-i could n't bear [him]1278-her cousin to feel [I]0-i wanted position or money from [him]1278-her cousin . [I]0-i only want love - love - love ! ' The silent repetition of that word gave [her]208-leila a wonderful sense of solidity and comfort . So long as [she]208-leila only wanted love , surely [he]1278-her cousin would give it .

[A tall figure]1280-a tall figure turned down past [the church]372-the church , coming towards [her]208-leila . It was [he]1278-her cousin ! And suddenly [she]208-leila bethought [herself]208-leila . [She]208-leila went to the little black piano , sat down , and began to sing the song [she]208-leila had sung to [him]1278-her cousin ten years ago : " If [I]208-leila could be the falling dew and fall on [thee]1278-her cousin all day ! "[208-leila] [She]208-leila did not even look round when [he]1278-her cousin came in , but continued to croon out the words , conscious of [him]1278-her cousin just behind [her]208-leila shoulder in the dark . But when [she]208-leila had finished , [she]208-leila got up and threw [her]208-leila arms round [him]1278-her cousin , strained [him]1278-her cousin to [her]208-leila , and burst into tears on [his]1278-her cousin shoulder ; thinking of [Noel]197-noel and [that dead boy]1282-that dead boy , thinking of [the millions of [other boys]1284-other boys]1283-the millions of other boys , thinking of [her]208-leila own happiness , thinking of those ten years wasted , of how short was life , and love ; thinking - hardly knowing what [she]208-leila thought ! And [Jimmy Fort]175-jimmy , very moved by this emotion which [he]175-jimmy only half understood , pressed [her]208-leila tightly in [his]175-jimmy arms , and kissed [her]208-leila wet cheeks and [her]208-leila neck , pale and warm in the darkness .

V

1

[Noel]197-noel went on with [her]208-leila work for a month , and then , one morning , fainted over a pile of dishes . The noise attracted attention , and [Mrs. Lynch]190-mrs. lynch was summoned .

The sight of [her]208-leila lying there so deadly white taxed [Leila]208-leila 's nerves severely . But [the girl]525-the girl revived quickly , and [a cab]1238-a cab was sent for . [Leila]208-leila went with [her]525-the girl , and told [the driver]996-the driver to stop at [Camelot Mansions]38-camelot mansions . Why take [her]208-leila [home]3048-home in this state , why not save the jolting , and let [her]208-leila recover properly ? [They]1289-they went [upstairs]1153-upstairs arm in arm . [Leila]208-leila made [her]208-leila lie down on the divan , and put a hot - water bottle to [her]208-leila feet . [Noel]197-noel was still so passive and pale that even to speak to [her]208-leila seemed a cruelty . And , going to [her]208-leila little sideboard , [Leila]208-leila stealthily extracted a pint bottle of some champagne which [Jimmy Fort]175-jimmy had sent in , and took it with two glasses and a corkscrew into [[her]208-leila bedroom]1291-her bedroom . [She]208-leila drank a little [herself]208-leila , and came out bearing a glass to [the girl]525-the girl . [Noel]197-noel shook [her]208-leila head , and [her]208-leila eyes seemed to say : " Do [you]175-jimmy really think [I]197-noel 'm so easily mended ? "[197-noel] But [Leila]208-leila had been through too much in [her]208-leila time to despise earthly remedies , and [she]208-leila held it to [the girl]525-the girl 's lips until [she]208-leila drank . It was excellent champagne , and , since [Noel]197-noel had never yet touched alcohol , had an instantaneous effect . [Her]208-leila eyes brightened ; little red spots came up in [her]208-leila cheeks . And suddenly [she]208-leila rolled over and buried [her]208-leila face deep in a cushion . With [her]208-leila short hair , [she]208-leila looked so like [a child lying there]1294-a child lying there , that [Leila]208-leila knelt down , stroking [her]525-the girl head , and saying : " There , there ; [my]208-leila love ! There , there ! "[208-leila]

At last [the girl]525-the girl raised [herself]525-the girl ; now that the pallid , masklike despair of the last month was broken , [she]208-leila seemed on fire , and [her]208-leila face had a wild look . [She]525-the girl withdrew [herself]525-the girl from [Leila]208-leila 's touch , and , crossing [her]525-the girl arms tightly across [her]525-the girl chest , said :

" [I]525-the girl ca n't bear it ; [I]525-the girl ca n't sleep . [I]525-the girl want [him]3547-him back ; [I]525-the girl hate life - [I]525-the girl hate [the world]606-the world . [We]3549-we had n't done anything - only just loved [each other]493-each other . [God]143-god likes punishing ; just because [we]3549-we loved [each other]493-each other ; [we]3549-we had only one day to love [each other]493-each other - only one day - only one ! "[525-the girl]

[Leila]208-leila could see the long white throat above those rigid arms straining and swallowing ; it gave [her]208-leila a choky feeling to watch it . The voice , uncannily dainty for all the wildness of the words and face , went on :

" [I]197-noel wo n't - [I]197-noel do n't want to live . If there 's another life , [I]197-noel shall go to [him]3553-him . And if there is n't - it 's just sleep . "[197-noel]

[Leila]208-leila put out [her]208-leila hand to ward of these wild wanderings . Like [most women who live simply the life of [their]1296-most women who live simply the life of their senses and emotions senses and emotions]1296-most women who live simply the life of their senses and emotions , [she]208-leila was orthodox ; or rather never speculated on such things .

" Tell [me]208-leila about [yourself]197-noel and [him]3553-him , "[208-leila] [she]208-leila said .

[Noel]197-noel fastened [her]208-leila great eyes on [[her]208-leila cousin]1278-her cousin . " [We]3554-we loved [each other]493-each other ; and [children]878-children are born , are n't [they]878-children , after [you]197-noel 've loved ? But [mine]208-leila wo n't be ! "[197-noel] From the look on [her]208-leila face rather than from [her]208-leila words , the full reality of [her]208-leila meaning came to [Leila]208-leila , vanished , came again . Nonsense ! But - what an awful thing , if true ! That which had always seemed to [her]208-leila such an exaggerated occurrence in the common walks of life - why ! now , it was a tragedy ! Instinctively [she]208-leila raised [herself]208-leila and put [her]208-leila arms round [the girl]525-the girl .

" [[My]208-leila poor dear]3557-my poor dear ! "[208-leila] [she]208-leila said ; " [you]525-the girl 're fancying things ! "[208-leila]

The colour had faded out of [Noel]197-noel 's face , and , with [her]208-leila head thrown back and [her]208-leila eyelids half - closed , [she]208-leila looked like [a scornful young ghost]1299-a scornful young ghost .

" If it is - [I]208-leila sha n't live . [I]208-leila do n't mean to - it 's easy to die . [I]208-leila do n't mean [Daddy]132-daddy to know . "[208-leila]

" Oh ! [[my]208-leila dear]3031-my dear , [[my]208-leila dear]3031-my dear ! "[208-leila] was all [Leila]208-leila could stammer .

" Was it wrong , [Leila]208-leila ? "[525-the girl]

" Wrong ? [I]208-leila do n't know - wrong ? If it really is so - it was - unfortunate . But surely , surely - [you]208-leila 're mistaken ? "[208-leila]

[Noel]197-noel shook [her]208-leila head . " [I]197-noel did it so that [we]3560-we should belong to [each other]493-each other . Nothing could have taken [him]132-daddy from [me]197-noel . "[197-noel]

[Leila]208-leila caught at [the girl]525-the girl 's words .

" Then , [[my]525-the girl dear]3031-my dear - [he]132-daddy has n't quite gone from [you]3031-my dear , [you]3031-my dear see ? "[525-the girl]

[Noel]197-noel 's lips formed a " No "[525-the girl] which was inaudible . " But [Daddy]132-daddy ! "[208-leila] [she]208-leila whispered .

[Edward]122-pierson 's face came before [Leila]208-leila so vividly that [she]208-leila could hardly see [the girl]525-the girl for the tortured shape of it . Then the hedonist in [her]208-leila revolted against that ascetic vision . [Her]208-leila worldly judgment condemned and deplored this calamity , [her]208-leila instinct could not help applauding that hour of life and love , snatched out of the jaws of death . " Need [he]132-daddy ever know ? "[208-leila] [she]208-leila said .

" [I]208-leila could never lie to [Daddy]132-daddy . But it does n't matter . Why should one go on living , when life is rotten ? "[208-leila]

Outside the sun was shining brightly , though it was late October . [Leila]208-leila got up from [her]208-leila knees . [She]208-leila stood at the window thinking hard .

" [[My]208-leila dear]3031-my dear , "[208-leila] [she]208-leila said at last , " [you]3031-my dear must n't get morbid . Look at [me]208-leila ! [I]208-leila 've had [two husbands]3564-two husbands , and - and - well , a pretty stormy up and down time of it ; and [I]208-leila daresay [I]208-leila 've got lots of trouble before [me]208-leila . But [I]208-leila 'm not going to cave in . Nor must [you]3031-my dear . [The Piersons]3565-the piersons have plenty of pluck ; [you]3031-my dear must n't be [a traitor to [your]3031-my dear blood]3566-a traitor to your blood . That 's the last thing . [[Your]3031-my dear boy]3567-your boy would have told [you]3031-my dear to stick it . These are [your]3031-my dear ' trenches , ' and [you]3031-my dear 're not going to be downed , are [you]3031-my dear ? "[208-leila]

After [she]208-leila had spoken there was a long silence , before [Noel]197-noel said :

" Give [me]197-noel a cigarette , [Leila]208-leila . "[197-noel]

[Leila]208-leila produced the little flat case [she]208-leila carried .

" That 's brave , "[208-leila] [she]208-leila said . " Nothing 's incurable at [your]208-leila age . Only one thing 's incurable - getting old . "[208-leila]

[Noel]197-noel laughed . " That 's curable too , is n't it ? "[197-noel]

" Not without surrender . "[197-noel]

Again there was a silence , while the blue fume from two cigarettes fast - smoked , rose towards the low ceiling . Then [Noel]197-noel got up from [the divan]1302-the divan , and went over to the piano . [She]208-leila was still in [her]208-leila hospital dress of lilac - coloured linen , and while [she]208-leila stood there touching the keys , playing a chord now , and then , [Leila]208-leila 's heart felt hollow from compassion ; [she]208-leila was so happy [herself]208-leila just now , and [this child]1090-this child so very wretched !

" Play to [me]208-leila , "[208-leila] [she]208-leila said ; " no - do n't ; [I]208-leila 'll play to [you]208-leila . "[208-leila] And sitting down , [she]208-leila began to play and sing a little French song , whose first line ran : " Si on est jolie , jolie comme vous . "[208-leila] It was soft , gay , charming . If [the girl]525-the girl cried , so much the better . But [Noel]197-noel did not cry . [She]208-leila seemed suddenly to have recovered all [her]208-leila self - possession . [She]208-leila spoke calmly , answered [Leila]208-leila 's questions without emotion , and said [she]208-leila would go [home]3048-home . [Leila]208-leila went out with [her]208-leila , and walked some way in the direction of [[her]208-leila home]1306-her home ; distressed , but frankly at a loss . At the bottom of [Portland Place]50-portland place [Noel]197-noel stopped and said : " [I]197-noel 'm quite all right now , [Leila]208-leila ; thank [you]208-leila awfully . [I]197-noel shall just go [home]3048-home and lie down . And [I]197-noel shall come to - morrow , the same as usual . Goodbye ! "[197-noel] [Leila]208-leila could only grasp [the girl]525-the girl 's hand , and say : " [[My]208-leila dear]3031-my dear , that 's splendid . There 's many a slip - besides , it 's war - time . "[208-leila]

With that saying , enigmatic even to [herself]208-leila , [she]208-leila watched [the girl]525-the girl moving slowly away ; and turned back [herself]208-leila towards [[her]208-leila hospital]3051-her hospital , with a disturbed and compassionate heart .

2

But [Noel]197-noel did not go east ; [she]208-leila walked down [Regent Street]61-regent street . [She]208-leila had received a certain measure of comfort , been steadied by [[her]208-leila experienced cousin]1310-her experienced cousin 's vitality , and the new thoughts suggested by those words : " [He]1310-her experienced cousin has n't quite gone from [you]208-leila , has [he]1310-her experienced cousin ? "[208-leila] " Besides , it 's war - time . "[208-leila] [Leila]208-leila had spoken freely , too , and the physical ignorance in which [the girl]525-the girl had been groping these last weeks was now removed . Like most proud natures , [she]208-leila did not naturally think much about the opinion of [other people]3542-other people ; besides , [she]208-leila knew nothing of [the world]606-the world , its feelings and judgments . [Her]208-leila nightmare was the thought of [[her]208-leila father]384-her father 's horror and grief . [She]208-leila tried to lessen that nightmare by remembering [his]384-her father opposition to [her]208-leila marriage , and the resentment [she]208-leila had felt . [He]384-her father had never realised , never understood , how [she]208-leila and [Cyril]133-cyril loved . Now , if [she]208-leila were really going to have [a child]415-a child , it would be [[Cyril]133-cyril 's - [[Cyril]133-cyril 's son]1317-cyril 's son]1316-cyril 's - cyril 's son - [Cyril]133-cyril over again . The instinct stronger than reason , refinement , tradition , upbringing , which had pushed [her]208-leila on in such haste to make sure of union - the irrepressible pulse of life faced with annihilation - seemed to revive within [her]208-leila , and make [her]208-leila terrible secret almost precious . [She]208-leila had read about " [War babies]3570-war babies "[208-leila] in the papers , read with a dull curiosity ; but now the atmosphere , as it were , of those writings was illumined for [her]208-leila . [These babies]1318-these babies were wrong , were a " problem , "[208-leila] and yet , behind all that , [she]208-leila seemed now to know that [people]3083-people were glad of [them]1318-these babies ; [they]3083-people made up , [they]3083-people filled the gaps . Perhaps , when [she]208-leila had one , [she]208-leila would be proud , secretly proud , in spite of [everyone]3072-everyone , in spite of [[her]208-leila father]384-her father ! [They]3083-people had tried to kill [Cyril]133-cyril - [God]143-god and [everyone]3072-everyone ; but [they]3083-people had n't been able , [he]133-cyril was alive within [her]208-leila !
