A glow came into [her]208-leila face , walking among [the busy shopping crowd]1323-the busy shopping crowd , and [people]3083-people turned to look at [her]208-leila ; [she]208-leila had that appearance of seeing [no one]3081-no one , nothing , which is strange and attractive to those who have a moment to spare from contemplation of [their]3083-people own affairs . Fully two hours [she]208-leila wandered thus , before going in , and only lost that exalted feeling when , in [[her]208-leila own little room]1326-her own little room , [she]208-leila had taken up [his]384-her father photograph , and was sitting on [her]208-leila bed gazing at it . [She]208-leila had a bad breakdown then . Locked in [there]3137-there , [she]208-leila lay on [her]208-leila bed , crying , dreadfully lonely , till [she]208-leila fell asleep exhausted , with the tear - stained photograph clutched in [her]208-leila twitching fingers . [She]208-leila woke with a start . It was dark , and [someone]502-someone was knocking on [her]208-leila door .

" [Miss Noel]197-noel ! "[502-someone]

Childish perversity kept [her]208-leila silent . Why could n't [they]502-someone leave [her]208-leila alone ? [They]502-someone would leave [her]208-leila alone if [they]502-someone knew . Then [she]208-leila heard another kind of knocking , and [[her]208-leila father]384-her father 's voice :

" [Nollie]131-nollie ! [Nollie]131-nollie ! "[384-her father]

[She]208-leila scrambled up , and opened . [He]384-her father looked scared , and [her]208-leila heart smote [her]208-leila .

" It 's all right , [Daddy]132-daddy ; [I]384-her father was asleep . "[384-her father]

" [[My]384-her father dear]3031-my dear , [I]384-her father 'm sorry , but dinner 's ready . "[384-her father]

" [I]384-her father do n't want any dinner ; [I]384-her father think [I]384-her father 'll go to bed . "[384-her father]

The frown between [his]384-her father brows deepened .

" [You]3031-my dear should n't lock [your]3031-my dear door , [Nollie]131-nollie : [I]384-her father was quite frightened . [I]384-her father went round to [the hospital]1022-the hospital to bring [you]3031-my dear [home]3048-home , and [they]1022-the hospital told [me]384-her father about [your]3031-my dear fainting . [I]384-her father want [you]3031-my dear to see [a doctor]3574-a doctor . "[384-her father]

[Noel]197-noel shook [her]1330-her head vigorously . " Oh , no ! It 's nothing ! "[197-noel]

" Nothing ? To faint like that ? Come , [[my]384-her father child]3086-my child . To please [me]384-her father . "[384-her father] [He]384-her father took [her]1330-her face in [his]384-her father hands . [Noel]197-noel shrank away .

" No , [Daddy]132-daddy . [I]384-her father wo n't see [a doctor]3574-a doctor . Extravagance in wartime ! [I]384-her father wo n't . It 's no good trying to make [me]384-her father . [I]384-her father 'll come down if [you]132-daddy like ; [I]384-her father shall be all right to - morrow . "[384-her father]

With this [Pierson]122-pierson had to be content ; but , often that evening , [she]1330-her saw [him]384-her father looking at [her]1330-her anxiously . And when [she]1330-her went up , [he]384-her father came out of [[his]384-her father study]1331-his study , followed to [[her]1330-her room]694-her room , and insisted on lighting [her]1330-her fire . Kissing [her]1330-her at the door , [he]384-her father said very quietly :

" [I]384-her father wish [I]384-her father could be [a mother to [you]1330-her]3577-a mother to you , [[my]384-her father child]3086-my child ! "[384-her father]

For a moment it flashed through [Noel]197-noel : ' [He]384-her father knows ! ' then , by the puzzled look on [his]384-her father face , [she]1330-her knew that [he]384-her father did not . If only [he]384-her father did know ; what a weight it would be off [her]1330-her mind ! But [she]1330-her answered quietly too ; " Good night , [[Daddy]132-daddy dear]3579-daddy dear ! "[1330-her] kissed [him]384-her father , and shut the door .

[She]1330-her sat down before the little new fire , and spread [her]1330-her hands out to it ; all was so cold and wintry in [her]1330-her heart . And the firelight flickered on [her]1330-her face , where shadows lay thick under [her]1330-her eyes , for all the roundness of [her]1330-her cheeks , and on [her]1330-her slim pale hands , and the supple grace of [her]1330-her young body . And out in the night , clouds raced over the moon , which had come full once more .

[VI

1

Pierson]210-vi 1 pierson went back to [[his]384-her father study]1331-his study , and wrote to [Gratian]127-gratian .

" If [you]127-gratian can get leave for a few days , [[my]210-vi 1 pierson dear]3031-my dear , [I]210-vi 1 pierson want [you]127-gratian at [home]3048-home . [I]210-vi 1 pierson am troubled about [Nollie]131-nollie . Ever since that disaster happened to [her]131-nollie [she]131-nollie has been getting paler ; and to - day [she]131-nollie fainted . [She]131-nollie wo n't see [a doctor]3574-a doctor , but perhaps [you]127-gratian could get [her]131-nollie to see [George]140-george . If [you]127-gratian come up , [he]140-george will surely be able to run up to [us]3583-us for a day or two . If not , [you]127-gratian must take [her]131-nollie down to [him]140-george at [the sea]653-the sea . [I]210-vi 1 pierson have just seen the news of [[your]127-gratian second cousin]3585-your second cousin [Charlie Pierson]211-pierson 's death ; [he]211-pierson was killed in one of the last attacks on [the Somme]3586-the somme ; [he]211-pierson was [nephew of [[my]210-vi 1 pierson cousin]3431-my cousin [Leila]208-leila whom , as [you]127-gratian know , [Noel]197-noel sees every day at [[her]208-leila hospital]3051-her hospital]3587-nephew of my cousin leila whom , as you know , noel sees every day at her hospital . [Bertram]123-robert has the D. S. O. [I]210-vi 1 pierson have been less hard - pressed lately ; [Lauder]212-mr. lauder has been [home]3048-home on leave and has taken some Services for [me]210-vi 1 pierson . And now the colder weather has come , [I]210-vi 1 pierson am feeling much fresher . Try [your]127-gratian best to come . [I]210-vi 1 pierson am seriously concerned for [[our]1336-we beloved child]3591-our beloved child .[210-vi 1 pierson]

" [[Your]127-gratian affectionate father]3592-your affectionate father[127-gratian]

" [EDWARD PIERSON]122-pierson . "[210-vi 1 pierson]

[Gratian]127-gratian answered that [she]127-gratian could get week - end leave , and would come on Friday . [He]1334-he met [her]127-gratian at [the station]474-the station , and [they]1336-we drove [thence]1337-thence straight to [the hospital]1022-the hospital , to pick up [Noel]197-noel . [Leila]208-leila came to [them]1336-we in [the waiting - room]1339-the waiting - room , and [Pierson]122-pierson , thinking [they]1336-we would talk more freely about [Noel]197-noel 's health if [he]122-pierson left [them]1336-we alone , went into [the recreation room]1340-the recreation room , and stood watching a game of bagatelle between [two convalescents]1341-two convalescents . When [he]1334-he returned to [the little sitting - room]1342-the little sitting - room [they]1336-we were still standing by the hearth , talking in low voices . [Gratian]127-gratian must surely have been stooping over the fire , for [her]127-gratian face was red , almost swollen , and [her]127-gratian eyes looked as if [she]127-gratian had scorched them .

[Leila]208-leila said lightly :

" Well , [Edward]122-pierson , are n't [the men]3458-the men delightful ? When are [we]1336-we going to another concert together ? "[208-leila]

[She]208-leila , too , was flushed and looking almost young .

" Ah ! If [we]1336-we could do the things [we]1336-we want to .[208-leila]

" That 's very pretty , [Edward]122-pierson ; but [you]122-pierson should , [you]122-pierson know - for a tonic . "[1334-he] [He]1334-he shook [his]1334-he head and smiled .

" [You]208-leila 're [a temptress]3594-a temptress , [Leila]208-leila . Will [you]122-pierson let [Nollie]131-nollie know , please , that [we]1336-we can take [her]131-nollie back with [us]1336-we ? Can [you]122-pierson let [her]131-nollie off to - morrow ? "[208-leila]

" For as long as [you]122-pierson like ; [she]131-nollie wants a rest . [I]208-leila 've been talking to [Gratian]127-gratian . [We]1336-we ought n't to have let [her]131-nollie go on after a shock like that - [my]208-leila fault , [I]208-leila 'm afraid . [I]208-leila thought that work might be best . "[208-leila]

[Pierson]122-pierson was conscious of [Gratian]127-gratian walking past [him]122-pierson out of [the room]517-the room . [He]122-pierson held out [his]122-pierson hand to [Leila]208-leila , and followed . A small noise occurred behind [him]122-pierson such as [a woman]3280-a woman makes when [she]3280-a woman has put a foot through [her]3280-a woman own skirt , or has other powerful cause for dismay . Then [he]122-pierson saw [Noel]197-noel in [the hall]522-the hall , and was vaguely aware of being the centre of a triangle of [women whose eyes were playing catch - glance]1346-women whose eyes were playing catch - glance . [[His]122-pierson daughters]619-his daughters kissed [each other]493-each other ; and [he]122-pierson became seated between [them]619-his daughters in [the taxi]1349-the taxi . [The most unobservant of [men]3061-men]1350-the most unobservant of men , [he]122-pierson parted from [them]619-his daughters in [the hall]522-the hall without having perceived anything except that [they]619-his daughters were rather silent ; and , going to [[his]122-pierson study]1331-his study , [he]122-pierson took up a Life of [Sir Thomas More]213-sir thomas more . There was a passage therein which [he]122-pierson itched to show [George Laird]140-george , who was coming up that evening .

[Gratian]127-gratian and [Noel]197-noel had mounted the stairs with lips tight set , and eyes averted ; [both]1354-both were very pale . When [they]619-his daughters reached the door of [[Gratian]127-gratian 's room]1355-gratian 's room [the room which had been [[their]619-his daughters mother]1357-their mother 's]1356-the room which had been their mother 's - [Noel]197-noel was for passing on , but [Gratian]127-gratian caught [her]1358-her by the arm , and said : " Come in . "[127-gratian] The fire was burning brightly in there , and [the two sisters]1359-the two sisters stood in front of [it]1360-it , one on each side , [their]1359-the two sisters hands clutching the mantel - shelf , staring at the flames . At last [Noel]197-noel put one hand in front of [her]127-gratian eyes , and said :

" [I]197-noel asked [her]127-gratian to tell [you]127-gratian . "[197-noel]

[Gratian]127-gratian made the movement of [one who is gripped by two strong emotions]1361-one who is gripped by two strong emotions , and longs to surrender to one or to the other .

" It 's too horrible , "[127-gratian] was all [she]127-gratian said .

[Noel]197-noel turned towards the door .

" Stop , [Nollie]131-nollie ! "[197-noel]

[Noel]197-noel stopped with [her]1358-her hand on the door knob . " [I]197-noel do n't want to be forgiven and sympathised with . [I]197-noel just want to be let alone . "[197-noel]

" How can [you]197-noel be let alone ? "[197-noel]

The tide of misery surged up in [Noel]197-noel , and [she]1358-her cried out passionately :

" [I]1358-her hate sympathy from people who ca n't understand . [I]1358-her do n't want [anyone]3200-anyone 's . [I]1358-her can always go away , and lose [myself]1358-her . "[1358-her]

The words " ca n't understand "[197-noel] gave [Gratian]127-gratian a shock .

" [I]127-gratian can understand , "[127-gratian] [she]127-gratian said .

" [You]197-noel ca n't ; [you]197-noel never saw [him]3596-him . [You]197-noel never saw - "[1358-her] [her]1358-her lips quivered so that [she]1358-her had to stop and bite them , to keep back a rush of tears .

" Besides [you]197-noel would never have done it [yourself]197-noel . "[1358-her]

[Gratian]127-gratian went towards [her]1358-her , but stopped , and sat down on the bed . It was true . [She]1358-her would never have done it [herself]1358-her ; it was just that which , for all [her]1358-her longing to help [[her]1358-her sister]1362-her sister , iced [her]1358-her love and sympathy . How terrible , wretched , humiliating ! [[Her]1358-her own sister]1363-her own sister , [[her]1358-her only sister]1364-her only sister , in the position of [all those poor , badly brought up girls , who forgot [themselves]1365-all those poor , badly brought up girls , who forgot themselves]1365-all those poor , badly brought up girls , who forgot themselves ! And [[her]1358-her father]384-her father - [[their]1367-their father]1368-their father ! Till that moment [she]1358-her had hardly thought of [him]384-her father , too preoccupied by the shock to [her]1358-her own pride . The word : " [Dad]158-dad ! "[197-noel] was forced from [her]1358-her .

[Noel]197-noel shuddered .

" [That boy]3597-that boy ! "[127-gratian] said [Gratian]127-gratian suddenly ; " [I]127-gratian ca n't forgive [him]3597-that boy . If [you]197-noel did n't know - [he]3597-that boy did . It was - it was - "[127-gratian] [She]127-gratian stopped at the sight of [Noel]197-noel 's face .

" [I]127-gratian did know , "[127-gratian] [she]127-gratian said . " It was [I.]127-gratian [He]3597-that boy was [[my]127-gratian husband]886-my husband , as much as [yours]197-noel is . If [you]197-noel say a word against [him]3597-that boy , [I]127-gratian 'll never speak to [you]197-noel again : [I]127-gratian 'm glad , and [you]197-noel would be , if [you]197-noel were going to have one . What 's the difference , except that [you]197-noel 've had luck , and [I]127-gratian - have n't . "[127-gratian] [Her]127-gratian lips quivered again , and [she]127-gratian was silent .

[Gratian]127-gratian stared up at [her]127-gratian . [She]127-gratian had a longing for [George]140-george - to know what [he]140-george thought and felt .

" Do [you]140-george mind if [I]127-gratian tell [George]140-george ? "[127-gratian] [she]127-gratian said .

[Noel]197-noel shook [her]127-gratian head . " No ! not now . Tell [anybody]3599-anybody . "[197-noel] And suddenly the misery behind the mask of [her]127-gratian face went straight to [Gratian]127-gratian 's heart . [She]127-gratian got up and put [her]127-gratian arms round [[her]127-gratian sister]1362-her sister .

" [Nollie]131-nollie dear , do n't look like that ! "[127-gratian]

[Noel]197-noel suffered the embrace without response , but when it was over , went to [[her]127-gratian own room]1370-her own room .

[Gratian]127-gratian stayed , sorry , sore and vexed , uncertain , anxious . [Her]127-gratian pride was deeply wounded , [her]127-gratian heart torn ; [she]127-gratian was angry with [herself]127-gratian . Why could n't [she]127-gratian have been more sympathetic ? And yet , now that [Noel]197-noel was no longer [there]3137-there , [she]127-gratian again condemned [the dead]1372-the dead . What [he]197-noel had done was unpardonable . [Nollie]131-nollie was such - [a child]415-a child ! [He]197-noel had committed sacrilege . If only [George]140-george would come , and [she]127-gratian could talk it all out with [him]197-noel ! [She]127-gratian , who had married for love and known passion , had insight enough to feel that [Noel]197-noel 's love had been deep - so far as anything , of course , could be deep in [such a child]3123-such a child . [Gratian]127-gratian was at the mature age of twenty . But to have forgotten [herself]127-gratian like that ! And [this boy]3095-this boy ! If [she]127-gratian had known [him]3095-this boy , that feeling might have been mitigated by the personal element , so important to all human judgment ; but never having seen [him]3095-this boy , [she]127-gratian thought of [his]3095-this boy conduct as " caddish . "[3095-this boy] And [she]127-gratian knew that this was , and would be , the trouble between [her]127-gratian and [[her]127-gratian sister]1362-her sister . However [she]127-gratian might disguise it , [Noel]197-noel would feel that judgment underneath .

[She]127-gratian stripped off [[her]127-gratian [nurse]440-nurse]1377-her nurse 's garb , put on an evening frock , and fidgeted about [the room]517-the room . Anything rather than go down and see [[her]127-gratian father]384-her father again before [she]127-gratian must . This , which had happened , was beyond words terrible for [him]384-her father ; [she]127-gratian dreaded the talk with [him]384-her father about [Noel]197-noel 's health which would have to come . [She]127-gratian could say nothing , of course , until [Noel]197-noel wished ; and , very truthful by nature , the idea , of having to act a lie distressed [her]127-gratian .

[She]127-gratian went down at last , and found [them]1381-them both in [the drawing - room]1382-the drawing - room already ; [Noel]197-noel in a frilly evening frock , sitting by the fire with [her]127-gratian chin on [her]127-gratian hand , while [[her]127-gratian father]384-her father was reading out the war news from the evening paper . At sight of [that cool , dainty , girlish figure]1384-that cool , dainty , girlish figure brooding over the fire , and of [[her]127-gratian father]384-her father 's worn face , the tragedy of this business thrust itself on [her]127-gratian with redoubled force . [Poor Dad]158-dad ! [Poor Nollie]131-nollie ! Awful ! Then [Noel]197-noel turned , and gave a little shake of [her]127-gratian head , and [her]127-gratian eyes said , almost as plainly as lips could have said it : ' Silence ! ' [Gratian]127-gratian nodded , and came forward to the fire . And so began one of those calm , domestic evenings , which cover sometimes such depths of heartache .

2

[Noel]197-noel stayed up until [[her]127-gratian father]384-her father went to bed , then went [upstairs]1153-upstairs at once . [She]127-gratian had evidently determined that [they]1388-we should not talk about [her]127-gratian . [Gratian]127-gratian sat on alone , waiting for [[her]127-gratian husband]554-her husband ! It was nearly midnight when [he]554-her husband came , and [she]127-gratian did not tell [him]554-her husband the family news till next morning . [He]554-her husband received it with a curious little grunt . [Gratian]127-gratian saw [his]554-her husband eyes contract , as [they]1388-we might have , perhaps , looking at some bad and complicated wound , and then stare steadily at the ceiling . Though [they]1388-we had been married over a year , [she]127-gratian did not yet know what [he]554-her husband thought about many things , and [she]127-gratian waited with a queer sinking at [her]127-gratian heart . This skeleton in [the family cupboard]1390-the family cupboard was a test of [his]554-her husband affection for [herself]127-gratian , a test of the quality of [the man [she]127-gratian had married]1391-the man she had married . [He]554-her husband did not speak for a little , and [her]127-gratian anxiety grew . Then [his]554-her husband hand sought [hers]127-gratian , and gave it a hard squeeze .

" [Poor little Nollie]131-nollie ! This is a case for [Mark Tapleyism]214-mark tapleyism . But cheer up , [Gracie]159-gracie ! [We]1388-we 'll get [her]131-nollie through somehow . "[554-her husband]

" But [father]3187-father ! It 's impossible to keep it from [him]554-her husband , and impossible to tell [him]554-her husband ! Oh [George]140-george ! [I]554-her husband never knew what family pride was till now . It 's incredible . [That wretched boy]3601-that wretched boy ! "[554-her husband]

" ' De mortuis . ' Come , [Gracie]159-gracie ! In the midst of death [we]1388-we are in life ! [Nollie]131-nollie was [a plumb little idiot]3602-a plumb little idiot . But it 's the war - the war ! [[Your]159-gracie father]3044-your father must get used to it ; it 's a rare chance for [his]3044-your father Christianity . "[554-her husband]

" [Dad]158-dad will be as sweet as anything - that 's what makes it so horrible ! "[554-her husband]

[George Laird]140-george redoubled [his]140-george squeeze . " Quite right ! [The old - fashioned father]3604-the old - fashioned father could let [himself]3044-your father go . But need [he]3044-your father know ? [We]1388-we can get [her]131-nollie away from [London]7-london , and later on , [we]1388-we must manage somehow . If [he]3044-your father does hear , [we]1388-we must make [him]3044-your father feel that [Nollie]131-nollie was ' doing [her]131-nollie bit . ' "[140-george]

[Gratian]127-gratian withdrew [her]127-gratian hand . " Do n't ! "[127-gratian] [she]127-gratian said in a muffled voice .

[George Laird]140-george turned and looked at [her]127-gratian . [He]140-george was greatly upset [himself]140-george , realising perhaps more truly than [[his]140-george young wife]628-his young wife the violence of this disaster ; [he]140-george was quite capable , too , of feeling how deeply [she]628-his young wife was stirred and hurt ; but , [a born pragmatist]1393-a born pragmatist , confronting life always in the experimental spirit , [he]140-george was impatient of the : " How awful ! "[140-george] attitude . And this streak of [[her]628-his young wife father]384-her father 's ascetic traditionalism in [Gratian]127-gratian always roused in [him]140-george a wish to break it up . If [she]628-his young wife had not been [[his]140-george wife]618-his wife [he]140-george would have admitted at once that [he]140-george might just as well try and alter the bone - formation of [her]628-his young wife head , as break down such a fundamental trait of character , but , being [[his]140-george wife]618-his wife , [he]140-george naturally considered alteration as possible as putting a new staircase in [a house]1397-a house , or throwing [two rooms]1398-two rooms into one . And , taking [her]628-his young wife in [his]140-george arms , [he]140-george said : " [I]140-george know ; but it 'll all come right , if [we]3605-we put a good face on it . Shall [I]140-george talk to [Nollie]131-nollie ? "[140-george]

[Gratian]127-gratian assented , from the desire to be able to say to [[her]127-gratian father]384-her father : " [George]140-george is seeing [her]131-nollie ! "[140-george] and so stay the need for a discussion . But the whole thing seemed to [her]127-gratian more and more a calamity which nothing could lessen or smooth away .

[George Laird]140-george had plenty of cool courage , invaluable in [men who have to inflict as well as to alleviate pain]1400-men who have to inflict as well as to alleviate pain , but [he]140-george did not like [his]140-george mission " a little bit "[140-george] as [he]140-george would have said ; and [he]140-george proposed a walk because [he]140-george dreaded a scene . [Noel]197-noel accepted for the same reason . [She]127-gratian liked [George]140-george , and with the disinterested detachment of [a sister - in - law]1401-a sister - in - law , and the shrewdness of extreme youth , knew [him]140-george perhaps better than did [[his]140-george wife]618-his wife . [She]127-gratian was sure , at all events , of being neither condemned nor sympathised with .

[They]1403-they might have gone , of course , in any direction , but chose to make for [the City]3301-the city . Such deep decisions are subconscious . [They]1403-they sought , no doubt , [a dry , unemotional region]1405-a dry , unemotional region ; or perhaps one where [George]140-george , who was in uniform , might rest [his]140-george arm from the automatic - toy game which [the military]1406-the military play . [They]1403-they had reached [Cheapside]62-cheapside before [he]140-george was conscious to the full of the bizarre nature of this walk with [[his]140-george pretty young sister - in - law]1407-his pretty young sister - in - law among all [the bustling , black - coated mob of money - makers]1408-the bustling , black - coated mob of money - makers . ' [I]0-i wish the devil [we]1403-they had n't come out ! ' [he]140-george thought ; ' it would have been easier [indoors]1409-indoors , after all . '

[He]140-george cleared [his]140-george throat , however , and squeezing [her]127-gratian arm gently , began : " [Gratian]127-gratian 's told [me]140-george , [Nollie]131-nollie . The great thing is to keep [your]127-gratian spirit up , and not worry . "[140-george]

" [I]140-george suppose [you]140-george could n't cure [me]140-george . "[140-george]

The words , in that delicate spurning voice , absolutely staggered [George]140-george ; but [he]140-george said quickly :

" Out of the question , [Nollie]131-nollie ; impossible ! What are [you]131-nollie thinking of ? "[140-george]

" [Daddy]132-daddy . "[140-george]

The words : " D - n [Daddy]132-daddy ! "[140-george] rose to [his]140-george teeth ; [he]140-george bit them off , and said : " Bless [him]132-daddy ! [We]3606-we shall have to see to all that . Do [you]131-nollie really want to keep it from [him]132-daddy ? It must be one way or the other ; no use concealing it , if it 's to come out later . "[140-george]

" No . "[1410-her]

[He]140-george stole a look at [her]1410-her . [She]1410-her was gazing straight before [her]1410-her . How damnably young [she]1410-her was , how pretty ! A lump came up in [his]140-george throat .

" [I]140-george should n't do anything yet , "[140-george] [he]140-george said ; " too early . Later on , if [you]131-nollie 'd like [me]140-george to tell [him]132-daddy . But that 's entirely up to [you]131-nollie , [[my]140-george dear]3031-my dear ; [he]132-daddy need never know . "[140-george]

" No . "[1410-her]

[He]140-george could not follow [her]1410-her thought . Then [she]1410-her said :

" [Gratian]127-gratian condemns [Cyril]133-cyril . Do n't let [her]1410-her . [I]1410-her wo n't have [him]132-daddy badly thought of . It was [my]1410-her doing . [I]1410-her wanted to make sure of [him]132-daddy . "[1410-her]

[George]140-george answered stoutly :

" [Gracie]159-gracie 's upset , of course , but [she]159-gracie 'll soon be all right . [You]140-george must n't let it come between [you]140-george . The thing [you]140-george 've got to keep steadily before [you]140-george is that life 's a huge wide adaptable thing . Look at [all these people]3608-all these people ! There 's hardly one of [them]3608-all these people who has n't got now , or has n't had , some personal difficulty or trouble before [them]3608-all these people as big as [yours]140-george almost ; bigger perhaps . And here [they]3608-all these people are as lively as fleas . That 's what makes the fascination of life - the jolly irony of it all . It would do [you]140-george good to have a turn in [France]13-france , and see [yourself]140-george in proportion to the whole . "[140-george] [He]140-george felt [her]1411-her fingers suddenly slip under [his]140-george arm , and went on with greater confidence :

" Life 's going to be the important thing in the future , [Nollie]131-nollie ; not comfort and cloistered virtue and security ; but living , and pressure to the square inch . Do [you]140-george twig ? All the old hard - and - fast traditions and drags on life are in the melting - pot . [Death]157-death 's boiling [their]3608-all these people bones , and [they]3608-all these people 'll make excellent stock for the new soup . When [you]140-george prune and dock things , the sap flows quicker . Regrets and repinings and repressions are going out of fashion ; [we]3609-we shall have no time or use for them in the future . [You]140-george 're going to make life - well , that 's something to be thankful for , anyway . [You]140-george 've kept [Cyril Morland]133-cyril alive . And - well , [you]140-george know , [we]3609-we 've all been born ; some of [us]3609-we properly , and some improperly , and there is n't a ha'porth of difference in the value of the article , or the trouble of bringing it into [the world]606-the world . The cheerier [you]140-george are the better [[your]140-george child]3611-your child will be , and that 's all [you]140-george 've got to think about . [You]140-george need n't begin to trouble at all for another couple of months , at least ; after that , just let [us]3609-we know where [you]140-george 'd like to go , and [I]1411-her 'll arrange it somehow . "[1411-her]

[She]1412-he looked round at [him]1412-he , and under that young , clear , brooding gaze [he]1412-he had the sudden uncomfortable feeling of having spoken like [a charlatan]1413-a charlatan . Had [he]1412-he really touched the heart of the matter ? What good were [his]1412-he generalities to [this young , fastidiously nurtured girl , brought up to tell the truth]1414-this young , fastidiously nurtured girl , brought up to tell the truth , by [a father so old - fashioned and devoted]1415-a father so old - fashioned and devoted , whom [she]1412-he loved ? It was [George]140-george 's nature , too , to despise words ; and the conditions of [his]1412-he life these last two years had given [him]1412-he a sort of horror of [those who act by talking]1416-those who act by talking . [He]1412-he felt inclined to say : ' Do n't pay the slightest attention to [me]0-i ; it 's all humbug ; what will be will be , and there 's an end of it :

[VII

[Noel]222-noel clasped [her]1491-i hands behind [her]1491-i head . " [I]1491-i think , "[1491-i] [she]1491-i said , looking straight before [her]1491-i , and speaking to the air , " that Christianity is what [you]132-daddy do , not what [you]132-daddy think or say . And [I]1491-i do n't believe [people]3083-people can be [Christians]3271-christians when [they]3083-people act like [others]395-others - [I]1491-i mean , when [they]3083-people join together to judge and hurt [people]3083-people . "[1491-i]

[Pierson]222-noel rose and paced [the room]517-the room . " [You]222-noel have not seen enough of life to talk like that , "[222-noel] [he]222-noel said . But [Noel]222-noel went on :

" [One of the men in [[her]1491-i hospital]3051-her hospital]3668-one of the men in her hospital told [Gratian]127-gratian about the treatment of [conscientious objectors]3670-conscientious objectors - it was horrible . Why do [they]3670-conscientious objectors treat [them]3670-conscientious objectors like that , just because [they]3670-conscientious objectors disagree ? [Captain Fort]197-noel says it 's fear which makes [people bullies]3671-people bullies . But how can it be fear when [they]3671-people bullies 're hundreds to one ? [He]197-noel says [man]631-man has domesticated [his]631-man animals but has never succeeded in domesticating [himself]631-man . [Man]173-man must be a wild beast , [you]3673-you know , or [the world]606-the world could n't be so awfully brutal . [I]222-noel do n't see much difference between being brutal for good reasons , and being brutal for bad ones . "[222-noel]

[Pierson]222-noel looked down at [her]1495-her with a troubled smile . There was something fantastic to [him]222-noel in this sudden philosophising by one whom [he]222-noel had watched grow up from a tiny thing . Out of the mouths of [babes and sucklings]1496-babes and sucklings - sometimes ! But then [the young generation]1497-the young generation was always something of a sealed book to [him]222-noel ; [his]222-noel sensitive shyness , and , still more , [his]222-noel cloth , placed a sort of invisible barrier between [him]222-noel and the hearts of [others]395-others , especially [the young]1499-the young . There were so many things of which [he]222-noel was compelled to disapprove , or which at least [he]222-noel could n't discuss . And [they]1500-they knew it too well . Until these last few months [he]222-noel had never realised that [[his]222-noel own daughters]1501-his own daughters had remained as undiscovered by [him]222-noel as [the interior of [Brazil]65-brazil]1502-the interior of brazil . And now that [he]222-noel perceived this , [he]222-noel was bewildered , yet could not imagine how to get on terms with [them]1501-his own daughters .

And [he]222-noel stood looking at [Noel]222-noel , intensely puzzled , suspecting nothing of the hard fact which was altering [her]1503-her - vaguely jealous , anxious , pained . And when [she]1503-her had gone up to bed , [he]222-noel roamed up and down [the room]517-the room a long time , thinking . [He]222-noel longed for [a friend]1505-a friend to confide in , and consult ; but [he]222-noel knew [no one]3081-no one . [He]222-noel shrank from [them]1501-his own daughters all , as too downright , bluff , and active ; too worldly and unaesthetic ; or too stiff and narrow . Amongst [the younger men in [his]222-noel profession]1507-the younger men in his profession [he]222-noel was often aware of faces which attracted [him]222-noel , but [one]424-one could not confide deep personal questions to [men half one]1509-men half one 's age . But of [[his]222-noel own generation]1510-his own generation , or [[his]222-noel elders]1511-his elders , [he]222-noel knew not one to whom [he]222-noel could have gone .

[VIII

Leila]174-leila was deep in [her]1512-she new draught of life . When [she]1512-she fell in love it had always been over head and ears , and so far [her]1512-she passion had always burnt itself out before that of [[her]1512-she partner]1513-her partner . This had been , of course , a great advantage to [her]1512-she . Not that [Leila]174-leila had ever expected [her]1512-she passions to burn themselves out . When [she]1512-she fell in love [she]1512-she had always thought it was for always . This time [she]1512-she was sure it was , surer than [she]1512-she had ever been . [Jimmy Fort]175-jimmy seemed to [her]1512-she [the man [she]1512-she had been looking for all [her]1512-she life]1514-the man she had been looking for all her life . [He]175-jimmy was not so good - looking as either [Farie]224-farie or [Lynch]190-mrs. lynch , but beside [him]175-jimmy these others seemed to [her]1512-she now almost ridiculous . Indeed [they]1515-they did not figure at all , [they]1515-they shrank , [they]1515-they withered , [they]1515-they were husks , together with the others for whom [she]1512-she had known passing weaknesses . There was only one man in [the world]606-the world for [her]1512-she now , and would be for evermore . [She]1512-she did not idealise [him]175-jimmy either , it was more serious than that ; [she]1512-she was thrilled by [his]175-jimmy voice , and [his]175-jimmy touch , [she]1512-she dreamed of [him]175-jimmy , longed for [him]175-jimmy when [he]175-jimmy was not with [her]1512-she . [She]1512-she worried , too , for [she]1512-she was perfectly aware that [he]175-jimmy was not half as fond of [her]1512-she as [she]1512-she was of [him]175-jimmy . Such a new experience puzzled [her]1512-she , kept [her]1512-she instincts painfully on the alert . It was perhaps just this uncertainty about [his]175-jimmy affection which made [him]175-jimmy seem more precious than any of the others . But there was ever the other reason , too - consciousness that Time was after [her]1512-she , and this [her]1512-she last grand passion . [She]1512-she watched [him]175-jimmy as a mother - cat watches [her]1512-she kitten , without seeming to , of course , for [she]1512-she had much experience . [She]1512-she had begun to have a curious secret jealousy of [Noel]222-noel though why [she]1512-she could not have said . It was perhaps merely incidental to [her]1512-she age , or sprang from that vague resemblance between [her]1512-she and one who outrivalled even what [she]1512-she had been as [a girl]1193-a girl ; or from the occasional allusions [Fort]175-jimmy made to what [he]175-jimmy called " [that little fairy princess]3675-that little fairy princess . "[175-jimmy] Something intangible , instinctive , gave [her]1512-she that jealousy . Until the death of [[[her]1512-she young cousin]1518-her young cousin 's lover]1519-her young cousin 's lover [she]1512-she had felt safe , for [she]1512-she knew that [Jimmy Fort]175-jimmy would not hanker after [[another man]1520-another man 's property]1521-another man 's property ; had [he]175-jimmy not proved that in old days , with [herself]1512-she , by running away from [her]1512-she ? And [she]1512-she had often regretted having told [him]175-jimmy of [Cyril Morland]133-cyril 's death . One day [she]1512-she determined to repair that error . It was at [the Zoo]1522-the zoo , where [they]1523-they often went on Sunday afternoons . [They]1523-they were standing before a creature called the meercat , which reminded [them]1523-they both of old days on [the veldt]66-the veldt . Without turning [her]1512-she head [she]1512-she said , as if to the little animal : " Do [you]175-jimmy know that [[your]175-jimmy fairy princess]3676-your fairy princess , as [you]175-jimmy call [her]3676-your fairy princess , is going to have what is known as [a war - baby]3677-a war - baby ? "[1512-she]

The sound of [his]175-jimmy " What ! "[175-jimmy] gave [her]1512-she quite a stab . It was so utterly horrified .

[She]1512-she said stubbornly : " [She]3676-your fairy princess came and told [me]1512-she all about it . [The boy]840-the boy is dead , as [you]175-jimmy know . Yes , terrible , is n't it ? "[1512-she] And [she]1512-she looked at [him]175-jimmy . [His]175-jimmy face was almost comic , so wrinkled up with incredulity .

" [That lovely child]3679-that lovely child ! But it 's impossible ! "[175-jimmy]

" The impossible is sometimes true , [Jimmy]175-jimmy . "[1512-she]

" [I]175-jimmy refuse to believe it . "[175-jimmy]

" [I]1512-she tell [you]175-jimmy it is so , "[1512-she] [she]1512-she said angrily .

" What a ghastly shame ! "[175-jimmy]

" It was [her]3676-your fairy princess own doing ; [she]3676-your fairy princess said so , [herself]3676-your fairy princess . "[175-jimmy]

" And [[her]3679-that lovely child father]384-her father - [the padre]1067-the padre ! [[My]175-jimmy God]499-my god ! "[175-jimmy]

[Leila]174-leila was suddenly smitten with a horrible doubt . [She]174-leila had thought it would disgust [him]175-jimmy , cure [him]175-jimmy of any little tendency to romanticise [that child]3092-that child ; and now [she]174-leila perceived that it was rousing in [him]175-jimmy , instead , a dangerous compassion . [She]174-leila could have bitten [her]174-leila tongue out for having spoken . When [he]175-jimmy got on the high horse of some championship , [he]175-jimmy was not to be trusted , [she]174-leila had found that out ; was even finding it out bitterly in [her]174-leila own relations with [him]175-jimmy , constantly aware that half [her]174-leila hold on [him]175-jimmy , at least , lay in [his]175-jimmy sense of chivalry , aware that [he]175-jimmy knew [her]174-leila lurking dread of being flung on [the beach]1525-the beach , by age . Only ten minutes ago [he]175-jimmy had uttered a tirade before the cage of a monkey which seemed unhappy . And now [she]174-leila had roused that dangerous side of [him]175-jimmy in favour of [Noel]222-noel . What [an idiot]1526-an idiot [she]174-leila had been !

" Do n't look like that , [Jimmy]175-jimmy . [I]174-leila 'm sorry [I]174-leila told [you]175-jimmy . "[174-leila]

[His]175-jimmy hand did not answer [her]174-leila pressure in the least , but [he]175-jimmy muttered :

" Well , [I]175-jimmy do think that 's the limit . What 's to be done for [her]174-leila ? "[175-jimmy]

[Leila]174-leila answered softly : " Nothing , [I]174-leila 'm afraid . Do [you]175-jimmy love [me]174-leila ? "[174-leila] And [she]174-leila pressed [his]175-jimmy hand hard .

" Of course . "[174-leila]

But [Leila]174-leila thought : ' If [I]0-i were [that meercat]1527-that meercat [he]1527-that meercat 'd have taken more notice of [my]0-i paw ! ' [Her]174-leila heart began suddenly to ache , and [she]174-leila walked on to the next cage with head up , and [her]174-leila mouth hard set .

[Jimmy Fort]175-jimmy walked away from [Camelot Mansions]38-camelot mansions that evening in extreme discomfort of mind . [Leila]174-leila had been so queer that [he]175-jimmy had taken leave immediately after supper . [She]174-leila had refused to talk about [Noel]222-noel ; had even seemed angry when [he]175-jimmy had tried to . How extraordinary [some women]1528-some women were ! Did [they]1528-some women think that [a man]3326-a man could hear of a thing like that about [such a dainty young creature]1530-such a dainty young creature without being upset ! It was the most perfectly damnable news ! What on earth would [she]174-leila do - [poor little fairy princess]1099-poor little fairy princess ! Down had come [[her]174-leila house of cards]1532-her house of cards with a vengeance ! The whole of [her]174-leila life - the whole of [her]174-leila life ! With [her]174-leila bringing - up and [[her]174-leila father]384-her father and all - it seemed inconceivable that [she]174-leila could ever survive it . And [Leila]174-leila had been almost callous about the monstrous business . [Women]3282-women were hard to each other ! Bad enough , these things , when it was [a simple working girl]1535-a simple working girl , but [this dainty , sheltered , beautiful child]1536-this dainty , sheltered , beautiful child ! No , it was altogether too strong - too painful ! And following an impulse which [he]175-jimmy could not resist , [he]175-jimmy made [his]175-jimmy way to [the old Square]1537-the old square . But having reached [the house]538-the house , [he]175-jimmy nearly went away again . While [he]175-jimmy stood hesitating with [his]175-jimmy hand on the bell , [a girl]1193-a girl and [a soldier]581-a soldier passed , appearing as if by magic out of the moonlit November mist , blurred and solid shapes embraced , then vanished into it again , leaving the sound of footsteps . [Fort]175-jimmy jerked the bell . [He]175-jimmy was shown into what seemed , to one coming out of that mist , to be [a brilliant , crowded room]1541-a brilliant , crowded room , though in truth there were but two lamps and [five people]1542-five people in [it]1541-a brilliant , crowded room . [They]1542-five people were sitting round the fire , talking , and paused when [he]175-jimmy came in . When [he]175-jimmy had shaken hands with [Pierson]222-noel and been introduced to " [[my]175-jimmy daughter]3140-my daughter [Gratian]127-gratian "[175-jimmy] and [a man in khaki]1543-a man in khaki " [[my]175-jimmy son - in - law]3684-my son - in - law [George Laird]140-george , "[175-jimmy] to [a tall thin - faced , foreign - looking man in a black stock and seemingly no collar]1544-a tall thin - faced , foreign - looking man in a black stock and seemingly no collar , [he]175-jimmy went up to [Noel]222-noel , who had risen from a chair before the fire . ' No ! ' [he]175-jimmy thought , ' [I]0-i 've dreamed it , or [Leila]174-leila has lied ! ' [She]174-leila was so perfectly [the self - possessed , dainty maiden [he]175-jimmy remembered]1545-the self - possessed , dainty maiden he remembered . Even the feel of [her]174-leila hand was the same - warm and confident ; and sinking into a chair , [he]175-jimmy said : " Please go on , and let [me]175-jimmy chip in . "[175-jimmy]

" [We]3685-we were quarrelling about [the Universe]21-the universe , [Captain Fort]197-noel , "[1546-the man in khaki] said [the man in khaki]1546-the man in khaki ; " delighted to have [your]197-noel help . [I]1546-the man in khaki was just saying that [this particular world]3686-this particular world has no particular importance , no more than [a newspaper - seller]3687-a newspaper - seller would accord to it if it were completely destroyed tomorrow - "[1546-the man in khaki] Orrible catastrophe , total destruction of [the world]606-the world - six o'clock edition - pyper ! ' [I]0-i say that it will become again the nebula out of which it was formed , and by friction with other nebula re - form into a fresh shape and so on ad infinitum - but [I]0-i ca n't explain why . [[My]0-i wife]3270-my wife wonders if it exists at all except in the human mind - but [she]3270-my wife ca n't explain what the human mind is . [[My]0-i father - in - law]1549-my father - in - law thinks that it is [God]143-god 's hobby - but [he]1549-my father - in - law ca n't explain who or what [God]143-god is . [Nollie]131-nollie is silent . And [Monsieur Lavendie]221-lavendie has n't yet told [us]1550-ourselves what [he]1549-my father - in - law thinks . What do [you]221-lavendie think , [monsieur]1551-monsieur ? " [The thin - faced , big - eyed man]3688-the thin - faced , big - eyed man put up [his]3688-the thin - faced , big - eyed man hand to [his]3688-the thin - faced , big - eyed man high , veined brow as if [he]3688-the thin - faced , big - eyed man had a headache , reddened , and began to speak in French , which [Fort]197-noel followed with difficulty .[221-lavendie]

" For [me]1552-i [the Universe]3689-the universe is [a limitless artist]3690-a limitless artist , [monsieur]1551-monsieur , who from all time and to all time is ever expressing [himself]3688-the thin - faced , big - eyed man in differing forms - always trying to make a masterpiece , and generally failing . For [me]1552-i [this world]3543-this world , and [all the worlds]3693-all the worlds , are like [ourselves]1550-ourselves , and the flowers and trees - little separate works of art , more or less perfect , whose little lives run their course , and are spilled or powdered back into [this Creative Artist , whence issue ever fresh attempts at art]3694-this creative artist , whence issue ever fresh attempts at art . [I]1552-i agree with [Monsieur Laird]225-monsieur laird , if [I]1552-i understand [him]225-monsieur laird right ; but [I]1552-i agree also with [Madame Laird]226-madame laird , if [I]1552-i understand [her]226-madame laird . [You]3695-you see , [I]1552-i think mind and matter are one , or perhaps there is no such thing as either mind or matter , only growth and decay and growth again , for ever and ever ; but always conscious growth - [an artist]1457-an artist expressing [himself]1457-an artist in millions of ever - changing forms ; decay and death as [we]1550-ourselves call them , being but rest and sleep , the ebbing of the tide , which must ever come between two rising tides , or the night which comes between two days . But the next day is never the same as the day before , nor the tide as the last tide ; so the little shapes of [the world]606-the world and of [ourselves]1550-ourselves , these works of art by [the Eternal Artist]3698-the eternal artist , are never renewed in the same form , are never twice alike , but always fresh - fresh worlds , [fresh individuals]3699-fresh individuals , fresh flowers , fresh everything . [I]1552-i do not see anything depressing in that . To [me]1552-i it would be depressing to think that [I]1552-i would go on living after death , or live again in a new body , [myself]1552-i yet not [myself]1552-i . How stale that would be ! When [I]1552-i finish a picture it is inconceivable to [me]1552-i that this picture should ever become another picture , or that one can divide the expression from the mind - stuff it has expressed . [The Great Artist who is the whole of Everything]3700-the great artist who is the whole of everything , is ever in fresh effort to achieve new things . [He]3700-the great artist who is the whole of everything is as a fountain who throws up new drops , [no two ever alike , which fall back into the water]3701-no two ever alike , which fall back into the water , flow into the pipe , and so are thrown up again in fresh - shaped drops . But [I]1552-i can not explain why there should be this Eternal Energy , ever expressing itself in fresh individual shapes , [this Eternal Working Artist]3702-this eternal working artist , instead of nothing at all - just empty dark for always ; except indeed that it must be one thing or the other , either all or nothing ; and it happens to be this and not that , the all and not the nothing . "[1552-i]

[He]1552-i stopped speaking , and [his]1552-i big eyes , which had fixed themselves on [Fort]197-noel 's face , seemed to [the latter]1553-the latter not to be seeing [him]1552-i at all , but to rest on something beyond . [The man in khaki]1546-the man in khaki , who had risen and was standing with [his]1546-the man in khaki hand on [[his]1546-the man in khaki wife]618-his wife 's shoulder , said :

" [Bravo]227-bravo , [monsieur]1551-monsieur ; Jolly well put from [the artist]3704-the artist 's point of view . The idea is pretty , anyway ; but is there any need for an idea at all ? Things are ; and [we]3705-we have just to take them . "[1546-the man in khaki] [Fort]197-noel had the impression of something dark and writhing ; the thin black form of [his]197-noel host , who had risen and come close to the fire .

" [I]1552-i can not admit , "[1552-i] [he]1552-i was saying , " the identity of [the Creator]3706-the creator with the created . [God]143-god exists outside [ourselves]3705-we . Nor can [I]1552-i admit that there is no defnite purpose and fulfilment . All is shaped to [His]1552-i great ends . [I]1552-i think [we]3705-we are too given to spiritual pride . [The world]606-the world has lost reverence ; [I]1552-i regret it , [I]1552-i bitterly regret it . "[1552-i]

" [I]1546-the man in khaki rejoice at it , "[1546-the man in khaki] said [the man in khaki]1546-the man in khaki . " Now , [Captain Fort]197-noel , [your]197-noel turn to bat ! "[1546-the man in khaki]

[Fort]197-noel , who had been looking at [Noel]197-noel , gave [himself]197-noel a shake , and said : " [I]197-noel think what [monsieur]1551-monsieur calls expression , [I]197-noel call fighting . [I]197-noel suspect [the Universe]21-the universe of being simply a long fight , a sum of conquests and defeats . Conquests leading to defeats , defeats to conquests . [I]197-noel want to win while [I]197-noel 'm alive , and because [I]197-noel want to win , [I]197-noel want to live on after death . Death is a defeat . [I]197-noel do n't want to admit it . While [I]197-noel have that instinct , [I]197-noel do n't think [I]197-noel shall really die ; when [I]197-noel lose it , [I]197-noel think [I]197-noel shall . "[197-noel] [He]197-noel was conscious of [Noel]197-noel 's face turning towards [him]197-noel , but had the feeling that [she]1557-i was n't really listening . " [I]1557-i suspect that what [we]3709-we call spirit is just the fighting instinct ; that what [we]3709-we call matter is the mood of lying down . Whether , as [Mr. Pierson]156-pierson says , [God]143-god is outside [us]3709-we , or , as [monsieur]1551-monsieur thinks , [we]3709-we are all part of [God]143-god , [I]1557-i do n't know , [I]1557-i 'm sure . "[1557-i]

" Ah ! There [we]3709-we are ! "[1546-the man in khaki] said [the man in khaki]1546-the man in khaki . " [We]3709-we all speak after [our]3709-we temperaments , and none of [us]3709-we know . [Monsieur]3712-monsieur was [a poet]3713-a poet just now , and [his]3712-monsieur is the only temperament which has never yet been rammed down [the world]606-the world 's throat in the form of religion . [The painter]1461-the painter shook [his]1461-the painter head with a smile which seemed to [Fort]197-noel very bright on the surface , and very sad underneath .

" Non , [monsieur]1551-monsieur , "[1461-the painter] [he]1461-the painter said ; " [the artist]3704-the artist does not wish to impose [his]3704-the artist temperament . Difference of temperament is the very essence of [his]3704-the artist joy , and [his]3704-the artist belief in life . Without difference there would be no life for [him]3704-the artist . ' Tout casse , tout lasse , ' but change goes on for ever : [We]3719-we artists reverence change , [monsieur]1551-monsieur ; [we]3719-we reverence the newness of each morning , of each night , of [each person]3721-each person , of each expression of energy . Nothing is final for [us]3719-we ; [we]3719-we are eager for all and always for more . [We]3719-we are in love , [you]3722-you see , even with - death . "[1461-the painter]

There was a silence ; then [Fort]197-noel heard [Pierson]156-pierson murmur :

" That is beautiful , [monsieur]1551-monsieur ; but oh ! how wrong ! "[156-pierson] " And what do [you]525-the girl think , [Nollie]131-nollie ? "[1546-the man in khaki] said [the man in khaki]1546-the man in khaki suddenly . [The girl]525-the girl had been sitting very still in [her]525-the girl low chair , with [her]525-the girl hands crossed in [her]525-the girl lap , [her]525-the girl eyes on the fire , and the lamplight shining down on [her]525-the girl fair hair ; [she]525-the girl looked up , startled , and [her]525-the girl eyes met [Fort]197-noel 's .

" [I]525-the girl do n't know ; [I]525-the girl was n't listening . "[525-the girl] Something moved in [him]197-noel , a kind of burning pity , a rage of protection . [He]197-noel said quickly :

" These are times of action . Philosophy seems to mean nothing nowadays . The one thing is to hate tyranny and cruelty , and protect everything that 's weak and lonely . It 's all that 's left to make life worth living , when all the packs of [all the world]3724-all the world are out for blood . "[197-noel]

[Noel]197-noel was listening now , and [he]197-noel went on fervently : " Why ! Even [we]3725-we who started out to fight [this Prussian pack]3726-this prussian pack , have caught the pack feeling - so that it 's hunting all over [the country]334-the country , on every sort of scent . It 's a most infectious thing . "[197-noel]

" [I]197-noel can not see that [we]3725-we are being infected , [Captain Fort]197-noel . "[197-noel]

" [I]197-noel 'm afraid [we]3725-we are , [Mr. Pierson]156-pierson . [The great majority of [people]3083-people]3728-the great majority of people are always inclined to run with the hounds ; the pressure 's great just now ; the pack spirit 's in the air . "[197-noel]

[Pierson]156-pierson shook [his]156-pierson head . " No , [I]156-pierson can not see it , "[156-pierson] [he]156-pierson repeated ; " it seems to [me]156-pierson that [we]3725-we are all more brotherly , and more tolerant . "[156-pierson]

" Ah ! [IX]122-pierson

When in the cupboard there is a real and very bony skeleton , carefully kept from the sight of [a single member of [the family]1595-the family]1594-a single member of the family , the position of [that member]1596-that member is liable to become lonely . But [Pierson]122-pierson , who had been lonely fifteen years , did not feel it so much , perhaps , as [most men]371-most men would have . In [his]1583-he dreamy nature there was a curious self - sufficiency , which only violent shocks disturbed , and [he]1583-he went on with [his]1583-he routine of duty , which had become for [him]1583-he as set as the pavements [he]1583-he trod on [his]1583-he way to and from [it]1598-it . It was not exactly true , as [the painter]1461-the painter had said , that this routine did not bring [him]1583-he into touch with life . After all [he]1583-he saw [people]3083-people when [they]3083-people were born , when [they]3083-people married , when [they]3083-people died . [He]1583-he helped [them]3083-people when [they]3083-people wanted money , and when [they]3083-people were ill ; [he]1583-he told [[their]3083-people children]1601-their children Bible stories on Sunday afternoons ; [he]1583-he served [those who were in need]1602-those who were in need with soup and bread from [[his]1583-he soup kitchen]1603-his soup kitchen . [He]1583-he never spared [himself]1583-he in any way , and [his]1583-he ears were always at the service of [their]3083-people woes . And yet [he]1583-he did not understand [them]3083-people , and [they]3083-people knew that . It was as though [he]1583-he , or [they]3083-people , were colour - blind . The values were all different . [He]1583-he was seeing one set of objects , [they]3083-people another .

[One street of [[his]1583-he parish]338-his parish]1604-one street of his parish touched a main line of thoroughfare , and formed a little part of [the new hunting - grounds of women , who , chased forth from [their]1606-the new hunting - grounds of women , who , chased forth from their usual haunts by the authorities under pressure of the country 's danger usual haunts by [the Authorities]638-the authorities under pressure of [the country]334-the country 's danger]1606-the new hunting - grounds of women , who , chased forth from their usual haunts by the authorities under pressure of the country 's danger , now pursued [their]1606-the new hunting - grounds of women , who , chased forth from their usual haunts by the authorities under pressure of the country 's danger calling in the dark . This particular evil had always been a sort of nightmare to [Pierson]122-pierson . The starvation which ruled [his]1583-he own existence inclined [him]1583-he to a particularly severe view and severity was not [his]1583-he strong point . In consequence there was ever within [him]1583-he a sort of very personal and poignant struggle going on beneath that seeming attitude of rigid disapproval . [He]1583-he joined [the hunters]1609-the hunters , as it were , because [he]1583-he was afraid - not , of course , of [his]1583-he own instincts , for [he]1583-he was fastidious , [a gentleman]1610-a gentleman , and [a priest]1611-a priest , but of being lenient to a sin , to something which [God]143-god abhorred : [He]1583-he was , as it were , bound to take a professional view of this particular offence . When in [his]1583-he walks abroad [he]1583-he passed [one of [these women]1613-these women]1612-one of these women , [he]1583-he would unconsciously purse [his]1583-he lips , and frown . The darkness of [the streets]3240-the streets seemed to lend [them]1613-these women such power , such unholy sovereignty over the night . [They]1613-these women were such a danger to [the soldiers]3242-the soldiers , too ; and in turn , [the soldiers]3242-the soldiers were such a danger to [the lambs of [[his]1583-he flock]1139-his flock]1617-the lambs of his flock . Domestic disasters in [[his]1583-he parish]338-his parish came to [his]1583-he ears from time to time ; cases of [young girls whose heads were turned by]1620-young girls whose heads were turned by [soldiers]600-soldiers , so that [they]1620-young girls whose heads were turned by were about to become [mothers]399-mothers . [They]1613-these women seemed to [him]1583-he pitiful indeed ; but [he]1583-he could not forgive [them]1613-these women for [their]1613-these women giddiness , for putting temptation in the way of [brave young men]1623-brave young men , fighting , or about to fight . The glamour which surrounded [soldiers]600-soldiers was not excuse enough . When [the babies]1625-the babies were born , and came to [his]1583-he notice , [he]1583-he consulted [a Committee [he]1583-he had formed]1626-a committee he had formed , of three married and [two maiden ladies]1627-two maiden ladies , who visited [the mothers]1628-the mothers , and if necessary took [the babies]1625-the babies into [a creche]1630-a creche ; for [those babies]1631-those babies had a new value to [the country]334-the country , and were not - poor little things ! - to be held responsible for [[their]1631-those babies mothers]1633-their mothers ' faults . [He]1583-he [himself]1583-he saw little of [the young mothers]1634-the young mothers ; shy of [them]1634-the young mothers , secretly afraid , perhaps , of not being censorious enough . But once in a way [Life]160-life set [him]1583-he face to face with [one]424-one .

" Well , "[156-pierson] [he]156-pierson said , " if [you]525-the girl need [[our]3822-our creche]3823-our creche , [you]525-the girl have only to come to [me]156-pierson , "[156-pierson] and [he]156-pierson turned to [the girl]525-the girl . [The girl]525-the girl said with a sort of surprising quietness : " [I]525-the girl do n't want [the baby]3827-the baby ! "[525-the girl]

" ' [Ilda]231-ilda was in munitions , "[377-her mother] said [[her]525-the girl mother]377-her mother in an explanatory voice : " earnin ' a matter of four pound a week . [They]1662-they stood up ; [he]156-pierson shook hands with [them]1662-they ; and was suddenly aware that the door was open , and [Noel]197-noel standing there . [He]156-pierson had heard no sound ; and how long [she]525-the girl had been [there]3137-there [he]156-pierson could not tell . There was a singular fixity in [her]525-the girl face and attitude . " Are n't [you]525-the girl early , [[my]156-pierson child]3086-my child ? "[156-pierson] said [Pierson]156-pierson . " [You]525-the girl came in very quietly . "[156-pierson]

" Yes ; [I]525-the girl heard . "[525-the girl]

" [I]525-the girl heard [you]525-the girl say : ' A judgment ! ' [You]525-the girl 'll say the same to [me]525-the girl , wo n't [you]525-the girl ? Only , [I]525-the girl do want [[my]525-the girl baby]3829-my baby . "[525-the girl]

[She]525-the girl was standing with [her]525-the girl back to the door , over which a dark curtain hung ; [her]525-the girl face looked young and small against its stuff , [her]525-the girl eyes very large . With one hand [she]525-the girl plucked at [her]525-the girl blouse , just over [her]525-the girl heart .

[Pierson]156-pierson stared at [her]525-the girl , and gripped the back of the chair [he]156-pierson had been sitting in . A lifetime of repression served [him]156-pierson in the half - realised horror of that moment . [He]156-pierson stammered out the single word -

" [Nollie]131-nollie ! "[156-pierson]

" It 's quite true , "[525-the girl] [she]525-the girl said , turned round , and went out .

[Pierson]156-pierson had a sort of vertigo ; if [he]156-pierson had moved , [he]156-pierson must have fallen down . [Nollie]131-nollie ! [He]156-pierson slid round and sank into [his]156-pierson chair , and by some horrible cruel fiction of [his]156-pierson nerves , [he]156-pierson seemed to feel [Noel]197-noel on [his]156-pierson knee , as , when [a little girl]1665-a little girl , [she]1665-a little girl had been wo nt to sit , with [her]1665-a little girl fair hair fluffing against [his]156-pierson cheek . [He]156-pierson seemed to feel that hair tickling [his]156-pierson skin ; it used to be the greatest comfort [he]156-pierson had known since [[her]1665-a little girl mother]377-her mother died . At that moment [his]156-pierson pride shrivelled like a flower held to a flame ; all that abundant secret pride of [a father who loves and admires , who worships still [a dead wife]1668-a dead wife in the children [she]1668-a dead wife has left [him]156-pierson]1667-a father who loves and admires , who worships still a dead wife in the children she has left him ; who , humble by nature , yet never knows how proud [he]156-pierson is till the bitter thing happens ; all the long pride of [the priest who , by dint of exhortation and remonstrance]1669-the priest who , by dint of exhortation and remonstrance has coated [himself]1669-the priest who , by dint of exhortation and remonstrance in a superiority [he]1669-the priest who , by dint of exhortation and remonstrance hardly suspects - all this pride shrivelled in [him]1669-the priest who , by dint of exhortation and remonstrance . Then something writhed and cried within , as a tortured beast cries , at loss to know why it is being tortured . How many times has not [a man]3326-a man used those words : " [[My]3326-a man God]499-my god ! [[My]3326-a man God]499-my god ! Why hast [Thou]3832-thou forsaken [me]3326-a man ! "[3326-a man] [He]156-pierson sprang up and tried to pace [his]156-pierson way out of this cage of confusion : [His]156-pierson thoughts and feelings made the strangest medley , spiritual and worldly - Social ostracism - [her]1668-a dead wife soul in peril - a trial sent by [God]143-god ! The future ! Imagination failed [him]156-pierson . [He]156-pierson went to [his]156-pierson little piano , opened it , closed it again ; took [his]156-pierson hat , and stole out . [He]156-pierson walked fast , without knowing where . It was very cold - a clear , bitter evening . Silent rapid motion in the frosty air was some relief . As [Noel]197-noel had fled from [him]156-pierson , having uttered [her]1668-a dead wife news , so did [he]156-pierson fly from [her]1668-a dead wife . The afflicted walk fast . [He]156-pierson was soon down by [the river]417-the river , and turned West along [its]417-the river wall . The moon was up , bright and nearly full , and the steel - like shimmer of its light burnished the ebbing water . A cruel night ! [He]156-pierson came to [the Obelisk]71-the obelisk , and leaned against it , overcome by a spasm of realisation . [He]156-pierson seemed to see [[his]156-pierson dead wife]1672-his dead wife 's face staring at [him]156-pierson out of the past , like an accusation . " How have [you]156-pierson cared for [Nollie]131-nollie , that [she]131-nollie should have come to this ? "[1673-it] [It]1673-it became the face of the moonlit sphinx , staring straight at [him]156-pierson , the broad dark face with wide nostrils , cruel lips , full eyes blank of pupils , all livened and whitened by the moonlight - an embodiment of the marvellous unseeing energy of Life , twisting and turning hearts without mercy . [He]156-pierson gazed into those eyes with a sort of scared defiance . The great clawed paws of the beast , the strength and remorseless serenity of that crouching creature with human head , made living by [his]156-pierson imagination and the moonlight , seemed to [him]156-pierson like a temptation to deny [God]143-god , like a refutation of human virtue .

Then , the sense of beauty stirred in [him]156-pierson ; [he]156-pierson moved where [he]156-pierson could see its flanks coated in silver by the moonlight , the ribs and the great muscles , and the tail with tip coiled over the haunch , like the head of a serpent . It was weirdly living ; fine and cruel , that great man - made thing . It expressed something in the soul of [man]631-man , pitiless and remote from love - or rather , the remorselessness which [man]631-man had seen , lurking within [man]631-man 's fate . [Pierson]156-pierson recoiled from it , and resumed [his]156-pierson march along [the Embankment]1677-the embankment , almost deserted in the bitter cold . [He]156-pierson came to where , in the opening of [the Underground railway]1678-the underground railway , [he]156-pierson could see the little forms of [people]3083-people moving , little orange and red lights glowing . The sight arrested [him]156-pierson by its warmth and motion . Was it not all a dream ? [That woman]1680-that woman and [[her]1680-that woman daughter]1681-her daughter , had [they]1682-they really come ? Had not [Noel]197-noel been but [an apparition]1683-an apparition , [her]1680-that woman words a trick which [his]156-pierson nerves had played [him]156-pierson ? Then , too vividly again , [he]156-pierson saw [her]1680-that woman face against the dark stuff of the curtain , the curve of [her]1680-that woman hand plucking at [her]1680-that woman blouse , heard the sound of [his]156-pierson own horrified : " Nollie ! "[1680-that woman] No illusion , no deception ! The edifice of [his]156-pierson life was in the dust . And a queer and ghastly company of faces came about [him]156-pierson ; faces [he]156-pierson had thought friendly , of [good men]1684-good men and women whom [he]156-pierson knew , yet at that moment did not know , all gathered round [Noel]197-noel , with fingers pointing at [her]1680-that woman . [He]156-pierson staggered back from that vision , could not bear it , could not recognise this calamity . With a sort of comfort , yet an aching sense of unreality , [his]156-pierson mind flew to all those summer holidays spent in [Scotland]72-scotland , [Ireland]32-ireland , [Cornwall]73-cornwall , [Wales]31-wales , by [mountain and lake]1685-mountain and lake , with [[his]156-pierson two girls]1686-his two girls ; what sunsets , and turning leaves , birds , beasts , and insects [they]1686-his two girls had watched together ! From [their]1686-his two girls youthful companionship , [their]1686-his two girls eagerness , [their]1686-his two girls confidence in [him]156-pierson , [he]156-pierson had known so much warmth and pleasure . If all those memories were true , surely this could not be true . [He]156-pierson felt suddenly that [he]156-pierson must hurry back , go straight to [Noel]197-noel , tell [her]1680-that woman that [she]1680-that woman had been cruel to [him]156-pierson , or assure [himself]156-pierson that , for the moment , [she]1680-that woman had been insane : [His]156-pierson temper rose suddenly , took fire . [He]156-pierson felt anger against [her]1680-that woman , against every one [he]156-pierson knew , against life itself . Thrusting [his]156-pierson hands deep into the pockets of [his]156-pierson thin black overcoat , [he]156-pierson plunged into [that narrow glowing tunnel of [the station booking - office]1688-the station booking - office , which led back to [the crowded streets]1689-the crowded streets]1687-that narrow glowing tunnel of the station booking - office , which led back to the crowded streets . But by the time [he]156-pierson reached [home]3048-home [his]156-pierson anger had evaporated ; [he]156-pierson felt nothing but utter lassitude . It was nine o'clock , and [the maids]3488-the maids had cleared the dining table . In despair [Noel]197-noel had gone up to [[her]1680-that woman room]694-her room . [He]197-noel had no courage left , and sat down supperless at [his]197-noel little piano , letting [his]197-noel fingers find soft painful harmonies , so that [Noel]197-noel perhaps heard the faint far thrumming of that music through uneasy dreams . And there [he]197-noel stayed , till it became time for [him]197-noel to go forth to the Old Year 's Midnight Service .

When [he]197-noel returned , [Pierson]156-pierson wrapped [himself]156-pierson in a rug and lay down on the old sofa in [[his]156-pierson study]1331-his study . [The maid]1694-the maid , coming in next morning to " do "[1694-the maid] the grate , found [him]156-pierson still asleep . [She]1694-the maid stood contemplating [him]156-pierson in awe ; [a broad - faced , kindly , fresh - coloured girl]1695-a broad - faced , kindly , fresh - coloured girl . [He]156-pierson lay with [his]156-pierson face resting on [his]156-pierson hand , [his]156-pierson dark , just grizzling hair unruffled , as if [he]156-pierson had not stirred all night ; [his]156-pierson other hand clutched the rug to [his]156-pierson chest , and [his]156-pierson booted feet protruded beyond it . To [her]1694-the maid young eyes [he]156-pierson looked rather appallingly neglected . [She]1694-the maid gazed with interest at the hollows in [his]156-pierson cheeks , and the furrows in [his]156-pierson brow , and the lips , dark - moustached and bearded , so tightly compressed , even in sleep . Being holy did n't make [a man]3326-a man happy , it seemed ! What fascinated [her]1694-the maid were the cindery eyelashes resting on the cheeks , the faint movement of face and body as [he]156-pierson breathed , the gentle hiss of breath escaping through the twitching nostrils . [She]1694-the maid moved nearer , bending down over [him]156-pierson , with the childlike notion of counting those lashes . [Her]1694-the maid lips parted in readiness to say : " Oh ! "[1694-the maid] if [he]156-pierson waked . Something in [his]156-pierson face , and the little twitches which passed over it , made [her]1694-the maid feel " that sorry "[1694-the maid] for [him]156-pierson . [He]156-pierson was [a gentleman]1610-a gentleman , had money , preached to [her]1694-the maid every Sunday , and was not so very old - what more could [a man]3326-a man want ? And yet - [he]156-pierson looked so tired , with those cheeks .

[She]1694-the maid pitied [him]156-pierson ; helpless and lonely [he]156-pierson seemed to [her]1694-the maid , asleep there instead of going to bed properly . And sighing , [she]1694-the maid tiptoed towards the door .

" Is that [you]156-pierson , [Bessie]233-bessie ? "[1694-the maid]

[Pierson]156-pierson had remembered . For full five minutes [he]156-pierson lay there staring at nothing . Then [he]156-pierson rose , folded the rug mechanically , and looked at the clock . Eight ! "[1694-the maid]

[His]156-pierson thoughts moved on in the confused , inarticulate suspense of prayer , till [he]156-pierson heard [her]1694-the maid say : " [You]156-pierson have n't failed ; why do [you]156-pierson talk of failing - it is n't true ; and do n't pray for [me]1694-the maid , [Daddy]132-daddy . "[1694-the maid]

[Pierson]156-pierson raised [himself]156-pierson , and moved back from the bed . [Her]1694-the maid words confounded [him]156-pierson , yet [he]156-pierson was afraid to answer . [She]1694-the maid pushed [her]1694-the maid head deep into the pillow , and lay looking up at the ceiling .

" [I]1694-the maid shall have [a son]3226-a son ; [Cyril]133-cyril wo n't quite have died . And [I]1694-the maid do n't want to be forgiven . "[1694-the maid]

[He]156-pierson dimly perceived what long dumb processes of thought and feeling had gone on in [her]1694-the maid to produce this hardened state of mind , which to [him]156-pierson seemed almost blasphemous . And in the very midst of this turmoil in [his]156-pierson heart , [he]156-pierson could not help thinking how lovely [her]1694-the maid face looked , lying back so that the curve of [her]1694-the maid throat was bared , with the short tendrils of hair coiling about it . That flung - back head , moving restlessly from side to side in the heat of the soft pillow , had such a passion of protesting life in it ! And [he]156-pierson kept silence .

" [I]1694-the maid want [you]1694-the maid to know it was all [me]1694-the maid . But [I]1694-the maid ca n't pretend . "[1694-the maid] With a movement incredibly lithe and swift , [she]1694-the maid turned and pressed [her]1694-the maid face down in the pillow , so that all [he]156-pierson could see was [her]1694-the maid tumbled hair and the bedclothes trembling above [her]1694-the maid shoulders . [He]156-pierson tried to stroke that hair , but [she]1694-the maid shook [her]1694-the maid head free , and [he]156-pierson stole out .

[She]1694-the maid did not come to breakfast ; and when [his]156-pierson own wretched meal was over , the mechanism of [his]156-pierson professional life caught [him]156-pierson again at once . New Year 's Day ! [He]156-pierson had much to do . [He]156-pierson had , before all , to be of a cheerful countenance before [[his]156-pierson flock]1139-his flock , to greet [all and any]1703-all and any with an air of hope and courage .

1

Thirza Pierson]137-thirza , seeing [[her]137-thirza brother - in - law]1704-her brother - in - law 's handwriting , naturally said : " Here 's a letter from [Ted]122-pierson . "[137-thirza]

[Bob Pierson]125-pierson , with a mouth full of sausage , as naturally responded :

" What does [he]133-cyril say ? "[125-pierson]

In reading on , [she]137-thirza found that to answer that question was one of the most difficult tasks ever set [her]137-thirza . Its news moved and disturbed [her]137-thirza deeply . Under [her]137-thirza wing this disaster had happened ! Down here had been wrought this most deplorable miracle , fraught with such dislocation of lives ! [Noel]197-noel 's face , absorbed and passionate , outside the door of [[her]137-thirza room]694-her room on the night when [Cyril Morland]133-cyril went away - [her]137-thirza instinct had been right !

" [He]133-cyril wants [you]197-noel to go up and stay with [him]133-cyril , [Bob]125-pierson . "[133-cyril]

" Why not both of [us]3847-us ? "[133-cyril]

" [He]133-cyril wants [Nollie]131-nollie to come down to [me]133-cyril ; [she]131-nollie 's not well . "[133-cyril]

" Not well ? What 's the matter ? "[133-cyril]

To tell [him]133-cyril seemed disloyalty to [her]137-thirza sex ; not to tell [him]133-cyril , disloyalty to [[her]137-thirza husband]554-her husband . A simple consideration of fact and not of principle , decided [her]137-thirza . [He]133-cyril would certainly say in a moment : ' Here ! Pitch it over ! ' and [she]137-thirza would have to . [She]137-thirza said tranquilly :

" [You]133-cyril remember that night when [Cyril Morland]133-cyril went away , and [Noel]197-noel behaved so strangely . Well , [[my]137-thirza dear]3031-my dear ; [she]137-thirza is going to have [a child]415-a child at the beginning of April . [The poor boy]3850-the poor boy is dead , [Bob]125-pierson ; [he]3850-the poor boy died for [the Country]334-the country . "[137-thirza]

[She]137-thirza saw the red tide flow up into [his]133-cyril face .

" What ! "[137-thirza]

" [Poor Edward]122-pierson is dreadfully upset . [We]3852-we must do what [we]3852-we can . [I]137-thirza blame [myself]137-thirza . "[137-thirza] By instinct [she]137-thirza used those words .

" Blame [yourself]133-cyril ? Stuff ! [That young]3853-that young - ! "[133-cyril] [He]133-cyril stopped .

[Thirza]137-thirza said quietly : " No , [Bob]125-pierson ; of the two , [I]137-thirza 'm sure it was [Noel]197-noel ; [she]3853-that young was desperate that day . Do n't [you]125-pierson remember [her]3853-that young face ? Oh ! this war ! It 's turned [the whole world]401-the whole world upside down . That 's the only comfort ; nothing 's normal . "[137-thirza]

[Bob Pierson]125-pierson possessed beyond [most men]371-most men the secret of happiness , for [he]133-cyril was always absorbed in the moment , to the point of unself - consciousness . Eating an egg , cutting down a tree , sitting on a Tribunal , making up [his]133-cyril accounts , planting potatoes , looking at the moon , riding [his]133-cyril cob , reading the Lessons - [no part of [him]133-cyril]1708-no part of him stood aside to see how [he]133-cyril was doing it , or wonder why [he]133-cyril was doing it , or not doing it better . [He]133-cyril grew like a cork - tree , and acted like a sturdy and well - natured dog . [His]133-cyril griefs , angers , and enjoyments were simple as [a child]415-a child 's , or as [his]133-cyril somewhat noisy slumbers . They were notably well - suited , for [Thirza]137-thirza had the same secret of happiness , though [her]137-thirza , absorption in the moment did not - as became [a woman]3280-a woman - prevent [her]137-thirza being conscious of [others]395-others ; indeed , such formed the chief subject of [her]137-thirza absorptions . [One]424-one might say that [they]1713-they neither of [them]1713-they had philosophy yet were as [philosophic a couple as one could meet on this earth of the self - conscious]1714-philosophic a couple as one could meet on this earth of the self - conscious . Daily life to [these two]1715-these two was still of simple savour . To be absorbed in life - the queer endless tissue of moments and things felt and done and said and made , the odd inspiriting conjunctions of [countless people]1716-countless people - was natural to [them]1716-countless people ; but [they]1716-countless people never thought whether [they]1716-countless people were absorbed or not , or had any particular attitude to Life or Death - a great blessing at the epoch in which [they]1716-countless people were living .

[Bob Pierson]125-pierson , then , paced [the room]517-the room , so absorbed in [his]125-pierson dismay and concern , that [he]125-pierson was almost happy .

" By [Jove]234-jove ! "[125-pierson] [he]125-pierson said , " what a ghastly thing ![125-pierson]
