" [Your]125-pierson coffee 's getting cold ! "[137-thirza] [she]137-thirza said .

" What do [you]125-pierson advise ? Shall [I]125-pierson go up , [heh]125-pierson ? "[125-pierson]

It was decided to put the plan into operation at mid - month , and [she]618-his wife bent all [her]618-his wife wits to instilling into [[her]618-his wife husband]554-her husband the thought that [a baby more or less]1721-a baby more or less was no great matter in [a world which already contained [twelve hundred million people]1723-twelve hundred million people]1722-a world which already contained twelve hundred million people . " Oh , bother ! "[137-thirza] said [Thirza]137-thirza with asperity .

The thought of sojourning in [town]1727-town for a spell was not unpleasant to [Bob Pierson]125-pierson . [His]125-pierson Tribunal work was over , [his]125-pierson early , potatoes in , and [he]125-pierson had visions of working for [the Country]334-the country , of being [a special constable]1729-a special constable , and dining at [[his]125-pierson Club]833-his club . The nearer [he]125-pierson was to the front , and the more [he]125-pierson could talk about the war , the greater the service [he]125-pierson felt [he]125-pierson would be doing . [He]125-pierson would ask for a job where [his]125-pierson brains would be of use . [He]125-pierson regretted keenly that [Thirza]137-thirza would n't be with [him]125-pierson ; a long separation like this would be a great trial . And [he]125-pierson would sigh and run [his]125-pierson fingers through [his]125-pierson whiskers . Still for [the Country]74-the country , and for [Nollie]131-nollie , [one]424-one must put up with it !

When [Thirza]137-thirza finally saw [him]125-pierson into [the train]580-the train , tears stood in the eyes of [both]1354-both , for [they]1354-both were honestly attached , and knew well enough that this job , once taken in hand , would have to be seen through ; a three months ' separation at least .

" [I]1735-i shall write every day . "[1735-i]

[She]1735-i went back to [the house]538-the house , emptied of [[her]1735-i husband]554-her husband , [daughter]1738-daughter , [boys]3438-boys , and [maids]1740-maids ; only the dogs left and [the old nurse whom [she]1735-i had taken into confidence]1741-the old nurse whom she had taken into confidence . Even in [that sheltered , wooded valley]1742-that sheltered , wooded valley it was very cold this winter . The birds hid [themselves]1743-themselves , not one flower bloomed , and [the red - brown river]1744-the red - brown river was full and swift . The sound of trees being felled for trench props , in the wood above [the house]538-the house resounded all day long in the frosty air . [She]1735-i meant to do the cooking [herself]1735-i ; and for the rest of the morning and early afternoon [she]1735-i concocted nice things , and thought out how [she]1735-i [herself]1735-i would feel if [she]1735-i were [Noel]197-noel and [Noel]197-noel [she]1746-she , so as to smooth out of the way anything which would hurt [the girl]525-the girl . In the afternoon [she]1735-i went down to [the station]474-the station in [the village car]1749-the village car , the same which had borne [Cyril Morland]133-cyril away that July night , for [[their]1750-their coachman]1751-their coachman had been taken for [the army]1752-the army , and the horses were turned out .

[Noel]197-noel looked tired and white , but calm - too calm . [Her]1735-i face seemed to [Thirza]137-thirza to have fined down , and with those brooding eyes , to be more beautiful . In [the car]3197-the car [she]1735-i possessed [herself]1735-i of [the girl]525-the girl 's hand , and squeezed it hard ; [their]1750-their only allusion to the situation , except [Noel]197-noel 's formal :

" Thank [you]137-thirza so much , [Auntie]152-auntie , for having [me]1735-i ; it 's most awfully sweet of [you]137-thirza and [Uncle Bob]141-uncle bob . "[1735-i]

" There 's [no one]3081-no one in [the house]538-the house , [[my]1735-i dear]3031-my dear , except [old Nurse]235-nurse . It 'll be very dull for [you]525-the girl ; but [I]1735-i thought [I]1735-i 'd teach [you]525-the girl to cook ; it 's rather useful . "[1735-i]

The smile which slipped on to [Noel]197-noel 's face gave [Thirza]137-thirza quite a turn .

[She]1735-i had assigned [the girl]525-the girl [a different room]1756-a different room , and had made [it]1756-a different room extraordinarily cheerful with a log fire , chrysanthemums , bright copper candlesticks , warming - pans , and such like .

[She]1735-i went up with [her]1735-i at bedtime , and standing before the fire , said :

" [You]525-the girl know , [Nollie]131-nollie , [I]1735-i absolutely refuse to regard this as any sort of tragedy . To bring life into [the worlds]3872-the worlds in these days , no matter how , ought to make [anyone]3200-anyone happy . [I]1735-i only wish [I]1735-i could do it again , then [I]1735-i should feel some use . Good night [dear]3030-dear ; and if [you]3030-dear want anything , knock on the wall . [I]1735-i 'm next door . "[1735-i] [She]1735-i saw that [the girl]525-the girl was greatly moved , underneath [her]525-the girl pale mask ; and went out astonished at [[her]1735-i niece]521-her niece 's powers of self - control .

But [she]1735-i did not sleep at all well ; for in imagination , [she]1735-i kept on seeing [Noel]197-noel turning from side to side in the big bed , and those great eyes of [hers]1735-i staring at the dark .

2

The meeting of [the brothers Pierson]137-thirza took place at the dinner - hour , and was characterised by a truly English lack of display . [They]1759-they were so extremely different , and had been together so little since early days in [[their]1759-they old [Buckinghamshire]76-buckinghamshire home]1760-their old buckinghamshire home , that [they]1759-they were [practically strangers]1761-practically strangers , with just the potent link of far - distant memories in common . It was of these [they]1759-they talked , and about the war . On this subject [they]1759-they agreed in the large , and differed in the narrow . For instance , both thought [they]1759-they knew about [Germany]77-germany and [other countries]1762-other countries , and neither of course had any real knowledge of [any country outside [their]1759-they own]1763-any country outside their own ; for , though [both]1354-both had passed through [considerable tracts of foreign ground]1765-considerable tracts of foreign ground at one time or another , [they]1759-they had never remarked anything except [its]1766-its surface , - [its]1766-its churches , and its sunsets . Again , [both]1354-both assumed that [they]1759-they were [democrats]1768-democrats , but neither knew the meaning of the word , nor felt that [the working man]1769-the working man could be really trusted ; and both revered [Church]236-church and , [King]237-king : [Both]1354-both disliked conscription , but considered it necessary . Both favoured Home Rule for [Ireland]32-ireland , but neither thought it possible to grant it . [Both]1354-both wished for the war to end , but were for prosecuting it to Victory , and neither knew what [they]1759-they meant by that word . So much for the large . On the narrower issues , such as strategy , and the personality of [[their]1759-they country 's leaders]1772-their country 's leaders , [they]1759-they were opposed . [Edward]122-pierson was [a Westerner]1773-a westerner , [Robert]123-robert [an Easterner]1774-an easterner , as was natural in [one who had lived twenty - five years in [Ceylon]8-ceylon]1775-one who had lived twenty - five years in ceylon . [Edward]122-pierson favoured [the fallen government]1776-the fallen government , [Robert the risen]123-robert . [Neither]1777-neither had any particular reasons for [their]1759-they partisanship except what [he]122-pierson had read in the journals . After all - what other reasons could [they]1759-they have had ? [Edward]122-pierson disliked [the Harmsworth Press]78-the harmsworth press ; [Robert]123-robert thought it was doing good . [Robert]123-robert was explosive , and rather vague ; [Edward]122-pierson dreamy , and a little didactic . [Robert]123-robert thought poor [Ted]122-pierson looking like a ghost ; [Edward]122-pierson thought poor [Bob]141-uncle bob looking like the setting sun . [Their]1759-they faces were indeed as curiously contrasted as [their]1759-they views and voices ; the pale - dark , hollowed , narrow face of [Edward]122-pierson , with its short , pointed beard , and the red - skinned , broad , full , whiskered face of [Robert]123-robert . [They]1759-they parted for the night with an affectionate hand - clasp . So began a queer partnership which consisted , as the days went on , of half an hour 's companionship at breakfast , each reading the paper ; and of dinner together perhaps three times a week . [Each]238-each thought [[his]238-each brother]327-his brother very odd , but continued to hold the highest opinion of [him]327-his brother . And , behind it all , the deep tribal sense that [they]1759-they stood together in trouble , grew . But of that trouble [they]1759-they never spoke , though not seldom [Robert]123-robert would lower [his]123-robert journal , and above the glasses perched on [his]123-robert well - shaped nose , contemplate [[his]123-robert brother]327-his brother , and a little frown of sympathy would ridge [his]123-robert forehead between [his]123-robert bushy eyebrows . And once in a way [he]123-robert would catch [Edward]122-pierson 's eyes coming off duty from [his]123-robert journal , to look , not at [[his]123-robert brother]327-his brother , but at - the skeleton ; when that happened , [Robert]123-robert would adjust [his]123-robert glasses hastily , damn the newspaper type , and apologise to [Edward]122-pierson for swearing . And [he]123-robert would think : ' [Poor Ted]122-pierson ! [He]122-pierson ought to drink port , and - and enjoy [himself]122-pierson , and forget it . What a pity [he]122-pierson 's [a parson]956-a parson ! '

In [his]123-robert letters to [Thirza]137-thirza [he]123-robert would deplore [Edward]122-pierson 's asceticism . " [He]122-pierson eats nothing , [he]122-pierson drinks nothing , [he]122-pierson smokes a miserable cigarette once in a blue moon . [He]122-pierson 's as lonely as [a coot]3875-a coot ; it 's a thousand pities [he]122-pierson ever lost [[his]122-pierson wife]618-his wife . [I]123-robert expect to see [his]122-pierson wings sprout any day ; but - dash it all [I]123-robert - [I]123-robert do n't believe [he]122-pierson 's got the flesh to grow them on . Send [him]122-pierson up some clotted cream ; [I]123-robert 'll see if [I]123-robert can get [him]122-pierson to eat it . "[123-robert] When the cream came , [he]123-robert got [Edward]122-pierson to eat some the first morning , and at tea time found that [he]123-robert had finished it [himself]123-robert . " [We]3877-we never talk about [Nollie]131-nollie , "[123-robert] [he]123-robert wrote , " [I]123-robert 'm always meaning to have it out with [him]122-pierson and tell [him]122-pierson to buck up , but when it comes to the point [I]123-robert dry up ; because , after all , [I]123-robert feel it too ; it sticks in [my]123-robert gizzard horribly . [We]3877-we Piersons are pretty old , and [we]3877-we 've always been respectable , ever since [St. Bartholomew]239-st. bartholomew , when [that Huguenot chap]3878-that huguenot chap came over and founded [us]3877-we . [The only black sheep]3879-the only black sheep [I]123-robert ever heard of is [Cousin Leila]208-leila . By the way , [I]123-robert saw [her]208-leila the other day ; [she]208-leila came round [here]3149-here to see [Ted]122-pierson . [I]123-robert remember going to stay with [her]208-leila and [[her]208-leila first husband]3881-her first husband ; [young Fane]179-young fane , at [Simla]180-simla , when [I]123-robert was coming [home]3048-home , just before [we]3877-we were married . Phew ! That was [a queer menage]3883-a queer menage ; [all the young chaps]3884-all the young chaps fluttering round [her]208-leila , and [young Fane]179-young fane looking like [a cynical ghost]3885-a cynical ghost . [Even]3886-even now [she]208-leila ca n't help setting [her]208-leila cap a little at [Ted]122-pierson , and [he]122-pierson swallows [her]208-leila whole ; thinks [her]208-leila [a devoted creature reformed to the nines with [[her]208-leila hospital]3051-her hospital and all that]3887-a devoted creature reformed to the nines with her hospital and all that . [Poor old Ted]122-pierson ; [he]122-pierson is [the most dreamy chap that ever was]3889-the most dreamy chap that ever was . "[123-robert]

" [We]3877-we have had [Gratian]127-gratian and [[her]127-gratian husband]554-her husband up for the week - end , "[1782-i] [he]1782-i wrote a little later ; " [I]1782-i do n't like [her]127-gratian so well as [Nollie]131-nollie ; too serious and downright for [me]1782-i . [[Her]127-gratian husband]554-her husband seems [a sensible fellow]3892-a sensible fellow , though ; but [the devil of a free - thinker]3893-the devil of a free - thinker . [She]208-leila 's sweet on [him]3894-a man called fort , [I]1782-i could see with half an eye , but poor old [Ted]122-pierson ca n't . [The doctor]3143-the doctor and [Ted]122-pierson talked up [hill and down dale]3896-hill and down dale . [The doctor]3143-the doctor said a thing which struck [me]1782-i . ' What divides [us]3877-we from the beasts ? Will power : nothing else . What 's this war , really , but a death carnival of proof that [man]631-man 's will is invincible ? ' [I]1782-i stuck it down to tell [you]1782-i , when [I]1782-i got [upstairs]1153-upstairs . [He]122-pierson 's [a clever fellow]3900-a clever fellow . But not till the middle of March , when [the brothers]1783-the brothers had been sitting opposite [each other]493-each other at meals for two months , was the subject broached between [them]1783-the brothers , and then not by [Robert]123-robert . [Edward]122-pierson , standing by the hearth after dinner , in [his]122-pierson familiar attitude , one foot on the fender , one hand grasping the mantel - shelf , and [his]122-pierson eyes fixed on the flames , said : " [I]122-pierson 've never asked [your]123-robert forgiveness , [Bob]141-uncle bob . "[122-pierson]

[Robert]123-robert , lingering at the table over [his]123-robert glass of port , started , looked at [Edward]122-pierson 's back in [its parson]1785-its parson 's coat , and answered :

" [[My]123-robert dear old chap]3902-my dear old chap ! "[123-robert]

" It has been very difficult to speak of this . "[123-robert]

" Of course , of course ! "[123-robert] And there was a silence , while [Robert]123-robert 's eyes travelled round the walls for inspiration . [They]1783-the brothers encountered only the effigies of past Piersons very oily works , and fell back on the dining - table . [Edward]122-pierson went on speaking to the fire :

" It still seems to [me]122-pierson incredible . Day and night [I]122-pierson think of what it 's [my]122-pierson duty to do . "[122-pierson]

" Nothing ! "[123-robert] ejaculated [Robert]123-robert . " Leave [the baby]3827-the baby with [Thirza]137-thirza ; [we]1783-the brothers 'll take care of [it]3827-the baby , and when [Nollie]131-nollie 's fit , let [her]131-nollie go back to work in [a hospital]3399-a hospital again . '

[Edward]122-pierson turned round on [him]327-his brother : " That is very sweet of [you]327-his brother both , but it would be wrong and cowardly for [me]122-pierson to allow it . "[122-pierson]

The resentment which springs up in [fathers]1787-fathers when [other fathers]1788-other fathers dispose of young lives , rose in [Robert]123-robert .

" Dash it all , [[my]122-pierson dear]3031-my dear [Ted]122-pierson , that 's for [Nollie]131-nollie to say . [She]131-nollie 's [a woman]3280-a woman now , remember . "[122-pierson]

A smile went straying about in the shadows of [[his]122-pierson brother]327-his brother 's face . " [A woman]3280-a woman ? [Little Nollie]131-nollie ! "[122-pierson] [He]122-pierson hid [his]122-pierson lips with [his]122-pierson hand , and turned again to the flames . [Robert]123-robert felt a lump in [his]123-robert throat . " Oh ! Hang it , [old boy]3909-old boy , [I]123-robert do n't think that . What else could [you]3909-old boy have done ? [You]3909-old boy take too much on [yourself]3909-old boy . After all , [they]3908-my girls 're [fine girls]3910-fine girls . [I]123-robert 'm sure [Nollie]131-nollie 's [a darling]3041-a darling . It 's these modern notions , and this war . Cheer up ! It 'll all dry straight . "[123-robert] [He]123-robert went up to [[his]123-robert brother]327-his brother and put a hand on [his]327-his brother shoulder . [Edward]122-pierson seemed to stiffen under that touch .

" Nothing comes straight , "[122-pierson] [he]122-pierson said , " unless it 's faced ; [you]123-robert know that , [Bob]141-uncle bob . "[122-pierson]

[Robert]123-robert 's face was a study at that moment . [His]123-robert cheeks filled and collapsed again like a dog 's when it has been rebuked . [His]123-robert colour deepened , and [he]123-robert rattled some money in a trouser pocket .

" Something in that , of course , "[123-robert] [he]123-robert said gruffly . " All the same , the decision 's with [Nollie]131-nollie . [We]3912-we 'll see what [Thirza]137-thirza says . Anyway , there 's no hurry . [It]3913-it 's a thousand pities [you]123-robert 're [a parson]956-a parson ; the trouble 's enough without that : "[123-robert]

[Edward]122-pierson shook [his]122-pierson head . " [My]122-pierson position is nothing ; it 's the thought of [[my]122-pierson child]3086-my child , [[my]122-pierson wife]3270-my wife 's child . It 's sheer pride ; and [I]122-pierson ca n't subdue it . [I]122-pierson ca n't fight it down . God forgive [me]122-pierson , [I]122-pierson rebel . "[122-pierson]

And [Robert]123-robert thought : ' By [George]140-george , [he]140-george does take it to heart ! Well , so should [I]0-i ! [I]0-i do , as it is ! ' [He]123-robert took out [his]123-robert pipe , and filled it , pushing the tobacco down and down .

" [I]327-his brother 'm not [a man of [the world]606-the world]3917-a man of the world , "[327-his brother] [he]123-robert heard [[his]123-robert brother]327-his brother say ; " [I]327-his brother 'm out of touch with many things . It 's almost unbearable to [me]327-his brother to feel that [I]327-his brother 'm joining with [the world]606-the world to condemn [[my]327-his brother own daughter]3920-my own daughter ; not for [their]3921-their reasons , perhaps - [I]327-his brother do n't know ; [I]327-his brother hope not , but still , [I]327-his brother 'm against [her]3920-my own daughter . "[327-his brother]

[Robert]123-robert lit [his]123-robert pipe .

" Steady , [old man]3922-old man ! "[123-robert] [he]123-robert said . " It 's a misfortune . But if [I]123-robert were [you]3922-old man [I]123-robert should feel : ' [She]3920-my own daughter 's done a wild , silly thing , but , hang it , if [anybody]3599-anybody says a word against [her]3920-my own daughter , [I]123-robert 'll wring [his]3599-anybody neck . ' And what 's more , [you]3922-old man 'll feel much the same , when it comes to the point . "[123-robert] [He]123-robert emitted a huge puff of smoke , which obscured [[his]123-robert brother]327-his brother 's face , and the blood , buzzing in [his]123-robert temples , seemed to thicken the sound of [Edward]122-pierson 's voice .

" [I]123-robert do n't know ; [I]123-robert 've tried to see clearly . [I]123-robert have prayed to be shown what [her]3920-my own daughter duty is , and [mine]123-robert . It seems to [me]123-robert there can be no peace for [her]3920-my own daughter until [she]3920-my own daughter has atoned , by open suffering ; that [the world]606-the world 's judgment is [her]3920-my own daughter cross , and [she]3920-my own daughter must bear it ; especially in these days , when all [the world]606-the world is facing suffering so nobly . And then it seems so hard - so bitter ; [[my]123-robert poor little Nollie]3926-my poor little nollie ! "[123-robert]

There was a silence , broken only by the gurgling of [Robert]123-robert 's pipe , till [he]123-robert said abruptly :

" [I]123-robert do n't follow [you]327-his brother , [Ted]122-pierson ; no , [I]123-robert do n't . [I]123-robert think [a man]3326-a man should screen [[his]3326-a man children]1232-his children all [he]3326-a man can . Talk to [her]3920-my own daughter as [you]327-his brother like , but do n't let [the world]606-the world do it . Dash it , [the world]606-the world 's [a rotten gabbling place]3931-a rotten gabbling place . [I]123-robert call [myself]123-robert [a man of [the world]606-the world]3917-a man of the world , but when it comes to private matters - well , then [I]123-robert draw the line . It seems to [me]123-robert it seems to [me]123-robert inhuman . What does [George Laird]140-george think about it ? [He]140-george 's [a knowing chap]3934-a knowing chap . [I]123-robert suppose [you]122-pierson 've - no , [I]123-robert suppose [you]122-pierson have n't - "[123-robert] For a peculiar smile had come on [Edward]122-pierson 's face .

" No , "[122-pierson] [he]122-pierson said , " [I]122-pierson should hardly ask [George Laird]140-george 's opinion . "[122-pierson]

And [Robert]123-robert realised suddenly the stubborn loneliness of that thin black figure , whose fingers were playing with a little gold cross . ' By [Jove]234-jove ! ' [he]123-robert thought , ' [I]0-i believe [old Ted]122-pierson 's like one of [those Eastern chaps who go into [lonely places]1794-lonely places]1793-those eastern chaps who go into lonely places . [He]122-pierson 's got [himself]122-pierson surrounded by visions of things that are n't there . [He]122-pierson lives in unreality - something [we]1795-we ca n't understand . [I]0-i should n't be surprised if [he]122-pierson heard voices , like - ' who was it ? [Tt]241-tt , tt ! What a pity ! ' [Ted]122-pierson was deceptive . [He]122-pierson was gentle and - all that , [a gentleman]1610-a gentleman of course , and that disguised [him]122-pierson ; but underneath ; what was there - [a regular ascetic]1797-a regular ascetic , [a fakir]1798-a fakir ! And a sense of bewilderment , of dealing with something which [he]122-pierson could not grasp , beset [Bob Pierson]125-pierson , so that [he]122-pierson went back to the table , and sat down again beside [his]122-pierson port .

" It seems to [me]122-pierson , "[122-pierson] [he]122-pierson said rather gruffly , " that the chicken had better be hatched before [we]3935-we count it . "[122-pierson] And then , sorry for [his]122-pierson brusqueness , emptied [his]122-pierson glass . As the fluid passed over [his]122-pierson palate , [he]122-pierson thought : ' [Poor old Ted]122-pierson ! [He]122-pierson does n't even drink - has n't a pleasure in life , so far as [I]0-i can see , except doing [his]122-pierson duty , and does n't even seem to know what that is . There are n't many like [him]122-pierson - luckily ! And yet [I]0-i love [him]122-pierson - [pathetic chap]1799-pathetic chap ! '

[The " pathetic chap]3936-the " pathetic chap "[3936-the " pathetic chap] was still staring at the flames . 3

And at this very hour , when [the brothers]1783-the brothers were talking - for thought and feeling do pass mysteriously over the invisible wires of space [[Cyril Morland]133-cyril 's son]1801-cyril morland 's son was being born of [Noel]197-noel , a little before [his]133-cyril time .

PART III

[I]0-i

Down by [the River Wye]80-the river wye , among plum - trees in blossom , [Noel]197-noel had laid [[her]1802-her baby]1803-her baby in a hammock , and stood reading a letter :

" [[MY]197-noel DEAREST]3937-my dearest [NOLLIE]131-nollie ,[197-noel]

" Now that [you]131-nollie are strong again , [I]197-noel feel that [I]197-noel must put before [you]131-nollie [my]197-noel feeling as to [your]131-nollie duty in this crisis of [your]131-nollie life . [[Your]131-nollie aunt]3089-your aunt and [uncle]3939-uncle have made the most kind and generous offer to adopt [[your]131-nollie little boy]3940-your little boy . [I]197-noel have known that this was in [their]3941-their minds for some time , and have thought it over day and night for weeks . In the worldly sense it would be the best thing , no doubt . But this is a spiritual matter . The future of [our]3942-our souls depends on how [we]3942-our meet the consequences of [our]3942-our conduct . And painful , dreadful , indeed , as they must be , [I]197-noel am driven to feel that [you]131-nollie can only reach true peace by facing [them]3941-their in a spirit of brave humility . [I]197-noel want [you]131-nollie to think and think - till [you]131-nollie arrive at a certainty which satisfies [your]131-nollie conscience . If [you]131-nollie decide , as [I]197-noel trust [you]131-nollie will , to come back to [me]197-noel here with [[your]131-nollie boy]3567-your boy , [I]197-noel shall do all in [my]197-noel power to make [you]131-nollie happy while [we]3942-our face the future together . To do as [[your]131-nollie aunt]3089-your aunt and [uncle]3939-uncle in [their]3941-their kindness wish , would , [I]197-noel am sore afraid , end in depriving [you]131-nollie of the inner strength and happiness which [God]143-god only gives to [those who do [their]3946-those who do their duty and try courageously to repair their errors duty and try courageously to repair [their]3946-those who do their duty and try courageously to repair their errors errors]3946-those who do their duty and try courageously to repair their errors . [I]197-noel have confidence in [you]131-nollie , [[my]197-noel dear child]3947-my dear child .[197-noel]

" Ever [[your]131-nollie most loving father]3948-your most loving father ,[197-noel]

" [EDWARD PIERSON]122-pierson . "[1804-she]

[She]1804-she read it through a second time , and looked at [[her]1804-she baby]1803-her baby . [Daddy]132-daddy seemed to think that [she]1804-she might be willing to part from [this wonderful creature]1806-this wonderful creature ! Sunlight fell through the plum blossom , in an extra patchwork quilt over the bundle lying there , touched [the baby]3827-the baby 's nose and mouth , so that [he]3827-the baby sneezed . [Noel]197-noel laughed , and put [her]1804-she lips close to [his]3827-the baby face . ' Give [you]3827-the baby up ! ' [she]1804-she thought : ' Oh , no ! And [I]0-i 'm going to be happy too . [They]1808-they sha n't stop [me]0-i :

In answer to the letter [she]1804-she said simply that [she]1804-she was coming up ; and a week later [she]1804-she went , to the dismay of [[her]1804-she uncle]692-her uncle and [aunt]1810-aunt . [The old nurse]1811-the old nurse went too . Everything had hitherto been so carefully watched and guarded against by [Thirza]137-thirza , that [Noel]197-noel did not really come face to face with [her]1804-she position till [she]1804-she reached [home]3048-home .

[Gratian]127-gratian , who had managed to get transferred to [a London Hospital]1813-a london hospital , was now living at [home]3048-home . [She]127-gratian had provided [the house]538-the house with [new maids]1816-new maids against [[her]127-gratian sister]1362-her sister 's return ; and though [Noel]197-noel was relieved not to meet [[her]1804-she old familiars]1818-her old familiars , [she]1804-she encountered with difficulty the stolid curiosity of new faces . That morning before [she]1804-she left [Kestrel]199-kestrel , [[her]1804-she aunt]695-her aunt had come into [[her]1804-she room]694-her room while [she]1804-she was dressing , taken [her]1804-she left hand and slipped a little gold band on to its third finger . " To please [me]695-her aunt , [Nollie]131-nollie , now that [you]131-nollie 're going , just for the foolish , who know nothing about [you]131-nollie . "[695-her aunt]

[Noel]197-noel had suffered it with the thought : ' It 's all very silly ! ' But now , when [the new maid]1821-the new maid was pouring out [her]1821-the new maid hot water , [she]1821-the new maid was suddenly aware of [the girl]525-the girl 's round blue eyes wandering , as it were , mechanically to [her]1821-the new maid hand . This little hoop of gold , then , had an awful power ! A rush of disgust came over [her]1804-she . All life seemed suddenly a thing of forms and sham . [Everybody]242-everybody then would look at that little ring ; and [she]1804-she was [a coward]1823-a coward , saving [herself]1804-she from [them]242-everybody ! When [she]1804-she was alone again , [she]1804-she slipped it off , and laid it on [the washstand]1824-the washstand , where the sunlight fell . Only this little shining band of metal , this little yellow ring , stood between [her]1804-she and [the world]606-the world 's hostile scorn ! [Her]1804-she lips trembled . [She]1804-she took up the ring , and went to the open window ; to throw it out . But [she]1804-she did not , uncertain and unhappy - half realising the cruelty of life . A knock at the door sent [her]1804-she flying back to [the washstand]1824-the washstand . [The visitor]1112-the visitor was [Gratian]127-gratian .

" [I]127-gratian 've been looking at [him]1112-the visitor , "[127-gratian] [she]127-gratian said softly ; " [he]1112-the visitor 's like [you]1804-she , [Nollie]131-nollie , except for [his]1112-the visitor nose . "[127-gratian]

" [He]1112-the visitor 's hardly got one yet . But are n't [his]1112-the visitor eyes intelligent ? [I]127-gratian think they 're wonderful . "[127-gratian] [She]127-gratian held up the ring : " What shall [I]127-gratian do about this , [Gratian]127-gratian ? "[127-gratian]

[Gratian]127-gratian flushed . " Wear it . [I]127-gratian do n't see why [outsiders]3949-outsiders should know . For the sake of [Dad]158-dad [I]127-gratian think [you]1804-she ought . There 's [the parish]1643-the parish . "[127-gratian]

[Noel]197-noel slipped the ring back on to [her]127-gratian finger . " Would [you]127-gratian ? "[197-noel]

" [I]127-gratian ca n't tell . [I]127-gratian think [I]127-gratian would . "[127-gratian]

[Noel]197-noel laughed suddenly . " [I]197-noel 'm going to get cynical ; [I]197-noel can feel it in [my]197-noel bones . How is [Daddy]132-daddy looking ? "[197-noel]

" Very thin ; [Mr. Lauder]212-mr. lauder is back again from the Front for a bit , and taking some of the work now . "[197-noel]

" Do [I]197-noel hurt [him]132-daddy very much still ? "[197-noel]

" [He]132-daddy 's awfully pleased that [you]197-noel 've come . [He]132-daddy 's as sweet as [he]132-daddy can be about [you]197-noel . "[197-noel]

" Yes , "[197-noel] murmured [Noel]197-noel , " that 's what 's dreadful . [I]197-noel 'm glad [he]132-daddy was n't in when [I]197-noel came . Has [he]132-daddy told [anyone]3200-anyone ? "[197-noel]

[Gratian]127-gratian shook [her]127-gratian head . " [I]127-gratian do n't think [anybody]3599-anybody knows ; unless - perhaps [Captain Fort]197-noel . [He]197-noel came in again the other night ; and somehow - "[127-gratian]

[Noel]197-noel flushed . " [Leila]208-leila ! "[127-gratian] [she]127-gratian said enigmatically . " Have [you]197-noel seen [her]208-leila ? "[127-gratian]

" [I]127-gratian went to [[her]208-leila flat]3953-her flat last week with [Dad]158-dad - [he]132-daddy likes [her]208-leila . "[127-gratian]

" [Delilah]243-delilah is [her]208-leila real name , [you]197-noel know . [All men]3954-all men like [her]208-leila . And [Captain Fort]197-noel is [[her]208-leila lover]3955-her lover . "[127-gratian]

[Gratian]127-gratian gasped . [Noel]197-noel would say things sometimes which made [her]127-gratian feel the younger of [the two]651-the two .

" Of course [he]197-noel is , "[197-noel] went on [Noel]197-noel in a hard voice . " [She]208-leila has [no men friends]3956-no men friends ; [[her]208-leila sort]3957-her sort never have , only [lovers]3958-lovers . Why do [you]197-noel think [he]197-noel knows about [me]197-noel ? "[197-noel]

" When [he]197-noel asked after [you]197-noel [he]197-noel looked - "[127-gratian]

" Yes ; [I]197-noel 've seen [him]197-noel look like that when [he]197-noel 's sorry for anything . [I]197-noel do n't care . Has [Monsieur Lavendie]221-lavendie been in lately ? "[197-noel]

" Yes ; [he]197-noel looks awfully unhappy . "[127-gratian]

" [[His]197-noel wife]618-his wife drugs . "[197-noel]

" Oh , [Nollie]131-nollie ! How do [you]197-noel know ? "[127-gratian]

" [I]197-noel saw [her]208-leila once ; [I]197-noel 'm sure [she]208-leila does ; there was a smell ; and [she]208-leila 's got wandering eyes that go all glassy . [He]197-noel can paint [me]197-noel now , if [he]197-noel likes . [I]197-noel would n't let [him]197-noel before . Does [he]197-noel know ? "[197-noel]

" Of course not . "[127-gratian]

" [He]197-noel knows there was something ; [he]197-noel 's got second sight , [I]197-noel think . But [I]197-noel mind [him]197-noel less than [anybody]3599-anybody . Is [his]197-noel picture of [Daddy]132-daddy good ? "[197-noel]

" Powerful , but it hurts , somehow . "[127-gratian]

" Let 's go down and see it . "[197-noel]

The picture was hung in [the drawing - room]1382-the drawing - room , and its intense modernity made [that old - fashioned room]1830-that old - fashioned room seem lifeless and strange . [The black figure , with long pale fingers touching the paler piano keys]1831-the black figure , with long pale fingers touching the paler piano keys , had a frightening actuality . The face , three - quarters full , was raised as if for inspiration , and the eyes rested , dreamy and unseeing , on the face of [a girl painted and hung on a background of wall above the piano]1832-a girl painted and hung on a background of wall above the piano .

" It 's the face of [that girl]1272-that girl , "[127-gratian] said [Gratian]127-gratian , when [they]1833-they had looked at the picture for some time in silence :

" No , "[197-noel] said [Noel]197-noel , " it 's the look in [his]197-noel eyes . "[197-noel]

" But why did [he]197-noel choose such [a horrid , common girl]3962-a horrid , common girl ? Is n't [she]1272-that girl fearfully alive , though ? [She]1272-that girl looks as if [she]1272-that girl were saying : ' Cheerio ! ' "[127-gratian]

" [She]1272-that girl is ; it 's awfully pathetic , [I]197-noel think . [Poor Daddy]132-daddy ! "[197-noel]

" It 's a libel , "[127-gratian] said [Gratian]127-gratian stubbornly .

" No . That 's what hurts . [He]197-noel is n't quite - quite all there . Will [he]197-noel be coming in soon ? "[197-noel]

[Gratian]127-gratian took [her]1834-her arm , and pressed it hard . " Would [you]197-noel like [me]127-gratian at dinner or not ; [I]127-gratian can easily be out ? "[127-gratian]

[Noel]197-noel shook [her]1834-her head . " It 's no good to funk it . [He]197-noel wanted [me]197-noel , and now [he]197-noel 's got [me]197-noel . Oh ! why did [he]197-noel ? It 'll be awful for [him]197-noel . "[197-noel]

[Gratian]127-gratian sighed . " [I]127-gratian 've tried [my]127-gratian best , but [he]197-noel always said : ' [I]127-gratian 've thought so long about it all that [I]127-gratian ca n't think any longer . [I]127-gratian can only feel the braver course is the best . When things are bravely and humbly met , there will be charity and forgiveness . ' "[127-gratian]

" There wo n't , "[197-noel] said [Noel]197-noel , " [Daddy]132-daddy 's [a saint]3751-a saint , and [he]197-noel does n't see . "[197-noel]

" Yes , [he]197-noel is [a saint]3751-a saint . But [one]424-one must think for [oneself]424-one - [one]424-one simply must . [I]127-gratian ca n't believe as [he]197-noel does , any more ; can [you]3967-you , [Nollie]131-nollie ? "[127-gratian]

" [I]197-noel do n't know . When [I]197-noel was going through it , [I]197-noel prayed ; but [I]197-noel do n't know whether [I]197-noel really believed . [I]197-noel do n't think [I]197-noel mind much about that , one way or the other . "[197-noel]

" [I]127-gratian mind terribly , "[127-gratian] said [Gratian]127-gratian , " [I]127-gratian want the truth . "[127-gratian]

" [I]197-noel do n't know what [I]197-noel want , "[197-noel] said [Noel]197-noel slowly , " except that sometimes [I]197-noel want - life ; awfully . "[197-noel]

And [the two sisters]1359-the two sisters were silent , looking at [each other]493-each other with a sort of wonder .

[Noel]197-noel had a fancy to put on a bright - coloured blue frock that evening , and at [her]1837-her neck [she]1837-her hung a Breton cross of old paste , which had belonged to [[her]1837-her mother]377-her mother . When [she]1837-her had finished dressing [she]1837-her went into [the nursery]1839-the nursery and stood by [the baby]3827-the baby 's cot . [The old nurse who was sitting there beside [him]197-noel]1841-the old nurse who was sitting there beside him , got up at once and said :

" [He]3827-the baby 's sleeping beautiful - the lamb . [I]1837-her 'll go down and get a cup o ' tea , and come up , [ma'am]3968-ma'am , when the gong goes . "[1837-her] In the way peculiar to those who have never to initiate , but only to support positions in which [they]1842-they are placed by [others]395-others , [she]1837-her had adopted for [herself]1837-her the theory that [Noel]197-noel was [a real war - widow]1844-a real war - widow . [She]1837-her knew the truth perfectly ; for [she]1837-her had watched that hurried little romance at [Kestrel]199-kestrel , but by dint of charity and blurred meditations it was easy for [her]1837-her to imagine the marriage ceremony which would and should have taken place ; and [she]1837-her was zealous that [other people]3542-other people should imagine it too . It was so much more regular and natural like that , and " [[her]1837-her "[1837-her] baby]3969-her " baby invested with [his]3827-the baby proper dignity . [She]1837-her went [downstairs]1846-downstairs to get a " cup o ' tea , "[1837-her] thinking : ' A picture [they]1847-they make - that [they]1847-they do , bless [his]3827-the baby little heart ; and [[his]3827-the baby pretty little mother]1848-his pretty little mother - no more than [a child]415-a child , all said and done . '

[Noel]197-noel had been standing there some minutes in the failing light , absorbed in the face of [the sleeping baby]1850-the sleeping baby , when , raising [her]1837-her eyes , [she]1837-her saw in a mirror the refection of [[her]1837-her father]384-her father 's dark figure by the door . [She]1837-her could hear [him]384-her father breathing as if the ascent of the stairs had tired [him]384-her father ; and moving to the head of the cot , [she]1837-her rested [her]1837-her hand on it , and turned [her]1837-her face towards [him]384-her father . [He]384-her father came up and stood beside [her]1837-her , looking silently down at [the baby]3827-the baby . [She]1837-her saw [him]384-her father make the sign of the Cross above it , and the movement of [his]384-her father lips in prayer . Love for [[her]1837-her father]384-her father , and rebellion against this intercession for [[her]1837-her perfect baby]1854-her perfect baby fought so hard in [the girl]525-the girl 's heart that [she]1837-her felt suffocated , and glad of the dark , so that [he]384-her father could not see [her]1837-her eyes . Then [he]384-her father took [her]1837-her hand and put it to [his]384-her father lips , but still without a word ; and for the life of [her]1837-her [she]1837-her could not speak either . In silence , [he]384-her father kissed [her]1837-her forehead ; and there mounted in [Noel]197-noel a sudden passion of longing to show [him]384-her father [her]1837-her pride and love for [[her]1837-her baby]1803-her baby . [She]1837-her put [her]1837-her finger down and touched one of [his]384-her father hands . The tiny sleeping fingers uncurled and , like some little sea anemone , clutched round it . [She]1837-her heard [[her]1837-her father]384-her father draw [his]384-her father breath in ; saw [him]384-her father turn away quickly , silently , and go out . And [she]1837-her stayed , hardly breathing , with the hand of [[her]1837-her baby]1803-her baby squeezing [her]1837-her finger .

II

1

When [Edward Pierson]122-pierson , afraid of [his]122-pierson own emotion , left [the twilit nursery]1859-the twilit nursery , [he]122-pierson slipped into [[his]122-pierson own room]1860-his own room , and fell on [his]122-pierson knees beside [his]122-pierson bed , absorbed in the vision [he]122-pierson had seen . [That young figure in Madonna blue , with the halo of bright hair]1861-that young figure in madonna blue , with the halo of bright hair ; [the sleeping babe in the fine dusk]1862-the sleeping babe in the fine dusk ; the silence , the adoration in [that white room]1863-that white room ! [He]122-pierson saw , too ; a vision of the past , when [Noel]197-noel [herself]197-noel had been [the sleeping babe within [[her]1837-her mother]377-her mother 's arm]1864-the sleeping babe within her mother 's arm , and [he]122-pierson had stood beside [them]1866-them , wondering and giving praise . It passed with its other - worldliness and the fine holiness which belongs to beauty , passed and left the tormenting realism of life . Ah ! to live with only the inner meaning , spiritual and beautifed , in a rare wonderment such as [he]122-pierson had experienced just now !

[His]122-pierson alarum clock , while [he]122-pierson knelt in [[his]122-pierson narrow , monkish little room]1867-his narrow , monkish little room - ticked the evening hour away into darkness . And still [he]122-pierson knelt , dreading to come back into it all , to face [the world]606-the world 's eyes , and the sound of [the world]606-the world 's tongue , and the touch of the rough , the gross , the unseemly . How could [he]122-pierson guard [[his]122-pierson child]662-his child ? How preserve that vision in [her]662-his child life , in [her]662-his child spirit , about to enter such cold , rough waters ? But the gong sounded ; [he]122-pierson got up , and went [downstairs]1846-downstairs .

But this first family moment , which [all]1872-all had dreaded , was relieved , as dreaded moments so often are , by the unexpected appearance of [the Belgian painter]1873-the belgian painter . [He]122-pierson had a general invitation , of which [he]122-pierson often availed [himself]122-pierson ; but [he]122-pierson was so silent , and [his]122-pierson thin , beardless face , which seemed all eyes and brow , so mournful , that [all three]1874-all three felt in the presence of a sorrow deeper even than [[their]1874-all three own family]1875-their own family grief . During the meal [he]122-pierson gazed silently at [Noel]197-noel . Once [he]122-pierson said : " [You]197-noel will let [me]122-pierson paint [you]197-noel now , [mademoiselle]219-mademoiselle , [I]122-pierson hope ? "[122-pierson] and [his]122-pierson face brightened a little when [she]1876-she nodded . There was never much talk when [he]122-pierson came , for any depth of discussion , even of art , brought out at once too wide a difference . And [Pierson]122-pierson could never avoid a vague irritation with [one who clearly had spirituality]1877-one who clearly had spirituality , but of a sort which [he]122-pierson could not understand . After dinner [he]122-pierson excused [himself]122-pierson , and went off to [[his]122-pierson study]1331-his study . [Monsieur]1879-monsieur would be happier alone with [the two girls]1880-the two girls ! [Gratian]127-gratian , too , got up . [She]127-gratian had remembered [Noel]197-noel 's words : " [I]127-gratian mind [him]122-pierson less than [anybody]3599-anybody . "[127-gratian] It was a chance for [Nollie]131-nollie to break the ice .

"[1461-the painter]

" [We]4061-we talked of [[our]4061-we homes]4062-our homes ; [he]254-a boche had a soul , [that man]975-that man . When [you]4066-you see [us]4061-we , mademoiselle , walking [the streets]3240-the streets , remember that . "[1929-i] And [he]1930-he dropped [his]1930-he face on to [his]1930-he fists again .

A silence had fallen in [the room]517-the room - very queer and complete . [The little girl]1906-the little girl nursed [[her]1906-the little girl doll]1933-her doll , [the soldier]583-the soldier gazed at the floor , [the woman]586-the woman 's mouth moved stealthily , and in [Noel]197-noel the thought rushed continually to the verge of action : ' Could n't [I]0-i get up and run [downstairs]1846-downstairs ? ' But [she]586-the woman sat on , hypnotised by that silence , till [Lavendie]253-lavendie reappeared with a bottle and four glasses .

" To drink [our]1937-the two men health , and wish [us]1937-the two men luck , mademoiselle , "[1930-he] [he]1930-he said .

[Noel]197-noel raised the glass [he]197-noel had given [her]586-the woman . " [I]197-noel wish [you]586-the woman all happiness . "[197-noel]

" And [you]586-the woman , [mademoiselle]219-mademoiselle , "[1937-the two men] [the two men]1937-the two men murmured .

[She]586-the woman drank a little , and rose .

" And now , [mademoiselle]219-mademoiselle , "[253-lavendie] said [Lavendie]253-lavendie , " if [you]586-the woman must go , [I]253-lavendie will see [you]586-the woman [home]3048-home . "[253-lavendie]

[Noel]197-noel took [Madame Lavendie]253-lavendie 's hand ; it was cold , and returned no pressure ; [her]586-the woman eyes had the glazed look that [she]586-the woman remembered . [The soldier]583-the soldier had put [his]583-the soldier empty glass down on the floor , and was regarding it unconscious of [her]586-the woman . [Noel]197-noel turned quickly to the door ; the last thing [she]586-the woman saw was [the little girl]1906-the little girl nursing [her]1906-the little girl doll .

In [the street]3753-the street [the painter]1461-the painter began at once in [his]1461-the painter rapid French :

" [I]1461-the painter ought not to have asked [you]586-the woman to come , [mademoiselle]219-mademoiselle ; [I]1461-the painter did not know [[our]4069-we friend]4070-our friend [Barra]245-monsieur barra was [there]3137-there . Besides , [[my]1461-the painter wife]3270-my wife is not fit to receive [a lady]4073-a lady ; vous voyez qu'il y a de la manie dans cette pauvre tote . [I]1461-the painter should not have asked [you]586-the woman ; but [I]1461-the painter was so miserable . "[1461-the painter]

" Oh ! "[197-noel] murmured [Noel]197-noel , " [I]1461-the painter know . "[1461-the painter]

" In [[our]4069-we home]4074-our home over [there]3137-there [she]3270-my wife had interests . In [this great town]4076-this great town [she]3270-my wife can only nurse [her]3270-my wife grief against [me]1461-the painter . Ah ! this war ! It seems to [me]1461-the painter [we]4069-we are all in the stomach of a great coiling serpent . [We]4069-we lie there , being digested . In a way it is better out there in [the trenches]3318-the trenches ; [they]3318-the trenches are beyond hate , [they]3318-the trenches have attained a height that [we]4069-we have not . It is wonderful how [they]3318-the trenches still can be for going on till [they]3318-the trenches have beaten [the Boche]254-a boche ; that is curious and it is very great . Did [Barra]245-monsieur barra tell [you]4078-you how , when [they]3318-the trenches come back - [all these fighters]4079-all these fighters - [they]3318-the trenches are going to rule , and manage the future of [the world]606-the world ? But it will not be so . [They]3318-the trenches will mix in with life , separate - be scattered , and [they]3318-the trenches will be ruled as [they]3318-the trenches were before . The tongue and the pen will rule [them]3318-the trenches : [those who have not seen the war]4081-those who have not seen the war will rule [them]3318-the trenches . "[1461-the painter]

" Oh ! "[197-noel] ' cried [Noel]197-noel , ' surely [they]1942-they will be the bravest and strongest in the future . "[197-noel]

[The painter]1461-the painter smiled .

" War makes [men]3061-men simple , "[197-noel] [he]197-noel said , " elemental ; life in peace is neither simple nor elemental , it is subtle , full of changing environments , to which [man]631-man must adapt [himself]631-man ; the cunning , the astute , [the adaptable]4084-the adaptable , will ever rule in times of peace . It is pathetic , the belief of [those brave soldiers]4085-those brave soldiers that the - future is [theirs]3318-the trenches . "[197-noel]

" [He]197-noel said , a strange thing , "[197-noel] murmured [Noel]197-noel ; " that [they]1942-they were all a little mad . "[197-noel]

" [He]197-noel is [a man of queer genius]4086-a man of queer genius - [Barra]245-monsieur barra ; [you]197-noel should see some of [his]197-noel earlier pictures . Mad is not quite the word , but something is loosened , is rattling round in them , [they]1942-they have lost proportion , [they]1942-they are being forced in one direction . [I]197-noel tell [you]197-noel , mademoiselle , this war is one great forcing - house ; every living plant is being made to grow too fast , each quality , each passion ; hate and love , intolerance and lust and avarice , courage and energy ; yes , and self - sacrifice - all are being forced and forced beyond [their]1942-they strength , beyond the natural flow of the sap , forced till there has come a great wild luxuriant crop , and then - [Psum]255-psum ! Presto ! The change comes , and these plants will wither and rot and stink . But [we]4087-we who see Life in forms of Art are [the only ones who feel that]4088-the only ones who feel that ; and [we]4087-we are so few . The natural shape of things is lost . There is a mist of blood before all eyes . [Men]3061-men are afraid of being fair . See how [we]4087-we all hate not only [[our]4087-we enemies]4090-our enemies , but [those who differ from [us]4087-we]4091-those who differ from us . Look at [the streets]3240-the streets too - see how [men]3061-men and [women]3282-women rush together , how [Venus]256-venus reigns in [this forcing - house]4095-this forcing - house . Is it not natural that [Youth about to die]4096-youth about to die should yearn for pleasure , for love , for union , before death ? "[197-noel]

[Noel]197-noel stared up at [him]197-noel . ' Now ! ' [she]1944-i thought : [I]0-i will . '

" Yes , "[1944-i] [she]1944-i said , " [I]1944-i know that 's true , because [I]1944-i rushed , [myself]1944-i . [I]1944-i 'd like [you]197-noel to know . [We]4097-we could n't be married - there was n't time . And - [he]197-noel was killed . But [[his]197-noel son]4098-his son is alive . That 's why [I]1944-i 've been away so long . [I]1944-i want [every one]4019-every one to know . "[1944-i] [She]1944-i spoke very calmly , but [her]1944-i cheeks felt burning hot .

[The painter]1461-the painter had made an upward movement of [his]1461-the painter hands , as if they had been jerked by an electric current , then [he]1461-the painter said quite quietly :

" [My]1461-the painter profound respect , [mademoiselle]219-mademoiselle , and [my]1461-the painter great sympathy . And [[your]219-mademoiselle father]3044-your father ? "[1461-the painter]

" It 's awful for [him]3044-your father . "[1461-the painter]

[The painter]1461-the painter said gently : " Ah ! [mademoiselle]219-mademoiselle , [I]1461-the painter am not so sure . Perhaps [he]3044-your father does not suffer so greatly . Perhaps not even [your]219-mademoiselle trouble can hurt [him]3044-your father very much . [He]3044-your father lives in [a world apart]4101-a world apart . That , [I]1461-the painter think , is [his]3044-your father true tragedy to be alive , and yet not living enough to feel reality . Do [you]219-mademoiselle know Anatole [France]13-france 's description of [an old woman]4102-an old woman : ' Elle vivait , [mais si peu]4103-mais si peu . ' Would that not be well said of [the Church]372-the church in these days : ' Elle vivait , [mais si peu]4103-mais si peu . ' [I]1461-the painter see [him]3044-your father always like a rather beautiful dark spire in the night - time when [you]219-mademoiselle can not see how it is attached to [the earth]3348-the earth . [He]3044-your father does not know , [he]3044-your father never will know , Life . "[1461-the painter]

[Noel]197-noel looked round at [him]197-noel . " What do [you]197-noel mean by Life , [monsieur]1551-monsieur ? [I]197-noel 'm always reading about Life , and [people]3083-people talk of seeing Life ! What is it - where is it ? [I]197-noel never see anything that [you]197-noel could call Life . "[197-noel]

[The painter]1461-the painter smiled .

" To ' see life ' ! "[1461-the painter] [he]1461-the painter said . " Ah ! that is different . To enjoy [yourself]219-mademoiselle ! Well , it is [my]1461-the painter experience that when [people]3083-people are ' seeing life ' as [they]3083-people call it , [they]3083-people are not enjoying [themselves]3083-people . [You]219-mademoiselle know when [one]424-one is very thirsty one drinks and drinks , but the thirst remains all the same . There are places where [one]424-one can see life as it is called , but the only persons [you]219-mademoiselle will see enjoying [themselves]3083-people at such places are [a few humdrums like [myself]1461-the painter , who go [there]3137-there for a talk over a cup of coffee]4112-a few humdrums like myself , who go there for a talk over a cup of coffee . Perhaps at [your]219-mademoiselle age , though , it is different . "[1461-the painter]

[Noel]197-noel clasped [her]1948-her hands , and [her]1948-her eyes seemed to shine in the gloom . " [I]197-noel want music and dancing and light , and beautiful things and faces ; but [I]197-noel never get them . "[197-noel]

" No , there does not exist in [this town]4114-this town , or in any other , [a place which will give [you]219-mademoiselle that]4115-a place which will give you that . Fox - trots and ragtime and paint and powder and glare and [half - drunken young men]4116-half - drunken young men , and [women with red lips]4117-women with red lips [you]219-mademoiselle can get [them]4117-women with red lips in plenty . But rhythm and beauty and charm never . In [Brussels]84-brussels when [I]1461-the painter was younger [I]1461-the painter saw much ' life ' as [they]4118-they call it , but not one lovely thing unspoiled ; it was all as ashes in the mouth . Ah ! [you]219-mademoiselle may smile , but [I]1461-the painter know what [I]1461-the painter am talking of . Happiness never comes when [you]219-mademoiselle are looking for it , mademoiselle ; beauty is in Nature and in real art , never in these false silly make believes . There is a place just here where [we]1949-they [Belgians]251-belgians go ; would [you]219-mademoiselle like to see how true [my]1461-the painter words are ?[1461-the painter]

" Oh , yes ! "[197-noel]

" Tres - bien ! Let [us]1949-they go in ? "[1461-the painter]

[They]1949-they passed into a revolving doorway with little glass compartments which shot [them]1949-they out into [a shining corridor]1950-a shining corridor . At the end of this [the painter]1461-the painter looked at [Noel]197-noel and seemed to hesitate , then [he]1461-the painter turned off from [the room]517-the room [they]1949-they were about to enter into [a room on the right]1953-a room on the right . [It]1953-a room on the right was large , full of gilt and plush and marble tables , where [couples]1954-couples were seated ; [young men in khaki and [older men]1956-older men in plain clothes , together or with [young women]1957-young women]1955-young men in khaki and older men in plain clothes , together or with young women . At these last [Noel]197-noel looked , face after face , while [they]1949-they were passing down a long way to an empty table . [She]1958-she saw that some were pretty , and some only trying to be , that nearly all were powdered and had [their]1959-their eyes darkened and [their]1959-their lips reddened , till [she]1958-she felt [her]1958-she own face to be dreadfully ungarnished : Up in [a gallery]1960-a gallery [a small band]1961-a small band was playing an attractive jingling hollow little tune ; and the buzz of talk and laughter was almost deafening .

" What will [you]197-noel have , mademoiselle ? "[1461-the painter] said [the painter]1461-the painter . " It is just nine o'clock ; [we]1949-they must order quickly . "[1461-the painter]

" May [I]1961-a small band have one of those green things ? "[1961-a small band]

" Deux cremes de menthe , "[253-lavendie] said [Lavendie]253-lavendie to [the waiter]1963-the waiter .

[Noel]197-noel was too absorbed to see the queer , bitter little smile hovering about [his]197-noel face . [She]1958-she was busy looking at the faces of [women whose eyes , furtively cold and enquiring]1964-women whose eyes , furtively cold and enquiring , were fixed on [her]1958-she ; and at the faces of [men with eyes that were furtively warm and wondering]1965-men with eyes that were furtively warm and wondering .

" [I]1958-she wonder if [Daddy]132-daddy was ever in [a place like this]4119-a place like this ? "[1958-she] [she]1958-she said , putting the glass of green stuff to [her]1958-she lips . " Is it nice ? It smells of peppermint . "[1958-she]

" It 's nice ; but awfully sticky . May [I]1958-she have a cigarette ? "[1958-she]

" Des cigarettes , "[253-lavendie] said [Lavendie]253-lavendie to [the waiter]1963-the waiter , " Et deux cafes noirs . Amusing , is n't it ? "[197-noel] [He]197-noel shrugged [his]197-noel shoulders .

[His]197-noel face struck [Noel]197-noel suddenly as tarnished and almost sullen .

" Do n't be angry , [monsieur]1551-monsieur , it 's all new to [me]197-noel , [you]1551-monsieur see . "[197-noel]

[The painter]1461-the painter smiled , [his]197-noel bright , skin - deep smile .

" Pardon ! [I]1969-he forget [myself]1969-he . Only , it hurts [me]1969-he to see beauty in a place like this . It does not go well with that tune , and these voices , and these faces . Enjoy [yourself]219-mademoiselle , [mademoiselle]219-mademoiselle ; drink it all in ! See the way [these people]4122-these people look at [each other]493-each other ; what love shines in [their]4122-these people eyes ! A pity , too , [we]4120-we can not hear what [they]4122-these people are saying . Believe [me]1969-he , [their]4122-these people talk is most subtle , tres - spirituel .
