Eat , drink , love , for tomorrow [we]4120-we die . Who cares for [the world]606-the world simple or [the world]606-the world beautiful , in days like these ? [The house of the spirit]4129-the house of the spirit is empty . "[1969-he]

[He]1969-he was looking at [her]1970-her sidelong as if [he]1969-he would enter [her]1970-her very soul .

[Noel]197-noel got up . " [I]197-noel 'm ready to go , [monsieur]1551-monsieur . "[197-noel]

[He]1969-he put [her]1970-her cloak on [her]1970-her shoulders , paid the bill , and [they]1971-they went out , threading again through the little tables , through the buzz of talk and laughter and the fumes of tobacco , while another hollow little tune jingled away behind [them]1971-they .

" Through there , "[1461-the painter] said [the painter]1461-the painter , pointing to another door , " [they]4125-all these who are serving their country dance . So it goes . [London]7-london in war - time ! Well , after all , it is never very different ; [no great town]4131-no great town is . Did [you]197-noel enjoy [your]197-noel sight of ' life , ' [mademoiselle]219-mademoiselle ? "[1461-the painter]

" [I]1461-the painter think [one]424-one must dance , to be happy . Is that where [[your]197-noel friends]4133-your friends go ? "[1461-the painter]

" Oh , no ! To [a room]4134-a room much rougher , and play dominoes , and drink coffee and beer , and talk . [They]4125-all these who are serving their country have no money to throw away . "[1461-the painter]

" Why did n't [you]197-noel show [me]1461-the painter ? "[1461-the painter]

" [Mademoiselle]219-mademoiselle , in [that room]4135-that room [you]219-mademoiselle might see someone perhaps whom one day [you]219-mademoiselle would meet again ; in the place [we]4136-we visited [you]219-mademoiselle were safe enough at least [I]1461-the painter hope so . "[1461-the painter]

[Noel]197-noel shrugged . " [I]197-noel suppose it does n't matter now , what [I]197-noel do . "[197-noel]

And a rush of emotion caught at [her]1973-her throat - a wave from the past - the moonlit night , [the dark old Abbey]1974-the dark old abbey , [the woods]337-the woods and [the river]417-the river . Two tears rolled down [her]1973-her cheeks .

" [I]1973-her was thinking of - something , "[1973-her] [she]1973-her said in a muffled voice . " It 's all right . "[1973-her]

" [Chere mademoiselle]219-mademoiselle ! "[253-lavendie] [Lavendie]253-lavendie murmured ; and all the way [home]3048-home [he]1978-he was timid and distressed . Shaking [his]1978-he hand at the door , [she]1973-her murmured :

" [I]1973-her 'm sorry [I]1973-her was such [a fool]3982-a fool ; and thank [you]1978-he awfully , [monsieur]1551-monsieur . Good night . "[1973-her]

" Good night ; and better dreams . There is a good time coming - Peace and Happiness once more in [the world]606-the world . It will not always be [this Forcing - House]85-this forcing - house . Good night , [chere mademoiselle]219-mademoiselle ! "[1973-her]

[Noel]197-noel went up to [the nursery]1839-the nursery , and stole in . A night - light was burning , [Nurse]235-nurse and [baby]1980-baby were fast asleep . [She]1973-her tiptoed through into [[her]1973-her own room]1370-her own room . Once there , [she]1973-her felt suddenly so tired that [she]1973-her could hardly undress ; and yet curiously rested , as if with that rush of emotion , [Cyril]133-cyril and the past had slipped from [her]1973-her for ever .

III

[Noel]197-noel 's first encounter with [Opinion]257-opinion took place the following day . [The baby]3827-the baby had just come in from its airing ; [she]1973-her had seen it comfortably snoozing , and was on [her]1973-her way [downstairs]1846-downstairs , when a voice from [the hall]522-the hall said :

" How do [you]197-noel do ? "[1973-her] and [she]1973-her saw the khaki - clad figure of [Adrian Lauder]258-lauder , [[her]1973-her father]384-her father 's curate ! Hesitating just a moment , [she]1973-her finished [her]1973-her descent , and put [her]1973-her fingers in [his]258-lauder . [He]258-lauder was [a rather heavy , dough - coloured young man of nearly thirty , unsuited by khaki , with a round white collar buttoned behind]1986-a rather heavy , dough - coloured young man of nearly thirty , unsuited by khaki , with a round white collar buttoned behind ; but [his]258-lauder aspiring eyes redeemed [him]258-lauder , proclaiming the best intentions in [the world]606-the world , and an inclination towards sentiment in the presence of beauty .

" [I]258-lauder have n't seen [you]1973-her for ages , "[258-lauder] [he]258-lauder said rather fatuously , following [her]1973-her into [[[her]1973-her father]384-her father 's study]1479-her father 's study .

" No , "[197-noel] said [Noel]197-noel . " How - do [you]258-lauder like being at the Front ? "[197-noel]

" Ah ! "[258-lauder] [he]258-lauder said , " they 're wonderful ! "[258-lauder] And [his]258-lauder eyes shone . " It 's so nice to see [you]1973-her again . "[258-lauder]

" Is it ? "[197-noel]

[He]258-lauder seemed puzzled by that answer ; stammered , and said :

" [I]197-noel did n't know [[your]1973-her sister]3132-your sister had [a baby]4141-a baby . [A jolly baby]4142-a jolly baby . "[197-noel]

" [She]3132-your sister has n't . "[197-noel]

[Lauder]258-lauder 's mouth opened . ' A silly mouth , ' [she]1973-her thought .

" Oh ! "[258-lauder] [he]258-lauder said . " Is it a protegee - [Belgian]218-belgian or something ? "[258-lauder]

" No , it 's [mine]1973-her ; [my]1973-her own . "[1973-her] And , turning round , [she]1973-her slipped the little ring off [her]1973-her finger . When [she]1973-her turned back to [him]258-lauder , [his]258-lauder face had not recovered from [her]1973-her words . It had a hapless look , as of [one to whom such a thing ought not to have happened]1990-one to whom such a thing ought not to have happened .

" Do n't look like that , "[197-noel] said [Noel]197-noel . " Did n't [you]258-lauder understand ? It 's mine - mine . "[1973-her] [She]1973-her put out [her]1973-her left hand . " Look ! There 's no ring . "[1973-her]

[He]258-lauder stammered : " [I]258-lauder say , [you]1973-her ought n't to - [you]1973-her ought n't to - ! "[258-lauder]

" What ? "[258-lauder]

" Joke about - about such things ; ought [you]258-lauder ? "[258-lauder]

" [One]424-one does n't joke if [one]424-one 's had [a baby]4141-a baby without being married , [you]1973-her know . "[258-lauder]

[Lauder]258-lauder went suddenly slack . A shell might have burst a few paces from [him]258-lauder . And then , just as one would in such a case , [he]258-lauder made an effort , braced [himself]258-lauder , and said in a curious voice , both stiff and heavy : " [I]258-lauder ca n't - [one]424-one does n't - it 's not - "[258-lauder]

" It is , "[197-noel] said [Noel]197-noel . " If [you]258-lauder do n't believe [me]197-noel , ask [Daddy]132-daddy . "[197-noel]

[He]258-lauder put [his]258-lauder hand up to [his]258-lauder round collar ; and with the wild thought that [he]258-lauder was going to tear it off , [she]1991-she cried : " Do n't ! "[1991-she]

" [You]197-noel ! "[258-lauder] [he]258-lauder said . " [You]197-noel ! But - "[258-lauder]

[Noel]197-noel turned away from [him]258-lauder to the window : [She]1991-she stood looking out , but saw nothing whatever .

" [I]1991-she do n't want it hidden , "[1991-she] [she]1991-she said without turning round , " [I]1991-she want [every one]4019-every one to know . It 's stupid as it is - stupid ! "[1991-she] and [she]1991-she stamped [her]1991-she foot . " Ca n't [you]258-lauder see how stupid it is - [everybody]403-everybody 's mouth falling open ! "[1991-she]

[He]258-lauder uttered a little sound which had pain in it , and [she]1991-she felt a real pang of compunction . [He]258-lauder had gripped the back of a chair ; [his]258-lauder face had lost its heaviness . A dull flush coloured [his]258-lauder cheeks . [Noel]197-noel had a feeling , as if [she]1991-she had been convicted of treachery . It was [his]258-lauder silence , the curious look of an impersonal pain beyond power of words ; [she]1991-she felt in [him]258-lauder something much deeper than mere disapproval - something which echoed within [herself]1991-she . [She]1991-she walked quickly past [him]258-lauder and escaped . [She]1991-she ran [upstairs]1153-upstairs and threw [herself]1991-she on [her]1991-she bed . [He]258-lauder was nothing : it was not that ! It was in [herself]1991-she , the awful feeling , for the first time developed and poignant , that [she]1991-she had betrayed [[her]1991-she caste]1993-her caste , forfeited the right to be thought [a lady]4073-a lady , betrayed [her]1991-she secret reserve and refinement , repaid with black ingratitude the love lavished on [her]1991-she up bringing , by behaving like [any uncared - for [common girl]1996-common girl]1995-any uncared - for common girl . [She]1991-she had never felt this before - not even when [Gratian]127-gratian first heard of it , and [they]1997-they had stood one at each end of the hearth , unable to speak . Then [she]1991-she still had [her]1991-she passion , and [her]1991-she grief for the dead . That was gone now as if it had never been ; and [she]1991-she had no defence , nothing between [her]1991-she and this crushing humiliation and chagrin . [She]1991-she had been mad ! [She]1991-she must have been mad ! [The Belgian Barra]218-belgian was right : " All a little mad "[218-belgian] in this " forcing - house "[1998-he] of a war ! [She]1991-she buried [her]1991-she face deep in the pillow , till it almost stopped [her]1991-she power of breathing ; [her]1991-she head and cheeks and ears seemed to be on fire . If only [he]1998-he had shown disgust , done something which roused [her]1991-she temper , [her]1991-she sense of justice , [her]1991-she feeling that [Fate]167-fate had been too cruel to [her]1991-she ; but [he]1998-he had just stood there , bewilderment incarnate , like [a creature with some very deep illusion shattered]1999-a creature with some very deep illusion shattered . It was horrible ! Then , feeling that [she]1991-she could not stay still , must walk , run , get away somehow from this feeling of treachery and betrayal , [she]1991-she sprang up . All was quiet below , and [she]1991-she slipped [downstairs]1846-downstairs and out , speeding along with no knowledge of direction , taking the way [she]1991-she had taken day after day to [[her]1991-she hospital]3051-her hospital . It was the last of April , trees and shrubs were luscious with blossom and leaf ; the dogs ran gaily ; [people]3083-people had almost happy faces in the sunshine . ' If [I]0-i could get away from [myself]0-i , [I]0-i would n't care , ' [she]1991-she thought . Easy to get away from [people]3083-people , from [London]7-london , even from [England]29-england perhaps ; but from oneself - impossible ! [She]1991-she passed [[her]1991-she hospital]3051-her hospital ; and looked at [it]3051-her hospital dully , at the Red Cross flag against [its]3051-her hospital stucco wall , and [a soldier in [his]2005-a soldier in his blue slops and red tie blue slops and red tie]2005-a soldier in his blue slops and red tie , coming out . [She]1991-she had spent many miserable hours [there]3137-there , but none quite so miserable as this . [She]1991-she passed [the church opposite to [the flats where [Leila]208-leila lived]2008-the flats where leila lived]2007-the church opposite to the flats where leila lived , and running suddenly into [a tall man coming round the corner]2009-a tall man coming round the corner , saw [Fort]197-noel . [She]1991-she bent [her]1991-she head , and tried to hurry past . But [his]197-noel hand was held out , [she]1991-she could not help putting [hers]1991-she into it ; and looking up hardily , [she]1991-she said :

" [You]197-noel know about [me]1991-she , do n't [you]197-noel ? "[1991-she]

[His]197-noel face , naturally so frank , seemed to clench up , as if [he]197-noel were riding at a fence . ' [He]197-noel 'll tell a lie , ' [she]1991-she thought bitterly . But [he]197-noel did not .

" Yes , [Leila]208-leila told [me]197-noel . "[197-noel]

And [she]1991-she thought : ' [I]0-i suppose [he]197-noel 'll try and pretend that [I]0-i 've not been a beast ! '

" [I]197-noel admire [your]1991-she pluck , "[197-noel] [he]197-noel said .

" [I]197-noel have n't any . "[197-noel]

" [We]4149-we never know [ourselves]4149-we , do [we]4149-we ? [I]197-noel suppose [you]197-noel would n't walk [my]197-noel pace a minute or two , would [you]197-noel ? [I]197-noel 'm going the same way . "[197-noel]

" [I]197-noel do n't know which way [I]197-noel 'm going . "[197-noel]

" That is [my]197-noel case , too . "[197-noel]

[They]2010-they walked on in silence .

" [I]197-noel wish to [God]143-god [I]197-noel were back in [France]13-france , "[197-noel] said [Fort]197-noel abruptly . " [One]424-one does n't feel clean [here]3149-here . "[197-noel]

[Noel]197-noel 's heart applauded .

Ah ! to get away - away from [oneself]2011-oneself ! But at the thought of [[her]2012-her baby]1803-her baby , [her]2012-her heart fell again . " Is [your]197-noel leg quite hopeless ? "[2012-her] [she]2012-her said .

" Quite . "[197-noel]

" That must be horrid . "[197-noel]

" [Hundreds of thousands]4152-hundreds of thousands would look on it as splendid luck ; and so it is if [you]197-noel count it better to be alive than dead , which [I]197-noel do , in spite of the blues . "[197-noel]

" How is [Cousin Leila]208-leila ? "[197-noel]

" Very well . [She]208-leila goes on pegging away at [the hospital]1022-the hospital ; [she]208-leila 's a brick . "[197-noel] But [he]197-noel did not look at [her]2012-her , and again there was silence , till [he]197-noel stopped by [[Lord]2014-lord 's Cricket - ground]1013-lord 's cricket - ground .

" [I]197-noel must n't keep [you]197-noel crawling along at this pace . "[197-noel]

" Oh , [I]197-noel do n't mind ! "[197-noel]

" [I]197-noel only wanted to say that if [I]197-noel can be of any service to [you]197-noel at any time in any way whatever , please command [me]197-noel . "[197-noel]

[He]197-noel gave [her]2012-her hand a squeeze , took [his]197-noel hat off ; and [Noel]197-noel walked slowly on . The little interview , with its suppressions , and its implications , had but exasperated [her]2012-her restlessness , and yet , in a way , it had soothed the soreness of [her]2012-her heart . [Captain Fort]197-noel at all events did not despise [her]2012-her ; and [he]197-noel was in trouble like [herself]2012-her . [She]2012-her felt that somehow by the look of [his]197-noel face , and the tone of [his]197-noel voice when [he]197-noel spoke of [Leila]208-leila . [She]2012-her quickened [her]2012-her pace . [George]140-george 's words came back to [her]2012-her : " If [you]2012-her 're not ashamed of [yourself]2012-her , [no one]3081-no one will be of [you]2012-her ! "[140-george] How easy to say ! The old days , [[her]2012-her school]2016-her school , [the little half grown - up dances [she]2012-her used to go to , when everything was happy]2017-the little half grown - up dances she used to go to , when everything was happy . Gone ! All gone !

But [her]2012-her meetings with [Opinion]257-opinion were not over for the day , for turning again at last into [the home Square]2018-the home square , tired out by [her]2012-her three hours ' ramble , [she]2012-her met [an old lady whom [she]2012-her and [Gratian]127-gratian had known from babyhood]2019-an old lady whom she and gratian had known from babyhood - [a handsome dame]2020-a handsome dame , [the widow of [an official]949-an official , who spent [her]2012-her days , which showed no symptom of declining , in admirable works]2021-the widow of an official , who spent her days , which showed no symptom of declining , in admirable works . [[Her]2012-her daughter]1681-her daughter , [the widow of [an officer killed at the Marne]2025-an officer killed at the marne]2024-the widow of an officer killed at the marne , was with [her]2012-her , and [the two]651-the two greeted [Noel]197-noel with a shower of cordial questions : So [she]2012-her was back from [the country]334-the country , and was [she]2012-her quite well again ? And working at [[her]2012-her hospital]3051-her hospital ? And how was [[her]2012-her dear father]2029-her dear father ? [They]651-the two had thought [him]2029-her dear father looking very thin and worn . But now [Gratian]127-gratian was at [home]3048-home - How dreadfully the war kept [husbands]2031-husbands and [wives]2032-wives apart ! And whose was [the dear little baby]2033-the dear little baby [they]651-the two had in [the house]538-the house ?

" [Mine]197-noel , "[197-noel] said [Noel]197-noel , walking straight past [them]651-the two with [her]2012-her head up . In every fibre of [her]2012-her being [she]2012-her could feel the hurt , startled , utterly bewildered looks of [those firm friendly persons left there on the pavement behind [her]2012-her]2035-those firm friendly persons left there on the pavement behind her ; could feel the way [they]651-the two would gather [themselves]651-the two together , and walk on , perhaps without a word , and then round the corner begin : " What has come to [Noel]197-noel ? What did [she]2012-her mean ? "[2012-her] And taking the little gold hoop out of [her]2012-her pocket , [she]2012-her flung it with all [her]2012-her might into [the Square Garden]569-the square garden . The action saved [her]2012-her from a breakdown ; and [she]2012-her went in calmly . Lunch was long over , but [[her]2012-her father]384-her father had not gone out , for [he]384-her father met [her]2012-her in [the hall]522-the hall and drew [her]2012-her into [the dining - room]1221-the dining - room .

" [You]2012-her must eat , [[my]384-her father child]3086-my child , "[384-her father] [he]384-her father said . And while [she]2012-her was swallowing down what [he]384-her father had caused to be kept back for [her]2012-her , [he]384-her father stood by the hearth in that favourite attitude of [his]384-her father , one foot on the fender , and one hand gripping the mantel - shelf .

" [You]384-her father 've got [your]384-her father wish , [Daddy]132-daddy , "[2012-her] [she]2012-her said dully : " [Everybody]403-everybody knows now . [I]2012-her 've told [Mr. Lauder]212-mr. lauder , and [Monsieur]4157-monsieur , and [the Dinnafords]259-the dinnafords . "[2012-her]

[She]2012-her saw [his]384-her father fingers uncrisp , then grip the shelf again . " [I]384-her father 'm glad , "[384-her father] [he]384-her father said .

" [Aunt Thirza]137-thirza gave [me]384-her father a ring to wear , but [I]384-her father 've thrown it away . "[384-her father]

" [[My]384-her father dearest child]4158-my dearest child , "[384-her father] [he]384-her father began , but could not go on , for the quivering of [his]384-her father lips .

" [I]384-her father wanted to say once more , [Daddy]132-daddy , that [I]384-her father 'm fearfully sorry about [you]132-daddy . And [I]384-her father am ashamed of [myself]384-her father ; [I]384-her father thought [I]384-her father was n't , but [I]384-her father am - only , [I]384-her father think it was cruel , and [I]384-her father 'm not penitent to [God]143-god ; and it 's no good trying to make [me]384-her father . "[384-her father]

[Pierson]122-pierson turned and looked at [her]2040-her . For a long time after , [she]2040-her could not get that look out of [her]2040-her memory .

[Jimmy Fort]175-jimmy had turned away from [Noel]197-noel feeling particularly wretched . Ever since the day when [Leila]208-leila had told [him]175-jimmy of [the girl]525-the girl 's misfortune [he]175-jimmy had been aware that [[his]175-jimmy liaison]2042-his liaison had no decent foundation , save a sort of pity . One day , in a queer access of compunction , [he]175-jimmy had made [Leila]208-leila an offer of marriage . [She]208-leila had refused ; and [he]175-jimmy had respected [her]208-leila the more , realising by the quiver in [her]208-leila voice and the look in [her]208-leila eyes that [she]208-leila refused [him]175-jimmy , not because [she]208-leila did not love [him]175-jimmy well enough , but because [she]208-leila was afraid of losing any of [his]175-jimmy affection . [She]208-leila was [a woman of great experience]2043-a woman of great experience .

To - day [he]175-jimmy had taken advantage of the luncheon interval to bring [her]208-leila some flowers , with a note to say that [he]175-jimmy could not come that evening . Letting [himself]175-jimmy in with [his]175-jimmy latchkey , [he]175-jimmy had carefully put those Japanese azaleas in the bowl " Famille Rose , "[175-jimmy] taking water from [[her]208-leila bedroom]1291-her bedroom . Then [he]175-jimmy had sat down on the divan with [his]175-jimmy head in [his]175-jimmy hands .

Though [he]175-jimmy had rolled so much about [the world]606-the world , [he]175-jimmy had never had much to do with [women]3282-women . And there was nothing in [him]175-jimmy of [the Frenchman]2047-the frenchman , who takes what life puts in [his]175-jimmy way as so much enjoyment on the credit side , and accepts the ends of such affairs as they naturally and rather rapidly arrive . It had been a pleasure , and was no longer a pleasure ; but this apparently did not dissolve it , or absolve [him]175-jimmy . [He]175-jimmy felt [himself]175-jimmy bound by an obscure but deep instinct to go on pretending that [he]175-jimmy was not tired of [her]208-leila , so long as [she]208-leila was not tired of [him]175-jimmy . And [he]175-jimmy sat there trying to remember any sign , however small , of such a consummation , quite without success . On the contrary , [he]175-jimmy had even the wretched feeling that if only [he]175-jimmy had loved [her]208-leila , [she]208-leila would have been much more likely to have tired of [him]175-jimmy by now . For [her]208-leila [he]175-jimmy was still the unconquered , in spite of [his]175-jimmy loyal endeavour to seem conquered . [He]175-jimmy had made a fatal mistake , that evening after the concert at [Queen 's Hall]56-queen 's hall , to let [himself]175-jimmy go , on a mixed tide of desire and pity !

[His]175-jimmy folly came to [him]175-jimmy with increased poignancy after [he]175-jimmy had parted from [Noel]197-noel . How could [he]175-jimmy have been such [a base fool]2048-a base fool , as to have committed [himself]175-jimmy to [Leila]208-leila on an evening when [he]175-jimmy had actually been in the company of [that child]3092-that child ? Was it the vague , unseizable likeness between [them]2050-them which had pushed [him]175-jimmy over the edge ? ' [I]0-i 've been [an ass]2051-an ass , ' [he]175-jimmy thought ; ' [a horrible ass]2052-a horrible ass . ' [I]0-i would always have given every hour [I]0-i 've ever spent with [Leila]208-leila , for one real smile from [that girl]1272-that girl . '

This sudden sight of [Noel]197-noel after months during which [he]175-jimmy had tried loyally to forget [her]208-leila existence , and not succeeded at all , made [him]175-jimmy realise as [he]175-jimmy never had yet that [he]175-jimmy was in love with [her]208-leila ; so very much in love with [her]208-leila that the thought of [Leila]208-leila was become nauseating . And yet the instincts of [a gentleman]1610-a gentleman seemed to forbid [him]175-jimmy to betray that secret to either of [them]2055-them . It was an accursed coil ! [He]175-jimmy hailed [a cab]1238-a cab , for [he]175-jimmy was late ; and all the way back to [the War Office]3382-the war office [he]175-jimmy continued to see [the girl]525-the girl 's figure and [her]525-the girl face with its short hair . And a fearful temptation rose within [him]175-jimmy . Was it not [she]208-leila who was now the real object for chivalry and pity ? Had [he]175-jimmy not the right to consecrate [himself]175-jimmy to championship of one in such a deplorable position ? [Leila]208-leila had lived [her]208-leila life ; but [this child]1090-this child 's life - pretty well wrecked - was all before [her]208-leila . And then [he]175-jimmy grinned from sheer disgust . For [he]175-jimmy knew that this was [Jesuitry]260-jesuitry . Not chivalry was moving [him]175-jimmy , but love ! Love ! Love of the unattainable ! And with a heavy heart , indeed , [he]175-jimmy entered [the great building]2060-the great building , where , in [a small room]2061-a small room , companioned by the telephone , and surrounded by sheets of paper covered with figures , [he]175-jimmy passed [his]175-jimmy days . The war made everything seem dreary , hopeless . No wonder [he]175-jimmy had caught at any distraction which came along - caught at it , till it had caught [him]175-jimmy !

IV

1

To find out the worst is , for human nature , only a question of time . But where the " worst "[2062-a family] is attached to [a family]2062-a family haloed , as it were , by the authority and reputation of [an institution like the Church]2063-an institution like the church , the process of discovery has to break through many a little hedge . Sheer unlikelihood , genuine respect , the defensive instinct in those identified with [an institution]2064-an institution , who will [themselves]2064-an institution feel weaker if its strength be diminished , the feeling that the scandal is too good to be true - all these little hedges , and more , had to be broken through . To [the Dinnafords]259-the dinnafords , the unholy importance of what [Noel]197-noel had said to [them]259-the dinnafords would have continued to keep [them]259-the dinnafords dumb , out of self - protection ; but its monstrosity had given [them]259-the dinnafords the feeling that there must be some mistake , that [the girl]525-the girl had been overtaken by a wild desire to " pull [their]259-the dinnafords legs "[197-noel] as [dear Charlie]211-pierson would say . With the hope of getting this view confirmed , [they]259-the dinnafords lay in wait for [the old nurse]1811-the old nurse who took [the baby]3827-the baby out , and obtained the information , shortly imparted : " Oh , yes ; [Miss Noel]197-noel 's . [Her]525-the girl ' usband was killed - [poor lamb]4159-poor lamb ! "[1811-the old nurse] And [they]259-the dinnafords felt rewarded . [They]259-the dinnafords had been sure there was some mistake . The relief of hearing that word " ' usband "[259-the dinnafords] was intense . One of these hasty war marriages , of which [the dear Vicar]2068-the dear vicar had not approved , and so it had been kept dark . Quite intelligible , but so sad ! Enough misgiving however remained in [their]259-the dinnafords minds , to prevent [their]259-the dinnafords going to condole with [the dear Vicar]2068-the dear vicar ; but not enough to prevent [their]259-the dinnafords roundly contradicting the rumours and gossip already coming to [their]259-the dinnafords ears . And then one day , when [[their]259-the dinnafords friend]2070-their friend [Mrs. Curtis]261-mrs. curtis had said too positively : " Well , [she]4160-she does n't wear a wedding - ring , that [I]261-mrs. curtis 'll swear , because [I]261-mrs. curtis took very good care to look ! "[261-mrs. curtis] [they]259-the dinnafords determined to ask [Mr. Lauder]212-mr. lauder . [He]212-mr. lauder would - indeed must - know ; and , of course , would not tell a story . When [they]259-the dinnafords asked [him]212-mr. lauder it was so manifest that [he]212-mr. lauder did know , that [they]259-the dinnafords almost withdrew the question . [The poor young man]2071-the poor young man had gone the colour of a tomato .

" [I]212-mr. lauder prefer not to answer , "[212-mr. lauder] [he]212-mr. lauder said . The rest of a very short interview was passed in exquisite discomfort . Indeed discomfort , exquisite and otherwise , within a few weeks of [Noel]197-noel 's return , had begun to pervade [all the habitual congregation of [[Pierson]211-pierson 's church]2073-pierson 's church]2072-all the habitual congregation of pierson 's church . It was noticed that [neither of [the two sisters]1359-the two sisters]2074-neither of the two sisters attended Service now . [Certain people who went in the sincere hope of]2076-certain people who went in the sincere hope of seeing [Noel]197-noel , only fell off again when [she]2077-she did not appear . After all , [she]2077-she would not have the face ! And [Gratian]127-gratian was too ashamed , no doubt . It was constantly remarked that [the Vicar]1004-the vicar looked very grave and thin , even for [him]2071-the poor young man . As the rumours hardened into certainty , the feeling towards [him]2071-the poor young man became a curious medley of sympathy and condemnation . There was about the whole business that which [English people]2079-english people especially resent . By the very fact of [his]2071-the poor young man presence before [them]259-the dinnafords every Sunday , and [his]2071-the poor young man public ministrations , [he]2071-the poor young man was exhibiting to [them]259-the dinnafords , as it were , the seamed and blushing face of [[his]2071-the poor young man daughter]356-his daughter 's private life , besides affording one long and glaring demonstration of the failure of [the Church]372-the church to guide [[its]372-the church flock]2082-its flock : If [a man]3326-a man could not keep [[his]3326-a man own daughter]1493-his own daughter in the straight path - whom could [he]3326-a man ? Resign ! The word began to be thought about , but not yet spoken . [He]2071-the poor young man had been [there]3137-there so long ; [he]2071-the poor young man had spent so much money on [the church]372-the church and [the parish]1643-the parish ; [his]2071-the poor young man gentle dreamy manner was greatly liked . [He]2071-the poor young man was [a gentleman]1610-a gentleman ; and had helped [many people]2089-many people ; and , though [his]2071-the poor young man love of music and vestments had always caused heart - burnings , yet it had given a certain cachet to [the church]372-the church . [The women]3269-the women , at any rate , were always glad to know that [the church]372-the church [they]3269-the women went to was capable of drawing [[their]3269-the women fellow women]2093-their fellow women away from [other churches]2094-other churches . Besides , it was war - time , and moral delinquency which in time of peace would have bulked too large to neglect , was now less insistently dwelt on , by minds preoccupied by food and air - raids . Things , of course , could not go on as they were ; but as yet [they]2095-they did go on .

The talked - about is always the last to hear the talk ; and nothing concrete or tangible came [Pierson]211-pierson 's way . [He]211-pierson went about [his]211-pierson usual routine without seeming change . And yet there was a change , secret and creeping . [Wounded]262-wounded almost to death [himself]211-pierson , [he]211-pierson felt as though surrounded by one great wound in others ; but it was some weeks before anything occurred to rouse within [him]211-pierson the weapon of anger or the protective impulse .

And then one day a little swift brutality shook [him]211-pierson to the very soul . [He]211-pierson was coming [home]3048-home from [a long parish round]2097-a long parish round , and had turned into [the Square]789-the square , when a low voice behind [him]211-pierson said :

" Wot price [the little barstard]4161-the little barstard ? "[211-pierson]

A cold , sick feeling stifled [his]211-pierson very breathing ; [he]211-pierson gasped , and spun round , to see [two big loutish boys]2099-two big loutish boys walking fast away . With swift and stealthy passion [he]211-pierson sprang after [them]2099-two big loutish boys , and putting [his]211-pierson hands on [their]2099-two big loutish boys two neighbouring shoulders , wrenched [them]2099-two big loutish boys round so that [they]2099-two big loutish boys faced [him]211-pierson , with mouths fallen open in alarm . Shaking [them]2099-two big loutish boys with all [his]211-pierson force , [he]211-pierson said :

" How dare [you]2099-two big loutish boys - how dare [you]2099-two big loutish boys use that word ? "[211-pierson] [His]211-pierson face and voice must have been rather terrible , for the scare in [their]2099-two big loutish boys faces brought [him]211-pierson to sudden consciousness of [his]211-pierson own violence , and [he]211-pierson dropped [his]211-pierson hands . In two seconds [they]2099-two big loutish boys were at the corner . [They]2099-two big loutish boys stopped there for a second ; [one of [them]2099-two big loutish boys]2100-one of them shouted " [Gran'pa]263-gran'pa "[2100-one of them] ; then [they]2099-two big loutish boys vanished . [He]211-pierson was left with lips and hands quivering , and a feeling that [he]211-pierson had not known for years - the weak white empty feeling [one]424-one has after yielding utterly to sudden murderous rage . [He]211-pierson crossed over , and stood leaning against the Garden railings , with the thought : ' [God]143-god forgive [me]0-i ! [I]0-i could have killed [them]2099-two big loutish boys - [I]0-i could have killed [them]2099-two big loutish boys ! ' There had been a devil in [him]211-pierson . If [he]211-pierson had had something in [his]211-pierson hand , [he]211-pierson might now have been [a murderer]2102-a murderer : How awful ! [Only one]2103-only one had spoken ; but [he]211-pierson could have killed [them]2099-two big loutish boys both ! And the word was true , and was in all mouths - all low common mouths , day after day , of [[his]211-pierson own daughter 's child]2104-his own daughter 's child ! The ghastliness of this thought , brought [home]3048-home so utterly , made [him]211-pierson writhe , and grasp the railings as if [he]211-pierson would have bent them .

From that day on , a creeping sensation of being rejected of [men]3061-men , never left [him]211-pierson ; the sense of identification with [Noel]197-noel and [[her]2107-her tiny outcast]2108-her tiny outcast became ever more poignant , more real ; the desire to protect [them]2099-two big loutish boys ever more passionate ; and the feeling that round about there were whispering voices , pointing fingers , and a growing malevolence was ever more sickening . [He]211-pierson was beginning too to realise the deep and hidden truth : How easily the breath of scandal destroys the influence and sanctity of [those endowed therewith by vocation]2109-those endowed therewith by vocation ; how invaluable it is to feel untarnished , and how difficult to feel that when [others]395-others think [you]2111-you tarnished .

[He]211-pierson tried to be with [Noel]197-noel as much as possible ; and in the evenings [they]2099-two big loutish boys sometimes went walks together , without ever talking of what was always in [their]2099-two big loutish boys minds . Between six and eight [the girl]525-the girl was giving sittings to [Lavendie]253-lavendie in [the drawing - room]1382-the drawing - room , and sometimes [Pierson]211-pierson would come [there]3137-there and play to [them]2099-two big loutish boys . [He]211-pierson was always possessed now by a sense of the danger [Noel]197-noel ran from companionship with [any man]2115-any man . On three occasions , [Jimmy Fort]175-jimmy made [his]175-jimmy appearance after dinner . [He]175-jimmy had so little to say that it was difficult to understand why [he]175-jimmy came ; but , sharpened by this new dread for [[his]175-jimmy daughter]356-his daughter , [Pierson]211-pierson noticed [his]175-jimmy eyes always following [her]356-his daughter . ' [He]175-jimmy admires [her]356-his daughter , ' [he]211-pierson thought ; and often [he]211-pierson would try [his]211-pierson utmost to grasp the character of [this man]2117-this man , who had lived such a roving life . ' Is [he]175-jimmy - can [he]175-jimmy be [the sort of man [I]0-i would trust [Nollie]131-nollie to]2118-the sort of man i would trust nollie to ? ' [he]211-pierson would think . ' Oh , that [I]0-i should have to hope like this that [some good man]2119-some good man would marry [her]356-his daughter - [[my]0-i little Nollie]3094-my little nollie , [a child only the other day]2121-a child only the other day ! '

In these sad , painful , lonely weeks [he]211-pierson found a spot of something like refuge in [[Leila]208-leila 's sitting - room]2122-leila 's sitting - room , and would go [there]3137-there often for half an hour when [she]208-leila was back from [[her]208-leila hospital]3051-her hospital . [That little black - walled room with [its]2125-that little black - walled room with its japanese prints and its flowers Japanese prints and its flowers]2125-that little black - walled room with its japanese prints and its flowers , soothed [him]211-pierson . And [Leila]208-leila soothed [him]211-pierson , innocent as [he]211-pierson was of any knowledge of [her]208-leila latest aberration , and perhaps conscious that [she]208-leila [herself]208-leila was not too happy . To watch [her]208-leila arranging flowers , singing [her]208-leila little French songs , or to find [her]208-leila beside [him]211-pierson , listening to [his]211-pierson confidences , was the only real pleasure [he]211-pierson knew in these days . And [Leila]208-leila , in turn , would watch [him]211-pierson and think : ' [Poor Edward]122-pierson ! [He]211-pierson has never lived ; and never will ; now ! ' But sometimes the thought would shoot through [her]208-leila : ' Perhaps [he]211-pierson 's to be envied . [He]211-pierson does n't feel what [I]0-i feel , anyway . Why did [I]0-i fall in love again ? '

[They]2126-they did not speak of [Noel]197-noel as a rule , but one evening [she]208-leila expressed [her]208-leila views roundly .

" It was a great mistake to make [Noel]197-noel come back . [Edward]122-pierson . It was [Quixotic]264-quixotic . [You]4162-you 'll be lucky if real mischief does n't come of it . [She]208-leila 's not [a patient character]4163-a patient character ; one day [she]208-leila 'll do something rash . And , mind [you]4162-you , [she]208-leila 'll be much more likely to break out if [she]208-leila sees [the world]606-the world treating [you]4162-you badly than if it happens to [herself]208-leila . [I]208-leila should send [her]208-leila back to [the country]334-the country , before [she]208-leila makes bad worse . "[208-leila]

" [I]208-leila ca n't do that , [Leila]208-leila . [We]4166-we must live it down together . "[208-leila]

" Wrong , [Edward]122-pierson . [You]122-pierson should take things as they are . "[208-leila]

With a heavy sigh [Pierson]122-pierson answered :

" [I]122-pierson wish [I]122-pierson could see [her]208-leila future . [She]208-leila 's so attractive . And [her]208-leila defences are gone . [She]208-leila 's lost faith , and belief in all that [a good woman]3859-a good woman should be . The day after [she]208-leila came back [she]208-leila told [me]122-pierson [she]208-leila was ashamed of [herself]208-leila . But since - [she]208-leila 's not given a sign . [She]208-leila 's so proud - [[my]122-pierson poor little Nollie]3926-my poor little nollie . [I]122-pierson see how [men]3061-men admire [her]208-leila , too . [[Our]4170-our Belgian friend]4171-our belgian friend is painting [her]208-leila . [He]4171-our belgian friend 's [a good man]3731-a good man ; but [he]4171-our belgian friend finds [her]208-leila beautiful , and who can wonder . And [[your]208-leila friend]4173-your friend Captain Fort . [Fathers]1787-fathers are supposed to be blind , but [they]1787-fathers see very clear sometimes . "[122-pierson]

[Leila]208-leila rose and drew down a blind .

" [This sun]4175-this sun , "[208-leila] [she]208-leila said . " Does [Jimmy Fort]175-jimmy come to [you]208-leila - often ? "[208-leila]

" Oh ! no ; very seldom . But still - [I]208-leila can see . "[208-leila]

' [You]2127-you bat - [you]2127-you blunderer ! ' thought [Leila]208-leila : ' See ! [You]2127-you ca n't even see this beside [you]2127-you ! '

" [I]208-leila expect [he]175-jimmy 's sorry for [her]208-leila , "[208-leila] [she]208-leila said in a queer voice .

" Why should [he]175-jimmy be sorry ? [He]175-jimmy does n't know : "[208-leila]

" Oh , yes ! [He]175-jimmy knows ; [I]208-leila told [him]175-jimmy . "[208-leila]

" [You]208-leila told [him]175-jimmy ! "[208-leila]

" Yes , "[208-leila] [Leila]208-leila repeated stubbornly ; " and [he]175-jimmy 's sorry for [her]208-leila . "[208-leila]

And even then " [this monk "[208-leila] beside [her]208-leila]4176-this monk " beside her did not see , and went blundering on .

" No , no ; it 's not merely that [he]175-jimmy 's sorry . By the way [he]175-jimmy looks at [her]208-leila , [I]208-leila know [I]208-leila 'm not mistaken . [I]208-leila 've wondered - what do [you]208-leila think , [Leila]208-leila . [He]175-jimmy 's too old for [her]208-leila ; but [he]175-jimmy seems [an honourable , kind man]4177-an honourable , kind man . "[208-leila]

" Oh ! [a most honourable , kind man]4178-a most honourable , kind man . "[208-leila] But only by pressing [her]208-leila hand against [her]208-leila lips had [she]208-leila smothered a burst of bitter laughter . [He]2128-he , who saw nothing , could yet notice [Fort]175-jimmy 's eyes when [he]2128-he looked at [Noel]197-noel , and be positive that [he]2128-he was in love with [her]208-leila ! How plainly those eyes must speak ! [Her]208-leila control gave way .

" All this is very interesting , "[208-leila] [she]208-leila said , spurning [her]208-leila words like [Noel]197-noel , " considering that [he]2128-he 's more than [[my]208-leila friend]4179-my friend , [Edward]122-pierson . "[208-leila] It gave [her]208-leila a sort of pleasure to see [him]2128-he wince . ' [These blind bats]2129-these blind bats ! ' [she]208-leila thought , terribly stung that [he]2128-he should so clearly assume [her]208-leila out of the running . Then [she]208-leila was sorry , [his]2128-he face had become so still and wistful . And turning away , [she]208-leila said :

" Oh ! [I]208-leila sha n't break [my]208-leila heart ; [I]208-leila 'm [a good loser]4180-a good loser . And [I]208-leila 'm [a good fighter]4181-a good fighter , too ; perhaps [I]208-leila sha n't lose . "[208-leila] And snapping off a sprig of geranium , [she]208-leila pressed it to [her]208-leila lips .

" Forgive [me]122-pierson , "[122-pierson] said [Pierson]122-pierson slowly ; " [I]122-pierson did n't know . [I]122-pierson 'm stupid . [I]122-pierson thought [your]208-leila love for [[your]208-leila poor soldiers]4182-your poor soldiers had left no room for other feelings . "[122-pierson]

[Leila]208-leila uttered a shrill laugh . " What have [they]4183-they to do with each other ? Did [you]122-pierson never hear of passion , [Edward]122-pierson ? Oh ! Do n't look at [me]208-leila like that . Do [you]122-pierson think [a woman]3280-a woman ca n't feel passion at [my]208-leila age ? As much as ever , more than ever , because it 's all slipping away . "[208-leila]

[She]208-leila took [her]208-leila hand from [her]208-leila lips , but a geranium petal was left clinging there , like a bloodstain . " What has [your]2130-your life been all these years , "[208-leila] [she]208-leila went on vehemently - ' suppression of passion , nothing else ! [You]2130-your monks twist [Nature]161-nature up with holy words , and try to disguise what [the eeriest simpleton]2131-the eeriest simpleton can see . Well , [I]0-i have n't suppressed passion , [Edward]122-pierson . That 's all . "[208-leila]

" And are [you]122-pierson happier for that ? "[208-leila]

" [I]208-leila was ; and [I]208-leila shall be again . "[208-leila]

A little smile curled [Pierson]122-pierson 's lips . " Shall be ? "[122-pierson] [he]122-pierson said . " [I]122-pierson hope so . It 's just two ways of looking at things , [Leila]208-leila . "[122-pierson]

" Oh , [Edward]122-pierson ! Do n't be so gentle ! [I]122-pierson suppose [you]122-pierson do n't think [a person like [me]122-pierson]4185-a person like me can ever really love ? "[122-pierson]

[He]122-pierson was standing before [her]208-leila with [his]122-pierson head down , and a sense that , naive and bat - like as [he]122-pierson was , there was something in [him]122-pierson [she]208-leila could not reach or understand , made [her]208-leila cry out :

" [I]208-leila 've not been nice to [you]122-pierson . Forgive [me]208-leila , [Edward]122-pierson ! [I]208-leila 'm so unhappy . "[208-leila]

" There was a Greek who used to say : ' [God]143-god is the helping of [man]631-man by [man]631-man . ' It is n't true , but it 's beautiful . Good - bye , dear [Leila]208-leila , and do n't be sorrowful . "[122-pierson]

[She]208-leila squeezed [his]122-pierson hand , and turned to the window .

[She]208-leila stood there watching [his]122-pierson black figure cross [the road]685-the road in the sunshine , and pass round the corner by the railings of [the church]372-the church . [He]122-pierson walked quickly , very upright ; there was something unseeing even about that back view of [him]122-pierson ; or was it that [he]122-pierson saw - [another world]2134-another world ? [She]208-leila had never lost the mental habits of [her]208-leila orthodox girlhood , and in spite of all impatience , recognised [his]122-pierson sanctity . When [he]122-pierson had disappeared [she]208-leila went into [[her]208-leila bedroom]1291-her bedroom . What [he]122-pierson had said , indeed , was no discovery . [She]208-leila had known . Oh ! [She]208-leila had known . ' Why did n't [I]0-i accept [Jimmy]175-jimmy 's offer ? Why did n't [I]0-i marry [him]122-pierson ? Is it too late ? ' [she]208-leila thought . ' Could [I]0-i ? Would [he]122-pierson - even now ? ' But then [she]208-leila started away from [her]208-leila own thought . Marry [him]122-pierson ! knowing [his]122-pierson heart was with [this girl]2136-this girl ?

[She]208-leila looked long at [her]208-leila face in the mirror , studying with a fearful interest the little hard lines and markings there beneath their light coating of powder . [She]208-leila examined the cunning touches of colouring matter here and there in [her]208-leila front hair . Were they cunning enough ? Did [they]2137-they deceive ? [They]2137-they seemed to [her]208-leila suddenly to stare out . [She]208-leila fingered and smoothed the slight looseness and fulness of the skin below [her]208-leila chin . [She]208-leila stretched [herself]208-leila , and passed [her]208-leila hands down over [her]208-leila whole form , searching as it were for slackness , or thickness . And [she]208-leila had the bitter thought : ' [I]0-i 'm all out . [I]0-i 'm doing all [I]0-i can . ' The lines of a little poem [Fort]175-jimmy had showed [her]208-leila went thrumming through [her]208-leila head :

" Time , [[you]175-jimmy old gipsy man]4188-you old gipsy man Will [you]175-jimmy not stay Put up [[your]175-jimmy caravan]4189-your caravan Just for a day ? "[175-jimmy]

What more could [she]208-leila do ? [He]175-jimmy did not like to see [her]208-leila lips reddened . [She]208-leila had marked [his]175-jimmy disapprovals , watched [him]175-jimmy wipe [his]175-jimmy mouth after a kiss , when [he]175-jimmy thought [she]208-leila could n't see [him]175-jimmy . ' [I]0-i need'nt ! ' [she]208-leila thought . ' [Noel]197-noel 's lips are no redder , really . What has [she]2138-she better than [I]0-i ? Youth - dew on the grass ! ' That did n't last long ! But long enough to " do [her]208-leila in "[2138-she] as [[her]208-leila soldier - men]2139-her soldier - men would say . And , suddenly [she]208-leila revolted against [herself]208-leila , against [Fort]175-jimmy , against [this chilled and foggy country]2140-this chilled and foggy country ; felt a fierce nostalgia for African sun , and the African flowers ; the happy - go - lucky , hand - to - mouth existence of those five years before the war began . [High Constantia]41-high constantia at grape harvest ! How many years ago - ten years , eleven years ! Ah ! To have before [her]208-leila those ten years , with [him]175-jimmy ! Ten years in the sun ! [He]175-jimmy would have loved [her]208-leila then , and gone on loving [her]208-leila ! And [she]208-leila would not have tired of [him]175-jimmy , as [she]208-leila had tired of those others . ' In half an hour , ' [she]208-leila thought , ' [he]175-jimmy 'll be here , sit opposite [me]0-i ; [I]0-i shall see [him]175-jimmy struggling forcing [himself]175-jimmy to seem affectionate ! It 's too humbling ! But [I]0-i do n't care ; [I]0-i want [him]175-jimmy ! '

[She]208-leila searched [her]208-leila wardrobe , for some garment or touch of colour , novelty of any sort , to help [her]208-leila . But [she]208-leila had tried them all - those little tricks - was bankrupt . And such a discouraged , heavy mood came on [her]208-leila , that [she]208-leila did not even " change , "[1694-the maid] but went back in [[her]208-leila nurse]1377-her nurse 's dress and lay down on the divan , pretending to sleep , while [the maid]1694-the maid set out the supper . [She]208-leila lay there moody and motionless , trying to summon courage , feeling that if [she]208-leila showed [herself]208-leila beaten [she]208-leila was beaten ; knowing that [she]208-leila only held [him]175-jimmy by pity . But when [she]208-leila heard [his]175-jimmy footstep on [the stairs]1892-the stairs [she]208-leila swiftly passed [her]208-leila hands over [her]208-leila cheeks , as if to press the blood out of them , and lay absolutely still . [She]208-leila hoped that [she]208-leila was white , and indeed [she]208-leila was , with finger - marks under the eyes , for [she]208-leila had suffered greatly this last hour . Through [her]208-leila lashes [she]208-leila saw [him]175-jimmy halt , and look at [her]208-leila in surprise . Asleep , or - ill , which ? [She]208-leila did not move . [She]208-leila wanted to watch [him]175-jimmy . [He]175-jimmy tiptoed across [the room]517-the room and stood looking down at [her]208-leila . There was a furrow between [his]175-jimmy eyes . ' Ah ! ' [she]208-leila thought , ' it would suit [you]175-jimmy , if [I]0-i were dead , [[my]0-i kind friend]2145-my kind friend . ' [He]175-jimmy bent a little towards [her]208-leila ; and [she]208-leila wondered suddenly whether [she]208-leila looked graceful lying there , sorry now that [she]208-leila had not changed [her]208-leila dress . [She]208-leila saw [him]175-jimmy shrug [his]175-jimmy shoulders ever so faintly with a puzzled little movement . [He]175-jimmy had not seen that [she]208-leila was shamming . How nice [his]175-jimmy face was - not mean , secret , callous ! [She]208-leila opened [her]208-leila eyes , which against [her]208-leila will had in them the despair [she]208-leila was feeling . [He]175-jimmy went on [his]175-jimmy knees , and lifting [her]208-leila hand to [his]175-jimmy lips , hid them with it .

" [Jimmy]175-jimmy , "[208-leila] [she]208-leila said gently , " [I]208-leila 'm an awful bore to [you]175-jimmy . [Poor Jimmy]175-jimmy ! No ! Do n't pretend ! [I]208-leila know what [I]208-leila know ! "[208-leila] ' Oh , [God]143-god ! What am [I]0-i saying ? ' [she]208-leila thought . ' It 's fatal - fatal . [I]0-i ought never ! ' And drawing [his]175-jimmy head to [her]208-leila , [she]208-leila put it to [her]208-leila heart . Then , instinctively aware that this moment had been pressed to its uttermost , [she]208-leila scrambled up , kissed [his]175-jimmy forehead , stretched [herself]208-leila , and laughed .

" [I]208-leila was asleep , dreaming ; dreaming [you]175-jimmy loved [me]208-leila . Was n't it funny ? Come along . There are oysters , for the last time this season . "[208-leila]

All that evening , as if [both]1354-both knew [they]1354-both had been looking over a precipice , [they]1354-both seemed to be treading warily , desperately anxious not to rouse emotion in [each other]493-each other , or touch on things which must bring a scene . And [Leila]208-leila talked incessantly of [Africa]86-africa .

" Do n't [you]175-jimmy long for the sun , [Jimmy]175-jimmy ? Could n't [we]1354-both - could n't [you]175-jimmy go ? Oh ! why does n't this wretched war end ? All that [we]1354-both 've got here at [home]3048-home every scrap of wealth , and comfort , and age , and art , and music , [I]208-leila 'd give it all for the light and the sun out there . Would n't [you]175-jimmy ? "[208-leila]

And [Fort]175-jimmy said [he]175-jimmy would , knowing well of one thing which [he]175-jimmy would not give . And [she]208-leila knew that , as well as [he]175-jimmy .

[They]1354-both were both gayer than [they]1354-both had been for a long time ; so that when [he]175-jimmy had gone , [she]208-leila fell back once more on to the divan , and burying [her]208-leila face in a cushion , wept bitterly .

V

1

It was not quite disillusionment that [Pierson]122-pierson felt while [he]122-pierson walked away . Perhaps [he]122-pierson had not really believed in [Leila]208-leila 's regeneration . It was more an acute discomfort , an increasing loneliness . A soft and restful spot was now denied [him]122-pierson ; a certain warmth and allurement had gone out of [his]122-pierson life . [He]122-pierson had not even the feeling that it was [his]122-pierson duty to try and save [Leila]208-leila by persuading [her]208-leila to marry [Fort]175-jimmy . [He]122-pierson had always been too sensitive , too much as it were of [a gentleman , for the robuster sorts of evangelism]2148-a gentleman , for the robuster sorts of evangelism . Such delicacy had been a stumbling - block to [him]122-pierson all through professional life . In the eight years when [[his]122-pierson wife]618-his wife was with [him]122-pierson , all had been more certain , more direct and simple , with the help of [her]618-his wife sympathy , judgment ; and companionship . At [her]618-his wife death a sort of mist had gathered in [his]122-pierson soul . [No one]3081-no one had ever spoken plainly to [him]122-pierson . To [a clergyman]3290-a clergyman , who does ? [No one]3081-no one had told [him]122-pierson in so many words that [he]122-pierson should have married again - that to stay unmarried was bad for [him]122-pierson , physically and spiritually , fogging and perverting life ; not driving [him]122-pierson , indeed , as it drove many , to intolerance and cruelty , but to that half - living dreaminess , and the vague unhappy yearnings which so constantly beset [him]122-pierson . All these celibate years [he]122-pierson had really only been happy in [his]122-pierson music , or in [far - away country places]2153-far - away country places , taking strong exercise , and losing [himself]122-pierson in the beauties of Nature ; and since the war began [he]122-pierson had only once , for those three days at [Kestrel]199-kestrel , been out of [London]7-london .

[He]122-pierson walked [home]3048-home , going over in [his]122-pierson mind very anxiously all the evidence [he]122-pierson had of [Fort]175-jimmy 's feeling for [Noel]197-noel . How many times had [he]122-pierson been to [them]2155-them since [she]2156-her came back ? Only three times - three evening visits ! And [he]122-pierson had not been alone with [her]2156-her a single minute ! Before this calamity befell [[his]122-pierson daughter]356-his daughter , [he]122-pierson would never have observed anything in [Fort]175-jimmy 's demeanour ; but , in [his]122-pierson new watchfulness , [he]122-pierson had seen the almost reverential way [he]122-pierson looked at [her]2156-her , noticed the extra softness of [his]122-pierson voice when [he]122-pierson spoke to [her]2156-her , and once a look of sudden pain , a sort of dulling of [his]122-pierson whole self , when [Noel]197-noel had got up and gone out of [the room]517-the room . And [the girl]525-the girl [herself]525-the girl ? Twice [he]122-pierson had surprised [her]2156-her gazing at [Fort]175-jimmy when [he]122-pierson was not looking , with a sort of brooding interest . [He]122-pierson remembered how , as [a little girl]1665-a little girl , [she]2156-her would watch [a grown - up]2161-a grown - up , and then suddenly one day attach [herself]2156-her to [him]122-pierson , and be quite devoted . Yes , [he]122-pierson must warn [her]2156-her , before [she]2156-her could possibly become entangled . In [his]122-pierson fastidious chastity , the opinion [he]122-pierson had held of [Fort]175-jimmy was suddenly lowered . [He]122-pierson , already [a free - thinker]2162-a free - thinker , was now revealed as [a free - liver]2163-a free - liver . [Poor little Nollie]131-nollie ! [Endangered]266-endangered again already ! Every man a kind of wolf waiting to pounce on [her]131-nollie !

[He]122-pierson found [Lavendie]253-lavendie and [Noel]197-noel in [the drawing - room]1382-the drawing - room , standing before the portrait which was nearing completion . [He]122-pierson looked at it for a long minute , and turned away :

" Do n't [you]253-lavendie think it 's like [me]122-pierson , [Daddy]132-daddy ? "[122-pierson]

" It 's like [you]132-daddy ; but it hurts [me]122-pierson . [I]122-pierson ca n't tell why . "[122-pierson]

[He]122-pierson saw the smile of [a painter whose picture is being criticised]2165-a painter whose picture is being criticised come on [Lavendie]253-lavendie 's face .

" It is perhaps the colouring which does not please [you]132-daddy , [monsieur]1551-monsieur ? "[122-pierson]

" No , no ; deeper . The expression ; what is [she]253-lavendie waiting for ? "[122-pierson]

The defensive smile died on [Lavendie]253-lavendie 's lips .

" It is as [I]122-pierson see [her]253-lavendie , [monsieur le cure]3730-monsieur le cure . "[122-pierson]

[Pierson]122-pierson turned again to the picture , and suddenly covered [his]122-pierson eyes . " [She]253-lavendie looks ' fey , "[122-pierson] ' [he]122-pierson said , and went out of [the room]517-the room .

[Lavendie]253-lavendie and [Noel]197-noel remained staring at the picture . " Fey ? What does that mean , mademoiselle ? "[253-lavendie]

" Possessed , or something . "[122-pierson]

And [they]2167-they continued to stare at the picture , till [Lavendie]253-lavendie said :

" [I]253-lavendie think there is still a little too much light on that ear . "[253-lavendie]

The same evening , at bedtime , [Pierson]122-pierson called [Noel]197-noel back .

" Nollie , [I]253-lavendie want [you]197-noel to know something . In all but the name , [Captain Fort]197-noel is [a married man]4193-a married man . "[253-lavendie]

[He]122-pierson saw [her]253-lavendie flush , and felt [his]122-pierson own face darkening with colour .

[She]253-lavendie said calmly : " [I]253-lavendie know ; to [Leila]208-leila . "[253-lavendie]

" Do [you]122-pierson mean [she]208-leila has told [you]122-pierson ? "[253-lavendie]

[Noel]197-noel shook [her]253-lavendie head .

" Then how ? "[253-lavendie]

" [I]122-pierson guessed . [Daddy]132-daddy , do n't treat [me]122-pierson as [a child]415-a child any more . What 's the use , now ? "[122-pierson]

[He]122-pierson sat down in the chair before the hearth , and covered [his]122-pierson face with [his]122-pierson hands . By the quivering of those hands , and the movement of [his]122-pierson shoulders , [she]253-lavendie could tell that [he]122-pierson was stifling emotion , perhaps even crying ; and sinking down on [his]122-pierson knees [she]253-lavendie pressed [his]122-pierson hands and face to [her]253-lavendie , murmuring : " Oh , [[Daddy]132-daddy dear]3579-daddy dear ! Oh , [[Daddy]132-daddy dear]3579-daddy dear ! "[253-lavendie]

[He]122-pierson put [his]122-pierson arms round [her]253-lavendie , and [they]2168-they sat a long time with [their]2168-they cheeks pressed together , not speaking a word .

VI

1

The day after that silent outburst of emotion in [the drawing - room]1382-the drawing - room was a Sunday . And , obeying the longing awakened overnight to be as good as [she]253-lavendie could to [[her]253-lavendie father]384-her father ; [Noel]197-noel said to [him]384-her father :

" Would [you]384-her father like [me]197-noel to come to [Church]3057-church ? "[197-noel]

" Of course , [Nollie]131-nollie . "[197-noel]

How could [he]122-pierson have answered otherwise ? To [him]122-pierson Church was [the home of comfort and absolution]2171-the home of comfort and absolution , where [people]3083-people must bring [their]3083-people sins and troubles - a haven of [sinners]2173-sinners , the fount of charity , of forgiveness , and love . Not to have believed that , after all these years , would have been to deny all [his]122-pierson usefulness in life , and to cast a slur on [the House of [God]143-god]2174-the house of god .

And so [Noel]197-noel walked [there]3137-there with [him]384-her father , for [Gratian]127-gratian had gone down to [George]140-george , for the week - end . [She]127-gratian slipped quietly up the side aisle to [their]2176-their empty pew , under the pulpit . Never turning [her]127-gratian eyes from [the chancel]986-the chancel , [she]127-gratian remained unconscious of the stir [her]127-gratian presence made , during that hour and twenty minutes . Behind [her]127-gratian , the dumb currents of wonder , disapproval , and resentment ran a stealthy course . On [her]127-gratian all eyes were fixed sooner or later , and every mind became the play ground of judgments . From [every soul]2178-every soul , kneeling , standing , or sitting , while the voice of [the Service]2179-the service droned , sang , or spoke , a kind of glare radiated on to that one small devoted head , which seemed so ludicrously devout . [She]127-gratian disturbed [their]2176-their devotions , [this girl who had betrayed [[her]127-gratian father]384-her father , [her]127-gratian faith , [[her]127-gratian class]945-her class]2180-this girl who had betrayed her father , her faith , her class . [She]127-gratian ought to repent , of course , and [Church]236-church was the right place ; yet there was something brazen in [her]127-gratian repenting there before [their]2176-their very eyes ; [she]127-gratian was too palpable a flaw in the crystal of [the Church]372-the church 's authority , too visible a rent in the raiment of [[their]2176-their priest]2184-their priest . [Her]127-gratian figure focused all the uneasy amazement and heart searchings of these last weeks . [Mothers]399-mothers quivered with the knowledge that [[their]399-mothers daughters]2186-their daughters could see [her]127-gratian ; [wives]2032-wives with the idea that [[their]2032-wives husbands]2188-their husbands were seeing [her]127-gratian . [Men]3061-men experienced sensations varying from condemnation to a sort of covetousness . [Young folk]2190-young folk wondered , and felt inclined to giggle . [Old maids]2191-old maids could hardly bear to look . Here and there [a man or woman who had seen life face to face]2192-a man or woman who had seen life face to face , was simply sorry ! The consciousness of [all who knew [her]127-gratian personally]2193-all who knew her personally was at stretch how to behave if [they]2193-all who knew her personally came within reach of [her]127-gratian in going out . For , though [only half a dozen]2194-only half a dozen would actually rub shoulders with [her]127-gratian , [all]1872-all knew that [they]2194-only half a dozen might be , and [many]2196-many felt it [their]2196-many duty to be , of [that half - dozen]2197-that half - dozen , so as to establish [their]2196-many attitude once for all . It was , in fact , too severe a test for human nature and the feelings which [Church]236-church ought to arouse . The stillness of [that young figure]2198-that young figure , the impossibility of seeing [her]127-gratian face and judging of [her]127-gratian state of mind thereby ; finally , a faint lurking shame that [they]2193-all who knew her personally should be so intrigued and disturbed by something which had to do with sex , in [this House of Worship]2199-this house of worship - all combined to produce in every mind that herd - feeling of defence , which so soon becomes , offensive . And , half unconscious , half aware of it all , [Noel]197-noel stood , and sat , and knelt . Once or twice [she]127-gratian saw [[her]127-gratian father]384-her father 's eyes fixed on [her]127-gratian ; and , still in the glow of last night 's pity and remorse , felt a kind of worship for [his]384-her father thin grave face . But for the most part , [her]127-gratian own wore the expression [Lavendie]253-lavendie had translated to [his]384-her father canvas - the look of one ever waiting for the extreme moments of life , for those few and fleeting poignancies which existence holds for the human heart . A look neither hungry nor dissatisfied , but dreamy and expectant , which might blaze into warmth and depth at any moment , and then go back to its dream .

When the last notes of the organ died away [she]127-gratian continued to sit very still , without looking round .

There was no second Service , and [the congregation]443-the congregation melted out behind [her]127-gratian , and had dispersed into [the streets]3240-the streets and [squares]2203-squares long before [she]127-gratian came forth . After hesitating whether or no to go to the vestry door , [she]127-gratian turned away and walked [home]3048-home alone .

It was this deliberate evasion of all contact which probably clinched the business . The absence of vent , of any escape - pipe for the feelings , is always dangerous . [They]2193-all who knew her personally felt cheated . If [Noel]197-noel had come out amongst all those whose devotions [her]127-gratian presence had disturbed , if in [that exit]2205-that exit , [some]464-some had shown and [others]395-others had witnessed one knows not what of a manifested ostracism , the outraged sense of social decency might have been appeased and sleeping dogs allowed to lie , for [we]2208-we soon get used to things ; and , after all , the war took precedence in every mind even over social decency . But none of this had occurred , and a sense that Sunday after Sunday the same little outrage would happen to [them]2193-all who knew her personally , moved [more than a dozen quite unrelated persons]2209-more than a dozen quite unrelated persons , and caused the posting that evening of as many letters , signed and unsigned , to a certain quarter . [London]7-london is [no place for]2210-no place for [parish conspiracy]2211-parish conspiracy , and a situation which in [the country]334-the country would have provoked meetings more or less public , and possibly a resolution , could perhaps only thus be dealt with . Besides , in certain folk there is ever a mysterious itch to write an unsigned letter - such missives satisfy some obscure sense of justice , some uncontrollable longing to get even with those who have hurt or disturbed [them]2193-all who knew her personally , without affording the offenders chance for further hurt or disturbance .

Letters which are posted often reach [their]2193-all who knew her personally destination .

On Wednesday morning [Pierson]122-pierson was sitting in [[his]122-pierson study]1331-his study at the hour devoted to the calls of [[his]122-pierson parishioners]1234-his parishioners , when [the maid]1694-the maid announced , " [Canon Rushbourne]267-canon rushbourne , [sir]3028-sir , "[1694-the maid] and [he]122-pierson saw before [him]122-pierson [an old College friend whom [he]122-pierson had met but seldom in recent years]2216-an old college friend whom he had met but seldom in recent years . [[His]122-pierson visitor]2217-his visitor was [a short , grey - haired man of rather portly figure , whose round , rosy , good - humoured face had a look of sober goodness]2218-a short , grey - haired man of rather portly figure , whose round , rosy , good - humoured face had a look of sober goodness , and whose light - blue eyes shone a little . [He]122-pierson grasped [Pierson]122-pierson 's hand , and said in a voice to whose natural heavy resonance professional duty had added a certain unction :

" [[My]122-pierson dear]3031-my dear [Edward]122-pierson , how many years it is since [we]4200-we met ! Do [you]122-pierson remember [dear old Blakeway]268-dear old blakeway ? [I]122-pierson saw [him]268-dear old blakeway only yesterday . [He]268-dear old blakeway 's just the same . [I]122-pierson 'm delighted to see [you]122-pierson again , "[122-pierson] and [he]122-pierson laughed a little soft nervous laugh . Then for a few moments [he]122-pierson talked of the war and old College days , and [Pierson]122-pierson looked at [him]122-pierson and thought : ' What has [he]122-pierson come for ? '

" [You]122-pierson 've something to say to [me]122-pierson , [Alec]269-alec , "[122-pierson] [he]122-pierson said , at last .

[Canon Rushbourne]267-canon rushbourne leaned forward in [his]267-canon rushbourne chair , and answered with evident effort : " Yes ; [I]267-canon rushbourne wanted to have a little talk with [you]122-pierson , [Edward]122-pierson . [I]267-canon rushbourne hope [you]122-pierson wo n't mind . [I]267-canon rushbourne do hope [you]122-pierson wo n't . "[267-canon rushbourne]

" Why should [I]267-canon rushbourne mind ? "[267-canon rushbourne]

[Canon Rushbourne]267-canon rushbourne 's eyes shone more than ever , there was real friendliness in [his]267-canon rushbourne face .

" [I]267-canon rushbourne know [you]122-pierson 've every right to say to [me]267-canon rushbourne : ' Mind [your]122-pierson own business . ' But [I]267-canon rushbourne made up [my]267-canon rushbourne mind to come as [a friend]1505-a friend , hoping to save [you]122-pierson from - er "[267-canon rushbourne] [he]267-canon rushbourne stammered , and began again : " [I]267-canon rushbourne think [you]122-pierson ought to know of the feeling in [[your]122-pierson parish]4202-your parish that - er - that - er - [your]122-pierson position is very delicate . Without breach of confidence [I]267-canon rushbourne may tell [you]122-pierson that letters have been sent to [headquarters]4203-headquarters ; [you]122-pierson can imagine perhaps what [I]267-canon rushbourne mean . Do believe , [[my]267-canon rushbourne dear friend]4204-my dear friend , that [I]267-canon rushbourne 'm actuated by [my]267-canon rushbourne old affection for [you]122-pierson ; nothing else , [I]267-canon rushbourne do assure [you]122-pierson . "[267-canon rushbourne]

In the silence , [his]267-canon rushbourne breathing could be heard , as of [a man a little touched with asthma]2219-a man a little touched with asthma , while [he]267-canon rushbourne continually smoothed [his]267-canon rushbourne thick black knees , [his]267-canon rushbourne whole face radiating an anxious kindliness . The sun shone brightly on [those two black figures]2220-those two black figures , so very different , and drew out of [their]2220-those two black figures well - worn garments the faint latent green mossiness which . underlies the clothes of [clergymen]2221-clergymen .

At last [Pierson]122-pierson said : " Thank [you]2222-the canon , [Alec]269-alec ; [I]122-pierson understand . "[122-pierson]

[The Canon]2222-the canon uttered a resounding sigh . " [You]122-pierson did n't realise how very easily [people]3083-people misinterpret [her]4206-her being here with [you]122-pierson ; it seems to [them]3083-people a kind - a kind of challenge . [They]3083-people were bound , [I]2222-the canon think , to feel that ; and [I]2222-the canon 'm afraid , in consequence - "[2222-the canon] [He]2222-the canon stopped , moved by the fact that [Pierson]122-pierson had closed [his]122-pierson eyes .

" [I]2222-the canon am to choose , [you]2222-the canon mean , between [[my]2222-the canon daughter]3140-my daughter and [[my]2222-the canon parish]4208-my parish ? "[2222-the canon]

[The Canon]2222-the canon seemed , with a stammer of words , to try and blunt the edge of that clear question .

" [My]2222-the canon visit is quite informal , [[my]2222-the canon dear fellow]3426-my dear fellow ; [I]2222-the canon ca n't say at all . But there is evidently much feeling ; that is what [I]2222-the canon wanted [you]3426-my dear fellow to know . [You]3426-my dear fellow have n't quite seen , [I]2222-the canon think , that - "[2222-the canon]

[Pierson]122-pierson raised [his]122-pierson hand . " [I]122-pierson ca n't talk of this . "[122-pierson]

[The Canon]2222-the canon rose . " Believe [me]122-pierson , [Edward]122-pierson , [I]122-pierson sympathise deeply . [I]122-pierson felt [I]122-pierson had to warn [you]3426-my dear fellow . "[122-pierson] [He]122-pierson held out [his]122-pierson hand . " Good - bye , [[my]122-pierson dear friend]4204-my dear friend , do forgive [me]122-pierson "[122-pierson] ; and [he]122-pierson went out . In [the hall]522-the hall an adventure befell [him]122-pierson so plump , and awkward , that [he]122-pierson could barely recite it to [Mrs. Rushbourne]270-mrs. rushbourne that night .

" Coming out from [[my]122-pierson poor friend]4211-my poor friend , "[122-pierson] [he]122-pierson said , " [I]122-pierson ran into [[a baby]4141-a baby 's perambulator]4213-a baby 's perambulator and [that young mother , whom [I]122-pierson remember as a little thing]4214-that young mother , whom i remember as a little thing "[122-pierson] - [he]122-pierson held [his]122-pierson hand at the level of [his]122-pierson thigh - " arranging it for going out . It startled [me]122-pierson ; and [I]122-pierson fear [I]122-pierson asked quite foolishly : ' Is it [a boy]797-a boy ? ' [The poor young thing]4216-the poor young thing looked up at [me]122-pierson . [She]4216-the poor young thing has very large eyes , quite beautiful , strange eyes .
