[You]4218-young lady must forgive [me]122-pierson . ' And then [she]4216-the poor young thing said : ' Are [they]4220-they going to ask [him]132-daddy to resign ? ' ' That depends on [you]4218-young lady , ' [I]122-pierson said . Why do [I]122-pierson say these things , [Charlotte]271-charlotte ? [I]122-pierson ought simply to have held [my]122-pierson tongue . [Poor young thing]4221-poor young thing ; so very young ! And [the little baby]4222-the little baby ! "[122-pierson] " [She]4216-the poor young thing has brought it on [herself]4216-the poor young thing , [Alec]269-alec , "[270-mrs. rushbourne] [Mrs. Rushbourne]270-mrs. rushbourne replied .

VII

1

The moment [[his]2226-his visitor]2217-his visitor had vanished , [Pierson]122-pierson paced up and down [the study]1235-the study , with anger rising in [his]2226-his , heart . [[His]122-pierson daughter]356-his daughter or [[his]122-pierson parish]338-his parish ! [The old saw]2231-the old saw , " [[An Englishman]839-an englishman 's house]4224-an englishman 's house is [[his]839-an englishman castle]4225-his castle ! "[2231-the old saw] was being attacked within [him]2226-his . Must [he]2226-his not then harbour [[his]2226-his own daughter]1493-his own daughter , and help [her]1493-his own daughter by candid atonement to regain [her]1493-his own daughter inward strength and peace ? Was [he]2226-his not thereby acting as [a true Christian]2233-a true christian , in by far the hardest course [he]2226-his and [she]1493-his own daughter could pursue ? To go back on that decision and imperil [[his]2226-his daughter]356-his daughter 's spirit , or else resign [[his]2226-his parish]338-his parish - the alternatives were brutal ! This was the centre of [[his]2226-his world]422-his world , [the only spot where so lonely [a man]3326-a man could hope to feel even the semblance of [home]3048-home]2237-the only spot where so lonely a man could hope to feel even the semblance of home ; a thousand little threads tethered [him]2226-his to [[his]2226-his church]421-his church , [[his]2226-his parishioners]1234-his parishioners , and [this house]2242-this house - for , to live on [here]3149-here if [he]2226-his gave up [[his]2226-his church]421-his church was out of the question . But [his]2226-his chief feeling was a bewildered anger that for doing what seemed to [him]2226-his [his]2226-his duty , [he]2226-his should be attacked by [[his]2226-his parishioners]1234-his parishioners .

A passion of desire to know what [they]1234-his parishioners really thought and felt - [these parishioners of [his]2226-his , whom [he]2226-his had befriended , and for whom [he]2226-his had worked so long]2246-these parishioners of his , whom he had befriended , and for whom he had worked so long - beset [him]2226-his now , and [he]2226-his went out . But the absurdity of [his]2226-his quest struck [him]2226-his before [he]2226-his had gone the length of [the Square]789-the square . [One]424-one could not go to [people]3083-people and say : " Stand and deliver [me]424-one [your]3083-people inmost judgments . "[424-one] And suddenly [he]2226-his was aware of how far away [he]2226-his really was from [them]3083-people . Through all [his]2226-his ministrations had [he]2226-his ever come to know [their]3083-people hearts ? And now , in this dire necessity for knowledge , there seemed no way of getting it . [He]2226-his went at random into [[a stationer]2250-a stationer 's shop]2251-a stationer 's shop ; [the shopman]2252-the shopman sang bass in [[his]2252-the shopman choir]2253-his choir . [They]2254-they had met Sunday after Sunday for the last seven years . But when , with this itch for intimate knowledge on [him]2226-his , [he]2226-his saw [the man behind the counter]2255-the man behind the counter , it was as if [he]2255-the man behind the counter were looking on [him]2226-his for the first time . The Russian proverb , " The heart of another is [a dark forest]4226-a dark forest , "[2255-the man behind the counter] gashed into [his]2226-his mind , while [he]2226-his said :

" Well , [Hodson]272-hodson , what news of [[your]3028-sir son]4227-your son ? "[2226-his]

" Nothing more , [Mr. Pierson]156-pierson , thank [you]3028-sir , [sir]3028-sir , nothing more at present . "[2226-his]

And it seemed to [Pierson]156-pierson , gazing at [the man]587-the man 's face clothed in a short , grizzling beard cut rather like [his]2226-his own , that [he]2226-his must be thinking : ' Ah ! [sir]3028-sir , but what news of [[your]3028-sir daughter]3820-your daughter ? ' [No one]3081-no one would ever tell [him]156-pierson to [his]156-pierson face what [he]156-pierson was thinking . And buying two pencils , [he]156-pierson went out . On the other side of [the road]685-the road was [[a bird - fancier]2261-a bird - fancier 's shop]2262-a bird - fancier 's shop , kept by [a woman whose husband had been taken for the Army]2263-a woman whose husband had been taken for the army . [She]2263-a woman whose husband had been taken for the army was not friendly towards [him]156-pierson , for it was known to [her]2263-a woman whose husband had been taken for the army that [he]156-pierson had expostulated with [[her]2263-a woman whose husband had been taken for the army husband]554-her husband for keeping larks , and other wild birds . And quite deliberately [he]156-pierson crossed [the road]685-the road , and stood looking in at the window , with the morbid hope that from [this unfriendly one]2266-this unfriendly one [he]156-pierson might hear truth . [She]2263-a woman whose husband had been taken for the army was in [[her]2263-a woman whose husband had been taken for the army shop]2267-her shop , and came to the door .

" Have [you]156-pierson any news of [[your]156-pierson husband]3384-your husband , [Mrs. Cherry]273-mrs. cherry ? "[2263-a woman whose husband had been taken for the army]

" No , [Mr. Pierson]156-pierson , [I]2263-a woman whose husband had been taken for the army ' ave not ; not this week . "[2263-a woman whose husband had been taken for the army]

" [He]3384-your husband has n't gone out yet ? "[2263-a woman whose husband had been taken for the army]

" No , [Mr. Pierson]156-pierson ; ' e ' as not . "[2263-a woman whose husband had been taken for the army]

There was no expression on [her]2263-a woman whose husband had been taken for the army face , perfectly blank it was - [Pierson]156-pierson had a mad longing to say ' For [God]143-god 's sake , [woman]1237-woman , speak out what 's in [your]1237-woman mind ; tell [me]0-i what [you]1237-woman think of [me]0-i and [[my]0-i daughter]3140-my daughter . Never mind [my]0-i cloth ! ' But [he]156-pierson could no more say it than [the woman]586-the woman could tell [him]156-pierson what was in [her]586-the woman mind . And with a " Good morning "[586-the woman] [he]156-pierson passed on . [No man]659-no man or [woman]1237-woman would tell [him]156-pierson anything , unless , perhaps , [they]2273-they were drunk . [He]156-pierson came to [a public house]2274-a public house , and for a moment even hesitated before [it]2274-a public house , but the thought of insult aimed at [Noel]197-noel stopped [him]156-pierson , and [he]156-pierson passed that too . And then reality made itself known to [him]156-pierson . Though [he]156-pierson had come out to hear what [they]2273-they were thinking , [he]156-pierson did not really want to hear it , could not endure it if [he]156-pierson did . [He]156-pierson had been too long immune from criticism , too long in the position of one who may tell others what [he]156-pierson thinks of [them]2273-they . And standing there in [the crowded street]2275-the crowded street , [he]156-pierson was attacked by that longing for [the country which had always come on [him]156-pierson when [he]156-pierson was hard pressed]2276-the country which had always come on him when he was hard pressed . [He]156-pierson looked at [his]156-pierson memoranda . By stupendous luck it was almost a blank day . An omnibus passed close by which would take [him]156-pierson far out . [He]156-pierson climbed on to [it]2277-it , and travelled as far as [Hendon]88-hendon ; then getting down , set forth on foot . It was bright and hot , and the May blossom in full foam . [He]156-pierson walked fast along [the perfectly straight road]2278-the perfectly straight road till [he]156-pierson came to [the top of [Elstree Hill]89-elstree hill]2279-the top of elstree hill . There for a few moments [he]156-pierson stood gazing at [the school chapel]2280-the school chapel , [the cricket - field]2281-the cricket - field , [the wide land beyond]2282-the wide land beyond . All was very quiet , for it was lunch - time . A horse was tethered there , and a strolling cat , as though struck by the tall black incongruity of [his]156-pierson figure , paused in [her]2283-her progress , then , slithering under the wicket gate , arched [her]2283-her back and rubbed [herself]2283-her against [his]156-pierson leg , crinkling and waving the tip of [her]2283-her tail . [Pierson]156-pierson bent down and stroked the creature 's head ; but uttering a faint miaou , the cat stepped daintily across [the road]685-the road , [Pierson]156-pierson too stepped on , past [the village]2285-the village , and down over the stile , into [a field path]2286-a field path . At the edge of the young clover , under [a bank of hawthorn]2287-a bank of hawthorn , [he]156-pierson lay down on [his]156-pierson back , with [his]156-pierson hat beside [him]156-pierson and [his]156-pierson arms crossed over [his]156-pierson chest , like the effigy of [some crusader one may see carved on [an old tomb]2289-an old tomb]2288-some crusader one may see carved on an old tomb . Though [he]156-pierson lay quiet as [that old knight]2290-that old knight , [his]156-pierson eyes were not closed , but fixed on the blue , where a lark was singing . [Its]2291-its song refreshed [his]156-pierson spirit ; its passionate light - heartedness stirred all the love of beauty in [him]156-pierson , awoke revolt against a world so murderous and uncharitable . Oh ! to pass up with that song into a land of bright spirits , where was nothing ugly , hard , merciless , and the gentle face of [the Saviour]274-the saviour radiated everlasting love ! The scent of the mayflowers , borne down by the sun shine , drenched [his]156-pierson senses ; [he]156-pierson closed [his]156-pierson eyes , and , at once , as if resenting that momentary escape , [his]156-pierson mind resumed debate with startling intensity . This matter went to the very well - springs , had a terrible and secret significance . If to act as conscience bade [him]156-pierson rendered [him]156-pierson unfit to keep [[his]156-pierson parish]338-his parish , all was built on sand , had no deep reality , was but rooted in convention . [Charity]273-mrs. cherry , and the forgiveness of sins honestly atoned for - what became of them ? Either [he]156-pierson was wrong to have espoused straightforward confession and atonement for [her]2293-her , or [they]2294-they were wrong in chasing [him]156-pierson from that espousal . There could be no making those extremes to meet . But if [he]156-pierson were wrong , having done the hardest thing already - where could [he]156-pierson turn ? [[His]156-pierson Church]421-his church stood bankrupt of ideals . [He]156-pierson felt as if pushed over the edge of [the world]606-the world , with feet on space , and head in some blinding cloud . ' [I]0-i can not have been wrong , ' [he]156-pierson thought ; ' any other course was so much easier . [I]0-i sacrificed [my]0-i pride , and [[my]0-i poor girl]824-my poor girl 's pride ; [I]0-i would have loved to let [her]2293-her run away . If for this [we]2298-we are to be stoned and cast forth , what living force is there in the religion [I]0-i have loved ; what does it all come to ? Have [I]0-i served a sham ? [I]0-i can not and will not believe it . Something is wrong with [me]0-i , something is wrong - but where - what ? ' [He]156-pierson rolled over , lay on [his]156-pierson face , and prayed . [He]156-pierson prayed for guidance and deliverance from the gusts of anger which kept sweeping over [him]156-pierson ; even more for relief from the feeling of personal outrage , and the unfairness of this thing . [He]156-pierson had striven to be loyal to what [he]156-pierson thought the right , had sacrificed all [his]156-pierson sensitiveness , all [his]156-pierson secret fastidious pride in [[his]156-pierson child]662-his child and [himself]156-pierson . For that [he]156-pierson was to be thrown out ! Whether through prayer , or in the scent and feel of the clover , [he]156-pierson found presently a certain rest . Away in the distance [he]156-pierson could see [the spire of [Harrow Church]90-harrow church]2300-the spire of harrow church .

[The Church]372-the church ! No ! [She]662-his child was not , could not be , at fault . The fault was in [himself]156-pierson . ' [I]0-i am unpractical , ' [he]156-pierson thought . ' It is so , [I]0-i know . [Agnes]135-agnes used to say so , [Bob]125-pierson and [Thirza]137-thirza think so . [They]2302-they all think [me]0-i unpractical and dreamy . Is it a sin - [I]0-i wonder ? ' There were lambs in [the next field]2303-the next field ; [he]156-pierson watched [their]2304-their gambollings and [his]156-pierson heart relaxed ; brushing the clover dust off [his]156-pierson black clothes , [he]156-pierson began to retrace [his]156-pierson steps . [The boys]3224-the boys were playing cricket now , and [he]156-pierson stood a few minutes watching [them]3224-the boys . [He]156-pierson had not seen cricket played since the war began ; it seemed almost otherworldly , with the click of the bats , and the shrill young ' voices , under the distant drone of that sky - hornet threshing along to [Hendon]88-hendon . [A boy]797-a boy made a good leg hit . " Well played ! "[156-pierson] [he]156-pierson called . Then , suddenly conscious of [his]156-pierson own incongruity and strangeness in that green spot , [he]156-pierson turned away on [the road]685-the road back to [London]7-london . To resign ; to await events ; to send [Noel]197-noel away - of those three courses , the last alone seemed impossible . ' Am [I]0-i really so far from [them]3224-the boys , ' [he]156-pierson thought , ' that [they]3224-the boys can wish [me]0-i to go , for this ? If so , [I]0-i had better go . It will be just another failure . But [I]0-i wo n't believe it yet ; [I]0-i ca n't believe it . '

The heat was sweltering , and [he]156-pierson became very tired before at last [he]156-pierson reached [his]156-pierson omnibus , and could sit with the breeze cooling [his]156-pierson hot face . [He]156-pierson did not reach [home]3048-home till six , having eaten nothing since breakfast . Intending to have a bath and lie down till dinner , [he]156-pierson went [upstairs]1153-upstairs .

Unwonted silence reigned . [He]156-pierson tapped on [the nursery]1839-the nursery door . [It]2311-it was deserted ; [he]156-pierson passed through to [[Noel]197-noel 's room]2312-noel 's room ; but that too was empty . The wardrobe stood open as if [it]2313-it had been hastily ransacked , and [her]2314-her dressing - table was bare . In alarm [he]156-pierson went to the bell and pulled it sharply . The old - fashioned ring of it jingled out far below . [The parlour - maid]2315-the parlour - maid came up .

" Where are [Miss Noel]197-noel and [Nurse]440-nurse , [Susan]275-susan ? "[2315-the parlour - maid]

" [I]2315-the parlour - maid did n't know [you]156-pierson were in , [sir]3028-sir . [Miss Noel]197-noel left [me]2315-the parlour - maid this note to give [you]156-pierson . [They]4232-they - [I]2315-the parlour - maid - "[2315-the parlour - maid]

[Pierson]125-pierson stopped [her]2315-the parlour - maid with [his]125-pierson hand . " Thank [you]2315-the parlour - maid , [Susan]275-susan ; get [me]125-pierson some tea , please . "[125-pierson] With the note unopened in [his]156-pierson hand , [he]156-pierson waited till [she]2315-the parlour - maid was gone . [His]156-pierson head was going round , and [he]156-pierson sat down on the side of [Noel]197-noel 's bed to read :

" [DARLING DADDY]4233-darling daddy ,[156-pierson]

" [The man who came this morning]4234-the man who came this morning told [me]156-pierson of what is going to happen . [I]156-pierson simply wo n't have it . [I]156-pierson 'm sending [Nurse]440-nurse and [baby]1980-baby down to [Kestrel]199-kestrel at once , and going to [Leila]208-leila 's for the night , until [I]156-pierson 've made up [my]156-pierson mind what to do . [I]156-pierson knew it was a mistake [my]156-pierson coming back . [I]156-pierson do n't care what happens to [me]156-pierson , but [I]156-pierson wo n't have [you]4237-you hurt . [I]156-pierson think it 's hateful of [people]3083-people to try and injure [you]4237-you for [my]156-pierson fault . [I]156-pierson 've had to borrow money from [Susan]275-susan - six pounds . Oh ! [Daddy]132-daddy dear , forgive [me]156-pierson .[156-pierson]

" [Your]132-daddy loving[156-pierson]

" [NOLLIE]131-nollie . "[156-pierson]

[He]2316-he read it with unutterable relief ; at all events [he]2316-he knew where [she]2317-she was - [poor , wilful , rushing , loving - hearted child]2318-poor , wilful , rushing , loving - hearted child ; knew where [she]2317-she was , and could get at [her]2317-she . After [his]2316-he bath and some tea , [he]2316-he would go to [[Leila]208-leila 's]1051-leila 's and bring [her]2317-she back . [Poor little Nollie]131-nollie , thinking that by just leaving [[his]2316-he house]3323-his house [she]131-nollie could settle this deep matter ! [He]2316-he did not hurry , feeling decidedly exhausted , and it was nearly eight before [he]2316-he set out , leaving a message for [Gratian]127-gratian , who did not as a rule come in from [[her]127-gratian hospital]3051-her hospital till past nine .

The day was still glowing , and now , in the cool of evening , [his]2316-he refreshed senses soaked up its beauty . ' [God]143-god has so made [this world]3543-this world , ' [he]2316-he thought , ' that , no matter what [our]2323-our struggles and sufferings , it 's ever a joy to live when the sun shines , or the moon is bright , or the night starry . Even [we]2323-our ca n't spoil it . ' In [Regent 's Park]42-regent 's park the lilacs and laburnums were still in bloom though [June]276-june had come , and [he]2316-he gazed at [them]2324-them in passing , as [a lover]2325-a lover might at [[his]2316-he lady]2326-his lady . [His]2316-he conscience pricked [him]2316-he suddenly . [Mrs. Mitchett]230-mrs. mitchett and [the dark - eyed girl [she]230-mrs. mitchett had brought to [him]2316-he on New Year 's Eve]2327-the dark - eyed girl she had brought to him on new year 's eve , the very night [he]2316-he had learned of [[his]2316-he own daughter]1493-his own daughter 's tragedy - had [he]2316-he ever thought of them since ? How had [that poor girl]2329-that poor girl fared ? [He]2316-he had been too impatient of [her]2329-that poor girl impenetrable mood . What did [he]2316-he know of the hearts of [others]395-others , when [he]2316-he did not even know [his]2316-he own , could not rule [his]2316-he feelings of anger and revolt , had not guided [[his]2316-he own daughter]1493-his own daughter into the waters of safety ! And [Leila]208-leila ! Had [he]2316-he not been too censorious in thought ? How powerful , how strange was this instinct of sex , which hovered and swooped on lives , seized them , bore [them]2332-them away , then dropped [them]2332-them exhausted and defenceless ! [Some munition - wagons , painted a dull grey , lumbered past]2333-some munition - wagons , painted a dull grey , lumbered past , driven by [sunburned youths in drab]2334-sunburned youths in drab . Life - force , Death - force - was it all one ; the great unknowable momentum from which there was but the one escape , in the arms of [[their]2335-their Heavenly Father]2336-their heavenly father ? [Blake]277-blake 's little old stanzas came into [his]2316-he mind :

" And [we]4239-we are put on [earth]3346-earth a little space , That [we]4239-we may learn to bear the beams of love ; And these black bodies and this sunburnt face Are but a cloud , and like a shady grove .[277-blake]

" For when [our]4239-we souls have learned the heat to bear , The cloud will vanish , [we]4239-we shall hear [His]2316-he voice , Saying : Come out from [the grove]4241-the grove , [my]277-blake love and care , And round [[my]277-blake golden tent]4242-my golden tent like lambs rejoice ! "[277-blake]

Learned the heat to bear ! Those lambs [he]2316-he had watched in [a field]2337-a field that afternoon , [their]2338-their sudden little leaps and rushes , [their]2338-their funny quivering wriggling tails , [their]2338-their tiny nuzzling black snouts - what little miracles of careless joy among the meadow flowers ! Lambs , and flowers , and sunlight ! Famine , lust , and the great grey guns ! [A maze]2339-a maze , [a wilderness]2340-a wilderness ; and but for faith , what issue , what path for [man]631-man to take which did not keep [him]631-man wandering hopeless , in its thicket ? ' [God]143-god preserve [our]2342-our faith in love , in charity , and the life to come ! ' [he]2316-he thought . And [a blind man with a dog , to whose neck was tied a little deep dish for pennies]2343-a blind man with a dog , to whose neck was tied a little deep dish for pennies , ground a hurdy - gurdy as [he]2343-a blind man with a dog , to whose neck was tied a little deep dish for pennies passed . [Pierson]125-pierson put a shilling in the dish . [The man]587-the man stopped playing , [his]587-the man whitish eyes looked up . " Thank [you]125-pierson kindly , [sir]3028-sir ; [I]2316-he 'll go [home]3048-home now . Come on , [Dick]278-dick ! "[2316-he] [He]2316-he tapped [his]2316-he way round the corner , with [his]2316-he dog straining in front . A blackbird hidden among the blossoms of an acacia , burst into evening song , and [another great grey munition - wagon]2345-another great grey munition - wagon rumbled out through the Park gate . 2

[The Church]372-the church - clock was striking nine when [he]2316-he reached [[Leila]208-leila 's flat]1239-leila 's flat , went up , and knocked . Sounds from - a piano ceased ; the door was opened by [Noel]197-noel . [She]208-leila recoiled when [she]208-leila saw who it was , and said :

" [Nollie]131-nollie ! "[197-noel]

"[197-noel] [She]2349-you stopped at the expression on [[her]2349-you father]384-her father 's face , the most strange look of pain , and horror , as if an unspoken treachery of [his]384-her father own had been dragged forth for [his]384-her father inspection .

" [You]2349-you 're talking wildly , "[384-her father] [he]384-her father said , but [his]384-her father lips were trembling . " [You]2349-you must n't say things like that ; they 're blasphemous and wicked . "[384-her father]

[Noel]197-noel bit [her]2349-you lips , sitting very stiff and still , against a high blue cushion . Then [she]2349-you burst out again :

" [You]197-noel 've slaved for [those people]4252-those people years and years , and [you]197-noel 've had no pleasure and [you]197-noel 've had no love ; and [they]4252-those people would n't care that if [you]197-noel broke [your]197-noel heart . " Oh , no ! Oh , no ! [I]197-noel do n't - [I]197-noel wo n't . Not again . [I]197-noel 've done that already . "[197-noel]

" [Daddy]132-daddy , [you]132-daddy - look awfully , awfully tired . [I]2351-her 'm going to give [you]132-daddy some medicine . "[2351-her] [She]2351-her went to a little three - cornered cupboard , and bent down . Medicine ! The medicine [he]197-noel wanted was not for the body ; knowledge of what [his]197-noel duty was - that alone could heal [him]197-noel !

The loud popping of a cork roused [him]197-noel . " What are [you]132-daddy doing , [Nollie]131-nollie ? "[2351-her]

[Noel]197-noel rose with a flushed face , holding in one hand a glass of champagne , in the other a biscuit .

" [You]132-daddy 're to take this ; and [I]197-noel 'm going to have some [myself]197-noel . "[197-noel]

" [[My]125-pierson dear]3031-my dear , "[125-pierson] said [Pierson]125-pierson bewildered ; " it 's not [yours]132-daddy . "[125-pierson]

" Drink it ; [Daddy]132-daddy ! Do n't [you]132-daddy know that [Leila]208-leila would never forgive [me]2352-she if [I]2352-she let [you]132-daddy go [home]3048-home looking like that . "[2352-she] And [she]2352-she stamped [her]2352-she foot .

[Pierson]125-pierson took the glass , and sat there nibbling and sipping . It was nice , very ! [He]125-pierson had not quite realised how much [he]125-pierson needed food and drink . [Noel]197-noel returned from the cupboard a second time ; [she]2352-she too had a glass and a biscuit .

" There , [you]132-daddy look better already . Now [you]132-daddy 're to go [home]3048-home at once , in [a cab]1238-a cab if [you]132-daddy can get one ; and tell [Gratian]127-gratian to make [you]132-daddy feed up , or [you]132-daddy wo n't have a body at all ; [you]132-daddy ca n't do [your]132-daddy duty if [you]132-daddy have n't one , [you]132-daddy know . "[2352-she]

[Pierson]125-pierson smiled , and finished the champagne .

[Noel]197-noel took the glass from [him]125-pierson . " [You]132-daddy 're [[my]197-noel child]3086-my child to - night , and [I]197-noel 'm going to send [you]132-daddy to bed . Do n't worry , [Daddy]132-daddy ; it 'll all come right . "[197-noel] And , taking [his]125-pierson arm , [she]2353-she went [downstairs]1846-downstairs with [him]125-pierson , and blew [him]125-pierson a kiss from the doorway .

[He]125-pierson walked away in a sort of dream . Daylight was not quite gone , but the moon was up , just past its full , and the search - lights had begun their nightly wanderings . It was a sky of ghosts and shadows , fitting to the thought which came to [him]125-pierson . The finger of [Providence]195-providence was in all this , perhaps ! Why should [he]125-pierson not go out to [France]13-france ! At last ; why not ? [Some better man]2355-some better man , who understood [men]3061-men 's hearts , who knew [the world]606-the world , would take [his]125-pierson place ; and [he]125-pierson could go where death made all things simple , and [he]125-pierson could not fail . [He]125-pierson walked faster and faster , full of an intoxicating relief . [Thirza]137-thirza and [Gratian]127-gratian would take care of Nollie far better than [he]125-pierson . Yes , surely it was ordained ! [Moonlight]279-moonlight had [the town]755-the town now ; and all was steel blue , the very air steel - blue ; [a dream - city of marvellous beauty , through which [he]125-pierson passed , exalted]2359-a dream - city of marvellous beauty , through which he passed , exalted . Soon [he]125-pierson would be where [that poor boy]2360-that poor boy , and [a million others]2361-a million others , had given [their]2361-a million others lives ; with the mud and the shells and the scarred grey ground , and the jagged trees , where [Christ]163-christ was daily crucified - there where [he]125-pierson had so often longed to be these three years past . It was ordained !

And [two women whom [he]125-pierson met]2362-two women whom he met looked at [each other]493-each other when [he]125-pierson had gone by , and those words ' the blighted crow ' which [they]2362-two women whom he met had been about to speak , died on [their]2362-two women whom he met lips .

[VIII

Noel]197-noel felt light - hearted too , as if [she]2364-she had won a victory . [She]2364-she found some potted meat , spread it on another biscuit , ate it greedily , and finished the pint bottle of champagne . Then [she]2364-she hunted for the cigarettes , and sat down at the piano . [She]2364-she played old tunes - " There is [a Tavern in [the Town]755-the town]4273-a tavern in the town , "[2364-she] " Once [I]2364-she Loved a Maiden Fair , "[2364-she] " Mowing [the Barley]92-the barley , "[2364-she] " [Clementine]281-clementine , "[2364-she] " [Lowlands]282-lowlands , "[2364-she] and sang to [them]2365-them such words as [she]2364-she remembered . There was a delicious running in [her]2364-she veins , and once [she]2364-she got up and danced . [She]2364-she was kneeling at the window , looking out , when [she]2364-she heard the door open , and without getting up , cried out :

" Is n't it a gorgeous night ! [I]3326-a man 've had [Daddy]132-daddy here . [I]3326-a man gave [him]132-daddy some of [your]208-leila champagne , and drank the rest - "[3326-a man] then was conscious of a figure far too tall for [Leila]208-leila , and [a man]3326-a man 's voice saying :

" [I]3326-a man 'm awfully sorry . It 's only [I]3326-a man , [Jimmy Fort]175-jimmy . "[3326-a man]

[Noel]197-noel scrambled up . " [Leila]208-leila is n't in ; but [she]208-leila will be directly - it 's past ten . "[197-noel]

[He]197-noel was standing stock - still in the middle of [the room]517-the room .

" Wo n't [you]197-noel sit down ? Oh ! and wo n't [you]197-noel have a cigarette ? "[197-noel]

" Thanks . "[197-noel]

By the flash of [his]197-noel briquette [she]2364-she saw [his]197-noel face clearly ; the look on it filled [her]2364-she with a sort of malicious glee .

" [I]2364-she 'm going now , "[2364-she] [she]2364-she said . " Would [you]197-noel mind telling [Leila]208-leila that [I]2364-she found [I]2364-she could n't stop ? "[2364-she] [She]2364-she made towards [the divan]1302-the divan to get [her]2364-she hat . When [she]2364-she had put it on , [she]2364-she found [him]197-noel standing just in front of [her]2364-she .

" [Noel]197-noel - if [you]197-noel do n't mind [me]197-noel calling [you]197-noel that ? "[197-noel]

" Not a bit . "[197-noel]

" Do n't go ; [I]197-noel 'm going [myself]197-noel . "[197-noel]

" Oh , no ! Not for worlds . "[2364-she] [She]2364-she tried to slip past , but [he]197-noel took hold of [her]2364-she wrist .

" Please ; just one minute ! "[197-noel]

[Noel]197-noel stayed motionless , looking at [him]197-noel , while [his]197-noel hand still held [her]2364-she wrist . [He]197-noel said quietly :

" Do [you]2364-she mind telling [me]197-noel why [you]2364-she came here ? "[197-noel]

" Oh , just to see [Leila]208-leila . "[197-noel]

" Things have come to a head at [home]3048-home , have n't [they]4276-they ? "[197-noel]

[Noel]197-noel shrugged [her]2364-she shoulders .

" [You]2364-she came for refuge , did n't [you]2364-she ? "[197-noel]

" From whom ? "[197-noel]

" Do n't be angry ; from the need of hurting [[your]2364-she father]3044-your father . "[197-noel]

[She]2364-she nodded .

" [I]197-noel knew it would come to that . What are [you]197-noel going to do ? "[197-noel]

" Enjoy [myself]2364-she . "[2364-she] [She]2364-she was saying something fatuous , yet [she]2364-she meant it .

" That 's absurd . Do n't be angry ! [You]197-noel 're quite right . Only , [you]197-noel must begin at the right end , must n't [you]197-noel ? Sit down ! "[2364-she]

[Noel]197-noel tried to free [her]2364-she wrist .

" No ; sit down , please . "[2364-she]

[Noel]197-noel sat down ; but as [he]197-noel loosed [her]2364-she wrist , [she]2364-she laughed . This was where [he]197-noel sat with [Leila]208-leila , where [they]2369-they would sit when [she]208-leila was gone . " It 's awfully funny , is n't it ? "[2364-she] [she]2364-she said .

" Funny ? "[197-noel] [he]197-noel muttered savagely . " Most things are , in this funny world . "[197-noel]

The sound of [a taxi stopping not far off]2370-a taxi stopping not far off had come to [her]2364-she ears , and [she]2364-she gathered [her]2364-she feet under [her]2364-she , planting them firmly . If [she]2364-she sprang up , could [she]2364-she slip by [him]197-noel before [he]197-noel caught [her]2364-she arm again , and get [that taxi]2371-that taxi ?

" If [I]197-noel go now , "[197-noel] [he]197-noel said , " will [you]2364-she promise [me]197-noel to stop till [you]2364-she 've seen [Leila]208-leila ? "[197-noel]

" No . "[197-noel]

" That 's foolish . Come , promise ! "[197-noel]

[Noel]197-noel shook [her]2364-she head . [She]2364-she felt a perverse pleasure at [his]197-noel embarrassment .

" [Leila]208-leila 's lucky , is n't [she]208-leila ? [No children]4278-no children , [no husband]4279-no husband , [no father]4280-no father , no anything . Lovely ! "[197-noel]

[She]2364-she saw [his]197-noel arm go up as if to ward off a blow . " [Poor Leila]208-leila ! "[197-noel] [he]197-noel said .

" Why are [you]197-noel sorry for [her]208-leila ? [She]208-leila has freedom ! And [she]208-leila has [you]197-noel ! "[2364-she]

[She]2364-she knew it would hurt ; but [she]2364-she wanted to hurt [him]197-noel .

" [You]197-noel need n't envy [her]208-leila for that . "[2364-she]

[He]197-noel had just spoken , when [Noel]197-noel saw [a figure over by the door]2372-a figure over by the door .

[She]2364-she jumped up , and said breathlessly :

" Oh , here [you]197-noel are , [Leila]208-leila ! [Father]145-father 's been [here]3149-here , and [we]4282-we 've had some of [your]197-noel champagne ! "[2364-she]

" Capital ! [You]197-noel are in the dark ! "[2364-she]

[Noel]197-noel felt the blood rush into [her]2364-she cheeks . The light leaped up , and [Leila]208-leila came forward . [She]208-leila looked extremely pale , calm , and self - contained , in [her]208-leila nurse 's dress ; [her]208-leila full lips were tightly pressed together , but [Noel]197-noel could see [her]208-leila breast heaving violently . A turmoil of shame and wounded pride began raging in [the girl]525-the girl . Why had [she]208-leila not flown long ago ? Why had [she]208-leila let [herself]208-leila be trapped like this ? [Leila]208-leila would think [she]208-leila had been making up to [him]197-noel ! Horrible ! Disgusting ! Why did n't [he]197-noel - why did n't [some one]2374-some one , speak ? Then [Leila]208-leila said :

" [I]208-leila did n't expect [you]197-noel , [Jimmy]175-jimmy ; [I]208-leila 'm glad [you]197-noel have n't been dull . [Noel]197-noel is staying [here]3149-here to - night . Give [me]208-leila a cigarette . Sit down , both of [you]197-noel . [I]208-leila 'm awfully tired ! "[208-leila]

[She]208-leila sank into a chair , leaning back , with [her]208-leila knees crossed ; and at that moment [Noel]197-noel admired [her]208-leila . [She]208-leila had said it beautifully ; [she]208-leila looked so calm . [Fort]175-jimmy was lighting [her]208-leila cigarette ; [his]175-jimmy hand was shaking , [his]175-jimmy face all sorry and mortified .

" Give [Noel]197-noel one , too , and draw the curtains , [Jimmy]175-jimmy . Quick ! Not that it makes any difference ; it 's as light as day . Sit down , [dear]3030-dear . "[175-jimmy]

But [Noel]197-noel remained standing .

" What have [you]175-jimmy been talking of ? Love and Chinese lanterns , or only [me]197-noel ? "[197-noel]

At those words [Fort]175-jimmy , who was drawing the last curtain , turned round ; [his]175-jimmy tall figure was poised awkwardly against the wall , [his]175-jimmy face , unsuited to diplomacy , had a look as of flesh being beaten . If [weals]2375-we had started up across [it]2376-it , [Noel]197-noel would not have been surprised .

[He]197-noel said with painful slowness :

" [I]197-noel do n't exactly know ; [we]2375-we had hardly begun , had [we]2375-we ? "[197-noel]

" The night is young , "[208-leila] said [Leila]208-leila . " Go on while [I]208-leila just take off [my]208-leila things . "[208-leila]

[She]208-leila rose with the cigarette between [her]208-leila lips , and went into [the inner room]2377-the inner room . In passing , [she]208-leila gave [Noel]197-noel a look . What there was in that look , [the girl]525-the girl could never make clear even to [herself]525-the girl . Perhaps [a creature shot]2379-a creature shot would gaze like that , with a sort of profound and distant questioning , reproach , and anger , with a sort of pride , and the quiver of death . As the door closed , [Fort]175-jimmy came right across [the room]517-the room .

" Go to [her]2381-she ; "[197-noel] cried [Noel]197-noel ; ' [she]2381-she wants [you]175-jimmy . Ca n't [you]175-jimmy see , [she]2381-she wants [you]175-jimmy ? "[2381-she]

And before [he]197-noel could move , [she]208-leila was at the door . [She]208-leila flew [downstairs]1846-downstairs , and out into the moonlight . [The taxi]1349-the taxi , a little way off , was just beginning to move away ; [she]208-leila ran towards [it]1349-the taxi , calling out :

" [Anywhere]4285-anywhere ! [Piccadilly]93-piccadilly ! "[208-leila] and jumping in , blotted [herself]208-leila against the cushions in the far corner .

[She]208-leila did not come to [herself]208-leila , as it were , for several minutes , and then feeling [she]208-leila ' could no longer bear [the cab]564-the cab , stopped it , and got out . Where was [she]208-leila ? [Bond Street]94-bond street ! [She]208-leila began , idly , wandering down [its]94-bond street narrow length ; [the fullest street]2385-the fullest street by day , the emptiest by night . Oh ! it had been horrible ! Nothing said by [any of [them]2387-them]2386-any of them - nothing , and yet everything dragged out - of [him]2388-him , of [Leila]208-leila , of [herself]208-leila ! [She]208-leila seemed to have no pride or decency left , as if [she]208-leila had been caught stealing . All [her]208-leila happy exhilaration was gone , leaving a miserable recklessness . Nothing [she]208-leila did was right , nothing turned out well , so what did it all matter ? The moonlight flooding down between [the tall houses]2389-the tall houses gave [her]208-leila a peculiar heady feeling . " Fey "[384-her father] [[her]208-leila father]384-her father had called [her]208-leila . [She]208-leila laughed . ' But [I]0-i 'm not going [home]3048-home , ' [she]208-leila thought . Bored with [the street]3753-the street 's length ; [she]208-leila turned off , and was suddenly in [Hanover Square]95-hanover square . There was [the Church]372-the church , grey - white , where [she]208-leila had been bridesmaid to [a second cousin]2394-a second cousin , when [she]208-leila was fifteen . [She]208-leila seemed to see it all again - [her]208-leila frock , the lilies in [her]208-leila hand , the surplices of the choir , [the bride]2395-the bride 's dress , all moonlight - coloured , and unreal . ' [I]0-i wonder what 's become of [her]208-leila ! ' [she]208-leila thought . ' [He]2394-a second cousin 's dead , [I]0-i expect , like [Cyril]133-cyril ! ' [She]208-leila saw [[her]208-leila father]384-her father 's face as [he]384-her father was marrying [them]2397-them , heard [his]384-her father voice : " For better , for worse , for richer , for poorer , in sickness and in health , till death do [you]208-leila part . "[384-her father] And the moonlight on [the Church]372-the church seemed to shift and quiver - some pigeons perhaps had been disturbed up there . Then instead of that wedding vision , [she]208-leila saw [Monsieur Barra]245-monsieur barra , sitting on [his]245-monsieur barra chair , gazing at the floor , and [Chica]246-chica nursing [her]246-chica doll . " All mad , mademoiselle , a little mad . Millions of [men with white souls]4286-men with white souls , but all a little tiny bit mad , [you]208-leila know . "[246-chica] Then [Leila]208-leila 's face came before [her]208-leila , with that look in [her]208-leila eyes . [She]208-leila felt again the hot clasp of [Fort]175-jimmy 's fingers on [her]208-leila wrist , and walked on , rubbing it with the other hand . [She]208-leila turned into [Regent Street]61-regent street . The wide curve of [the Quadrant]96-the quadrant swept into a sky of unreal blue , and the orange - shaded lamps merely added to the unreality . ' Love and Chinese lanterns ! [I]0-i should like some coffee , ' [she]208-leila thought suddenly . [She]208-leila was quite close to [the place where [Lavendie]253-lavendie had taken [her]208-leila]2399-the place where lavendie had taken her . Should [she]208-leila go in [there]3137-there ? Why not ? [She]208-leila must go somewhere . [She]208-leila turned into the revolving cage of glass . But no sooner was [she]208-leila imprisoned [there]3137-there than in a flash [Lavendie]253-lavendie 's face of disgust ; and [the red - lipped women]2402-the red - lipped women , the green stuff that smelled of peppermint came back , filling [her]208-leila with a rush of dismay . [She]208-leila made the full circle in [the revolving cage]2403-the revolving cage ; and came out into [the street]3753-the street again with a laugh . [A tall young man in khaki]2405-a tall young man in khaki stood there : " [Hallo]283-hallo ! "[2405-a tall young man in khaki] [he]2405-a tall young man in khaki said . " Come in and dance ! "[2405-a tall young man in khaki] [She]208-leila started , recoiled from [him]2405-a tall young man in khaki and began to walk away as fast as ever [she]208-leila could . [She]208-leila passed [a woman whose eyes seemed to scorch [her]208-leila]2406-a woman whose eyes seemed to scorch her . [A woman like a swift vision of ruin with those eyes , and thickly powdered cheeks , and loose red mouth]2407-a woman like a swift vision of ruin with those eyes , and thickly powdered cheeks , and loose red mouth . [Noel]197-noel shuddered and fled along , feeling that [her]208-leila only safety lay in speed . But [she]208-leila could not walk about all night . There would be [no train]2408-no train for [Kestrel]199-kestrel till the morning - and did [she]208-leila really want to go [there]3137-there , and eat [her]208-leila heart out ? Suddenly [she]208-leila thought of [George]140-george . Why should [she]208-leila not go down to [him]140-george ? [He]140-george would know what was best for [her]208-leila to do . At the foot of the steps below [the Waterloo Column]2410-the waterloo column [she]208-leila stood still . All was quiet there and empty , [the great buildings]2411-the great buildings whitened , the trees blurred and blue ; and sweeter air was coming across their flowering tops . The queer " fey "[208-leila] moony sensation was still with [her]208-leila ; so that [she]208-leila felt small and light , as if [she]208-leila could have floated through a ring . Faint rims of light showed round the windows of [the Admiralty]2412-the admiralty . The war ! However lovely the night , however sweet the lilac smelt - that never stopped ! [She]208-leila turned away and passed out under the arch , making for [the station]474-the station . [The train of [the wounded]2415-the wounded]2414-the train of the wounded had just come in , and [she]208-leila stood in [the cheering crowd]2416-the cheering crowd watching [the ambulances]2417-the ambulances run out . Tears of excited emotion filled [her]208-leila eyes , and trickled down . Steady , smooth , grey , one after the other [they]2418-they came gliding , with a little burst of cheers greeting [each one]2419-each one . [All]1872-all were gone now , and [she]208-leila could pass in . [She]208-leila went to the buffet and got a large cup of coffee , and a bun . Then , having noted the time of [her]208-leila early morning train , [she]208-leila sought [[the ladies]2421-the ladies ' waiting - room]2422-the ladies ' waiting - room , and sitting down in a corner , took out [her]208-leila purse and counted [her]208-leila money . Two pounds fifteen - enough to go to [the hotel]2423-the hotel , if [she]208-leila liked . But , without luggage - it was so conspicuous , and [she]208-leila could sleep in [this corner]2424-this corner all right , if [she]208-leila wanted . What did [girls]3204-girls do who had no money , and [no friends]3989-no friends to go to ? Tucked away in the corner of [that empty , heavy , varnished room]2427-that empty , heavy , varnished room , [she]208-leila seemed to see the cruelty and hardness of life as [she]208-leila had never before seen it , not even when facing [her]208-leila confinement . How lucky [she]208-leila had been , and was ! [Everyone]3072-everyone was good to [her]208-leila . [She]208-leila had no real want or dangers , to face . But , for [women]3282-women - yes , and [men]3061-men too - who had [no one to fall back on]2431-no one to fall back on , nothing but [their]3061-men own hands and health and luck , it must be awful . [That girl whose eyes had scorched [her]2432-that girl whose eyes had scorched her]2432-that girl whose eyes had scorched her - perhaps [she]2432-that girl whose eyes had scorched her had [no one]3081-no one - nothing . And [people who were born ill]2434-people who were born ill , and the millions of poor women , like those whom [she]208-leila had gone visiting with [Gratian]127-gratian sometimes in [the poorer streets of [[her]208-leila father]384-her father 's parish]2435-the poorer streets of her father 's parish - for the first time [she]208-leila seemed to really know and feel the sort of lives [they]2437-they led . And then , [Leila]208-leila 's face came back to [her]208-leila once more - [Leila]208-leila whom [she]208-leila had robbed . And the worst of it was , that , alongside [her]208-leila remorseful sympathy , [she]208-leila felt a sort of satisfaction . [She]208-leila could not help [his]384-her father not loving [Leila]208-leila , [she]208-leila could not help it if [he]384-her father loved [herself]208-leila ! And [he]384-her father did - [she]208-leila knew it ! To feel that [anyone]3200-anyone loved [her]208-leila was so comforting . But it was all awful ! And [she]208-leila - the cause of it ! And yet - [she]208-leila had never done or said anything to attract [him]384-her father . No ! [She]208-leila could not have helped it .

[She]208-leila had begun to feel drowsy , and closed [her]208-leila eyes . And gradually there came on [her]208-leila a cosey sensation , as if [she]208-leila were leaning up against someone with [her]208-leila head tucked in against [his]384-her father shoulder , as [she]208-leila had so often leaned as [a child]415-a child against [[her]208-leila father]384-her father , coming back from some long darkening drive in [Wales]31-wales or [Scotland]72-scotland . [She]208-leila seemed even to feel the wet soft Westerly air on [her]208-leila face and eyelids , and to sniff the scent of a frieze coat ; to hear the jog of hoofs and the rolling of the wheels ; to feel the closing in of the darkness . Then , so dimly and drowsily , [she]208-leila seemed to know that it was not [[her]208-leila father]384-her father , but [someone]502-someone - [someone]502-someone - then no more , no more at all .

IX

[She]208-leila was awakened by the scream of an engine , and looked around [her]208-leila amazed . [Her]208-leila neck had fallen sideways while [she]208-leila slept , and felt horridly stiff ; [her]208-leila head ached , and [she]208-leila was shivering . [She]208-leila saw by the clock that it was past five . ' If only [I]0-i could get some tea ! ' [she]208-leila thought . ' Anyway [I]0-i wo n't stay [here]3149-here any longer ! ' When [she]208-leila had washed , and rubbed some of the stiffness out of [her]208-leila neck , the tea renewed [her]208-leila sense of adventure wonderfully . [Her]208-leila train did not start for an hour ; [she]208-leila had time for a walk , to warm [herself]208-leila , and went down to [the river]417-the river . There was an early haze , and all looked a little mysterious ; but [people]3083-people were already passing on [their]3083-people way to work . [She]208-leila walked along , looking at the water flowing up under the bright mist to which the gulls gave a sort of hovering life . [She]208-leila went as far as [Blackfriars Bridge]97-blackfriars bridge , and turning back , sat down on a bench under a plane - tree , just as the sun broke through . [A little pasty woman with a pinched yellowish face]2447-a little pasty woman with a pinched yellowish face was already sitting there , so still , and seeming to see so little , that [Noel]197-noel wondered of what [she]2447-a little pasty woman with a pinched yellowish face could be thinking . While [she]208-leila watched , [the woman]586-the woman 's face began puckering , and tears rolled slowly , down , trickling from pucker to pucker , till , summoning up [her]208-leila courage , [Noel]197-noel sidled nearer , and said :

" Oh ! What 's the matter ? "[197-noel]

The tears seemed to stop from sheer surprise ; little grey eyes gazed round , patient little eyes from above an almost bridgeless nose .

" [I'ad]197-noel [a baby]4141-a baby . [It]4141-a baby 's dead .... [[its]4141-a baby father]4288-its father 's dead in [France]13-france .... [I]197-noel was goin' in [the water]670-the water , but [I]197-noel did n't like the look of it , and now [I]197-noel never will . "[197-noel]

That " Now [I]197-noel never will , "[197-noel] moved [Noel]197-noel terribly . [She]208-leila slid [her]208-leila arm along the back of the bench and clasped the skinniest of shoulders .

" Do n't cry ! "[208-leila]

" It was [my]208-leila first . [I]208-leila 'm thirty - eight . [I]208-leila 'll never ' ave another . Oh ! Why did n't [I]208-leila go in [the water]670-the water ? "[208-leila]

The face puckered again , and the squeezed - out tears ran down . ' Of course [she]2449-she must cry , ' thought [Noel]197-noel ; ' cry and cry till it feels better . ' And [she]208-leila stroked the shoulder of [the little woman , whose emotion was disengaging the scent of old clothes]2450-the little woman , whose emotion was disengaging the scent of old clothes .

" [The father of [[my]208-leila baby]3829-my baby]4291-the father of my baby was killed in [France]13-france , too , "[208-leila] [she]208-leila said at last . [The little sad grey eyes]2451-the little sad grey eyes looked curiously round .

" Was ' [e]4293-e ? ' Ave [you]4293-e got [[your]4293-e baby]4294-your baby still ? "[208-leila]

" Yes , oh , yes ! "[208-leila]

" [I]208-leila 'm glad of that . It ' urts so bad , it does . [I]208-leila 'd rather lose [me]208-leila ' usband than [[me]208-leila baby]4295-me baby , any day . "[208-leila] The sun was shining now on a cheek of that terribly patient face ; its brightness seemed cruel perching there .

" Can [I]197-noel do anything to help [you]208-leila ? "[197-noel] [Noel]197-noel murmured .

" No , thank [you]208-leila , [miss]3218-miss . [I]208-leila 'm goin' ' ome now . [I]208-leila do n't live far . Thank [you]208-leila kindly . "[208-leila] And raising [her]208-leila eyes for one more of those half - bewildered looks , [she]208-leila moved away along the Embankment wall . When [she]208-leila was out of sight , [Noel]197-noel walked back to [the station]474-the station . [The train]580-the train was in , and [she]208-leila took [her]208-leila seat . [She]208-leila had [three fellow passengers]2454-three fellow passengers , all in khaki ; very silent and moody , as [men]3061-men are when [they]3061-men have to get up early . [One]424-one was tall , dark , and perhaps thirty - five ; [the second small , and about fifty , with cropped , scanty grey hair]2457-the second small , and about fifty , with cropped , scanty grey hair ; the third was of medium height and quite sixty - five , with a long row of little coloured patches on [his]2458-he tunic , and a bald , narrow , well - shaped head , grey hair brushed back at the sides , and the thin , collected features and drooping moustache of [the old school]2459-the old school . It was at [him]2458-he that [Noel]197-noel looked . When [he]2458-he glanced out of the window , or otherwise retired within [himself]2458-he , [she]208-leila liked [his]2458-he face ; but when [he]2458-he turned to [the ticket - collector]2460-the ticket - collector or spoke to [the others]456-the others , [she]208-leila did not like it half so much . It was as if [the old fellow]2462-the old fellow had two selves , one of which [he]2458-he used when alone , the other in which [he]2458-he dressed every morning to meet [the world]606-the world . [They]2464-they had begun to talk about some Tribunal on which [they]2464-they had to sit . [Noel]197-noel did not listen , but a word or two carried to [her]208-leila now and then .

" How many to - day ? "[2462-the old fellow] [she]208-leila heard [the old fellow]2462-the old fellow ask , and [the little cropped man]2466-the little cropped man answering : " Hundred and fourteen . "[2466-the little cropped man]

Fresh from the sight of [the poor little shabby woman]2467-the poor little shabby woman and [her]2467-the poor little shabby woman grief , [she]208-leila could not help a sort of shrinking from [that trim old soldier , with [his]2458-he thin , regular face , who held the fate of a " Hundred and fourteen "[2458-he] in [his]2458-he firm , narrow grasp]2468-that trim old soldier , with his thin , regular face , who held the fate of a " hundred and fourteen " in his firm , narrow grasp , perhaps every day . Would [he]2458-he understand [their]2464-they troubles or wants ? Of course [he]2458-he would n't ! Then , [she]208-leila saw [him]2458-he looking at [her]208-leila critically with [his]2458-he keen eyes . If [he]2458-he had known [her]208-leila secret , [he]2458-he would be thinking : ' [A lady]4073-a lady and act like that ! Oh , no ! Quite - quite out of the question ! ' And [she]208-leila felt as if [she]208-leila could , sink under the seat with shame . But no doubt [he]2458-he was only thinking : ' Very young to be travelling by [herself]4073-a lady at this hour of the morning . Pretty too ! ' If [he]2458-he knew the real truth of [her]208-leila - how [he]2458-he would stare ! But why should [this utter stranger]2470-this utter stranger , [this old disciplinarian]2471-this old disciplinarian , by a casual glance , by the mere form of [his]2458-he face , make [her]208-leila feel more guilty and ashamed than [she]208-leila had yet felt ? That puzzled [her]208-leila . [He]2458-he was , must be , [a narrow , conventional old man]2472-a narrow , conventional old man ; but [he]2458-he had this power to make [her]208-leila feel ashamed , because [she]208-leila felt that [he]2458-he had faith in [[his]2458-he gods]2473-his gods , and was true to [them]2473-his gods ; because [she]208-leila knew [he]2458-he would die sooner than depart from [his]2458-he creed of conduct . [She]208-leila turned to the window , biting [her]208-leila lips - angry and despairing . [She]208-leila would never - never get used to [her]208-leila position ; it was no good ! And again [she]208-leila had the longing of [her]208-leila dream , to tuck [her]208-leila face away into that coat , smell the scent of the frieze , snuggle in , be protected , and forget . ' If [I]0-i had been [that poor lonely little woman]2474-that poor lonely little woman , ' [she]0-i thought , ' and had lost everything , [I]0-i should have gone into [the water]670-the water . [I]0-i should have rushed and jumped . It 's only luck that [I]0-i 'm alive . [I]0-i wo n't look at [that old man]2476-that old man again : then [I]0-i sha n't feel so bad . '

[She]208-leila had bought some chocolate at [the station]474-the station , and nibbled it , gazing steadily at [the fields covered with daisies]2478-the fields covered with daisies and the first of the buttercups and cowslips . [The three soldiers]2479-the three soldiers were talking now in carefully lowered voices . The words : " [women]3282-women , "[2479-the three soldiers] " under control , "[2479-the three soldiers] " perfect plague , "[2479-the three soldiers] came to [her]208-leila , making [her]208-leila ears burn . In the hypersensitive mood caused by the strain of yesterday , [her]208-leila broken night , and the emotional meeting with [the little woman]2480-the little woman , [she]208-leila felt as if [they]2479-the three soldiers were including [her]208-leila among [those " women]4298-those " women . "[2479-the three soldiers] ' If [we]2481-we stop , [I]0-i 'll get out , ' [she]208-leila thought . But when [the train]580-the train did stop it was [they]2479-the three soldiers who got out . [She]208-leila felt [the old General]2483-the old general 's keen veiled glance sum [her]208-leila up for the last time , and looked full at [him]2483-the old general just for a moment . [He]2483-the old general touched [his]2483-the old general cap , and said : " Will [you]208-leila have the window up or down ? "[2483-the old general] and lingered to draw it half - way up . ' [His]2483-the old general punctiliousness made [her]208-leila feel worse than ever . When [the train]580-the train had started again [she]208-leila roamed up and down [[her]208-leila empty carriage]2485-her empty carriage ; there was no more a way out of [her]208-leila position than out of [this rolling cushioned carriage]2486-this rolling cushioned carriage ! And then [she]208-leila seemed to hear [Fort]175-jimmy 's voice saying : ' Sit down , please ! ' and to feel [his]2483-the old general fingers clasp [her]208-leila wrist , Oh ! [he]2483-the old general was nice and comforting ; [he]2483-the old general would never reproach or remind [her]208-leila ! And now , probably , [she]208-leila would never see [him]2483-the old general again .

[The train]580-the train drew up at last . [She]208-leila did not know where [George]140-george lodged , and would have to go to [[his]140-george hospital]2488-his hospital . [She]208-leila planned to get [there]3137-there at half past nine , and having eaten a sort of breakfast at [the station]474-the station , went forth into [the town]755-the town . [The seaside]2492-the seaside was still wrapped in the early glamour which haunts chalk of a bright morning . But [the streets]3240-the streets were very much alive . Here was real business of the war . [She]208-leila passed [houses which had been wrecked]2494-houses which had been wrecked . [Trucks]2495-trucks clanged and shunted , [great lorries]2496-great lorries rumbled smoothly by . [Sea]98-sea - and [Air - planes]2497-air - planes were moving like great birds far up in the bright haze , and khaki was everywhere . But it was [the sea]653-the sea [Noel]197-noel wanted . [She]208-leila made [her]208-leila way westward to [a little beach]2499-a little beach ; and , sitting down on a stone , opened [her]208-leila arms to catch the sun on [her]208-leila face and chest . The tide was nearly up , with the wavelets of [a blue bright sea]2500-a blue bright sea . The great fact , the greatest fact in [the world]606-the world , except the sun ; vast and free , making everything human seem small and transitory ! It did [her]208-leila good , like [a tranquillising friend]2502-a tranquillising friend . [The sea]653-the sea might be cruel and terrible , awful things [it]653-the sea could do , and awful things were being done on [it]653-the sea ; but its wide level line , its never - ending song , its sane savour , were the best medicine [she]208-leila could possibly have taken . [She]208-leila rubbed the Shelly sand between [her]208-leila fingers in absurd ecstasy ; took off [her]208-leila shoes and stockings , paddled , and sat drying [her]208-leila legs in the sun .

When [she]208-leila left [the little beach]2504-the little beach , [she]208-leila felt as if [someone]502-someone had said to [her]208-leila :

' [Your]208-leila troubles are very little . There 's the sun , [the sea]653-the sea , the air ; enjoy them . [They]502-someone ca n't take those from [you]208-leila . '

At [the hospital]1022-the hospital [she]208-leila had to wait half an hour in [a little bare room]2508-a little bare room before [George]140-george came .

" [Nollie]131-nollie ! Splendid . [I]140-george 've got an hour . Let 's get out of [this cemetery]4299-this cemetery . [We]4300-we 'll have time for a good stretch on the tops . [Jolly of [you]208-leila]4301-jolly of you to have come to [me]140-george . Tell [us]4300-we all about it . "[140-george]

When [she]208-leila had finished , [he]140-george squeezed [her]208-leila arm . 348

" [I]140-george knew it would n't do . [[Your]208-leila Dad]4302-your dad forgot that [he]4302-your dad 's [a public figure]4303-a public figure , and must expect to be damned accordingly . " Why should [he]4302-your dad resign , "[197-noel] cried [Noel]197-noel again , " now that [I]197-noel 've gone ? [He]4302-your dad 'll be lost without it all . "[197-noel]

[George]140-george smiled .

" Found , [[my]140-george dear]3031-my dear . [He]4302-your dad 'll be where [he]4302-your dad ought to be , [Nollie]131-nollie , where [the Church]372-the church is , and [the Churchmen]4306-the churchmen are not - in the air ! "[140-george]

" Do n't ! "[197-noel] cried [Noel]197-noel passionately .

" No , no , [I]140-george 'm not chaffing . There 's no room on [earth]3346-earth for [saints]4308-saints in authority . There 's use for a saintly symbol , even if [one]424-one does n't hold with it , but there 's no mortal use for those who try to have things both ways - to be [saints]4308-saints and [seers of visions]4311-seers of visions , and yet to come the practical and worldly and rule [ordinary men]4312-ordinary men 's lives . Saintly example yes ; but not saintly governance . [You]131-nollie 've been [his]4302-your dad deliverance , [Nollie]131-nollie . "[140-george]

" But [Daddy]132-daddy loves [[his]132-daddy Church]421-his church . "[140-george]

[George]140-george frowned . " Of course , it 'll be a wrench . [George]140-george grunted . " Dreams , [Nollie]131-nollie , all round [him]4302-your dad ; of the past and the future , of what [people]3083-people are and what [he]4302-your dad can do with [them]3083-people . "[140-george]

" Yes , "[197-noel] murmured [Noel]197-noel fervently .

" [He]4302-your dad 's such a queer mixture , "[140-george] mused [George]140-george . " [Clean]284-clean out of [his]4302-your dad age ; chalks above most of the parsons in a spiritual sense and chalks below most of them in the worldly . [You]131-nollie see , [the Church]236-church spiritual ca n't make good in this age - has no chance of making good , and so in the main it 's given it up for vested interests and social influence . [[Your]131-nollie father]3044-your father is a symbol of what [the Church]372-the church is not . But what about [you]131-nollie , [[my]140-george dear]3031-my dear ? "[140-george]

" [I]140-george 'll have to send a wire to [Daddy]132-daddy . "[140-george]

" [I]140-george 'll do that . [You]131-nollie come to [[my]140-george diggings]4335-my diggings at half past one , and [I]140-george 'll settle [you]131-nollie in . Until then , [you]131-nollie 'd better stay up [here]3149-here . "[140-george]

When [he]2512-he had gone [she]2513-she roamed a little farther , and lay down on the short grass , where the chalk broke through in patches . [She]2513-she could hear a distant rumbling , very low , travelling in that grass , the long mutter of the Flanders guns . ' [I]0-i wonder if it 's as beautiful a day there , ' [she]2513-she thought . ' How dreadful to see no green , no butterflies , no flowers - not even sky - for the dust of the shells . Oh ! wo n't it ever , ever end ? ' And a sort of passion for the earth welled up in [her]2513-she , the warm grassy earth along which [she]2513-she lay , pressed so close that [she]2513-she could feel it with every inch of [her]2513-she body , and the soft spikes of the grass against [her]2513-she nose and lips . An aching sweetness tortured [her]2513-she , [she]2513-she wanted [the earth]3348-the earth to close its arms about [her]2513-she , [she]2513-she wanted the answer to [her]2513-she embrace of it . [She]2513-she was alive , and wanted love . Not death - not loneliness - not death ! And out there , where the guns muttered , [millions of [men]3061-men]2515-millions of men would be thinking that same thought !

[X

Pierson]137-thirza had passed nearly the whole night with the relics of [his]2512-he past , the records of [his]2512-he stewardship , the tokens of [his]2512-he short married life . The idea which had possessed [him]2512-he walking [home]3048-home in the moonlight sustained [him]2512-he in that melancholy task of docketing and destruction . There was not nearly so much to do as [one]424-one would have supposed , for , with all [his]2512-he dreaminess , [he]2512-he had been oddly neat and businesslike in all parish matters . But a hundred times that night [he]2512-he stopped , overcome by memories . Every corner , drawer , photograph , paper was a thread in the long - spun web of [his]2512-he life in [this house]2242-this house . Some phase of [his]2512-he work , some vision of [[his]2512-he wife]618-his wife or [daughters]2521-daughters started forth from each bit of furniture , picture , doorway . Noiseless , in [his]2512-he slippers , [he]2512-he stole up and down between [the study]1235-the study , [diningroom]2523-diningroom , [drawing - room]2524-drawing - room , and [anyone seeing [him]2512-he at [his]2512-he work in the dim light which visited the staircase from above the front door and the upper - passage window]2525-anyone seeing him at his work in the dim light which visited the staircase from above the front door and the upper - passage window , would have thought : ' [A ghost]2526-a ghost , [a ghost gone into mourning for the condition of]2527-a ghost gone into mourning for the condition of [the world]606-the world . ' [He]2512-he had to make this reckoning to - night , while the exaltation of [his]2512-he new idea was on [him]2512-he ; had to rummage out the very depths of old association , so that once for all [he]2512-he might know whether [he]2512-he had strength to close the door on the past . Five o'clock struck before [he]2512-he had finished , and , almost dropping from fatigue , sat down at [his]2512-he little piano in bright daylight . The last memory to beset [him]2512-he was the first of all ; [his]2512-he honeymoon , before [they]2529-they came back to live in [this house]2242-this house , already chosen , furnished , and waiting for [them]2529-they . [They]2529-they had spent it in [Germany]77-germany - the first days in [Baden - baden]101-baden - baden , and each morning had been awakened by a Chorale played down in [the gardens of [the Kurhaus]102-the kurhaus]2531-the gardens of the kurhaus , a gentle , beautiful tune , to remind [them]2529-they that [they]2529-they were in [heaven]500-heaven . And softly , so softly that the tunes seemed to be but dreams [he]2512-he began playing those old Chorales , one after another , so that the stilly sounds floated out , through the opened window , puzzling the early birds and cats and those few humans who were abroad as yet .....

[He]2512-he received the telegram from [Noel]197-noel in the afternoon of the same day , just as [he]2512-he was about to set out for [Leila]208-leila 's to get news of [her]208-leila ; and close on the top of it came [Lavendie]253-lavendie . [He]2512-he found [the painter]1461-the painter standing disconsolate in front of [his]1461-the painter picture .

" [Mademoiselle]219-mademoiselle has deserted [me]2512-he ? "[2512-he]

" [You]2512-he are going ? "[2512-he]

" Yes , [I]2512-he am leaving [here]3149-here . [I]2512-he hope to go to [France]13-france . "[2512-he]

" And mademoiselle ? "[2512-he]

" [She]219-mademoiselle is at [the sea]653-the sea with [[my]2512-he son - in - law]3684-my son - in - law . "[2512-he]

[The painter]1461-the painter ran [his]1461-the painter hands through [his]1461-the painter hair , but stopped them half - way , as if aware that [he]1461-the painter was being guilty of ill - breeding .

" Ah , [monsieur]1551-monsieur ! "[2535-the painter , on whom nothing was lost] said [the painter , on whom nothing was lost]2535-the painter , on whom nothing was lost . " Comme je suis egoiste ! [Man]631-man responds to example , not to teaching ; [you]1551-monsieur set the example of [the stranger]4350-the stranger , not [the brother]4351-the brother . [You]1551-monsieur expect from [others]395-others what [you]1551-monsieur do not give . "[253-lavendie]

[Pierson]137-thirza grew red . " [I]137-thirza hope there is another feeling too . "[137-thirza]

" [Monsieur]1551-monsieur , au fond [we]4355-we are all concerned with self . To seem selfless is but [your]1551-monsieur particular way of cultivating the perfection of self . [You]1551-monsieur admit that not to obtrude self is the way to perfect [yourself]1551-monsieur . Eh bien ! What is that but a deeper concern with self ? " Some day , perhaps - "[137-thirza]

" Some day ! The picture will stand still , but [mademoiselle]219-mademoiselle will not . [She]219-mademoiselle will rush at something , and behold ! this face will be gone .
