"[253-lavendie] And carrying easel and canvas , [he]2536-i departed .

[Pierson]137-thirza stayed in [the old drawing - room]2537-the old drawing - room , waiting for [Gratian]127-gratian to come in , and thinking over [the painter]1461-the painter 's words . Had [his]2536-i education and position really made it impossible for [him]2536-i to be brotherly ? Was this the secret of the impotence which [he]2536-i sometimes felt ; the reason why charity and love were not more alive in the hearts of [[his]2536-i congregation]2539-his congregation ? ' [God]143-god knows [I]0-i 've no consciousness of having felt [myself]0-i superior , ' [he]2536-i thought ; ' and yet [I]0-i would be truly ashamed to tell [people]3083-people of [my]0-i troubles and of [my]0-i struggles . Can it be that [Christ]163-christ , if [he]163-christ were on [earth]3346-earth , would count [us]2542-ourselves [Pharisees]2543-pharisees , believing [ourselves]2542-ourselves not as [other men]3063-other men ? But surely it is not as [Christians]3271-christians but rather as [gentlemen]2546-gentlemen that [we]2542-ourselves keep [ourselves]2542-ourselves to [ourselves]2542-ourselves . [Officers]3457-officers , [he]163-christ called [us]2542-ourselves . [I]0-i fear - [I]0-i fear it is true . ' Ah , well ! There would not be many more days now . [He]163-christ would learn out there how to open the hearts of [others]395-others , and [his]163-christ own . Suffering and death levelled all barriers , made [all men brothers]2549-all men brothers . [He]163-christ was still sitting there when [Gratian]127-gratian came in ; and taking [her]2550-her hand , [he]163-christ said :

" [Noel]197-noel has gone down to [George]140-george , and [I]163-christ want [you]2550-her to get transferred and go to [them]4362-them , [Gracie]159-gracie . [I]163-christ 'm giving up [the parish]1643-the parish and asking for a chaplaincy . "[163-christ]

" Giving up ? After all this time ? Is it because of [Nollie]131-nollie ? "[163-christ]

" No , [I]163-christ think not ; [I]163-christ think the time has come . [I]163-christ feel [my]163-christ work [here]3149-here is barren . "[163-christ]

" Oh , no ! And even if it is , it 's only because - "[163-christ]

[Pierson]137-thirza smiled . " Because of what , [Gracie]159-gracie ? "[137-thirza]

" [Dad]158-dad , it 's what [I]163-christ 've felt in [myself]163-christ . [We]4365-we want to think and decide things for [ourselves]4365-we , [we]4365-we want to own [our]4365-we consciences , [we]4365-we ca n't take things at second - hand any longer . "[163-christ]

[Pierson]137-thirza 's face darkened . " Ah ! "[2551-he] [he]2551-he said , " to have lost faith is a grievous thing . "[2551-he]

" [We]4365-we 're gaining charity , "[127-gratian] cried [Gratian]127-gratian .

" The two things are not opposed , [[my]2551-he dear]3031-my dear . "[2551-he]

" Not in theory ; but in practice [I]2551-he think they often are . Oh , [Dad]158-dad ! [you]158-dad look so tired . Have [you]158-dad really made up [your]158-dad mind ? Wo n't [you]158-dad feel lost ? "[2551-he]

" For a little . [I]2551-he shall find [myself]2551-he , out there . "[2551-he]

But the look on [his]2551-he face was too much for [Gratian]127-gratian 's composure , and [she]127-gratian turned away .

[Pierson]137-thirza went down to [[his]2551-he study]1331-his study to write [his]2551-he letter of resignation . Sitting before that blank sheet of paper , [he]2551-he realised to the full how strongly [he]2551-he had resented the public condemnation passed on [his]2551-he own flesh and blood , how much [his]2551-he action was the expression of a purely mundane championship of [[his]2551-he daughter]356-his daughter ; of a mundane mortification . ' Pride , ' [he]2551-he thought . ' Ought [I]0-i to stay and conquer it ? ' Twice [he]2551-he set [his]2551-he pen down , twice took it up again . [He]2551-he could not conquer it . To stay where [he]2551-he was not wanted , on a sort of sufferance - never ! And while [he]2551-he sat before that empty sheet of paper [he]2551-he tried to do the hardest thing [a man]3326-a man can do - to see [himself]3326-a man as [others]395-others see [him]3326-a man ; and met with such success as [one]424-one might expect - harking at once to the verdicts , not of [others]395-others at all , but of [his]2551-he own conscience ; and coming soon to that perpetual gnawing sense which had possessed [him]2551-he ever since the war began , that it was [his]2551-he duty to be dead . This feeling that to be alive was unworthy of [him]2551-he when so many of [[his]2551-he flock]1139-his flock had made the last sacrifice , was reinforced by [his]2551-he domestic tragedy and the bitter disillusionment it had brought . A sense of having lost caste weighed on [him]2551-he , while [he]2551-he sat there with [his]2551-he past receding from [him]2551-he , dusty and unreal . [He]2551-he had the queerest feeling of [his]2551-he old life falling from [him]2551-he , dropping round [his]2551-he feet like the outworn scales of a serpent , rung after rung of tasks and duties performed day after day , year after year . Had they ever been quite real ? Well , [he]2551-he had shed them now , and was to move out into life illumined by the great reality - death ! And taking up [his]2551-he pen , [he]2551-he wrote [his]2551-he resignation .

XI

1

The last Sunday , sunny and bright ! Though [he]2551-he did not ask [her]2559-her to go , [Gratian]127-gratian went to every Service that day . And the sight of [her]2559-her , after this long interval , in [[their]2560-their old pew]2561-their old pew , where once [he]2551-he had been wo nt to see [[his]2551-he wife]618-his wife 's face , and draw refreshment therefrom , affected [Pierson]137-thirza more than anything else . [He]2551-he had told [no one]3081-no one of [his]2551-he coming departure , shrinking from the falsity and suppression which must underlie every allusion and expression of regret . In the last minute of [his]2551-he last sermon [he]2551-he would tell [them]2564-them ! [He]2551-he went through the day in a sort of dream . [Truly proud and sensitive]2565-truly proud and sensitive , under this social blight , [he]2551-he shrank from [all alike]2566-all alike , made no attempt to single out [supporters]2567-supporters or [adherents]2568-adherents from [those who had fallen away]2569-those who had fallen away . [He]2551-he knew there would be some , perhaps many , seriously grieved that [he]2551-he was going ; but to try and realise who [they]2564-them were , to weigh [them]2564-them in the scales against the rest and so forth , was quite against [his]2551-he nature . It was all or nothing . But when for the last time of [all those hundreds]2570-all those hundreds , [he]2551-he mounted the steps of [[his]2551-he dark pulpit]2571-his dark pulpit , [he]2551-he showed no trace of finality , did not perhaps even feel it yet . For so beautiful a summer evening [the congregation]443-the congregation was large . In spite of all reticence , rumour was busy and curiosity still rife . [The writers of the letters , anonymous and otherwise]2573-the writers of the letters , anonymous and otherwise , had spent a week , not indeed in proclaiming what [they]2573-the writers of the letters , anonymous and otherwise had done , but in justifying to [themselves]2573-the writers of the letters , anonymous and otherwise the secret fact that [they]2573-the writers of the letters , anonymous and otherwise had done it . And this was best achieved by speaking to [[their]2573-the writers of the letters , anonymous and otherwise neighbours]2574-their neighbours of the serious and awkward situation of [the poor Vicar]2575-the poor vicar . The result was visible in a better attendance than had been seen since summer - time began .

[Pierson]137-thirza had never been [a great preacher]2576-a great preacher , [his]2551-he voice lacked resonance and pliancy , [his]2551-he thought breadth and buoyancy , and [he]2551-he was not free from , the sing - song which mars the utterance of [many who have to speak professionally]2577-many who have to speak professionally . But [he]2551-he always made an impression of goodness and sincerity . On this last Sunday evening [he]2551-he preached again the first sermon [he]2551-he had ever preached from that pulpit , fresh from the honeymoon with [[his]2551-he young wife]628-his young wife . " [Solomon]285-solomon in all [his]285-solomon glory was not arrayed like one of these . "[2551-he] It lacked now the happy fervour of that most happy of all [his]2551-he days , yet gained poignancy , coming from so worn a face and voice . [Gratian]127-gratian , who knew that [he]2551-he was going to end with [his]2551-he farewell , was in a choke of emotion long before [he]2551-he came to it . [She]628-his young wife sat winking away [her]628-his young wife tears , and not till [he]2551-he paused , for so long that [she]628-his young wife thought [his]2551-he strength had failed , did [she]628-his young wife look up . [He]2551-he was leaning a little forward , seeming to see nothing ; but [his]2551-he hands , grasping the pulpit 's edge , were quivering . There was deep silence in [the Church]372-the church , for the look of [his]2551-he face and figure was strange , even to [Gratian]127-gratian . When [his]2551-he lips parted again to speak , a mist covered [her]628-his young wife eyes , and [she]628-his young wife lost sight of [him]2551-he .

" [Friends]4367-friends , [I]2551-he am leaving [you]4367-friends ; these are the last words [I]2551-he shall ever speak in [this place]4368-this place . [I]2551-he go to other work . [You]4367-friends have been very good to [me]2551-he . [God]143-god has been very good to [me]2551-he . [I]2551-he pray with [my]2551-he whole heart that [He]143-god may bless [you]4367-friends all . Amen ! Amen ! "[2551-he]

The mist cleared into tears , and [she]628-his young wife could see [him]2551-he again gazing down at [her]628-his young wife . Was it at [her]628-his young wife ? [He]2551-he was surely seeing something - some vision sweeter than reality , something [he]2551-he loved more dearly . [She]628-his young wife fell on [her]628-his young wife knees , and buried [her]628-his young wife face in [her]628-his young wife hand . All through the hymn [she]628-his young wife knelt , and through [his]2551-he clear slow Benediction : " The peace of [God]143-god , which passeth all understanding , keep [your]4367-friends hearts and minds in the knowledge and love of [God]143-god , and of [[his]143-god Son]4098-his son Jesus Christ [[our]4370-our Lord]3354-our lord ; and the blessing of [God Almighty]143-god , [the Father]660-the father , [the Son]4373-the son , and [the Holy Ghost]4374-the holy ghost , be amongst [you]4367-friends and remain with [you]4367-friends always . "[628-his young wife] And still [she]628-his young wife knelt on ; till [she]628-his young wife was alone in [the Church]372-the church . Then [she]628-his young wife rose and stole [home]3048-home . [He]2551-he did not come in ; [she]628-his young wife did not expect [him]2551-he . ' It 's over , ' [she]628-his young wife kept thinking ; ' all over . [[My]0-i beloved [Daddy]132-daddy]2582-my beloved daddy ! Now [he]2551-he has no [home]3048-home ; [Nollie]131-nollie and [I]0-i have pulled [him]2551-he down . And yet [I]0-i could n't help it , and perhaps [she]131-nollie could n't . [Poor Nollie]131-nollie ! ... '

2

[Pierson]137-thirza had stayed in [the vestry]2584-the vestry , talking with [[his]2551-he choir and [wardens]2586-wardens]2585-his choir and wardens ; there was no hitch , for [his]2551-he resignation had been accepted , and [he]2551-he had arranged with [a friend]1505-a friend to carry on till [the new Vicar]2588-the new vicar was appointed . When [they]2589-they were gone [he]2551-he went back into [the empty Church]2590-the empty church , and mounted to [the organ - loft]2591-the organ - loft . A little window up there was open , and [he]2551-he stood leaning against the stone , looking out , resting [his]2551-he whole being . Only now that it was over did [he]2551-he know what stress [he]2551-he had been through . [Sparrows]287-sparrows were chirping , but sound of traffic had almost ceased , in that quiet Sunday hour of the evening meal . Finished ! Incredible that [he]2551-he would never come up here again , never see those roof - lines , [that corner of [Square Garden]104-square garden]2592-that corner of square garden , and hear this familiar chirping of the sparrows . [He]2551-he sat down at the organ and began to play . The last time the sound would roll out and echo ' round [the emptied House of]2593-the emptied house of [God]143-god . For a long time [he]2551-he played , while [the building]2594-the building darkened slowly down there below [him]2551-he . Of all that [he]2551-he would leave , [he]2551-he would miss this most - the right to come and play here in [the darkening Church]2595-the darkening church , to release emotional sound in [this dim empty space]2596-this dim empty space growing ever more beautiful . From chord to chord [he]2551-he let [himself]2551-he go deeper and deeper into the surge and swell of those sound waves , losing all sense of actuality , till the music and [the whole dark building]2597-the whole dark building were fused in one rapturous solemnity . Away down there the darkness crept over [the Church]372-the church , till the pews , the altar - all was invisible , save the columns ; and the walls . [He]2551-he began playing [his]2551-he favourite slow movement from [Beethoven]288-beethoven 's Seventh Symphony - kept to the end , for the visions it ever brought [him]2551-he . And a cat , which had been stalking the sparrows , crept in through the little window , and crouched , startled , staring at [him]2551-he with [her]2599-her green eyes . [He]2551-he closed the organ , went quickly down , and locked up [[his]2551-he Church]421-his church for the last time . It was warmer outside than in , and lighter , for daylight was not quite gone . [He]2551-he moved away a few yards , and stood looking up . [Walls]2601-walls , buttresses , and spire were clothed in milky shadowy grey . The top of the spire seemed to touch a star . ' Goodbye , [[my]0-i Church]3504-my church ! ' [he]2551-he thought . ' Good - bye , good - bye ! ' [He]2551-he felt [his]2551-he face quiver ; clenched [his]2551-he teeth , and turned away .

XII

When [Noel]197-noel fled , [Fort]175-jimmy had started forward to stop [her]2599-her ; then , realising that with [his]2551-he lameness [he]2551-he could never catch [her]2599-her , [he]2551-he went back and entered [[Leila]208-leila 's bedroom]2603-leila 's bedroom .

[She]208-leila had taken off [her]208-leila dress , and was standing in front of [her]208-leila glass , with the cigarette still in [her]208-leila mouth ; and the only movement was the curling of its blue smoke . [He]2551-he could see [her]208-leila face reflected , pale , with a little spot of red in each cheek , and burning red ears . [She]208-leila had not seemed to hear [him]2551-he coming in , but [he]2551-he saw [her]208-leila eyes change when [they]2604-they caught [his]2551-he reflection in the mirror . From lost and blank , they became alive and smouldering .

" [Noel]197-noel 's gone ! "[2551-he] [he]2551-he said .

[She]208-leila answered , as if to [his]2551-he reflection in the glass

" And [you]2551-he have n't gone too ? Ah , no ! Of course - [your]2551-he leg ! [She]208-leila fled , [I]208-leila suppose ? It was rather a jar , [my]208-leila coming in , [I]208-leila 'm afraid . "[208-leila]

" No ; it was [my]208-leila coming in that was the jar . "[208-leila]

[Leila]208-leila turned round . " [Jimmy]175-jimmy ! [I]208-leila wonder [you]175-jimmy could discuss [me]208-leila . [The rest]1487-the rest - "[208-leila] [She]208-leila shrugged [her]208-leila shoulders - " But that ! "[208-leila]

" [I]208-leila was not discussing [you]175-jimmy . [I]208-leila merely said [you]175-jimmy were not to be envied for having [me]208-leila . Are [you]175-jimmy ? "[208-leila]

The moment [he]2605-he had spoken , [he]2605-he was sorry . The anger in [her]208-leila eyes changed instantly , first to searching , then to misery . [She]208-leila cried out :

" [I]208-leila was to be envied . Oh ! [Jimmy]175-jimmy ; [I]208-leila was ! "[208-leila] and flung [herself]208-leila face down on the bed .

Through [Fort]175-jimmy 's mind went the thought : ' Atrocious ! ' How could [he]2605-he soothe - make [her]208-leila feel that [he]2605-he loved [her]208-leila , when [he]2605-he did n't - that [he]2605-he wanted [her]208-leila , when [he]2605-he wanted [Noel]197-noel . [He]2605-he went up to the bedside and touched [her]208-leila timidly :

" [Leila]208-leila , what is it ? [You]208-leila 're overtired . What 's the matter ? [I]2605-he could n't help [the child]977-the child 's being [here]3149-here . Why do [you]208-leila let it upset [you]208-leila ? [She]977-the child 's gone . It 's all right . Things are just as they were . "[2605-he]

" Yes ! "[2605-he] came the strangled echo ; " just ! "[2605-he]

[He]2605-he knelt down and stroked [her]208-leila arm . [It]2606-it shivered under the touch , seemed to stop shivering and wait for the next touch , as if hoping it might be warmer ; shivered again .

" Look at [me]2605-he ! "[2605-he] [he]2605-he said . " What is it [you]208-leila want ? [I]2605-he 'm ready to do anything . "[2605-he]

[She]208-leila turned and drew [herself]208-leila up on the bed , screwing [herself]208-leila back against the pillow as if for support , with [her]208-leila knees drawn under [her]208-leila . [He]2605-he was astonished at the strength of [her]208-leila face and figure , thus entrenched .

" [[My]208-leila dear]3031-my dear [Jimmy]175-jimmy ! "[208-leila] [she]208-leila said , " [I]208-leila want [you]175-jimmy to do nothing but get [me]208-leila another cigarette . At [my]208-leila age one expects no more than [one]424-one gets ! "[208-leila] [She]208-leila held out [her]208-leila thumb and finger : " Do [you]175-jimmy mind ? "[208-leila]

[Fort]175-jimmy turned away to get the cigarette . With what bitter restraint and curious little smile [she]208-leila had said that ! But no sooner was [he]2605-he out of [the room]517-the room and hunting blindly for the cigarettes , than [his]2605-he mind was filled with an aching concern for [Noel]197-noel , fleeing like that , reckless and hurt , with nowhere to go . [He]2605-he found the polished birch - wood box which held the cigarettes , and made a desperate effort to dismiss the image of [the girl]525-the girl before [he]2605-he again reached [Leila]208-leila . [She]525-the girl was still sitting there , with [her]525-the girl arms crossed , in the stillness of [one whose every nerve and fibre was stretched taut]2609-one whose every nerve and fibre was stretched taut .

" Have one [yourself]175-jimmy , "[208-leila] [she]208-leila said . " The pipe of peace . "[208-leila]

[Fort]175-jimmy lit the cigarettes , and sat down on the edge of the bed ; and [his]2605-he mind at once went back to [Noel]197-noel .

" Yes , "[208-leila] [she]208-leila said suddenly ; " [I]208-leila wonder where [she]525-the girl 's gone . Can [you]2605-he see [her]525-the girl ? [She]525-the girl might do something reckless a second time . [Poor Jimmy]175-jimmy ! It would be a pity . And so [that monk]4380-that monk 's been [here]3149-here , and drunk champagne . Good idea ! Get [me]208-leila some , [Jimmy]175-jimmy ! "[208-leila]

Again [Fort]175-jimmy went , and with [him]175-jimmy the image of [the girl]525-the girl . When [he]175-jimmy came back the second time ; [she]208-leila had put on that dark silk garment in which [she]208-leila had appeared suddenly radiant the fatal night after the [Queen 's Hall concert]2611-queen 's hall concert . [She]208-leila took the wineglass , and passed [him]175-jimmy , going into [the sitting - room]2612-the sitting - room .

" Come and sit down , "[208-leila] [she]208-leila said . " Is [your]175-jimmy leg hurting [you]175-jimmy ? "[208-leila]

" Not more than usual , "[175-jimmy] and [he]175-jimmy sat down beside [her]208-leila .

" Wo n't [you]208-leila have some ? ' In vino veritas ; ' [[my]175-jimmy friend]4179-my friend . "[175-jimmy]

[He]175-jimmy shook [his]175-jimmy head , and said humbly : " [I]175-jimmy admire [you]208-leila , [Leila]208-leila . "[175-jimmy]

" That 's lucky . [I]208-leila do n't know anyone else who , would . "[208-leila] And [she]208-leila drank [her]208-leila champagne at a draught .

" Do n't [you]175-jimmy wish , "[208-leila] [she]208-leila said suddenly , " that [I]208-leila had been one of [those wonderful New Women]4383-those wonderful new women , all brain and good works . How [I]208-leila should have talked [the Universe]21-the universe up and down , and the war , and [Causes]290-causes , drinking tea , and never boring [you]175-jimmy to try and love [me]208-leila . What a pity ! "[208-leila]

But to [Fort]175-jimmy there had come [Noel]197-noel 's words : " It 's awfully funny , is n't it ? "[197-noel]

" [Leila]208-leila , "[175-jimmy] [he]175-jimmy said suddenly , ' something 's got to be done . So long as [you]208-leila do n't wish [me]0-i to , [I]0-i 'll promise never to see [that child]3092-that child again . "[0-i]

" [[My]208-leila dear boy]3122-my dear boy , [she]3092-that child 's not [a child]415-a child . [She]3092-that child 's ripe for love ; and - [I]208-leila 'm too ripe for love . That 's what 's the matter , and [I]208-leila 've got to lump it . "[208-leila] [She]208-leila wrenched [her]208-leila hand out of [his]175-jimmy and , dropping the empty glass , covered [her]208-leila face . The awful sensation which visits [the true Englishman]2614-the true englishman when a scene stares [him]2614-the true englishman in the face spun in [Fort]175-jimmy 's brain . Should [he]175-jimmy seize [her]208-leila hands , drag them down , and kiss [her]208-leila ? Should [he]175-jimmy get up and leave [her]208-leila alone ? Speak , or keep silent ; try to console ; try to pretend ? And [he]175-jimmy did absolutely nothing . So far as [a man]3326-a man can understand that moment in [a woman]3280-a woman 's life when [she]3280-a woman accepts the defeat of Youth and [Beauty]291-beauty , [he]175-jimmy understood perhaps ; but it was only a glimmering . [He]175-jimmy understood much better how [she]3280-a woman was recognising once for all that [she]3280-a woman loved where [she]3280-a woman was not loved .

' And [I]0-i ca n't help that , ' [he]175-jimmy thought dumbly ; ' simply ca n't help that ! ' Nothing [he]175-jimmy could say or do would alter it . No words can convince [a woman]3280-a woman when kisses have lost reality . Then , to [his]175-jimmy infinite relief , [she]208-leila took [her]208-leila hands from [her]208-leila face , and said :

" This is very dull . [I]208-leila think [you]175-jimmy 'd better go , [Jimmy]175-jimmy . "[208-leila]

[He]175-jimmy made an effort to speak , but was too afraid of falsity in [his]175-jimmy voice .

" Very nearly a scene ! "[208-leila] said [Leila]208-leila . " [[My]208-leila God]499-my god ![208-leila]

" How [men]3061-men hate [them]3061-men ! So do [I.]208-leila [I]175-jimmy 've had too many in [my]175-jimmy time ; nothing comes of them but a headache next morning . [I]175-jimmy 've spared [you]175-jimmy that , [Jimmy]175-jimmy . Give [me]175-jimmy a kiss for it . "[175-jimmy]

[He]175-jimmy bent down and put [his]175-jimmy lips to [hers]208-leila . With all [his]175-jimmy heart [he]175-jimmy tried to answer the passion in [her]208-leila kiss . [She]208-leila pushed [him]175-jimmy away suddenly , and said faintly :

" Thank [you]175-jimmy ; [you]175-jimmy did try ! "[208-leila]

[Fort]175-jimmy dashed [his]175-jimmy hand across [his]175-jimmy eyes . The sight of [her]208-leila face just then moved [him]175-jimmy horribly . What [a brute]2618-a brute [he]175-jimmy felt ! [He]175-jimmy took [her]208-leila limp hand , put it to [his]175-jimmy lips , and murmured :

" [I]175-jimmy shall come in to - morrow . [We]4388-we 'll go to [the theatre]4389-the theatre , shall [we]4388-we ? Good night , [Leila]208-leila ! "[175-jimmy]

But , in opening the door , [he]175-jimmy caught sight of [her]208-leila face , staring at [him]175-jimmy , evidently waiting for [him]175-jimmy to turn ; the eyes had a frightened look . They went suddenly soft , so soft as to give [his]175-jimmy heart a squeeze .

[She]208-leila lifted [her]208-leila hand , blew [him]175-jimmy a kiss , and [he]175-jimmy saw [her]208-leila smiling . Without knowing what [his]175-jimmy own lips answered , [he]175-jimmy went out . [He]175-jimmy could not make up [his]175-jimmy mind to go away , but , crossing to the railings , stood leaning against them , looking up at [her]208-leila windows . [She]208-leila had been very good to [him]175-jimmy . [He]175-jimmy felt like [a man who has won at cards]2619-a man who has won at cards , and sneaked away without giving [the loser]2620-the loser [his]2620-the loser revenge . If only [she]208-leila had n't loved [him]175-jimmy ; and it had been a soulless companionship , a quite sordid business . Anything rather than this ! English to the backbone , [he]175-jimmy could not divest [himself]175-jimmy of a sense of guilt . To see no way of making up to [her]208-leila , of straightening it out , made [him]175-jimmy feel intensely mean . ' Shall [I]0-i go up again ? ' [he]175-jimmy thought . The window - curtain moved . Then the shreds of light up there vanished . ' [She]208-leila 's gone to bed , ' [he]175-jimmy thought . ' [I]0-i should only upset [her]208-leila worse . Where is [Noel]197-noel , now , [I]0-i wonder ? [I]0-i shall never see [her]208-leila again , [I]0-i suppose . Altogether a bad business . [[My]0-i God]499-my god , yes ! A bad - bad business ! '

And , painfully , for [his]175-jimmy leg was hurting [him]175-jimmy , [he]175-jimmy walked away .

[Leila]208-leila was only too well aware of a truth that feelings are no less real , poignant , and important to those outside morality 's ring fence than to those within . [Her]208-leila feelings were , indeed , probably even more real and poignant , just as a wild fruit 's flavour is sharper than that of the tame product . Opinion - [she]208-leila knew - would say , that having wilfully chosen a position outside morality [she]208-leila had not half the case for brokenheartedness [she]208-leila would have had if [Fort]175-jimmy had been [[her]208-leila husband]554-her husband : Opinion - [she]208-leila knew - would say [she]208-leila had no claim on [him]175-jimmy , and the sooner an illegal tie was broken , the better ! But [she]208-leila felt fully as wretched as if [she]208-leila had been married . [She]208-leila had not wanted to be outside morality ; never in [her]208-leila life wanted to be that . [She]208-leila was like those who by confession shed [their]2623-their sins and start again with a clear conscience . [She]208-leila never meant to sin , only to love , and when [she]208-leila was in love , nothing else mattered for the moment . But , though [a gambler]2624-a gambler , [she]208-leila had always so far paid up . Only , this time the stakes were the heaviest [a woman]3280-a woman can put down . It was [her]208-leila last throw ; and [she]208-leila knew it . So long as [a woman]3280-a woman believed in [her]3280-a woman attraction , there was hope , even when the curtain fell on a love - affair ! But for [Leila]208-leila the lamp of belief had suddenly gone out , and when this next curtain dropped [she]208-leila felt that [she]208-leila must sit in the dark until old age made [her]208-leila indifferent . And between forty - four and real old age a gulf is fixed . This was the first time [a man]3326-a man had tired of [her]208-leila . Why ! [he]3326-a man had been tired before [he]3326-a man began , or so [she]208-leila felt . In one swift moment as of [a drowning person]2628-a drowning person , [she]208-leila saw again all the passages of [their]2629-their companionship , knew with certainty that it had never been a genuine flame . Shame ran , consuming , in [her]208-leila veins . [She]208-leila buried [her]208-leila face in the cushions . [This girl]2136-this girl had possessed [his]3326-a man real heart all the time . With a laugh [she]208-leila thought : ' [I]0-i put [my]0-i money on the wrong horse ; [I]0-i ought to have backed [Edward]122-pierson . [I]0-i could have turned [that poor monk]2631-that poor monk 's head . If only [I]0-i had never seen [Jimmy]175-jimmy again ; if [I]0-i had torn [his]175-jimmy letter up , [I]0-i could have made poor [Edward]122-pierson love [me]0-i ! ' Ifs ! What folly ! Things happened as they must !

And , starting up , [she]208-leila began to roam [the little room]1071-the little room . Without [Jimmy]175-jimmy [she]208-leila would be wretched , with [him]175-jimmy [she]208-leila would be wretched too ! ' [I]0-i ca n't bear to see [his]175-jimmy face , ' [she]208-leila thought ; ' and [I]0-i ca n't live [here]3149-here without [him]175-jimmy ! It 's really funny ! ' The thought of [[her]208-leila hospital]3051-her hospital filled [her]208-leila with loathing . To go [there]3137-there day after day with this despair eating at [her]208-leila heart - [she]208-leila simply could not . [She]208-leila went over [her]208-leila resources . [She]208-leila had more money than [she]208-leila thought ; [Jimmy]175-jimmy had given [her]208-leila a Christmas present of five hundred pounds . [She]208-leila had wanted to tear up the cheque , or force [him]175-jimmy to take it back ; but the realities of the previous five years had prevailed with [her]208-leila , and [she]208-leila had banked it . [She]208-leila was glad now . [She]208-leila had not to consider money . [Her]208-leila mind sought to escape in the past . [She]208-leila thought of [[her]208-leila first husband]3881-her first husband , [Ronny Fane]179-young fane ; of [[their]2637-their mosquito - curtained rooms in that ghastly Madras heat]2638-their mosquito - curtained rooms in that ghastly madras heat . [Poor Ronny]179-young fane ! What [a pale , cynical young ghost]2639-a pale , cynical young ghost started up under that name . [She]208-leila thought of [Lynch]190-mrs. lynch , [his]175-jimmy horsey , matter - of - fact solidity . [She]208-leila had loved [them]2637-their both - for a time . [She]208-leila thought of the veldt , of [Constantia]41-high constantia , and the loom of [Table Mountain]105-table mountain under the stars ; and the first sight of [Jimmy]175-jimmy , [his]175-jimmy straight look , the curve of [his]175-jimmy crisp head , the kind , fighting - schoolboy frankness of [his]175-jimmy face . Even now , after all those months of [their]2637-their companionship , that long - ago evening at grape harvest , when [she]208-leila sang to [him]175-jimmy under the scented creepers , was the memory of [him]175-jimmy most charged with real feeling . That one evening at any rate [he]175-jimmy had longed for [her]208-leila , eleven : years ago , when [she]208-leila was in [her]208-leila prime . [She]208-leila could have held [her]208-leila own then ; [Noel]197-noel would have come in vain . To think that [this girl]2136-this girl had still fifteen years before [she]208-leila would be even in [her]208-leila prime . Fifteen years of witchery ; and then another ten before [she]208-leila was on the shelf . Why ! if [Noel]197-noel married [Jimmy]175-jimmy , [he]175-jimmy would be [an old man doting on [her]208-leila still]2641-an old man doting on her still , by the time [she]208-leila had reached this fatal age of forty - four : [She]208-leila felt as if [she]208-leila must scream , and ; stuffing [her]208-leila handkerchief into [her]208-leila mouth , turned out the light . Darkness cooled [her]208-leila , a little . [She]208-leila pulled aside the curtains , and let in the moon light . [Jimmy]175-jimmy and [that girl]1272-that girl were out in it some where , seeking [each other]493-each other , if not in body , then in thought . And soon , somehow , somewhere , [they]2644-they would come together - come together because [Fate]167-fate meant [them]2644-they to ! Fate which had given [[her]208-leila young cousin]1518-her young cousin a likeness to [herself]208-leila ; placed [her]208-leila , too , in just such a hopeless position as appealed to [Jimmy]175-jimmy , and gave [him]175-jimmy a chance against [younger men]2646-younger men . [She]208-leila saw it with bitter surety . [Good gamblers]2647-good gamblers cut [their]2647-good gamblers losses ! Yes , and [proud women]2648-proud women did not keep [unwilling lovers]2649-unwilling lovers ! If [she]208-leila had even an outside chance , [she]208-leila would trail [her]208-leila pride , drag it through the mud , through thorns ! But [she]208-leila had not . And [she]208-leila clenched [her]208-leila fist , and struck out at the night , as though at the face of that Fate which [one]424-one could never reach - impalpable , remorseless , surrounding [Fate]167-fate with its faint mocking smile , devoid of all human warmth . Nothing could set back the clock , and give [her]208-leila what [this girl]2136-this girl had . Time had " done [her]208-leila in , "[2652-every woman] as it " did in "[2652-every woman] [every woman]2652-every woman , one by one . And [she]208-leila saw [herself]208-leila going down the years , powdering a little more , painting a little more , touching up [her]208-leila hair , till it was all artifice , holding on by every little device - and all , to what end ? To see [his]2653-his face get colder and colder , hear [his]2653-his voice more and more constrained to gentleness ; and know that underneath , aversion was growing with the thought ' [You]2653-his are keeping [me]0-i from life , and love ! ' till one evening , in sheer nerve - break , [she]208-leila would say or do some fearful thing , and [he]2653-his would come no more . ' No , [Jimmy]175-jimmy ! ' [she]208-leila thought ; ' find [her]2136-this girl , and stay with [her]2136-this girl . [You]175-jimmy 're not worth all that ! ' And puffing to the curtains , as though with that gesture [she]208-leila could shut out [her]208-leila creeping fate , [she]208-leila turned up the light and sat down at [her]208-leila writing table . [She]208-leila stayed some minutes motionless , [her]208-leila chin resting on [her]208-leila hands , the dark silk fallen down from [her]208-leila arms . A little mirror , framed in curiously carved ivory , picked up by [her]208-leila in an Indian bazaar twenty - five years ago , hung on a level with [her]208-leila face and gave that face back to [her]208-leila . ' [I]0-i 'm not ugly , ' [she]208-leila thought passionately , ' [I]0-i 'm not . [I]0-i still have some looks left . If only [that girl]1272-that girl had n't come . And it was all [my]0-i doing . Oh , what made [me]0-i write to both of [them]2655-them , [Edward]122-pierson and [Jimmy]175-jimmy ? ' [She]208-leila turned the mirror aside , and took up a pen .

" [[MY]208-leila DEAR]3031-my dear [JIMMY]175-jimmy , "[208-leila] [she]208-leila wrote : " It will be better for [us]2655-them both if [you]175-jimmy take a holiday from here . Do n't come again till [I]208-leila write for [you]175-jimmy . [I]208-leila 'm sorry [I]208-leila made [you]175-jimmy so much disturbance to - night . Have a good time , and a good rest ; and do n't worry . [Your]175-jimmy - "[208-leila]

So far [she]208-leila had written when a tear dropped on the page , and [she]208-leila had to tear it up and begin again . This time [she]208-leila wrote to the end - " [[Your]175-jimmy [Leila]208-leila]4391-your leila . "[208-leila] ' [I]0-i must post it now , ' [she]208-leila thought , ' or [he]2656-he may not get it before to - morrow evening . [I]0-i could n't go through with this again . ' [She]208-leila hurried out with it and slipped it in a pillar box . The night smelled of flowers ; and , hastening back , [she]208-leila lay down , and stayed awake for hours , tossing , and staring at the dark .

XIII

1

[Leila]208-leila had pluck , but little patience . [Her]208-leila one thought was to get away and [she]208-leila at once began settling up [her]208-leila affairs and getting a permit to return to [South Africa]9-south africa . The excitements of purchase and preparation were as good an anodyne as [she]208-leila could have taken . The perils of [the sea]653-the sea were at full just then , and the prospect of danger gave [her]208-leila a sort of pleasure . ' If [I]0-i go down , ' [she]208-leila thought , ' all the better ; brisk , instead of long and dreary . ' But when [she]208-leila had the permit and [[her]208-leila cabin]2658-her cabin was booked , the irrevocability of [her]208-leila step came to [her]208-leila with full force . Should [she]208-leila see [him]2656-he again or no ? [Her]208-leila boat started in three days , and [she]208-leila must decide . If in compunction [he]2656-he were to be affectionate , [she]208-leila knew [she]208-leila would never keep to [her]208-leila decision , and then the horror would begin again , till again [she]208-leila was forced to this same action . [She]208-leila let the hours go and go till the very day before , when the ache to see [him]2656-he and the dread of it had become so unbearable that [she]208-leila could not keep quiet . Late that afternoon - everything , to the last label , ready - [she]208-leila went out , still undecided . An itch to turn the dagger in [her]208-leila wound , to know what had become of [Noel]197-noel , took [her]208-leila to [[Edward]122-pierson 's house]2659-edward 's house . Almost unconsciously [she]208-leila had put on [her]208-leila prettiest frock , and spent an hour before the glass . A feverishness of soul , more than of body , which had hung about [her]208-leila ever since that night , gave [her]208-leila colour . [She]208-leila looked [her]208-leila prettiest ; and [she]208-leila bought a gardenia at [a shop in [Baker Street]106-baker street]2660-a shop in baker street and fastened it in [her]208-leila dress . Reaching [the old Square]1537-the old square , [she]208-leila was astonished to see a board up with the words : " To let , "[208-leila] though [the house]538-the house still looked inhabited . [She]208-leila rang , and was shown into [the drawing - room]1382-the drawing - room . [She]208-leila had only twice been in [this house]2242-this house before ; and for some reason , perhaps because of [her]208-leila own unhappiness , [the old , rather shabby room]2665-the old , rather shabby room struck [her]208-leila as pathetic , as if inhabited by the past . ' [I]0-i wonder what [[his]2666-i wife]618-his wife was like , ' [she]208-leila thought : And then [she]208-leila saw , hanging against a strip of black velvet on the wall , that faded colour sketch of [the slender young woman]2668-the slender young woman leaning forward , with [her]2668-the slender young woman hands crossed in [her]2668-the slender young woman lap . The colouring was lavender and old ivory , with faint touches of rose . The eyes , so living , were a little like Gratian 's ; the whole face delicate , eager , good . ' Yes , ' [she]208-leila thought , ' [he]2666-i must have loved [you]2666-i very much . To say good - bye must have been hard . ' [She]208-leila was still standing before it when [Pierson]122-pierson came in .

" That 's a dear face , [Edward]122-pierson . [I]122-pierson 've come to say good - bye . [I]122-pierson 'm leaving for [South Africa]9-south africa to - morrow . "[122-pierson] And , as [her]208-leila hand touched [his]2666-i , [she]208-leila thought : ' [I]0-i must have been mad to think [I]0-i could ever have made [him]2666-i love [me]0-i . '

" Are [you]2666-i - are [you]2666-i leaving [him]2666-i ? "[208-leila]

[Leila]208-leila nodded :

" That 's very brave , and wonderful . "[208-leila]

" Oh ! no . Needs must when [the devil]4392-the devil drives - that 's all . [I]2666-i do n't give up happiness of [my]2666-i own accord . That 's not within a hundred miles of the truth . What [I]2666-i shall become , [I]2666-i do n't know , but nothing better , [you]208-leila may be sure . [I]2666-i give up because [I]2666-i ca n't keep , and [you]208-leila know why . Where is [Noel]197-noel ? "[2666-i]

" Down at [the sea]653-the sea , with [George]140-george and [Gratian]127-gratian . "[208-leila]

[He]2666-i was looking at [her]208-leila in wonder ; and the pained , puzzled expression on [his]2666-i face angered [her]208-leila .

" [I]208-leila see [the house]538-the house is to let . Who 'd have thought [a child like that]3097-a child like that could root up [two fossils like [us]4397-us]4396-two fossils like us ? Never mind , [Edward]122-pierson , there 's the same blood in [us]4397-us . [We]4397-us 'll keep [our]4397-us ends up in [our]4397-us own ways . Where are [you]122-pierson going ? "[208-leila]

" [They]4398-they 'll give [me]2666-i [a chaplaincy in [the East]12-east]4399-a chaplaincy in the east , [I]2666-i think . "[2666-i]

For a wild moment [Leila]208-leila thought : ' Shall [I]0-i offer to go with [him]2669-him - the two lost dogs together ? '

" What would have happened , [Edward]122-pierson , if [you]122-pierson had proposed to [me]208-leila that May week , when [we]4397-us were - a little bit in love ? Which would it have been , worst for , [you]122-pierson or [me]208-leila ? "[208-leila]

" [You]122-pierson would n't have taken [me]208-leila , [Leila]208-leila . "[208-leila]

" Oh , [one]424-one never knows . But [you]122-pierson 'd never have been [a priest]1611-a priest then , and [you]122-pierson 'd never have become [a saint]3751-a saint . "[208-leila]

" Do n't use that silly word . If [you]122-pierson knew - "[208-leila]

" [I]2670-she do ; [I]2670-she can see that [you]122-pierson 've been half burned alive ; half burned and half buried ! Well , [you]122-pierson have [your]122-pierson reward , whatever it is , and [I]2670-she mine . Good - bye , [Edward]122-pierson ! "[2670-she] [She]2670-she took [his]2671-his hand . " [You]122-pierson might give [me]2670-she [your]122-pierson blessing ; [I]2670-she want it . "[2670-she]

[Pierson]122-pierson put [his]122-pierson other hand on [her]2670-she shoulder and , bending forward , kissed [her]2670-she forehead .

The tears rushed up in [Leila]208-leila 's eyes . " Ah [me]2670-she ! "[2670-she] [she]2670-she said , " it 's [a sad world]4403-a sad world ! "[2670-she] And wiping the quivering off [her]2670-she lips with the back of [her]2670-she gloved hand , [she]2670-she went quickly past [him]2671-his to the door . [She]2670-she looked back from there . [He]2671-his had not stirred , but [his]2671-his lips were moving . ' [He]2671-his 's praying for [me]0-i ! ' [she]2670-she thought . ' How funny ! '

2

The moment [she]2670-she was outside , [she]2670-she forgot [him]2671-his ; the dreadful ache for [Fort]175-jimmy seemed to have been whipped up within [her]2670-she , as if that figure of lifelong repression had infuriated the love of life and pleasure in [her]2670-she . [She]2670-she must and would see [Jimmy]175-jimmy again , if [she]2670-she had to wait and seek for [him]2671-his all night ! It was nearly seven , [he]2671-his would surely have finished at [the War Office]3382-the war office ; [he]2671-his might be at [[his]2671-his Club]833-his club or at [[his]2671-his rooms]832-his rooms . [She]2670-she made for the latter .

[The little street near [Buckingham Gate]108-buckingham gate , where no wag had chalked " Peace "[2670-she] on the doors]2675-the little street near buckingham gate , where no wag had chalked " peace " on the doors for nearly a year now , had an arid look after a hot day 's sun . [The hair - dresser 's shop below [[his]2671-his rooms]832-his rooms]2676-the hair - dresser 's shop below his rooms was still open , and the private door ajar : ' [I]0-i wo n't ring , ' [she]2670-she thought ; ' [I]0-i 'll go straight up . ' While [she]2670-she was mounting [the two flights of stairs]2678-the two flights of stairs , [she]2670-she stopped twice , breathless , from a pain in [her]2670-she side . [She]2670-she often had that pain now , as if the longing in [her]2670-she heart strained it physically . On the modest landing at the top , outside [[his]2671-his rooms]832-his rooms , [she]2670-she waited , leaning against the wall , which was covered with a red paper . A window at the back was open and the confused sound of singing came in - a chorus " Vive - la , vive - la , vive - la ve . Vive la compagnie . "[2670-she] So it came to [her]2670-she . ' O [God]143-god ! ' [she]2670-she thought : ' Let [him]2671-his be in , let [him]2671-his be nice to [me]0-i . It 's the last time . ' And , sick from anxiety , [she]2670-she opened the door . [He]2671-his was in - lying on a wicker - couch against the wall in the far corner , with [his]2671-his arms crossed behind [his]2671-his head , and a pipe in [his]2671-his mouth ; [his]2671-his eyes were closed , and [he]2671-his neither moved , nor opened them , perhaps supposing [her]2670-she to be [the servant]2680-the servant . Noiseless as a cat , [Leila]208-leila crossed [the room]517-the room till [she]208-leila stood above [him]2671-his . And waiting for [him]2671-his to come out of that defiant lethargy , [she]2670-she took [her]2670-she fill of [his]2671-his thin , bony face , healthy and hollow at the same time . With teeth clenched on the pipe it had a look of hard resistance , as of [a man with [his]2671-his head back , [his]2671-his arms pinioned to [his]2671-his sides , stiffened against some creature , clinging and climbing and trying to drag [him]2671-his down]2682-a man with his head back , his arms pinioned to his sides , stiffened against some creature , clinging and climbing and trying to drag him down . The pipe was alive , and dribbled smoke ; and [his]2671-his leg , [the injured one]2683-the injured one , wriggled restlessly , as if worrying [him]2671-his ; but the rest of [him]2671-his was as utterly and obstinately still as though [he]2671-his were asleep . [His]2671-his hair grew thick and crisp , not a thread of grey in it , the teeth which held the pipe glinted white and strong . [His]2671-his face was young ; so much younger than [hers]208-leila . Why did [she]2670-she love it - the face of [a man who could n't love [her]2670-she]2684-a man who could n't love her ? For a second [she]2670-she felt as if [she]2670-she could seize the cushion which had slipped down off the couch , and smother [him]2671-his as [he]2671-his lay there , refusing , so it seemed to [her]2670-she , to come to consciousness . Love despised ! [Humiliation]292-humiliation ! [She]2670-she nearly turned and stole away . Then through the door , left open , behind [her]2670-she , the sound of that chorus : " Vive - la , vive - la , vive - la ve ! "[175-jimmy] came in and jolted [her]2670-she nerves unbearably . Tearing the gardenia from [her]2670-she breast , [she]2670-she flung it on to [his]2671-his upturned face .

" [Jimmy]175-jimmy ! "[2670-she]

[Fort]175-jimmy struggled up , and stared at [her]2670-she . [His]2671-his face was comic from bewilderment , and [she]2670-she broke into a little nervous laugh .

" [You]175-jimmy were n't dreaming of [me]2670-she , dear [Jimmy]175-jimmy , that 's certain . In [what garden]4404-what garden were [you]175-jimmy wandering ? "[2670-she]

" [Leila]208-leila ! [You]175-jimmy ! How - how jolly ! "[2670-she]

" How - how jolly ! [I]2670-she wanted to see [you]175-jimmy , so [I]2670-she came . And [I]2670-she have seen [you]175-jimmy , as [you]175-jimmy are , when [you]175-jimmy are n't with [me]2670-she . [I]2670-she shall remember it ; it was good for [me]2670-she - awfully good for [me]2670-she . "[2670-she]

" [I]2670-she did n't hear [you]175-jimmy . "[2670-she]

" Far , far away , [[my]2670-she dear]3031-my dear . Put [my]2670-she gardenia in , [your]175-jimmy buttonhole . Stop , [I]2670-she 'll pin it in . Have [you]175-jimmy had a good rest all this week ? Do [you]175-jimmy like [my]2670-she dress ? It 's new . [You]175-jimmy would n't have noticed it , would [you]175-jimmy ? "[2670-she]

" [I]2670-she should have noticed . [I]2670-she think it 's charming .[2670-she]

" [Jimmy]175-jimmy , [I]2670-she believe that nothing - nothing will ever shake [your]2685-his chivalry . "[2670-she]

" Chivalry ? [I]2670-she have none . "[2670-she]

" [I]2685-his am going to shut the door , do [you]175-jimmy mind ? "[2685-his] But [he]2685-his went to the door [himself]2685-his , shut it , and came back to [her]2686-her . [Leila]208-leila looked up at [him]2685-his .

" [Jimmy]175-jimmy , if ever [you]2685-his loved [me]2685-his a little bit , be nice to [me]2685-his today . And if [I]2685-his say things - if [I]2685-his 'm bitter - do n't mind ; do n't notice it . Promise ! "[2685-his]

" [I]2685-his promise . "[2685-his]

[She]208-leila took off [her]208-leila hat and sat leaning against [him]2685-his on the couch , so that [she]208-leila could not see [his]2685-his face . And with [his]2685-his arm round [her]208-leila , [she]208-leila let [herself]208-leila go , deep into the waters of illusion ; down - down , trying to forget there was a surface to which [she]208-leila must return ; like [a little girl]1665-a little girl [she]208-leila played that game of make - believe . ' [He]2685-his loves [me]0-i - [he]2685-his loves [me]0-i - [he]2685-his loves [me]0-i ! ' To lose [herself]208-leila like that for , just an hour , only an hour ; [she]208-leila felt that [she]208-leila would give the rest of the time vouchsafed to [her]208-leila ; give it all and willingly . [Her]208-leila hand clasped [his]2685-his against [her]208-leila heart , [she]208-leila turned [her]208-leila face backward , up to [his]2685-his , closing [her]208-leila eyes so as still not to see [his]2685-his face ; the scent of the gardenia in [his]2685-his coat hurt [her]208-leila , so sweet and strong it was .

3

When with [her]208-leila hat on [she]208-leila stood ready to go , it was getting dark . [She]208-leila had come out of [her]208-leila dream now , was playing at make - believe no more . And [she]208-leila stood with a stony smile , in the half - dark , looking between [her]208-leila lashes at the mortified expression on [his]2685-his unconscious face .

" [Poor Jimmy]293-poor jimmy ! "[208-leila] [she]208-leila said ; " [I]208-leila 'm not going to keep [you]2685-his from dinner any longer . No , do n't come with [me]208-leila . [I]208-leila 'm going alone ; and do n't light up , for heaven 's sake . "[208-leila]

[She]208-leila put [her]208-leila hand on the lapel of [his]2685-his coat . " That flower 's gone brown at the edges . Throw it away ; [I]208-leila ca n't bear faded flowers . Nor can [you]2685-his . Get [yourself]2685-his a fresh one tomorrow . "[208-leila]

[She]208-leila pulled the flower from [his]2685-his buttonhole and , crushing it in [her]208-leila hand , held [her]208-leila face up .

" Well , kiss [me]208-leila once more ; it wo n't hurt [you]2685-his . "[208-leila]

For one moment [her]208-leila lips clung to [his]2685-his with all [their]2688-their might . [She]208-leila wrenched them away , felt for the handle blindly , opened the door , and , shutting it in [his]2685-his face , went slowly , swaying a little , down [the stairs]1892-the stairs . [She]208-leila trailed a gloved hand along the wall , as if its solidity could help [her]208-leila . At the last half - landing , where a curtain hung , dividing off back premises , [she]208-leila stopped and listened . There was n't a sound . ' If [I]0-i stand here behind this curtain , ' [she]208-leila thought , ' [I]0-i shall see [him]2685-his again . ' [She]208-leila slipped behind the curtain , close drawn but for a little chink . It was so dark there that [she]208-leila could not see [her]208-leila own hand . [She]208-leila heard the door open , and [his]2685-his slow footsteps coming down the stairs . [His]2685-his feet , knees , whole figure came into sight , [his]2685-his face just a dim blur . [He]2685-his passed , smoking a cigarette . [She]208-leila crammed [her]208-leila hand against [her]208-leila mouth to stop [herself]208-leila from speaking and the crushed gardenia filled [her]208-leila nostrils with its cold , fragrant velvet . [He]2685-his was gone , the door below was shut . A wild , half - stupid longing came on [her]208-leila to go up again , wait till [he]2685-his came in , throw [herself]208-leila upon [him]2685-his , tell [him]2685-his [she]208-leila was going , beg [him]2685-his to keep [her]208-leila with [him]2685-his . Ah ! and [he]2685-his would ! [He]2685-his would look at [her]208-leila with that haggard pity [she]208-leila could not bear , and say , " Of course , [Leila]208-leila , of course . "[2685-his] No ! By [God]143-god , no ! " [I]208-leila am going quietly [home]3048-home , "[208-leila] [she]208-leila muttered ; " just quietly [home]3048-home ! Come along , be brave ; do n't be [a fool]3982-a fool ! Come along ! "[208-leila] And [she]208-leila went down into [the street]3753-the street : At the entrance to [the Park]2691-the park [she]208-leila saw [him]2685-his , fifty yards in front , dawdling along . And , as if [she]208-leila had been [his]2685-his shadow lengthened out to that far distance , [she]208-leila moved behind [him]2685-his . Slowly , always at that distance , [she]208-leila followed [him]2685-his under the plane - trees , along the Park railings , past [[St. James]109-st. james 's Palace]2692-st. james 's palace , into [Pall Mall]110-pall mall . [He]2685-his went up some steps , and vanished into [[his]2685-his Club]833-his club . It was the end . [She]208-leila looked up at [the building]2594-the building ; [a monstrous granite tomb , all dark]2695-a monstrous granite tomb , all dark . [An emptied cab]2696-an emptied cab was just moving from the door . [She]208-leila got in . " [Camelot Mansions]38-camelot mansions , [St. John 's Wood]39-st. john 's wood . "[208-leila] And braced against the cushions , panting , and clenching [her]208-leila hands , [she]208-leila thought : ' Well , [I]0-i 've seen [him]2685-his again . Hard crust 's better than no bread . Oh , God ! All finished - not a crumb , not a crumb ! Vive - la , vive - la , vive - la ve . Vive - la compagnie ! '

[XIV

Fort]294-xiv fort had been lying there about an hour , sleeping and awake , before that visit : [He]294-xiv fort had dreamed a curious and wonderfully emotionalising dream . A long grey line , in a dim light , neither of night nor morning , the whole length of the battle - front in [France]13-france , charging in short drives , which carried the line a little forward , with just a tiny pause and suck - back ; then on again irresistibly , on and on ; and at each rush , every voice , [his]294-xiv fort own among [them]2697-them , shouted " Hooray ! the English ! Hooray ! [the English]220-the english ! "[294-xiv fort] The sensation of [that advancing tide of dim figures in grey light]2698-that advancing tide of dim figures in grey light , the throb and roar , the wonderful , rhythmic steady drive of it , no more to be stopped than the waves of an incoming tide , was gloriously fascinating ; life was nothing , death nothing . " Hooray , the English ! "[2699-he] In that dream , [he]2699-he was [[his]2699-he country]2700-his country , [he]2699-he was [every one of that long charging line , driving forward in . those great heaving pulsations]2701-every one of that long charging line , driving forward in . those great heaving pulsations , irresistible , on and on . Out of the very centre of this intoxicating dream [he]294-xiv fort had been dragged by some street noise , and had closed [his]294-xiv fort eyes again , in the vain hope that [he]294-xiv fort might dream it on to its end . But it came no more ; and lighting [his]294-xiv fort pipe , [he]294-xiv fort lay there wondering at its fervid , fantastic realism . Death was nothing , if [[his]294-xiv fort country]2700-his country lived and won . In waking hours [he]294-xiv fort never had quite that single - hearted knowledge of [himself]294-xiv fort . And what marvellously real touches got mixed into the fantastic stuff of dreams , as if something were at work to convince [the dreamer]2703-the dreamer in spite of [himself]294-xiv fort - " Hooray ! "[208-leila] not " Hurrah ! "[208-leila] Just common " Hooray ! "[208-leila] And " the English , "[208-leila] not the literary " British . "[208-leila] And then the soft flower had struck [his]294-xiv fort forehead , and [Leila]208-leila 's voice cried : " [Jimmy]293-poor jimmy ! "[208-leila]

When [she]208-leila left [him]294-xiv fort , [his]294-xiv fort thought was just a tired : ' Well , so it 's begun again ! ' What did it matter , since common loyalty and compassion cut [him]294-xiv fort off from what [his]294-xiv fort heart desired ; and that desire was absurd , as little likely of attainment as the moon . What did it matter ? If it gave [her]208-leila any pleasure to love [him]294-xiv fort , let it go on ! Yet , all the time that [he]294-xiv fort was walking across under the plane trees , [Noel]197-noel seemed to walk in front of [him]294-xiv fort , just out of reach , so that [he]294-xiv fort ached with the thought that [he]294-xiv fort would never catch [her]208-leila up , and walk beside [her]208-leila .

Two days later , on reaching [[his]294-xiv fort rooms]832-his rooms in the evening , [he]294-xiv fort found this letter on [ship]2705-ship 's note - paper , with the Plymouth postmark -

" Fare [thee]4409-thee well , and if for ever , Then for ever fare [thee]4409-thee well "[294-xiv fort] " [Leila]208-leila "[294-xiv fort]

[He]294-xiv fort read it with a really horrible feeling , for all [the world]606-the world as if [he]294-xiv fort had been accused of a crime and did not know whether [he]294-xiv fort had committed it or not . And , trying to collect [his]294-xiv fort thoughts , [he]294-xiv fort took [a cab]1238-a cab and drove to [[her]208-leila fiat]2708-her fiat . It was closed , but [her]208-leila address was given [him]294-xiv fort ; [a bank in [Cape Town]60-cape town]2709-a bank in cape town . [He]294-xiv fort had received [his]294-xiv fort release . In [his]294-xiv fort remorse and relief , so confusing and so poignant , [he]294-xiv fort heard the driver of [the cab]564-the cab asking where [he]294-xiv fort wanted to go now . " Oh , back again ! "[294-xiv fort] But before [they]2711-they had gone a mile [he]294-xiv fort corrected the address , in an impulse of which next moment [he]294-xiv fort felt thoroughly ashamed . What [he]294-xiv fort was doing indeed , was as indecent as if [he]294-xiv fort were driving from the funeral of [[his]294-xiv fort wife]618-his wife to [the boudoir of [another woman]2714-another woman]2713-the boudoir of another woman . When [he]294-xiv fort reached [the old Square]1537-the old square , and the words " To let "[2714-another woman] stared [him]294-xiv fort in the face , [he]294-xiv fort felt a curious relief , though it meant that [he]294-xiv fort would not see [her]2714-another woman whom to see for ten minutes [he]294-xiv fort felt [he]294-xiv fort would give a year of life . Dismissing [his]294-xiv fort cab , [he]294-xiv fort stood debating whether to ring the bell . The sight of [a maid]553-a maid 's face at the window decided [him]294-xiv fort . [Mr. Pierson]156-pierson was out , and [the young ladies]3406-the young ladies were away . [He]294-xiv fort asked for [Mrs. Laird]295-mrs. laird 's address , and turned away , almost into the arms of [Pierson]156-pierson [himself]294-xiv fort . The greeting was stiff and strange . ' Does [he]156-pierson know that [Leila]208-leila 's gone ? ' [he]294-xiv fort thought . ' If so , [he]156-pierson must think [me]0-i [the most awful skunk]2718-the most awful skunk . And am [I]0-i ? Am [I]0-i ? ' When [he]294-xiv fort reached [home]3048-home , [he]294-xiv fort sat down to write to [Leila]208-leila . But having stared at the paper for an hour and written these three lines -

" [[MY]294-xiv fort DEAR]3031-my dear [LEILA]208-leila ,[294-xiv fort]

" [I]294-xiv fort can not express to [you]208-leila the feelings with which [I]294-xiv fort received [your]208-leila letter - "[294-xiv fort]

[he]294-xiv fort tore it up . Nothing would be adequate , nothing would be decent . Let the dead past bury [its]2720-its dead - the dead past which in [his]294-xiv fort heart had never been alive ! Why pretend ? [He]294-xiv fort had done [his]294-xiv fort best to keep [his]294-xiv fort end up . Why pretend ?

PART IV

[I]0-i

In [the boarding - house]2721-the boarding - house , whence [the Lairds]2722-the lairds had not yet removed , [the old lady who knitted]2723-the old lady who knitted , sat by the fireplace , and light from the setting sun threw [her]2723-the old lady who knitted shadow on the wall , moving spidery and grey , over the yellowish distemper , in time to the tune of [her]2723-the old lady who knitted needles . [She]2723-the old lady who knitted was [a very old lady]2724-a very old lady - [the oldest lady in [the world]606-the world]2725-the oldest lady in the world , [Noel]197-noel thought - and [she]2723-the old lady who knitted knitted without stopping , without breathing , so that [the girl]525-the girl felt inclined to scream . In the evening when [George]140-george and [Gratian]127-gratian were not in , [Noel]197-noel would often sit watching the needles , brooding over [her]2723-the old lady who knitted as yet undecided future . And now and again [the old lady]2728-the old lady would look up above [her]2728-the old lady spectacles ; move the corners of [her]2728-the old lady lips ever so slightly , and drop [her]2728-the old lady gaze again . [She]2728-the old lady had pitted [herself]2728-the old lady against [Fate]167-fate ; so long as [she]2728-the old lady knitted , the war could not stop - such was the conclusion [Noel]197-noel had come to . [This old lady]2729-this old lady knitted the epic of acquiescence to the tune of [her]2729-this old lady needles ; it was [she]2729-this old lady who kept the war going such [a thin old lady]2730-a thin old lady ! ' If [I]0-i were to hold [her]2729-this old lady elbows from behind , ' [the girl]525-the girl used to think , ' [I]0-i believe [she]2729-this old lady 'd die . [I]0-i expect [I]0-i ought to ; then the war would stop . And if the war stopped , there 'd be love and life again . ' Then the little silvery tune would click itself once more into [her]525-the girl brain , and stop [her]525-the girl thinking . In [her]525-the girl lap this evening lay a letter from [[her]525-the girl father]384-her father .

" [[MY]384-her father DEAREST]3937-my dearest [NOLLIE]131-nollie ,[384-her father]

" [I]384-her father am glad to say [I]384-her father have [[my]384-her father chaplaincy]4412-my chaplaincy , and am to start for [Egypt]112-egypt very soon . [I]384-her father should have wished to go to [France]13-france , but must take what [I]384-her father can get , in view of [my]384-her father age , for [they]4413-they really do n't want [us]4414-us who are getting on , [I]384-her father fear . It is a great comfort to [me]384-her father to think that [Gratian]127-gratian is with [you]131-nollie , and no doubt [you]131-nollie will all soon be in [a house where [[my]384-her father little grandson]4416-my little grandson can join [you]131-nollie]4415-a house where my little grandson can join you . [I]384-her father have excellent accounts of [him]4416-my little grandson in a letter from [[your]131-nollie aunt]3089-your aunt , just received : [[My]384-her father child]3086-my child , [you]131-nollie must never again think that [my]384-her father resignation has been due to [you]131-nollie . It is not so . [You]131-nollie know , or perhaps [you]131-nollie do n't , that ever since the war broke out , [I]384-her father have chafed over staying at [home]3048-home , [my]384-her father heart has been with [[our]4420-our boys]3209-our boys out there , and sooner or later it must have come to this , apart from anything else . [Monsieur Lavendie]221-lavendie has been round in the evening , twice ; [he]221-lavendie is [a nice man]3454-a nice man , [I]384-her father like [him]221-lavendie very much , in spite of [our]4420-our differences of view . [He]221-lavendie wanted to give [me]384-her father the sketch [he]221-lavendie made of [you]131-nollie in [the Park]2691-the park , but what can [I]384-her father do with it now ? And to tell [you]131-nollie the truth , [I]384-her father like it no better than the oil painting . It is not a likeness , as [I]384-her father know [you]131-nollie . [I]384-her father hope [I]384-her father did n't hurt [his]221-lavendie feelings , the feelings of [an artist]1457-an artist are so very easily wounded . There is one thing [I]384-her father must tell [you]131-nollie . [Leila]208-leila has gone back to [South Africa]9-south africa ; [she]208-leila came round one evening about ten days ago , to say goodbye . [She]208-leila was very brave , for [I]384-her father fear it means a great wrench for [her]208-leila . [I]384-her father hope and pray [she]208-leila may find comfort and tranquillity out there . And now , [[my]384-her father dear]3031-my dear , [I]384-her father want [you]131-nollie to promise [me]384-her father not to see [Captain Fort]197-noel . [I]384-her father know that [he]197-noel admires [you]131-nollie . But , apart from the question of [his]197-noel conduct in regard to [Leila]208-leila , [he]197-noel made the saddest impression on [me]384-her father by coming to [[our]4426-our house]3050-our house the very day after [her]208-leila departure . There is something about that which makes [me]384-her father feel [he]197-noel can not be [the sort of man in whom [I]384-her father could feel any confidence]4428-the sort of man in whom i could feel any confidence . [I]384-her father do n't suppose for a moment that [he]197-noel is in [your]131-nollie thoughts , and yet before going so far from [you]131-nollie , [I]384-her father feel [I]384-her father must warn [you]131-nollie . [I]384-her father should rejoice to see [you]131-nollie married to [a good man]3731-a good man ; but , though [I]384-her father do n't wish to think hardly of [anyone]3200-anyone , [I]384-her father can not believe [Captain Fort]197-noel is that .[384-her father]

" [I]384-her father shall come down to [you]131-nollie before [I]384-her father start , which may be in quite a short time now . [[My]384-her father dear]3031-my dear love to [you]131-nollie and [Gracie]159-gracie , and best wishes to [George]140-george .[384-her father]

" [[Your]197-noel ever loving father]4432-your ever loving father ,[384-her father]

" [EDWARD PIERSON]122-pierson "[384-her father]

Across this letter lying on [her]2733-her knees , [Noel]197-noel gazed at the spidery movement on the wall . Was it acquiescence that [the old lady]2728-the old lady knitted , or was it resistance - a challenge to death itself , a challenge dancing to the tune of the needles like the grey ghost of human resistance to Fate ! [She]2728-the old lady would n't give in , [this oldest lady in [the world]606-the world]2735-this oldest lady in the world , [she]2728-the old lady meant to knit till [she]2728-the old lady fell into the grave . And so [Leila]208-leila had gone ! It hurt [her]2733-her to know that ; and yet it pleased [her]2733-her . Acquiescence - resistance ! Why did [Daddy]132-daddy always want to choose the way [she]208-leila should go ? So gentle [he]132-daddy was , yet [he]132-daddy always wanted to ! And why did [he]132-daddy always make [her]208-leila feel that [she]208-leila must go the other way ? The sunlight ceased to stream in , [the old lady]2728-the old lady 's shadow faded off the wall , but the needles still sang their little tune . And [the girl]525-the girl said :

" Do [you]2728-the old lady enjoy knitting , [Mrs. Adam]296-mrs. adam ? "[525-the girl]

[The old lady]2728-the old lady looked at [her]2733-her above the spectacles .

" Enjoy , [[my]2728-the old lady dear]3031-my dear ? It passes the time . "[2728-the old lady]

" But do [you]2728-the old lady want the time to pass ? "[2728-the old lady]

There was no answer for a moment , and [Noel]197-noel thought : ' How dreadful of [me]0-i to have said that ! '

" Eh ? "[2728-the old lady] said [the old lady]2728-the old lady .

" [I]2728-the old lady said : Is n't it very tiring ? "[2728-the old lady]

" Not when [I]2728-the old lady do n't think about it , [[my]2728-the old lady dear]3031-my dear . "[2728-the old lady]

" What do [you]2728-the old lady think about ? "[2728-the old lady]

[The old lady]2728-the old lady cackled gently .

" Oh - well ! "[2728-the old lady] [she]2728-the old lady said .

And [Noel]197-noel thought : ' It must be dreadful to grow old , and pass the time ! '

[She]525-the girl took up [[her]525-the girl father]384-her father 's letter , and bent it meditatively against [her]525-the girl chin . [He]197-noel wanted [her]525-the girl to pass the time - not to live , not to enjoy ! To pass the time . What else had [he]197-noel been doing [himself]197-noel , all these years , ever since [she]525-the girl could remember , ever since [[her]525-the girl mother]377-her mother died , but just passing the time ? Passing the time because [he]197-noel did not believe in this life ; not living at all , just preparing for the life [he]197-noel did believe in . Denying [himself]197-noel everything that was exciting and nice , so that when [he]197-noel died [he]197-noel might pass pure and saintly to [[his]197-noel other world]2744-his other world . [He]197-noel could not believe [Captain Fort]197-noel [a good man]3731-a good man , because [he]197-noel had not passed the time , and resisted [Leila]208-leila ; and [Leila]208-leila was gone ! And now it was a sin for [him]197-noel to love [someone else]3544-someone else ; [he]197-noel must pass the time again . ' [Daddy]132-daddy does n't believe in life , ' [she]525-the girl thought ; ' it 's [monsieur]1551-monsieur 's picture . [Daddy]132-daddy 's [a saint]3751-a saint ; but [I]0-i do n't want to be [a saint]3751-a saint , and pass the time . [He]132-daddy does n't mind making [people]3083-people unhappy , because the more [they]3083-people 're repressed , the saintlier [they]3083-people 'll be . But [I]0-i ca n't bear to be unhappy , or to see [others]395-others unhappy . [I]0-i wonder if [I]0-i could bear to be unhappy to save [someone else]3544-someone else - as [Leila]208-leila is ? [I]0-i admire [her]208-leila ! Oh ! [I]0-i admire [her]208-leila ! [She]208-leila 's not doing it because [she]208-leila thinks it good for [her]208-leila soul ; only because [she]208-leila ca n't bear making [him]132-daddy unhappy . [She]208-leila must love [him]132-daddy very much . [Poor Leila]208-leila ! And [she]208-leila 's done it all by [herself]208-leila , of [her]208-leila own accord . ' It was like what [George]140-george said of [the soldiers]3242-the soldiers ; [they]3242-the soldiers did n't know why [they]3242-the soldiers were [heroes]3513-heroes , it was not because [they]3242-the soldiers 'd been told to be , or because [they]3242-the soldiers believed in a future life . [They]3242-the soldiers just had to be , from inside somewhere , to save [others]395-others . ' And [they]3242-the soldiers love life as much as [I]0-i do , ' [she]0-i thought . ' What a beast it makes [one]424-one feel ! ' Those needles ! Resistance - acquiescence ? Both perhaps . [The oldest lady in [the world]606-the world]2725-the oldest lady in the world , with [her]2725-the oldest lady in the world lips moving at the corners , keeping things in , had lived [her]2725-the oldest lady in the world life , and knew it . How dreadful to live on when [you]2759-you were of no more interest to [anyone]3200-anyone , but must just " pass the time "[0-i] and die . But how much more dreadful to " pass the time "[0-i] when [you]2759-you were strong , and life and love were yours for the taking ! ' [I]0-i sha n't answer [Daddy]132-daddy , ' [she]0-i thought .

[II

[The maid]1694-the maid , who one Saturday in July opened the door to [Jimmy Fort]175-jimmy]2761-ii the maid , who one saturday in july opened the door to jimmy fort , had never heard the name of [Laird]140-george , for [she]1694-the maid was but a unit in the ceaseless procession which pass through [the boarding - houses of places subject to air - raids]2763-the boarding - houses of places subject to air - raids . Placing [him]132-daddy in [a sitting - room]2764-a sitting - room , [she]1694-the maid said [she]1694-the maid would find [Miss ' Allow]297-miss ' allow . There [he]132-daddy waited , turning the leaves of an illustrated Journal , wherein [Society beauties]2765-society beauties ; [starving Servians]2766-starving servians , actresses with pretty legs , prize dogs , [sinking ships]2767-sinking ships , [Royalties]2768-royalties , shells bursting , and [padres reading funeral services]2769-padres reading funeral services , testified to the catholicity of the public taste , but did not assuage [his]132-daddy nerves . What if [their]2770-their address were not known [here]3149-here ? Why , in [his]132-daddy fear of putting things to the test , had [he]132-daddy let this month go by ? [An old lady]2772-an old lady was sitting by the hearth , knitting , the click of whose needles blended with the buzzing of a large bee on the window - pane . ' [She]2772-an old lady may know , ' [he]132-daddy thought , ' [she]2772-an old lady looks as if [she]2772-an old lady 'd been here for ever . ' And approaching [her]2772-an old lady , [he]132-daddy said :

" [I]132-daddy can assure [you]2772-an old lady those socks are very much appreciated , [ma'am]3968-ma'am . "[132-daddy]

[The old lady]2728-the old lady bridled over [her]2728-the old lady spectacles .

" It passes the time , "[2728-the old lady] [she]2728-the old lady said .

" Oh , more than that ; it helps to win the war , [ma'am]3968-ma'am . "[132-daddy]

[The old lady]2728-the old lady 's lips moved at the corners ; [she]2728-the old lady did not answer . ' Deaf ! ' [he]132-daddy thought .

" May [I]132-daddy ask if [you]2772-an old lady knew [[my]132-daddy friends]4437-my friends , [Doctor]298-doctor and [Mrs. Laird]295-mrs. laird , and [Miss Pierson]198-pierson ? "[132-daddy]

[The old lady]2728-the old lady cackled gently .

" Oh , yes ! [A pretty young girl]4438-a pretty young girl ; as pretty as life . [She]4438-a pretty young girl used to sit with [me]2728-the old lady . Quite a pleasure to watch [her]4438-a pretty young girl ; such large eyes [she]4438-a pretty young girl had . "[2728-the old lady]

" Where have [they]4437-my friends gone ? Can [you]2772-an old lady tell [me]2728-the old lady ? "[2728-the old lady]

" Oh , [I]2728-the old lady do n't know at all . "[2728-the old lady]

It was a little cold douche on [his]132-daddy heart . [He]132-daddy longed to say : ' Stop knitting a minute , please . It 's [my]0-i life , to know . ' But the tune of the needles answered : ' It 's [my]0-i life to knit . ' And [he]132-daddy turned away to the window .

" [She]4438-a pretty young girl used to sit just there ; quite still ; quite still . "[132-daddy]

[Fort]197-noel looked down at the window - seat . So , [she]2728-the old lady used to sit just here , quite still .

" What a dreadful war this is ! "[2728-the old lady] said [the old lady]2728-the old lady . " Have [you]197-noel been at the front ? "[2728-the old lady]

" Yes . "[2728-the old lady]

" To think of [the poor young girls who 'll never have [husbands]2031-husbands]4439-the poor young girls who 'll never have husbands ! [I]2728-the old lady 'm sure [I]2728-the old lady think it 's dreadful . "[2728-the old lady]

" Yes , "[197-noel] said [Fort]197-noel ; " it 's dreadful - "[197-noel] And then a voice from the doorway said :

" Did [you]197-noel want [Doctor]298-doctor and [Mrs. Laird]295-mrs. laird , [sir]3028-sir ? [East Bungalow]113-east bungalow [their]113-east bungalow address is ; it 's a little way out on [the North Road]4442-the north road . [Anyone]3200-anyone will tell [you]197-noel . "[2728-the old lady]

" Good afternoon . "[2777-the old lady who had called noel as pretty as life] The needles clicked , and little movements occurred at the corners of [her]2777-the old lady who had called noel as pretty as life mouth . [Fort]197-noel went out . [He]197-noel could not find [a vehicle]1242-a vehicle , and was a long time walking . [The Bungalow]2779-the bungalow was ugly , of yellow brick pointed with red . [It]2779-the bungalow lay about two - thirds up between [the main road]2780-the main road and [cliffs]2781-cliffs , and had [a rock - garden]2782-a rock - garden and a glaring , brand - new look , in the afternoon sunlight . [He]197-noel opened the gate , uttering one of those prayers which come so glibly from unbelievers when [they]2783-they want anything . [A baby]4141-a baby 's crying answered it , and [he]197-noel thought with ecstasy : ' Heaven , [she]4141-a baby is here ! ' Passing [the rock - garden]2785-the rock - garden [he]197-noel could see a lawn at [the back of [the house]538-the house]2786-the back of the house and a perambulator out there under a holm - oak tree , and [Noel]197-noel - surely [Noel]197-noel [herself]197-noel ! Hardening [his]197-noel heart , [he]197-noel went forward . In a lilac sunbonnet [she]4141-a baby was bending over the perambulator . [He]197-noel trod softly on the grass , and was quite close before [she]4141-a baby heard [him]197-noel . [He]197-noel had prepared no words , but just held out [his]197-noel hand . [The baby]3827-the baby , interested in the shadow failing across [its]3827-the baby pram , ceased crying . [Noel]197-noel took [his]197-noel hand . Under the sunbonnet , which hid [her]4141-a baby hair , [she]4141-a baby seemed older and paler , as if [she]4141-a baby felt the heat . [He]197-noel had no feeling that [she]4141-a baby was glad to see [him]197-noel .

" How do [you]197-noel do ? Have [you]197-noel seen [Gratian]127-gratian ; [she]127-gratian ought to be in . "[4141-a baby]

" [I]197-noel did n't come to see [her]127-gratian ; [I]197-noel came to see [you]197-noel . "[197-noel]

" That 's a deep saying : but [his]3827-the baby eyes are awfully interested in [you]2792-its mother . "[197-noel]

[Noel]197-noel smiled ; and very slowly [the baby]3827-the baby 's curly mouth unclosed , and discovered [his]3827-the baby toothlessness .

" [He]3827-the baby 's [a darling]3041-a darling , "[2792-its mother] [she]2792-its mother said in a whisper .

" [Daddy]132-daddy is here , "[2792-its mother] [she]2792-its mother said suddenly , without looking up . " [He]132-daddy 's sailing for [Egypt]112-egypt the day after to - morrow . [He]132-daddy does n't like [you]197-noel . "[2792-its mother]

[Fort]197-noel 's heart gave a jump . Why did [she]2792-its mother tell [him]197-noel that , unless - unless [she]2792-its mother was just a little on [his]197-noel side ?

[Noel]197-noel looked up at [him]197-noel . " Sin ! "[2792-its mother] [she]2792-its mother said , and bent again over [[her]2792-its mother baby]1803-her baby . " [I]2792-its mother think so . "[2792-its mother]
