" [You]197-noel call it [a priest]1611-a priest 's view ; [I]198-pierson think it is only the view of [a man of honour]4471-a man of honour . "[198-pierson]

[Fort]197-noel reddened . " That 's for [my]197-noel conscience , "[197-noel] [he]197-noel said stubbornly . " [I]197-noel ca n't tell [you]197-noel , and [I]197-noel 'm not going to , how things began . [I]197-noel was [a fool]3982-a fool . But [I]197-noel did [my]197-noel best , and [I]197-noel know that [Leila]208-leila does n't think [I]197-noel 'm bound . If [she]208-leila had , [she]208-leila would never have gone . When there 's no feeling - there never was real feeling on [my]197-noel side - and when there 's this terribly real feeling for [Noel]197-noel , which [I]197-noel never sought , which [I]197-noel tried to keep down , which [I]197-noel ran away from - "[197-noel]

" Did [you]197-noel ? "[198-pierson]

" Yes . To go on with the other was foul . [I]197-noel should have thought [you]197-noel might have seen that , [sir]3028-sir ; but [I]197-noel did go on with it . It was [Leila]208-leila who made an end . "[197-noel]

" [Leila]208-leila behaved nobly , [I]198-pierson think . "[198-pierson]

" [She]208-leila was splendid ; but that does n't make [me]197-noel [a brute]2618-a brute . "[197-noel] .

[Pierson]198-pierson turned away to the window , whence [he]2801-i must see [Noel]197-noel .

" It is repugnant to [me]2801-i , "[2801-i] [he]2801-i said . " Is there never to be any purity in [her]208-leila life ? "[2801-i]

" Is there never to be any life for [her]208-leila ? At [your]197-noel rate , [sir]3028-sir , there will be none . [I]198-pierson 'm no worse than [other men]3063-other men , and [I]198-pierson love [her]208-leila more than [they]3063-other men could . "[198-pierson]

For fully a minute [Pierson]198-pierson stood silent , before [he]2801-i said : " Forgive [me]2801-i if [I]2801-i 've spoken harshly . [I]2801-i did n't mean to . [I]2801-i love [her]208-leila intensely ; [I]2801-i wish for nothing but [her]208-leila good . But all [my]2801-i life [I]2801-i have believed that for [a man]3326-a man there is only [one woman]4478-one woman - for [a woman]3280-a woman only [one man]4480-one man . "[2801-i]

" Then , [Sir]3028-sir , "[197-noel] [Fort]197-noel burst out , " [you]3028-sir wish [her]208-leila - "[197-noel]

[Pierson]198-pierson had put [his]2801-i hand up , as if to ward off a blow ; and , angry though [he]197-noel was , [Fort]197-noel stopped .

" [We]4482-we are all made of flesh and blood , "[197-noel] [he]197-noel continued coldly , " and it seems to [me]197-noel that [you]197-noel think [we]4482-we are n't . "[197-noel]

" [We]4482-we have spirits too , [Captain Fort]197-noel . "[2801-i] The voice was suddenly so gentle that [Fort]197-noel 's anger evaporated .

" [I]197-noel have a great respect for [you]3028-sir , [sir]3028-sir ; but a greater love for [Noel]197-noel , and nothing in [this world]3543-this world will prevent [me]197-noel trying to give [my]197-noel life to [her]4485-her . "[197-noel]

A smile quivered over [Pierson]198-pierson 's face . " If [you]197-noel try , then [I]198-pierson can but pray that [you]197-noel will fail . "[198-pierson]

[Fort]197-noel did not answer , and went out .

[He]197-noel walked slowly away from [the bungalow]2779-the bungalow , with [his]197-noel head down , sore , angry , and yet - relieved . [He]197-noel knew where [he]197-noel stood ; nor did [he]197-noel feel that [he]197-noel had been worsted - those strictures had not touched [him]197-noel . Convicted of immorality , [he]197-noel remained conscious of private justifications , in a way that [human beings]2803-human beings have . Only one little corner of memory , unseen and uncriticised by [[his]197-noel opponent]2804-his opponent , troubled [him]197-noel . [He]197-noel pardoned [himself]197-noel the rest ; the one thing [he]197-noel did not pardon was the fact that [he]197-noel had known [Noel]197-noel before [his]197-noel liaison with [Leila]208-leila commenced ; had even let [Leila]208-leila sweep [him]197-noel away on , an evening when [he]197-noel had been in [Noel]197-noel 's company . For that [he]197-noel felt a real disgust with [himself]197-noel . And all the way back to [the station]474-the station [he]197-noel kept thinking : ' How could [I]0-i ? [I]0-i deserve to lose [her]208-leila ! Still , [I]0-i shall try ; but not now - not yet ! ' And , wearily enough , [he]197-noel took [the train]580-the train back to [town]1727-town .

[III]150-pierson

[Both girls]2808-both girls rose early that last day , and went with [[their]2808-both girls father]1368-their father to [Communion]114-communion . As [Gratian]127-gratian had said to [George]140-george : " It 's nothing to [me]197-noel now , but it will mean a lot to [him]197-noel out there , as a memory of [us]2808-both girls . So [I]197-noel must go . "[197-noel] And [he]197-noel had answered : " Quite right , [[my]197-noel dear]3031-my dear . Let [him]197-noel have all [he]197-noel can get of [you]3031-my dear both to - day . [I]197-noel 'll keep out of the way , and be back the last thing at night . "[197-noel] [[Their]2808-both girls father]1368-their father 's smile when [he]197-noel saw [them]2808-both girls waiting for [him]197-noel went straight to both [their]2808-both girls hearts . It was a delicious day , and the early freshness had not yet dried out of the air , when [they]2808-both girls were walking [home]3048-home to breakfast . [Each girl]2812-each girl had slipped a hand under [his]197-noel arm . ' It 's like [Moses]300-moses or was it [Aaron]179-young fane ? ' [Noel]197-noel thought absurdly Memory had complete hold of [her]2812-each girl . All the old days ! Nursery hours on Sundays after tea , stories out of the huge Bible bound in mother - o'pearl , with photogravures of [the Holy Land]115-the holy land - palms , and hills , and goats , and [little Eastern figures]2813-little eastern figures , and funny boats on [the Sea of Galilee]116-the sea of galilee , and camels - always camels . The book would be on [his]197-noel knee , and [they]2808-both girls one on each arm of [his]197-noel chair , waiting eagerly for the pages to be turned so that a new picture came . And there would be the feel of [his]197-noel cheek , prickly against [theirs]2808-both girls ; and the old names with the old glamour - to [Gratian]127-gratian , [Joshua]301-joshua , [Daniel]302-daniel , [Mordecai]303-mordecai , [Peter]304-peter ; to [Noel Absalom]305-noel because of [his]197-noel hair , and [Haman]306-haman because [she]2812-each girl liked the sound , and [Ruth]307-ruth because [she]307-ruth was pretty and [John]121-john galsworthy because [he]121-john galsworthy leaned on [Jesus]308-jesus ' breast . [Neither of [them]2808-both girls]2814-neither of them cared for [Job]309-job or [David]310-david , and [Elijah]311-elijah and [Elisha]312-elisha [they]2808-both girls detested because [they]2808-both girls hated the name [Eliza]313-eliza . And later days by firelight in [the drawing - room]1382-the drawing - room , roasting chestnuts just before evening church , and telling ghost stories , and trying to make [Daddy]132-daddy eat [his]132-daddy share . And hours beside [him]132-daddy at the piano , each eager for [her]2812-each girl special hymns - for [Gratian]127-gratian , " Onward , [Christian Soldiers]4487-christian soldiers , "[127-gratian] " Lead , Kindly Light , "[2812-each girl] and " O God [Our]4488-our Help "[2812-each girl] ; for [Noel]305-noel , " Nearer , [[My]305-noel God]499-my god , to [Thee]4490-thee , "[4491-the one with " the hosts of midian " in it , and " for those in peril on the sea] [the one with " [The Hosts of [Midian]117-midian]4492-the hosts of midian "[4491-the one with " the hosts of midian " in it , and " for those in peril on the sea] in it , and " For Those in Peril on [the Sea]98-sea]4491-the one with " the hosts of midian " in it , and " for those in peril on the sea . "[4491-the one with " the hosts of midian " in it , and " for those in peril on the sea] And carols ! Ah ! And Choristers ! [Noel]305-noel had loved [one]424-one deeply - the word " chorister "[305-noel] was so enchanting ; and because of [his]132-daddy whiteness , and hair which had no grease on it , but stood up all bright ; [she]2812-each girl had never spoken to [him]132-daddy - [a far worship , like that for a star]2817-a far worship , like that for a star . And always , always [Daddy]132-daddy had been gentle ; sometimes angry , but always gentle ; and [they]2818-they sometimes not at all ! And mixed up with it all , the dogs [they]2818-they had had , and the cats [they]2818-they had had , and the cockatoo , and [the governesses]2819-the governesses , and [their]2819-the governesses red cloaks , and [the curates]2820-the curates , and the pantomimes , and " [Peter Pan]304-peter , "[132-daddy] and " [Alice]314-alice in Wonderland "[132-daddy] - [Daddy]132-daddy sitting between [them]2818-they , so that [one]424-one could snuggle up . And later , the school - days , the hockey , the prizes , the holidays , the rush into [his]132-daddy arms ; and the great and wonderful yearly exodus to [far places]2822-far places , fishing and bathing ; walks and drives ; rides and climbs , always with [him]132-daddy . And concerts and Shakespeare plays in the Christmas and Easter holidays ; and the walk [home]3048-home through [the streets]3240-the streets - all lighted in those days - one on each side of [him]132-daddy . And this was the end ! [They]2818-they waited on [him]132-daddy at breakfast : [they]2818-they kept stealing glances at [him]132-daddy , photographing [him]132-daddy in [their]2818-they minds . [Gratian]127-gratian got [her]127-gratian camera and did actually photograph [him]132-daddy in the morning sunlight with [Noel]305-noel , without [Noel]305-noel , with [the baby]3827-the baby ; against all regulations for the defence of [the realm]2826-the realm . It was [Noel]305-noel who suggested : " [Daddy]132-daddy , let 's take lunch out and go for all day on [the cliffs]4493-the cliffs , [[us]2818-they three]4494-us three , and forget there 's a war . "[305-noel]

So easy to say , so difficult to do , with the boom of the guns travelling to [their]2818-they ears along the grass , mingled with the buzz of insects . Yet that hum of summer , the innumerable voices of tiny lives , gossamer things all as alive as [they]2818-they , and as important to [[their]2818-they frail selves]2827-their frail selves ; and the white clouds , few and so slow - moving , and the remote strange purity which clings to [the chalky downs]2828-the chalky downs , all this white and green and blue of [land and sea]2829-land and sea had its peace , which crept into the spirits of [those three]2830-those three alone with Nature , this once more , the last time for - who could say how long ? [They]2818-they talked , by tacit agreement , of nothing but what had happened before the war began , while [the flock of the blown dandelions]2831-the flock of the blown dandelions drifted past . [Pierson]150-pierson sat cross - legged on the grass , without [his]150-pierson cap , suffering a little still from the stiffness of [his]150-pierson unwonted garments . And [the girls]3241-the girls lay one on each side of [him]150-pierson , half critical , and half admiring . [Noel]305-noel could not bear [his]305-noel collar .

" If [you]132-daddy had a soft collar [you]132-daddy 'd be lovely , [Daddy]132-daddy . Perhaps out there [they]3241-the girls 'll let [you]132-daddy take it off . It must be fearfully hot in [Egypt]112-egypt . Oh ! [I]305-noel wish [I]305-noel were going . [I]305-noel wish [I]305-noel were going everywhere in [the world]606-the world . Some day ! "[305-noel] Presently [he]305-noel read to [them]3241-the girls , [Murray]315-murray 's " Hippolytus "[305-noel] of [Euripides]316-euripides . And now and then [Gratian]127-gratian and [he]305-noel discussed a passage . But [Noel]305-noel lay silent , looking at the sky . Whenever [his]305-noel voice ceased , there was the song of the larks , and very faint , the distant mutter of the guns .

[They]3241-the girls stayed up there till past six , and it was time to go and have tea before Evening Service . Those hours in the baking sun had drawn virtue out of [them]3241-the girls ; [they]3241-the girls were silent and melancholy all the evening . [Noel]305-noel was the first to go up to [[her]2833-her bedroom]1291-her bedroom . [She]2833-her went without saying good night - [she]2833-her knew [[her]2833-her father]384-her father would come to [[her]2833-her room]694-her room that last evening . [George]140-george had not yet come in ; and [Gratian]127-gratian was left alone with [Pierson]150-pierson in [the drawing - room]1382-the drawing - room , round whose single lamp , in spite of close - drawn curtains , moths were circling : [She]127-gratian moved over to [him]384-her father on the sofa .

" [Dad]158-dad , promise [me]127-gratian not to worry about [Nollie]131-nollie ; [we]4496-we 'll take care of [her]131-nollie . "[127-gratian]

" [She]131-nollie can only take care of [herself]131-nollie , [Gracie]159-gracie , and will [she]131-nollie ? Did [you]150-pierson know that [Captain Fort]197-noel was [here]3149-here yesterday ? "[127-gratian]

" [She]131-nollie told [me]127-gratian . "[127-gratian]

" What is [her]131-nollie feeling about [him]197-noel ? "[127-gratian]

" [I]127-gratian do n't think [she]131-nollie knows . [Nollie]131-nollie dreams along , and then suddenly rushes . "[127-gratian]

" [I]127-gratian wish [she]131-nollie were safe from [that man]975-that man . "[127-gratian]

" But , [Dad]158-dad , why ? [George]140-george likes [him]197-noel and so do [I.]127-gratian "[127-gratian]

A big grey moth was fluttering against the lamp . [Pierson]150-pierson got up and caught it in the curve of [his]150-pierson palm . " Poor thing ! [You]150-pierson 're like [[my]150-pierson Nollie]1019-my nollie ; so soft , and dreamy , so feckless , so reckless . "[150-pierson] And going to the curtains , [he]150-pierson thrust [his]150-pierson hand through , and released the moth .

" [Dad]158-dad ! "[127-gratian] said [Gratian]127-gratian suddenly , " [we]4500-we can only find out for [ourselves]4500-we , even if [we]4500-we do singe [our]4500-we wings in doing it . [We]4500-we 've been reading [James]293-poor jimmy 's ' Pragmatism . ' [George]140-george says the only chapter that 's important is missing - the one on ethics , to show that what [we]4500-we do is not wrong till it 's proved wrong by the result . [I]127-gratian suppose [he]140-george was afraid to deliver that lecture . "[127-gratian]

[Pierson]150-pierson 's face wore the smile which always came on it when [he]150-pierson had to deal with [George]140-george , the smile which said : " Ah , [George]140-george , that 's very clever ; but [I]140-george know . "[140-george]

" [[My]150-pierson dear]3031-my dear , "[150-pierson] [he]150-pierson said , " that doctrine is the most dangerous in [the world]606-the world . [I]150-pierson am surprised at [George]140-george . "[150-pierson]

" [I]140-george do n't think [George]140-george is in danger , [Dad]158-dad . "[140-george]

" [George]140-george is [a man of wide experience and strong judgment and character]4503-a man of wide experience and strong judgment and character ; but think how fatal it would be for [Nollie]131-nollie , [[my]150-pierson poor Nollie , whom a little gust can blow into the candle]131-nollie . "[150-pierson]

" All the same , "[127-gratian] said [Gratian]127-gratian stubbornly , " [I]127-gratian do n't think [anyone]3200-anyone can be good or worth anything unless [they]3200-anyone judge for [themselves]3200-anyone and take risks . "[127-gratian]

[Pierson]150-pierson went close to [her]127-gratian ; [his]150-pierson face was quivering .

" Do n't let [us]4505-us differ on this last night ; [I]150-pierson must go up to [Nollie]131-nollie for a minute , and then to bed . [I]150-pierson sha n't see [you]127-gratian to - morrow ; [you]127-gratian must n't get up ; [I]150-pierson can bear parting better like this . And [my]150-pierson train goes at eight . God bless [you]127-gratian , [Gracie]159-gracie ; give [George]140-george [my]150-pierson love . [I]150-pierson know , [I]150-pierson have always known that [he]140-george 's [a good man]3731-a good man , though [we]4507-we do fight so . Good - bye , [[my]150-pierson darling]3170-my darling . "[150-pierson]

[He]150-pierson went out with [his]150-pierson cheeks wet from [Gratian]127-gratian 's tears , and stood in [the porch]693-the porch a minute to recover [his]150-pierson composure . The shadow of [the house]538-the house stretched velvet and blunt over the rock - garden . A night - jar was spinning ; the churring sound affected [him]150-pierson oddly . The last English night - bird [he]150-pierson would hear . [England]29-england ! What a night - to say good - bye ! ' [[My]0-i country]3630-my country ! ' [he]150-pierson thought ; ' [[my]0-i beautiful country]2841-my beautiful country ! ' The dew was lying thick and silvery already on [the little patch of grass]2842-the little patch of grass - the last dew , the last scent of an English night . The call of a bugle floated out . " [England]29-england ! "[150-pierson] [he]150-pierson prayed ; " [God]143-god be about [you]29-england ! "[150-pierson] A little sound answered from across the grass , like [an old man]2843-an old man 's cough , and the scrape and rattle of a chain . A face emerged at the edge of [the house]538-the house 's shadow ; bearded and horned like that of [Pan]304-peter , it seemed to stare at [him]150-pierson . And [he]150-pierson saw the dim grey form of the garden goat , heard it scuttle round the stake to which it was tethered , as though alarmed at [this visitor]2845-this visitor to [its]2845-this visitor ' domain .

[He]150-pierson went up [the half - flight of stairs]2846-the half - flight of stairs to [[Noel]197-noel 's narrow little room]2847-noel 's narrow little room , next [the nursery]1839-the nursery . No voice answered [his]150-pierson tap . It was dark , but [he]150-pierson could see [her]2849-her at the window , leaning far out , with [her]2849-her chin on [her]2849-her hands .

" [Nollie]131-nollie ! "[2849-her]

[She]2849-her answered without turning : " Such a lovely night , [Daddy]132-daddy . Come and look ! [I]2849-her 'd like to set the goat free , only [he]2845-this visitor 'd eat the rock plants . But it is [his]2845-this visitor night , is n't it ? [He]2845-this visitor ought to be running and skipping in it : it 's such a shame to tie things up . Did [you]132-daddy never , feel wild in [your]132-daddy heart , [Daddy]132-daddy ? "[2849-her]

" Always , [I]2849-her think , [Nollie]131-nollie ; too wild . It 's been hard to tame [oneself]4509-oneself . "[2849-her]

[Noel]197-noel slipped [her]2849-her hand through [his]150-pierson arm . " Let 's go and take the goat and skip together on [the hills]4510-the hills . If only [we]4511-we had a penny whistle ! Did [you]2849-her hear the bugle ? The bugle and the goat ! "[197-noel]

[Pierson]150-pierson pressed the hand against [him]150-pierson .

" [Nollie]131-nollie , be good while [I]150-pierson 'm away . [You]131-nollie know what [I]150-pierson do n't want . [I]150-pierson told [you]131-nollie in [my]150-pierson letter . "[150-pierson] [He]150-pierson looked at [her]2849-her cheek , and dared say no more . [Her]2849-her face had its " fey "[2849-her] look again .

" Do n't [you]150-pierson feel , "[2849-her] [she]2849-her said suddenly , " on a night like this , all the things , all the things - the stars have lives , [Daddy]132-daddy , and the moon has a big life , and the shadows have , and the moths and the birds and the goats and the trees , and the flowers , and all of [us]4511-we - escaped ? Oh ! [Daddy]132-daddy , why is there a war ? And why are [people so bound and so unhappy]4512-people so bound and so unhappy ? Do n't tell [me]2849-her it 's [God]143-god - do n't ! "[2849-her]

[Pierson]150-pierson could not answer , for there came into [his]150-pierson mind the Greek song [he]150-pierson had been reading aloud that afternoon -

" O for a deep and dewy Spring , With runlets cold to draw and drink , And a great meadow blossoming , Long - grassed , and poplars in a ring , To rest [me]150-pierson by the brink . O take [me]150-pierson to [the mountain]4513-the mountain , O , Past the great pines and through the wood , Up where the lean hounds softly go , A - whine for wild things ' blood , And madly flies the dappled roe , O God , to shout and speed [them]4512-people so bound and so unhappy there ; An arrow by [my]150-pierson chestnut hair Drawn tight and one keen glimmering spear Ah ! if [I]150-pierson could ! "[150-pierson]

All that in life had been to [him]150-pierson unknown , of venture and wild savour ; all the emotion [he]150-pierson had stifled ; the swift Pan [he]150-pierson had denied ; the sharp fruits , the burning suns , the dark pools , the unearthly moonlight , which were not of [God]143-god - all came with the breath of that old song , and the look on [the girl]525-the girl 's face . And [he]150-pierson covered [his]150-pierson eyes .

[Noel]197-noel 's hand tugged at [his]197-noel arm . " Is n't beauty terribly alive , "[525-the girl] [she]525-the girl murmured , " like [a lovely person]4514-a lovely person ? it makes [you]197-noel ache to kiss it . "[525-the girl]

[His]197-noel lips felt parched . " There is a beauty beyond all that , "[197-noel] [he]197-noel said stubbornly .

" Where ? "[197-noel]

" Holiness , duty , faith . O Nollie , [[my]197-noel love]3147-my love ! "[197-noel] But [Noel]197-noel 's hand tightened on [his]197-noel arm .

" Shall [I]525-the girl tell [you]197-noel what [I]525-the girl should like ? "[525-the girl] [she]525-the girl whispered . " To take [God]143-god 's hand and show [Him]143-god things . [I]525-the girl 'm certain [He]143-god 's not seen everything . "[525-the girl]

A shudder went through [Pierson]150-pierson , one of those queer sudden shivers , which come from a strange note in a voice , or a new sharp scent or sight .

" [[My]197-noel dear]3031-my dear , what things [you]197-noel say ! "[197-noel]

" But [He]143-god has n't , and it 's time [He]143-god did . [We]4517-we 'd creep , and peep , and see it all for once , as [He]143-god ca n't in [[His]143-god churches]423-his churches . [Daddy]132-daddy , oh ! [Daddy]132-daddy ! [I]525-the girl ca n't bear it any more ; to think of [them]4519-they being killed on a night like this ; killed and killed so that [they]4519-they never see it all again - never see it - never see it ! "[525-the girl] [She]525-the girl sank down , and covered [her]525-the girl face with [her]525-the girl arms .

" [I]525-the girl ca n't , [I]525-the girl ca n't ! Oh ! take it all away , the cruelty ! Why does it come - why the stars and the flowers , if [God]143-god does n't care any more than that ? "[525-the girl]

[Horribly]317-horribly affected [he]2851-his stood bending over [her]525-the girl , stroking [her]525-the girl head . Then the habit of a hundred death - beds helped [him]2851-his . " Come , [Nollie]131-nollie ! This life is but a minute . [We]4520-we must all die . "[2851-his]

" But not [they]4519-they - not so young ! "[525-the girl] [She]525-the girl clung to [his]2851-his knees , and looked up . " [Daddy]132-daddy , [I]525-the girl do n't want [you]2851-his to go ; promise [me]525-the girl to come back ! "[525-the girl]

The childishness of those words brought back [his]2851-his balance .

" [[My]525-the girl dear sweetheart]4521-my dear sweetheart , of course ! Come , [Nollie]131-nollie , get up . The sun 's been too much for [you]131-nollie . "[525-the girl]

[Noel]197-noel got up , and put [her]525-the girl hands on [[her]525-the girl father]384-her father 's shoulders . " Forgive [me]525-the girl for all [my]525-the girl badness , and all [my]525-the girl badness to come , especially all [my]525-the girl badness to come ! "[525-the girl]

[Pierson]150-pierson smiled . " [I]150-pierson shall always forgive [you]131-nollie , [Nollie]131-nollie ; but there wo n't be - there must n't be any badness to come . [I]150-pierson pray [God]143-god to keep [you]131-nollie , and make [you]131-nollie like [[your]131-nollie mother]3087-your mother . "[150-pierson]

" [Mother]149-mother never had a devil , like [you]131-nollie and [me]1090-this child . "[1090-this child]

[He]384-her father was silent from surprise . How did [this child]1090-this child know the devil of wild feeling [he]384-her father had fought against year after year ; until with the many years [he]384-her father had felt it weakening within [him]384-her father ! [She]1090-this child whispered on : " [I]1090-this child do n't hate [my]1090-this child devil .[1090-this child]

" Why should [I]1090-this child ? - it 's part of [me]1090-this child . Every day when the sun sets , [I]1090-this child 'll think of [you]384-her father , [Daddy]132-daddy ; and [you]384-her father might do the same - that 'll keep [me]1090-this child good . [I]1090-this child sha n't come to [the station]474-the station tomorrow , [I]1090-this child should only cry . And [I]1090-this child sha n't say good - bye now . It 's unlucky . "[1090-this child]

[She]1090-this child flung [her]1090-this child arms round [him]384-her father ; and half smothered by that fervent embrace , [he]384-her father kissed [her]1090-this child cheeks and hair . Freed of [each other]493-each other at last , [he]384-her father stood for a moment looking at [her]1090-this child by the moonlight .

" There never was anyone more loving than [you]1090-this child ; [Nollie]131-nollie ! "[384-her father] [he]384-her father said quietly . " Remember [my]384-her father letter . And good night , [[my]384-her father love]3147-my love ! "[384-her father] Then , afraid to stay another second , [he]384-her father went quickly out of [the dark little room]2855-the dark little room ....

[George Laird]140-george , returning half an hour later , heard a voice saying softly : " [George]140-george , [George]140-george ! "[1090-this child]

Looking up , [he]140-george saw a little white blur at the window , and [Noel]197-noel 's face just visible .

" [George]140-george , let the goat loose , just for to - night , to please [me]197-noel . "[197-noel]

Something in that voice , and in the gesture of [her]1090-this child stretched - out arm moved [George]140-george in a queer way , although , as [Pierson]150-pierson had once said , [he]384-her father had no music in [his]384-her father soul . [He]384-her father loosed the goat .

IV

1

In the weeks which succeeded [Pierson]150-pierson 's departure , [Gratian]127-gratian and [George]140-george often discussed [Noel]197-noel 's conduct and position by the light of the Pragmatic theory . [George]140-george held a suitably scientific view . Just as [he]140-george would point out to [[his]140-george wife]618-his wife - in the physical world , creatures who diverged from [the normal]2857-the normal had to justify [their]2858-their divergence in competition with [their]2858-their environments , or else go under , so in [the ethical world]2859-the ethical world it was all a question of whether [Nollie]131-nollie could make good [her]131-nollie vagary . If [she]131-nollie could , and grew in strength of character thereby , it was ipso facto all right , [her]131-nollie vagary would be proved an advantage , and [the world]606-the world enriched . If not , [the world]606-the world by [her]131-nollie failure to make good would be impoverished , and [her]131-nollie vagary proved wrong . [The orthodox and academies]2862-the orthodox and academies - [he]140-george insisted - were always forgetting the adaptability of living organisms ; how every action which was out of the ordinary , unconsciously modified all the other actions together with the outlook , and philosophy of [the doer]2863-the doer . " Of course [Nollie]131-nollie was crazy , "[140-george] [he]140-george said , " but when [she]131-nollie did what [she]131-nollie did , [she]131-nollie at once began to think differently about life and morals . The deepest instinct [we]4525-we all have is the instinct that [we]4525-we must do what [we]4525-we must , and think that what [we]4525-we 've done is really all right ; in fact the - instinct of self - preservation . [We]4525-we 're all fighting animals ; and [we]4525-we feel in [our]4525-we bones that if [we]4525-we admit [we]4525-we 're beaten - [we]4525-we are beaten ; but that every fight [we]4525-we win , especially against odds , hardens those bones . But personally [I]140-george do n't think [she]131-nollie can make good on [her]131-nollie own . "[140-george]

[Gratian]127-gratian , whose Pragmatism was not yet fully baked , responded doubtfully :

" No , [I]127-gratian do n't think [she]131-nollie can . And if [she]131-nollie could [I]127-gratian 'm not sure . But is n't Pragmatism a perfectly beastly word , [George]140-george ? It has no sense of humour in it at all . "[127-gratian]

" It is a bit thick , and in the hands of [the young]1499-the young , deuced likely to become Prigmatism ; but not with [Nollie]131-nollie . "[127-gratian]

[They]2864-them watched the victim of [their]2864-them discussions with real anxiety . The knowledge that [she]127-gratian would never be more sheltered than [she]127-gratian was with [them]2864-them , at all events until [she]127-gratian married , gravely impeded the formation of any judgment as to whether or no [she]127-gratian could make good . Now and again there would come to [Gratian]127-gratian who after all knew [[her]127-gratian sister]1362-her sister better than [George]140-george - the disquieting thought that whatever conclusion [Noel]197-noel led [them]2864-them to form , [she]127-gratian would almost certainly force [them]2864-them to abandon sooner or later .

Three days after [[her]127-gratian father]384-her father 's departure [Noel]197-noel had declared that [she]127-gratian wanted to work on [the land]2867-the land . This [George]140-george had promptly vetoed .

" [You]127-gratian are n't strong enough yet , [[my]140-george dear]3031-my dear : Wait till the harvest begins . Then [you]127-gratian can go and help on [the farm]4528-the farm here . If [you]127-gratian can stand that without damage , [we]4529-we 'll think about it . "[140-george]

But the weather was wet and harvest late , and [Noel]197-noel had nothing much to do but attend to [[her]127-gratian baby]1803-her baby , already well attended to by [Nurse]440-nurse , and dream and brood , and now and then cook an omelette or do some housework for the sake of a gnawing conscience . Since [Gratian]127-gratian and [George]140-george were away in [hospital]912-hospital all day , [she]127-gratian was very much alone . Several times in the evenings [Gratian]127-gratian tried to come at the core of [her]127-gratian thoughts , Twice [she]127-gratian flew the kite of [Leila]208-leila . The first time [Noel]197-noel only answered : " Yes , [she]1803-her baby 's [a brick]4530-a brick . "[127-gratian] The second time , [she]127-gratian said : " [I]127-gratian do n't want to think about [her]1803-her baby . "[127-gratian]

But , hardening [her]127-gratian heart , [Gratian]127-gratian went on : " Do n't [you]197-noel think it 's queer [we]4531-we 've never heard from [Captain Fort]197-noel since [he]197-noel came down ? "[127-gratian]

In [her]127-gratian calmest voice [Noel]197-noel answered : " Why should [we]4531-we , after being told that [he]197-noel was n't liked ? "[197-noel]

" Who told [him]197-noel that ? "[127-gratian]

" [I]127-gratian told [him]197-noel , that [Daddy]132-daddy did n't ; but [I]127-gratian expect [Daddy]132-daddy said much worse things . "[127-gratian] [She]127-gratian gave a little laugh , then softly added : " [Daddy]132-daddy 's wonderful , is n't [he]132-daddy ? "[127-gratian]

" How ? "[127-gratian]

" The way [he]132-daddy drives [one]424-one to do the other thing . If [he]132-daddy had n't opposed [my]127-gratian marriage to [Cyril]133-cyril , [you]4533-you know , that would n't have happened , it just made all the difference . It stirred [me]127-gratian up so fearfully . "[127-gratian] [Gratian]127-gratian stared at [her]127-gratian , astonished that [she]127-gratian could see [herself]127-gratian so clearly . Towards the end of August [she]127-gratian had a letter from [Fort]197-noel .

" [DEAR]3030-dear [MRS . LAIRD]295-mrs. laird ,[127-gratian]

" [You]295-mrs. laird know all about things , of course , except the one thing which to [me]127-gratian is all important . [I]127-gratian ca n't go on without knowing whether [I]127-gratian have a chance with [[your]295-mrs. laird sister]3132-your sister . It is against [[your]295-mrs. laird father]3044-your father 's expressed wish that [she]3132-your sister should have anything to do with [me]127-gratian , but [I]127-gratian told [him]3044-your father that [I]127-gratian could not and would not promise not to ask [her]3132-your sister . [I]127-gratian get [my]127-gratian holiday at the end of this month , and am coming down to put it to the touch . It means more to [me]127-gratian than [you]295-mrs. laird can possibly imagine .[127-gratian]

" [I]127-gratian am , dear [Mrs. Laird]295-mrs. laird ,[127-gratian]

" [[Your]295-mrs. laird very faithful servant]3385-your very faithful servant ,[127-gratian]

" [JAMES FORT]175-jimmy . "[127-gratian]

[She]2871-she discussed the letter with [George]140-george , whose advice was : " Answer it politely , but say nothing ; and nothing to [Nollie]131-nollie . [I]140-george think it would be a very good thing . Of course it 's a bit of a make - shift - twice [her]131-nollie age ; but [he]3385-your very faithful servant 's [a genuine man]4538-a genuine man , if not exactly brilliant . "[140-george]

[Gratian]127-gratian answered almost sullenly : " [I]127-gratian 've always wanted the very best for [Nollie]131-nollie . "[127-gratian]

[George]140-george screwed up [his]140-george steel - coloured eyes , as [he]140-george might have looked at one on whom [he]140-george had to operate . " Quite so , "[140-george] [he]140-george said . " But [you]127-gratian must remember , [Gracie]159-gracie , that out of the swan [she]131-nollie was , [Nollie]131-nollie has made [herself]131-nollie into a lame duck . Fifty per cent at least is off [her]131-nollie value , socially . [We]4539-we must look at things as they are . "[140-george]

" [Father]3187-father is dead against it . "[140-george]

[George]140-george smiled , on the point of saying : ' That makes [me]0-i feel it must be a good thing ! ' But [he]140-george subdued the impulse .

" [I]140-george agree that [we]4539-we 're bound by [his]140-george absence not to further it actively . Still [Nollie]131-nollie knows [his]140-george wishes , and it 's up to [her]131-nollie and [no one else]4541-no one else . After all , [she]131-nollie 's no longer [a child]415-a child . "[140-george]

[His]140-george advice was followed . But to write that polite letter , which said nothing , cost [Gratian]127-gratian a sleepless night , and two or three hours ' penmanship . [She]127-gratian was very conscientious . Knowledge of this impending visit increased the anxiety with which [she]127-gratian watched [[her]127-gratian sister]1362-her sister , but the only inkling [she]127-gratian obtained of [Noel]197-noel 's state of mind was when [the girl]525-the girl showed [her]127-gratian a letter [she]127-gratian had received from [Thirza]137-thirza , asking [her]127-gratian to come back to [Kestrel]199-kestrel . A postscript , in [Uncle Bob]141-uncle bob 's handwriting , added these words :

" [We]4543-we 're getting quite fossilised down here ; [Eve]130-eve 's gone and left [us]4543-we again . [We]4543-we miss [you]197-noel and [the youngster]4544-the youngster awfully . Come along down , Nollie there 's [a dear]4545-a dear ! "[141-uncle bob]

" [They]4546-they 're [darlings]4547-darlings , "[197-noel] [Noel]197-noel said , " but [I]197-noel sha n't go . [I]197-noel 'm too restless , ever since [Daddy]132-daddy went ; [you]197-noel do n't know how restless . This rain simply makes [me]197-noel want to die . "[197-noel]

2

The weather improved next day , and at the end of that week harvest began . By what seemed to [Noel]197-noel a stroke of luck [the farmer]2874-the farmer 's binder was broken ; [he]197-noel could not get it repaired , and wanted all the human binders [he]197-noel could get . That first day in [the fields]2875-the fields blistered [her]2876-she hands , burnt [her]2876-she face and neck , made every nerve and bone in [her]2876-she body ache ; but was the happiest day [she]2876-she had spent for weeks , the happiest perhaps since [Cyril Morland]133-cyril left [her]2876-she , over a year ago . [She]2876-she had a bath and went to bed the moment [she]2876-she got in .

Lying there nibbling chocolate and smoking a cigarette , [she]2876-she luxuriated in the weariness which had stilled [her]2876-she dreadful restlessness . Watching the smoke of [her]2876-she cigarette curl up against the sunset glow which filled [her]2876-she window , [she]2876-she mused : If only [she]2876-she could be tired out like this every day ! [She]2876-she would be all right then , would lose the feeling of not knowing what [she]2876-she wanted , of being in a sort o of large box , with the lid slammed down , roaming round it like a dazed and homesick bee in an overturned tumbler ; the feeling of being only half alive , of having a wing maimed so that [she]2876-she could only fly a little way , and must then drop .

[She]2876-she slept like a top that night . But the next day 's work was real torture , and the third not much better . By the end of the week , however , [she]2876-she was no longer stiff .

Saturday was cloudless ; a perfect day . The field [she]2876-she was working in lay on [a slope]2877-a slope . [It]2878-it was [the last field to be]2879-the last field to be cut , and the best wheat yet , with a glorious burnt shade in its gold and the ears blunt and full . [She]2876-she had got used now to the feel of the great sheaves in [her]2876-she arms , and the binding wisps drawn through [her]2876-she hand till [she]2876-she held them level , below the ears , ready for the twist . There was no new sensation in it now ; just steady , rather dreamy work , to keep [her]2876-she place in the row , to the swish - swish of the cutter and the call of [the driver]996-the driver to [his]996-the driver horses at the turns ; with continual little pauses , to straighten and rest [her]2876-she back a moment , and shake [her]2876-she head free from the flies , or suck [her]2876-she finger , sore from the constant pushing of the straw ends under . So the hours went on , rather hot and wearisome , yet with a feeling of something good being done , of a job getting surely to its end . And gradually the centre patch narrowed , and the sun slowly slanted down .

When [they]2881-they stopped for tea , instead of running [home]3048-home as usual , [she]2876-she drank it cold out of a flask [she]2876-she had brought , ate a bun and some chocolate , and lay down on [her]2876-she back against the hedge . [She]2876-she always avoided [that group of [[her]2876-she fellow workers]2884-her fellow workers round the tea - cans which [[the farmer]2874-the farmer 's wife]2886-the farmer 's wife brought out]2883-that group of her fellow workers round the tea - cans which the farmer 's wife brought out . To avoid [people]3083-people , if [she]2876-she could , had become habitual to [her]2876-she now . [They]3083-people must know about [her]2876-she , or would soon if [she]2876-she gave [them]3083-people the chance . [She]2876-she had never lost consciousness of [her]2876-she ring - finger , expecting every eye to fall on it as a matter of course . Lying on [her]2876-she face , [she]2876-she puffed [her]2876-she cigarette into the grass , and watched a beetle , till one of the sheep - dogs , scouting for scraps , came up , and [she]2876-she fed [him]2888-him with [her]2876-she second bun . Having finished the bun , [he]2888-him tried to eat the beetle , and , when [she]2876-she rescued it , convinced that [she]2876-she had nothing more to give [him]2888-him , sneezed at [her]2876-she , and went away . Pressing the end of [her]2876-she cigarette out against the bank , [she]2876-she turned over . Already [the driver]996-the driver was perched on [his]996-the driver tiny seat , and [[his]996-the driver companion]2890-his companion , whose business it was to free the falling corn , was getting up alongside . Swish - swish ! It had begun again . [She]2876-she rose , stretched [herself]2876-she , and went back to [her]2876-she place in [the row]2891-the row . [The field]3361-the field would be finished to - night ; [she]2876-she would have a lovely rest - all Sunday [I]0-i Towards seven o'clock [a narrow strip]2893-a narrow strip , not twenty yards broad , alone was left . This last half hour was what [Noel]197-noel dreaded . To - day it was worse , for [the farmer]2874-the farmer had [no cartridges left]2895-no cartridges left , and the rabbits were dealt with by hullabaloo and sticks and chasing dogs . [Rabbits]2896-rabbits were vermin , of course , and ate the crops , and must be killed ; besides , [they]2896-rabbits were good food , and fetched two shillings apiece ; all this [she]2876-she knew but to see the poor frightened things stealing out , pounced on , turned , shouted at , chased , rolled over by great swift dogs , fallen on by [the boys]3224-the boys and killed and carried with [their]2896-rabbits limp grey bodies upside down , so dead and soft and helpless , always made [her]2876-she feel quite sick . [She]2876-she stood very still , trying not to see or hear , and in the corn opposite to [her]2876-she a rabbit stole along , crouched , and peeped . ' Oh ! ' [she]2876-she thought , ' come out here , [bunny]2898-bunny . [I]0-i 'll let [you]2898-bunny away - ca n't [you]2898-bunny see [I]0-i will ? It 's [your]2898-bunny only chance . Come out ! ' But the rabbit crouched , and gazed , with its little cowed head poked forward , and its ears laid flat ; it seemed trying to understand whether this still thing in front of it was the same as those others . With the thought , ' Of course it wo n't while [I]0-i look at it , ' [Noel]197-noel turned [her]2876-she head away . Out of the corner of [her]2876-she eye [she]2876-she could see [a man]3326-a man standing a few yards off . The rabbit bolted out . Now [the man]587-the man would shout and turn [it]2901-it . But [he]587-the man did not , and the rabbit scuttled past [him]587-the man and away to the hedge . [She]2876-she heard a shout from the end of the row , saw a dog galloping . Too late ! Hurrah ! And clasping [her]2876-she hands , [she]2876-she looked at [the man]587-the man . It was [Fort]197-noel ! With the queerest feeling - amazement , pleasure , the thrill of conspiracy , [she]2876-she saw [him]587-the man coming up to [her]2876-she .

" [I]2876-she did want that rabbit to get off , "[2876-she] [she]2876-she sighed out ; " [I]2876-she 've been watching it . Thank [you]587-the man ! "[2876-she]

[He]587-the man looked at [her]2876-she . " [My]587-the man goodness ! "[587-the man] was all [he]587-the man said .

[Noel]197-noel 's hands flew up to [her]2876-she cheeks . " Yes , [I]197-noel know ; is [my]197-noel nose very red ? "[197-noel]

" No ; [you]197-noel 're as lovely as [Ruth]307-ruth , if [she]307-ruth was lovely . "[197-noel]

Swish - swish ! The cutter came by ; [Noel]197-noel started forward to [her]2876-she place in the row ; but catching [her]2876-she arm , [he]197-noel said : " No , let [me]197-noel do this little bit . [I]197-noel have n't had a day in [the fields]2875-the fields since the war began . Talk to [me]197-noel while [I]197-noel 'm binding . "[197-noel]

[She]2876-she stood watching [him]197-noel . [He]197-noel made a different , stronger twist from [hers]2876-she , and took larger sheaves , so that [she]2876-she felt a sort of jealousy .

" [I]197-noel did n't know [you]2876-she knew about this sort of thing . "[197-noel]

" Oh , Lord , yes ! [I]197-noel had [a farm]4549-a farm once out [West]15-west . Nothing like field - work , to make [you]2876-she feel good . [I]197-noel 've been watching [you]2876-she ; [you]2876-she bind jolly well . "[197-noel]

[Noel]197-noel gave a sigh of pleasure .

" Where have [you]197-noel come from ? "[2876-she] [she]2876-she asked .

" Straight from [the station]474-the station . [I]197-noel 'm on [my]197-noel holiday . "[197-noel] [He]197-noel looked up at [her]2876-she , and [they]2903-they both fell silent .

Swish - swish ! The cutter was coming again . [Noel]197-noel went to the beginning of [her]2876-she portion of the falling corn , [he]197-noel to the end of it . [They]2903-they worked towards [each other]493-each other , and met before the cutter was on [them]2903-they a third time .

" Will [you]197-noel come in to supper ? "[197-noel]

" [I]197-noel 'd love to . "[197-noel]

" Then let 's go now , please . [I]197-noel do n't want to see any more rabbits killed . "[197-noel]

[They]2903-they spoke very little on the way to [the bungalow]2779-the bungalow , but [she]2876-she felt [his]197-noel eyes on [her]2876-she all the time . [She]2876-she left [him]197-noel with [George]140-george and Gratian who had just come in , and went up for [her]2876-she bath .

Supper had been laid out in [the verandah]2906-the verandah , and it was nearly dark before [they]2903-they had finished . In rhyme with the failing of the light [Noel]197-noel became more and more silent . When [they]2903-they went in , [she]2876-she ran up to [[her]2876-she baby]1803-her baby . [She]2876-she did not go down again , but as on the night before [[her]2876-she father]384-her father went away , stood at [her]2876-she window , leaning out . A dark night , no moon ; in the starlight [she]2876-she could only just see [the dim garden]2909-the dim garden , where no goat was grazing . Now that [her]2876-she first excitement had worn off , this sudden reappearance of [Fort]197-noel filled [her]2876-she with nervous melancholy : [She]2876-she knew perfectly well what [he]197-noel had come for , [she]2876-she had always known . [She]2876-she had no certain knowledge of [her]2876-she own mind ; but [she]2876-she knew that all these weeks [she]2876-she had been between [his]197-noel influence and [[her]2876-she father]384-her father 's , listening to [them]2911-them , as it were , pleading with [her]2876-she . And , curiously , the pleading of [each]811-each , instead of drawing [her]2876-she towards [the pleader]2913-the pleader , had seemed dragging [her]2876-she away from [him]197-noel , driving [her]2876-she into the arms of [the other]1017-the other . To the protection of one or the other [she]2876-she felt [she]2876-she must go ; and it humiliated [her]2876-she to think that in [all the world]3724-all the world there was no other place for [her]2876-she . The wildness of that one night in [the old Abbey]335-the old abbey seemed to have power to govern all [her]2876-she life to come . Why should that one night , that one act , have this uncanny power to drive [her]2876-she this way or that , to those arms or these ? Must [she]2876-she , because of it , always need protection ? Standing there in the dark it was almost as if [they]2911-them had come up behind [her]2876-she , with [their]2911-them pleadings ; and a shiver ran down [her]2876-she back . [She]2876-she longed to turn on [them]2911-them , and cry out : " Go away ; oh ; go away ! [I]2876-she do n't want either of [you]2911-them ; [I]2876-she just want to be left alone ! "[2876-she] Then something , a moth perhaps , touched [her]2876-she neck . [She]2876-she gasped and shook [herself]2876-she . How silly !

[She]2876-she heard the back door round the corner of [the house]538-the house opening ; [a man]3326-a man 's low voice down in the dark said :

" Who 's [the young lady that comes out in [the fields]2875-the fields]4551-the young lady that comes out in the fields ? "[3326-a man]

[Another voice]2919-another voice - [one of [the maids]3488-the maids]2920-one of the maids - answered :

" [[The Missis]318-the missis 's sister]4553-the missis 's sister . "[2919-another voice]

" [They]4554-they say [she]4553-the missis 's sister 's got [a baby]4141-a baby . "[2920-one of the maids]

" Never [you]197-noel mind what [she]4553-the missis 's sister 's got . "[2919-another voice]

[Noel]197-noel heard [the man]587-the man 's laugh . It seemed to [her]2876-she the most odious laugh [she]2876-she had ever heard . [She]2876-she thought swiftly and absurdly : ' [I]0-i 'll get away from all this . ' The window was only a few feet up . [She]2876-she got out on to the ledge , let [herself]2876-she down , and dropped . There was a flower - bed below , quite soft , with a scent of geranium - leaves and earth . [She]2876-she brushed [herself]2876-she , and went tiptoeing across the gravel and [the little front lawn]2923-the little front lawn , to the gate . [The house]538-the house was quite dark , quite silent . [She]2876-she walked on , down [the road]685-the road . ' [Jolly]319-jolly ! ' [she]2876-she thought . ' Night after night [we]2926-we sleep , and never see the nights : sleep until [we]2926-we 're called , and never see anything . If [they]2927-they want to catch [me]0-i [they]2927-they 'll have to run . ' And [she]2876-she began running down [the road]685-the road in [her]2876-she evening frock and shoes , with nothing on [her]2876-she head . [She]2876-she stopped after going perhaps three hundred yards , by the edge of the wood . It was splendidly dark in there , and [she]2876-she groped [her]2876-she way from trunk to trunk , with a delicious , half - scared sense of adventure and novelty . [She]2876-she stopped at last by a thin trunk whose bark glimmered faintly . [She]2876-she felt it with [her]2876-she cheek , quite smooth - a birch tree ; and , with [her]2876-she arms round it , [she]2876-she stood perfectly still . Wonderfully , magically silent , fresh and sweet - scented and dark ! The little tree trembled suddenly within [her]2876-she arms , and [she]2876-she heard the low distant rumble , to which [she]2876-she had grown so accustomed - the guns , always at work , killing - killing [men]3061-men and killing trees , little trees perhaps like this within [her]2876-she arms , little trembling trees ! Out there , in this dark night , there would not be a single unscarred tree like this smooth quivering thing , no fields of corn , not even a bush or a blade of grass , no leaves to rustle and smell sweet , not a bird , no little soft - footed night beasts , except the rats ; and [she]2876-she shuddered , thinking of [the Belgian soldier - painter]2930-the belgian soldier - painter . Holding the tree tight , [she]2876-she squeezed its smooth body against [her]2876-she . A rush of the same helpless , hopeless revolt and sorrow overtook [her]2876-she , which had wrung from [her]2876-she that passionate little outburst to [[her]2876-she father]384-her father , the night before [he]384-her father went away . Killed , torn , and bruised ; burned , and killed , like [Cyril]133-cyril ! [All the young things]2932-all the young things , like this little tree .

Rumble ! Rumble ! Quiver ! Quiver ! And all else so still , so sweet and still , and starry , up there through the leaves .... ' [I]0-i ca n't bear it ! ' [she]2876-she thought . [She]0-i pressed [her]0-i lips , which the sun had warmed all day , against the satiny smooth bark . But the little tree stood within [her]2876-she arms insentient , quivering only to the long rumbles . With each of those dull mutterings , life and love were going out , like the flames of candles on a Christmas - tree , blown , one by one . To [her]2876-she eyes , accustomed by now to the darkness in there , the wood seemed slowly to be gathering a sort of life , as though it were a great thing watching [her]2876-she ; a great thing with hundreds of limbs and eyes , and the power of breathing . The little tree , which had seemed so individual and friendly , ceased to be a comfort and became a part of the whole living wood , absorbed in itself , and coldly watching [her]2876-she , [this intruder of the mischievous breed]2933-this intruder of the mischievous breed , [the fatal breed which loosed those rumblings on]2934-the fatal breed which loosed those rumblings on [the earth]3348-the earth . [Noel]197-noel unlocked [her]2876-she arms , and recoiled . A bough scraped [her]2876-she neck , some leaves flew against [her]2876-she eyes ; [she]2876-she stepped aside , tripped over a root , and fell . A bough had hit [her]2876-she too , and [she]2876-she lay a little dazed , quivering at such dark unfriendliness . [She]2876-she held [her]2876-she hands up to [her]2876-she face for the mere pleasure of seeing something a little less dark ; it was childish , and absurd , but [she]2876-she was frightened . The wood seemed to have so many eyes , so many arms , and all unfriendly ; it seemed waiting to give [her]2876-she other blows , other falls , and to guard [her]2876-she within its darkness until - ! [She]2876-she got up , moved a few steps , and stood still , [she]2876-she had forgotten from where [she]2876-she had come in . And afraid of moving deeper into [the unfriendly wood]2936-the unfriendly wood , [she]2876-she turned slowly round , trying to tell which way to go . It was all just one dark watching thing , of limbs on the ground and in the air . ' Any way , ' [she]2876-she thought ; ' any way of course will take [me]0-i out ! ' And [she]2876-she groped forward , keeping [her]2876-she hands up to guard [her]2876-she face . It was silly , but [she]2876-she could not help the sinking , scattered feeling which comes to one bushed , or lost in a fog . If the wood had not been so dark , so , - alive ! And for a second [she]2876-she had the senseless , terrifying thought of [a child]415-a child : ' What if [I]0-i never get out ! ' Then [she]2876-she laughed at it , and stood still again , listening . There was no sound to guide [her]2876-she , no sound at all except that faint dull rumble , which seemed to come from every side , now . And the trees watched [her]2876-she . ' Ugh ! ' [she]2876-she thought ; ' [I]0-i hate this wood ! ' [She]2876-she saw it now , its snaky branches , its darkness , and great forms , as an abode of [giants]2938-giants and [witches]2939-witches . [She]2876-she groped and scrambled on again , tripped once more , and fell , hitting [her]2876-she forehead against a trunk . The blow dazed and sobered [her]2876-she . ' It 's idiotic , ' [she]2876-she thought ; ' [I]0-i 'm [a baby]4141-a baby ! [I]0-i 'll Just walk very slowly till [I]0-i reach the edge . [I]0-i know it is n't a large wood ! ' [She]2876-she turned deliberately to face each direction ; solemnly selected that from which the muttering of the guns seemed to come , and started again , moving very slowly with [her]2876-she hands stretched out . Something rustled in the undergrowth , quite close ; [she]2876-she saw a pair of green eyes shining . [Her]2876-she heart jumped into [her]2876-she mouth . [The thing]2941-the thing sprang - there was a swish of ferns and twigs , and silence . [Noel]197-noel clasped [her]2876-she breast . A poaching cat ! And again [she]2876-she moved forward . But [she]2876-she had lost direction . ' [I]0-i 'm going round and round , ' [she]2876-she thought . ' [They]2942-they always do . ' And the sinking scattered feeling of the " bushed "[2876-she] clutched at [her]2876-she again . ' Shall [I]0-i call ? ' [she]2876-she thought . ' [I]0-i must be near [the road]685-the road . But it 's so babyish . ' [She]2876-she moved on again . [Her]2876-she foot struck something soft . A voice muttered a thick oath ; a hand seized [her]2876-she ankle . [She]2876-she leaped , and dragged and wrenched it free ; and , utterly unnerved , [she]2876-she screamed , and ran forward blindly .

[V]320-v

[No one]3081-no one could have so convinced a feeling as [Jimmy Fort]175-jimmy that [he]175-jimmy would be a ' bit of a makeshift ' for [Noel]197-noel . [He]197-noel had spent the weeks after [his]197-noel interview with [[her]2876-she father]384-her father obsessed by [her]2876-she image , often saying to [himself]197-noel " It wo n't do . [It]4556-it 's playing it too low down to try and get [that child]3092-that child , when [I]197-noel know that , but for [her]3092-that child trouble , [I]197-noel should n't have a chance . "[197-noel] [He]197-noel had never had much opinion of [his]197-noel looks , but now [he]197-noel seemed to [himself]197-noel absurdly old and dried - up in [this desert of a [London]7-london]2946-this desert of a london . [He]197-noel loathed the Office job to which [they]2947-they had put [him]197-noel , and the whole atmosphere of officialdom . Another year of it , and [he]197-noel would shrivel like an old apple ! [He]197-noel began to look at [himself]197-noel anxiously , taking stock of [his]197-noel physical assets now that [he]197-noel had this dream of [young beauty]2948-young beauty . [He]197-noel would be forty next month , and [she]2948-young beauty was nineteen ! But there would be times too when [he]197-noel would feel that , with [her]2948-young beauty , [he]197-noel could be as much of a " three - year - old "[197-noel] as [the youngster [she]2948-young beauty had loved]2949-the youngster she had loved . Having little hope of winning [her]2948-young beauty , [he]197-noel took [her]2948-young beauty " past "[197-noel] but lightly . Was it not that past which gave [him]197-noel what chance [he]197-noel had ? On two things [he]197-noel was determined : [He]197-noel would not trade on [her]2948-young beauty past . And if by any chance [she]2948-young beauty took [him]197-noel , [he]197-noel would never show [her]2948-young beauty that [he]197-noel remembered that [she]2948-young beauty had one .

After writing to [Gratian]127-gratian [he]197-noel had spent the week before [his]197-noel holiday began , in an attempt to renew the youthfulness of [his]197-noel appearance , which made [him]197-noel feel older , leaner , bonier and browner than ever . [He]197-noel got up early , rode in the rain , took Turkish baths , and did all manner of exercises ; neither smoked nor drank , and went to bed early , exactly as if [he]197-noel had been going to ride a steeplechase . On the afternoon , when at last [he]197-noel left on that terrific pilgrimage , [he]197-noel gazed at [his]197-noel face with a sort of despair , it was so lean , and leather - coloured , and [he]197-noel counted almost a dozen grey hairs .

When [he]197-noel reached [the bungalow]2779-the bungalow , and was told that [she]2948-young beauty was working in [the corn - fields]2951-the corn - fields , [he]197-noel had for the first time a feeling that [Fate]167-fate was on [his]197-noel side . Such a meeting would be easier than any other ! [He]197-noel had been watching [her]2948-young beauty for several minutes before [she]2948-young beauty saw [him]197-noel , with [his]197-noel heart beating more violently than it had ever beaten in [the trenches]3318-the trenches ; and that new feeling of hope stayed with [him]197-noel - all through the greeting , throughout supper , and even after [she]2948-young beauty had left [them]2953-them and gone [upstairs]1153-upstairs . Then , with the suddenness of a blind drawn down , it vanished , and [he]197-noel sat on , trying to talk , and slowly getting more and more silent and restless .

" [Nollie]131-nollie gets so tired , working , "[2948-young beauty] [Gratian]127-gratian said : [He]197-noel knew [she]2948-young beauty meant it kindly but that [she]2948-young beauty should say it at all was ominous . [He]197-noel got up at last , having lost hope of seeing [Noel]197-noel again , conscious too that [he]197-noel had answered the last three questions at random .

In [the porch]693-the porch [George]140-george said : " [You]197-noel 'll come in to lunch tomorrow , wo n't [you]197-noel ? "[140-george]

" Oh , thanks , [I]140-george 'm afraid it 'll bore [you]2953-them all . "[140-george]

" Not a bit . [Nollie]131-nollie wo n't be so tired . "[140-george]

Again - so well meant . [They]2953-them were very kind . [He]197-noel looked up from the gate , trying to make out which [her]2948-young beauty window might be ; but all was dark . A little way down [the road]685-the road [he]197-noel stopped to light a cigarette ; and , leaning against a gate , drew the smoke of it deep into [his]197-noel lungs , trying to assuage the ache in [his]197-noel heart . So it was hopeless ! [She]2948-young beauty had taken the first , the very first chance , to get away from [him]197-noel ! [She]2948-young beauty knew that [he]197-noel loved [her]2948-young beauty , could not help knowing , for [he]197-noel had never been able to keep it out of [his]197-noel eyes and voice . If [she]2948-young beauty had felt ever so little for [him]197-noel , [she]2948-young beauty would not have avoided [him]197-noel this first evening . ' [I]0-i 'll go back to [that desert]2957-that desert , ' [he]197-noel thought ; ' [I]0-i 'm not going to whine and crawl . [I]0-i 'll go back , and bite on it ; [one]424-one must have some pride . Oh , why the hell am [I]0-i crocked - up like this ? If only [I]0-i could get out to [France]13-france again ! ' And then [Noel]197-noel 's figure bent over the falling corn formed before [him]197-noel . ' [I]0-i 'll have one more try , ' [he]197-noel thought ; ' one more - tomorrow somewhere , [I]0-i 'll get to know for certain . And if [I]0-i get what [Leila]208-leila 's got [I]0-i shall deserve it , [I]0-i suppose . [Poor Leila]208-leila ! Where is [she]208-leila ? Back at [High Constantia]41-high constantia ? ' What was that ? A cry - of terror - in that wood ! Crossing to the edge , [he]197-noel called " Coo - ee ! "[197-noel] and stood peering into [its]2959-its darkness . [He]197-noel heard the sound of bushes being brushed aside , and whistled . [A figure]2960-a figure came bursting out , almost into [his]197-noel arms .

" Hallo ! "[197-noel] [he]197-noel said ; " what 's up ? "[197-noel]

A voice gasped : " Oh ! It 's - it 's nothing ! "[197-noel]

[He]197-noel saw [Noel]197-noel . [She]2960-a figure had swayed back , and stood about a yard away . [He]197-noel could dimly see [her]2960-a figure covering [her]2960-a figure face with [her]2960-a figure arms . Feeling instinctively that [she]2960-a figure wanted to hide [her]2960-a figure fright , [he]197-noel said quietly :

" What luck ! [I]197-noel was just passing . [It]4558-it 's awfully dark . "[197-noel]

" [I]197-noel - [I]197-noel got lost ; and [a man]3326-a man - caught [my]197-noel foot , in there ! "[197-noel]

Moved beyond control by the little gulps and gasps of [her]2960-a figure breathing , [he]197-noel stepped forward and put [his]197-noel hands on [her]2960-a figure shoulders . [He]197-noel held [her]2960-a figure lightly , without speaking , terrified lest [he]197-noel should wound [her]2960-a figure pride .

" [I]2960-a figure - [I]2960-a figure got in [there]3137-there , "[2960-a figure] [she]2960-a figure gasped , " and the trees - and [I]2960-a figure stumbled over [a roan asleep]4561-a roan asleep , and [he]4561-a roan asleep - "[2960-a figure]

" Yes , Yes , [I]197-noel know , "[197-noel] [he]197-noel murmured , as if to [a child]415-a child . [She]2960-a figure had dropped [her]2960-a figure arms now , and [he]197-noel could see [her]2960-a figure face , with eyes unnaturally dilated , and lips quivering . Then moved again beyond control , [he]197-noel drew [her]2960-a figure so close that [he]197-noel could feel the throbbing of [her]2960-a figure heart , and put [his]197-noel lips to [her]2960-a figure forehead all wet with heat . [She]2960-a figure closed [her]2960-a figure eyes , gave a little choke , and buried [her]2960-a figure face against [his]197-noel coat .

" There , there , [[my]197-noel darling]3170-my darling ! "[197-noel] [he]197-noel kept on saying . " There , there , [[my]197-noel darling]3170-my darling ! "[197-noel] [He]197-noel could feel the snuggling of [her]2960-a figure cheek against [his]197-noel shoulder . [He]197-noel had got [her]2960-a figure - had got [her]2960-a figure ! [He]197-noel was somehow certain that [she]2960-a figure would not draw back now . And in the wonder and ecstasy of that thought , all the world above [her]2960-a figure head , the stars in their courses , the wood which had frightened [her]2960-a figure , seemed miracles of beauty and fitness . By such fortune as had never come to [man]631-man , [he]197-noel had got [her]2960-a figure ! And [he]197-noel murmured over and over again :

" [I]197-noel love [you]2960-a figure ! "[197-noel] [She]2960-a figure was resting perfectly quiet against [him]197-noel , while [her]2960-a figure heart ceased gradually to beat so fast . [He]197-noel could feel [her]2960-a figure cheek rubbing against [his]197-noel coat of Harris tweed . Suddenly [she]2960-a figure sniffed at it , and whispered :

" It smells good . "[2960-a figure]

VI

When summer sun has burned all [Egypt]112-egypt , [the white man]2963-the white man looks eagerly each day for evening , whose rose - coloured veil melts opalescent into the dun drift , of [the hills]4510-the hills , and iridescent above , into the slowly deepening blue . [Pierson]137-thirza stood gazing at the mystery of [the desert]2965-the desert from under the little group of palms and bougainvillea which formed [the garden of [the hospital]1022-the hospital]2966-the garden of the hospital . Even - song was in full voice : From the far wing a gramophone was grinding out a music - hall ditty ; [two aeroplanes]2968-two aeroplanes , wheeling exactly like the buzzards of [the desert]2965-the desert , were letting drip the faint whir of [their]2968-two aeroplanes flight ; metallic voices drifted from [the Arab village]2970-the arab village ; the wheels of the water - wells creaked ; and every now and then a dry rustle was stirred from the palm - leaves by puffs of desert wind . On either hand [an old road]2971-an old road ran out , whose line could be marked by the little old watch - towers of another age . For how many hundred years had human life passed along [it]2971-an old road to East and West ; [the brown men]2972-the brown men and [their]2972-the brown men camels , threading that immemorial track over [the desert]2965-the desert , which ever filled [him]197-noel with wonder , so still it was , so wide , so desolate , and every evening so beautiful ! [He]197-noel sometimes felt that [he]197-noel could sit for ever looking at it ; as though its cruel mysterious loveliness were - [home]3048-home ; and yet [he]197-noel never looked at it without a spasm of homesickness .

So far [his]197-noel new work had brought [him]197-noel no nearer to the hearts of [men]3061-men . Or at least [he]197-noel did not feel it had . Both at [the regimental base]2976-the regimental base , and now in [this hospital]2977-this hospital - an intermediate stage - waiting for the draft with which [he]197-noel would be going into [Palestine]119-palestine , all had been very nice to [him]197-noel , friendly , and as it were indulgent ; so might [schoolboys]2978-schoolboys have treated [some well - intentioned dreamy master]2979-some well - intentioned dreamy master , or [business men]2980-business men [a harmless idealistic inventor who came visiting [[their]2980-business men offices]2982-their offices]2981-a harmless idealistic inventor who came visiting their offices . [He]197-noel had even the feeling that [they]2983-i were glad to have [him]197-noel about , just as [they]2983-i were glad to have [their]2983-i mascots and [their]2983-i regimental colours ; but of heart - to - heart simple comradeship - it seemed [they]2983-i neither wanted it of [him]197-noel nor expected [him]197-noel to give it , so that [he]197-noel had a feeling that [he]197-noel would be forward and impertinent to offer it . Moreover , [he]197-noel no longer knew how . [He]197-noel was very lonely . ' When [I]0-i come face to face with death , ' [he]197-noel would think , ' it will be different . [Death]157-death makes [[us]2984-us all [brothers]2986-brothers]2985-us all brothers . [I]0-i may be of real use to [them]2983-i then . '

[They]2983-i brought [him]197-noel a letter while [he]197-noel stood there listening to that even - song , gazing at [the old desert road]2987-the old desert road .

" [DARLING DAD]158-dad ,[2983-i]

" [I]2983-i do hope this will reach [you]158-dad before [you]158-dad move on to [Palestine]119-palestine . [You]158-dad said in [your]158-dad last - at the end of September , so [I]2983-i hope [you]158-dad 'll just get it . There is one great piece of news , which [I]2983-i 'm afraid will hurt and trouble [you]158-dad ; [Nollie]131-nollie is married to [Jimmy Fort]175-jimmy . [They]2983-i were married down here this afternoon , and have just gone up to [Town]120-town . [They]2983-i have to find [a house]1397-a house of course . [She]131-nollie has been very restless , lonely , and unhappy ever since [you]158-dad went , and [I]2983-i 'm sure it is really for the best : [She]131-nollie is quite another creature , and simply devoted , headlong . It 's just like [Nollie]131-nollie . [She]131-nollie says [she]131-nollie did n't know what [she]131-nollie wanted , up to the last minute . But now [she]131-nollie seems as if [she]131-nollie could never want anything else .[2983-i]

" [Dad]158-dad dear , [Nollie]131-nollie could never have made good by [herself]131-nollie . It is n't [her]131-nollie nature , and it 's much better like this , [I]2983-i feel sure , and so does [George]140-george . Of course it is n't ideal - and [one]424-one wanted that for [her]131-nollie ; but [she]131-nollie did break [her]131-nollie wing , and [he]140-george is so awfully good and devoted to [her]131-nollie , though [you]158-dad did n't believe it , and perhaps wo n't , even now . The great thing is to feel [her]131-nollie happy again , and know [she]131-nollie 's safe . [Nollie]131-nollie is capable of great devotion ; only [she]131-nollie must be anchored . [She]131-nollie was drifting all about ; and [one]424-one does n't know what [she]131-nollie might have done , in one of [her]131-nollie moods . [I]2983-i do hope [you]158-dad wo n't grieve about it . [She]131-nollie 's dreadfully anxious about how [you]158-dad 'll feel . [I]2983-i know it will be wretched for [you]158-dad , so far off ; but do try and believe it 's for the best .... [She]131-nollie 's out of danger ; and [she]131-nollie was really in a horrible position . It 's so good for [the baby]3827-the baby , too , and only fair to [him]3827-the baby . [I]2983-i do think [one]424-one must take things as they are , [[Dad]158-dad dear]3168-dad dear . It was impossible to mend [Nollie]131-nollie 's wing . If [she]131-nollie were [a fighter]4570-a fighter , and gloried in it , or if [she]131-nollie were [the sort who would ' take the veil ']4571-the sort who would ' take the veil ' - but [she]131-nollie is n't either . So it is all right , [Dad]158-dad . [She]131-nollie 's writing to [you]158-dad [herself]131-nollie . [I]2983-i 'm sure [Leila]208-leila did n't want [Jimmy Fort]175-jimmy to be unhappy because [he]175-jimmy could n't love [her]131-nollie ; or [she]131-nollie would never have gone away . [George]140-george sends [you]158-dad [his]140-george love ; [we]4572-we are both very well . And [Nollie]131-nollie is looking splendid still , after [her]131-nollie harvest work . All , all [my]2983-i love , [Dad dear]3168-dad dear . Is there anything [we]4572-we can get , and send [you]158-dad ? Do take care of [your]158-dad blessed self , and do n't grieve about [Nollie]131-nollie .[2983-i]

" [GRATIAN]127-gratian . "[2983-i]

A half - sheet of paper fluttered down ; [he]2988-he picked it up from among the parched fibre of dead palm - leaves .

" [DADDY DARLING]321-daddy darling ,[2988-he]

" [I]2988-he 've done it . Forgive [me]2988-he - [I]2988-he 'm so happy .[2988-he]

" [[Your]321-daddy darling [NOLLIE]131-nollie]4574-your nollie . "[2988-he]

[The desert]2965-the desert shimmered , the palm - leaves rustled , and [Pierson]137-thirza stood trying to master the emotion roused in [him]2988-he by those two letters . [He]2988-he felt no anger , not even vexation ; [he]2988-he felt no sorrow , but a loneliness so utter and complete that [he]2988-he did not know how to bear it . It seemed as if some last link with life had ' snapped . ' [[My]0-i girls]3908-my girls are happy , ' [he]2988-he thought . ' If [I]0-i am not - what does it matter ? If [my]0-i faith and [my]0-i convictions mean nothing to [them]3908-my girls - why should [they]3908-my girls follow ? [I]0-i must and will not feel lonely . [I]0-i ought to have the sense of [God]143-god present , to feel [His]143-god hand in [mine]0-i . If [I]0-i can not , what use am [I]0-i - what use to [the poor fellows in there]2991-the poor fellows in there , what use in [all the world]3724-all the world ? '

[An old native on [a donkey]2994-a donkey]2993-an old native on a donkey went by , piping a Soudanese melody on a little wooden Arab flute . [Pierson]137-thirza turned back into [the hospital]1022-the hospital humming it . [A nurse]3053-a nurse met [him]2988-he [there]3137-there .

" [The poor boy at the end of [A ward]4576-a ward]4575-the poor boy at the end of a ward is sinking fast , [sir]3028-sir ; [I]3053-a nurse expect [he]4575-the poor boy at the end of a ward 'd like to see [you]3028-sir . "[3053-a nurse]

[He]2988-he went into [A ward]4576-a ward , and walked down between the beds to the west window end , where two screens had been put , to block off the cot . [Another nurse]2999-another nurse , who was sitting beside it , rose at once .

" [He]840-the boy 's quite conscious , "[2999-another nurse] [she]2999-another nurse whispered ; " [he]840-the boy can still speak a little . [He]840-the boy 's such [a dear]4545-a dear . "[2999-another nurse] A tear rolled down [her]2999-another nurse cheek , and [she]2999-another nurse passed out behind the screens . [Pierson]137-thirza looked down at [the boy]840-the boy ; perhaps [he]840-the boy was twenty , but the unshaven down on [his]840-the boy cheeks was soft and almost colourless . [His]840-the boy eyes were closed . [He]840-the boy breathed regularly , and did not seem in pain ; but there was about [him]840-the boy that which told [he]840-the boy was going ; something resigned , already of the grave . The window was wide open , covered by mosquito - netting , and a tiny line of sunlight , slanting through across the foot of the cot , crept slowly backwards over the sheets and [the boy]840-the boy 's body , shortening as it crept . In the grey whiteness of the walls ; the bed , [the boy]840-the boy 's face , just that pale yellow bar of sunlight , and one splash of red and blue from a little flag on the wall glowed out . At this cooler hour , [the ward behind the screens]3003-the ward behind the screens was almost empty , and few sounds broke the stillness ; but from without came that intermittent rustle of dry palm - leaves . [Pierson]137-thirza waited in silence , watching the sun sink . If [the boy]840-the boy might pass like this , it would be [God]143-god 's mercy . Then [he]840-the boy saw [the boy]840-the boy 's eyes open , wonderfully clear eyes of the lighted grey which has dark rims ; [his]840-the boy lips moved , and [Pierson]137-thirza bent down to hear .

" [I]840-the boy 'm goin' West , [zurr]4579-zurr . "[840-the boy] The whisper had a little soft burr ; the lips quivered ; a pucker as of [a child]415-a child formed on [his]840-the boy face , and passed .

Through [Pierson]137-thirza 's mind there flashed the thought : ' O [God]143-god ! Let [me]0-i be [some help to [him]840-the boy]3007-some help to him ! '

" To [God]143-god , [[my]840-the boy dear son]4580-my dear son ! "[840-the boy] [he]840-the boy said .

A flicker of humour , of ironic question , passed over [the boy]840-the boy 's lips .

[Terribly]322-terribly moved , [Pierson]137-thirza knelt down , and began softly , fervently praying . [His]840-the boy whispering mingled with the rustle of the palm - leaves , while the bar of sunlight crept up the body . In [the boy]840-the boy 's smile had been the whole of stoic doubt , of stoic acquiescence . It had met [him]840-the boy with an unconscious challenge ; had seemed to know so much . [Pierson]137-thirza took [his]840-the boy hand , which lay outside the sheet . [The boy]840-the boy 's lips moved , as though in thanks ; [he]840-the boy drew a long feeble breath , as if to suck in the thread of sunlight ; and [his]840-the boy eyes closed . [Pierson]137-thirza bent over the hand . When [he]840-the boy looked up [the boy]840-the boy was dead . [He]840-the boy kissed [his]840-the boy forehead and went quietly out .

The sun had set , and [he]840-the boy walked away from [the hospital]1022-the hospital to a hillock beyond [the track on [the desert 's edge]3014-the desert 's edge]3013-the track on the desert 's edge , and stood looking at [the afterglow]3015-the afterglow . The sun and [the boy]840-the boy - together [they]3017-they had gone [West]3018-west , into that wide glowing nothingness .

[The muezzin call to sunset prayer in [the Arab village]2970-the arab village]3019-the muezzin call to sunset prayer in the arab village came to [him]840-the boy clear and sharp , while [he]840-the boy sat there , unutterably lonely . Why had that smile so moved [him]840-the boy ? Other death smiles had been like this evening smile on [the desert hills]3021-the desert hills - a glowing peace , a promise of heaven . But [the boy]840-the boy 's smile had said : ' Waste no breath on [me]0-i - [you]3023-you can not help . Who knows - who knows ? [I]0-i have no hope , no faith ; but [I]0-i am adventuring . Good - bye ! ' [Poor boy]3038-poor boy ! [He]840-the boy had braved all things , and moved out uncertain , yet undaunted ! Was that , then , the uttermost truth , was faith a smaller thing ? But from that strange notion [he]840-the boy recoiled with horror . ' In faith [I]0-i have lived , in faith [I]0-i will die ! ' [he]840-the boy thought , ' [God]143-god helping [me]0-i ! ' And the breeze , ruffling [the desert sand]3025-the desert sand , blew the grains against the palms of [his]840-the boy hands , outstretched above the warm earth .
